reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 5%
Homework 10%
Midterm1  15%
Midterm2  20%
Final exam 50%

不過後尾好似因為online exam改左少少weighting
有時會有pop-up quiz 但係for attendance用，幾題MC only（好似大概兩次）
Exam Mean比較高，但final超難

Mt 1:100/100
Mt 2: 97/100
final: 49/100 （踩mean）
最後A-
reviews.comment_workload:
2個midterm （大概一個月一次）
1個final
5份 homework （做曬就有分，無論啱定錯）

reviews.author: Marcodailo
reviews.title: ACCT 2010
reviews.comment_content: content is fair, it is similar to the DSE account. If u have not studied bafs in secondary school, it will be hard for you to learn it in three months.
reviews.comment_teaching: teaching is boring, he just follows the notes to read. He has homework for you to follow your study progress every week. Just follow it.
reviews.comment_grading: grading is good if u studied bags in secondary school, it is easy for u to have a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
in-class work every lesson
and homework every week
normal workload for a three-credit course

reviews.author: ilovewaib
reviews.comment_content:
basic accounting concept similar to the concept learnt in Secondary school accounting
he provided a lot of appendices for us to learn but I think it is unnecessary to use it, reading lecture notes is enough
reviews.comment_teaching:
kelvin used a lot of examples to explain but sometimes the examples may be too difficult
the financial statement was a little bit different from the thing that you learnt in secondary school, so you may feel confused if you studied bafs before
Sometimes he would use Cantonese to explain and said some jokes, so it's a little bit funny in the lesson and you can use Cantonese to ask question after the lesson. He is so nice to reply all your questions
reviews.comment_grading:
midterm 85/100
final 61/75 MC
For the lesson assignment, all get full mark
individual report 13/15
final got
A+
reviews.comment_workload:
the workload was few
had some discussion in some lessons and count marks and he would divide the group by the sitting in the lecture, so you would meet different people
the mid term and final were very easy
the lecture that tested in mid-term would not be tested in the final exam
you need to submit an individual report after the exam but it really easy, you can go online to search for information, most of my friend got nearly full mark

reviews.author: 番茄薯仔湯
reviews.title: Good prof but a 3x pages final
reviews.comment_content:
Pretty easy to catch up if you are a BAFS student.
Weight
Homework (2 assignments: 10% each)20%
Midterm 1      20%
Midterm 2 20%
Final exam 40%
reviews.comment_teaching:
I really like his teaching. A funny prof with examples. Would recommend going to his lessons.
Just revise the lecture notes and do his examples and its fine. maybe hv one tricky question so be careful
Attend the course when its near mt. He may tell you one of the question on mt(and ans). If you attend, the marks are yours.

Feel free to find him and he will answer you.

Add oil I recommend choosing him. You will be interested in accounting
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm 1 95/100 mean 96.6
Midterm 2 92/100 mean 92.6
Final exam 121/200 mean 153.5

The two mts are relatively easy and allowing you to bring cheat sheets so you have to be really careful. As once you are wrong in one question, you are below mean.

I screwed up my final and my final grade is C.
I have never done such a long exam. Its 3x pages! and you have to do balance sheets and long calculations every page! My brain is such a mess and I died.
Even though it is open book is super difficult.
Imagine you have other exams coming and there just isn't enough time for you to finish. The difficulty between mt and final is just like heaven and hell. I heard another class its just MCS.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much workload just two assignments and is quite easy.No attendance so you can just skip all lectures.

We have cheat sheets for mts. Not sure will you have cheat sheets in final coz we have our online exam because of the extradition law. So everything is open book.

reviews.author: nek
reviews.title: Midterm too easy
reviews.comment_content:
Basic accounting knowledge. The content of Sidd seems slightly easier than other prof.

Topics covered:
Financial Statements
T-Accounts, Journal Entries
Accounting ratios
Inventory costing
Operating Cycle
Time value of money
...
reviews.comment_teaching: He is a new prof. His teaching is fun and will use some real financial statements(APPLE, AMAZON, NIKE, ...)  as example. He use companies in the US as example and for HW.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework 20%
Midterm1 20%
Midterm2  20%
Final 40%

HW and midterm are too easy so the mean is quite high. You can bring 5 cheatsheet for midterm. But the online final exam is quite difficult.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light. Two assignments are easy.

reviews.author: youwillbefine
reviews.comment_content:
Very practical and not hard to catch up even for those without BAFS background like me. Friends with BAFS background said it is easy.
No attendances needed.
2 homework.
2 midterms which cheat sheets is allowed (very nice!)
1 final (very hard tho)
GREAT!
reviews.comment_teaching: Very clear and easy to catch up! But really need to focus and listen. He likes to use real-life examples and teach us to read financial statements from real companies.
reviews.comment_grading: I think maybe because he is new, so his grading is quite loose(?)
reviews.comment_workload: Only 2 homework and he will teach how to do them in-class.

reviews.author: Kiki Cheng
reviews.comment_content:
power point is a bit overloaded and skipped many basic
information for students didnt take bafs in secondary school.
homework have many questions for self practice.
reviews.comment_teaching:
explained quite clearly.
lessons are useful.
in-class exercise to help you familiarize with the study progress.
reviews.comment_grading:
got c-
assignment all handed in.
mean in first mid term.
below mean 2sd in second mid term and 1sd final.
(study hard dont be like me)
reviews.comment_workload:
bi-weekly homework to hand in with two midterms and one final.
homework have extra questions for self practice.
no group project.

reviews.author: Liana
reviews.comment_content: The content is relatively not difficult, the concepts are simple and not much application is required.
reviews.comment_teaching: His presentations have most of the content, and teaching is not bad at all. His English is decent and he makes sure most of the students get a grasp of the content reviewed in each class before moving on by making them answer questions at the end of each lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading system consists of two quizzes, one in-class midterm, one final exam, and mandatory attendance. You can miss upto five classes which will not affect your attendance, but attendance is quite important in the grading system. He will take everyone’s attendance in the traditional way by calling out names, not using iprs.

The standard deviation for this class is extremely small, and the mean is quite high so it is not easy to get a good grade if you are below the mean or only slightly above. The grading system is quite competitive.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is pretty low, with only a few homework assignments which are fully graded upon completion and there are no group projects, only individual studies needed for your quizzes and exams.

reviews.author: gamingking8
reviews.comment_content: The content is interesting but can be boring sometimes so the professor usually gives interesting real-world examples and makes jokes which help if you don't like to just learn the theory.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor goes at a decent speed in classes. He is also very organized so you always know how to prepare for classes.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is good and you get a B+ if you score mean is everything.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is a lot: Attendance is taken every class, and HW is due every two weeks and needs to be handwritten.

reviews.author: ln19
reviews.comment_content: We focused on the balance sheet, income statement, cash flow statement and touched on equity slightly. As a student taking accounting for the first time, the content was relatively easy to follow but it got slightly difficult towards the end.
reviews.comment_teaching: I loved his teaching style as he made sure we had enough practice which I think was important for familiarising me with the balance sheet, income statement and the cash flow statement. You could also tell he really wanted the best for the students while teaching and would reply emails extremely quickly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework - 20%
Midterm 1 - 20%
Midterm 2 - 20%
Final exam - 40%

It is hard to score extremely well since the mean is extremely high so it is important to not make small errors in any the exams and homework.
reviews.comment_workload: There isn't a lot of workload compared to the amount of content taught in the course but there was a lot of self-studying involved because the professor went through the topics quite quickly.

reviews.author: lnt
reviews.comment_content: Basic accounting knowledge. If you studied BAFS in secondary school. It's not difficult at all.
reviews.comment_teaching: Sidd is nice and well prepared for class, but he's a new professor so his style is a bit different. He explains things well and replys emails fast.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework (2 assignments: 10% each) 20%
Midterm 1 20%
Midterm 2 20%
Final exam 40%

The two midterms were easy, average was around 90 sth. But this term we did our final online, so it's EXTREMELY difficult. I literally spent 12 hours to finish it even it's open book and open internet.

I scored 118.5/200 and got a C. Mean 154, SD 23.
reviews.comment_workload: 2 easy assignments, 2 easy midterms, long and difficult final. no attendance needed tho i attended all lectures. There are some optional readings but just for your reference.

reviews.author: radish
reviews.comment_content: 11 chapters with manageable content for someone with no accounting experience at all. The content is appropriate for the course description if taught well.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dennis was good at teaching but he did not go into enough detail with practical accounting. Our class was often confused on how to do assignments / coursework.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading for this course was fair. Bad performance in the mid-term + okay performance in the assignment and final exam gave me a B+ despite be expecting C-range.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload was light for a majority of the course. The assignments were hard to manage for reasons mentioned in "teaching". However those were the only commitments in the course.

reviews.author: ieeliee
reviews.comment_content: Notes are not concise but you can follow every single things easily even though you dont attend lectures.
reviews.comment_teaching: Make sure you can understand foreign jokes and get used to the tone he speaks. otherwise the lessons will be a bit boring. but he did teach with heart and answer questions patiently. Also, he always end his lessons earlier.
reviews.comment_grading: Mid terms and assignments  are super easy that make sure you don’t have any careless mistakes. Final is hard. I had all mid terms and assignments getting full marks and slightly above mean for final. I got B.
reviews.comment_workload: The least workload of all the courses. Simple midterms and assignments.

reviews.author: ypoons9
reviews.comment_content: It's about some basic accounting concepts. Although I didn't take BAFS as an elective in HKDSE, I don't find it difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching: He explained everything in detail but it was so boring that I almost fell asleep every lesson lol
reviews.comment_grading:
5/6 Classwork, 1 Midterm, 1 Assignment, and 1 Final
I finished 5 classwork and got slightly above the mean in both midterm and assignment. ( final exam score is not known)
I got A- finally. I was really surprised because I didn't perform very well and I heard that he gave a few As.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was fair. There was only one assignment but it was not easy to finish.

reviews.author: Karlbear
reviews.title: Best Teaching and Good Grade
reviews.comment_content:
This course is all about 4 financial statements, including Balance Sheet, Income Statement, Statement of Stockholders’ Equity and Statement of Cash Flow.
It covers the Textbook Ch1-4 Ch6-7 Ch8-9 Ch11-12
(Ch13 was removed due to the social event)
I think it is the most interesting course in the first semester for SBM students, a bit challenging but if you follow Dennis, read PPT and Textbook, Do all the exercise assigned, it should be OK. I don’t think students without accounting background are at disadvantage as not many locals learn BAFS accounting in secondary school.
I don’t learn any business subjects before but still get a good grade. I felt confused and struggled in the beginning but after reading textbook and doing practices, I understood a lot. Hard work=Good Grade!
reviews.comment_teaching: Dennis should be the best professor in ACCT 2010! He is So Funny, and make the complicated content Simple and Interesting. He can give many real-life examples to explain concepts clearly. So remember to attend all the lectures if you can’t understand by just reading the PPT or textbook. If you have any problems, you can ask him after lecture or by sending email.
reviews.comment_grading:
Classwork(5%-6%):counted for submission regardless of the performance, full if you attend the lectures and summit all the works
Midterm(15%) One LQ in 60 minutes! Difficult for beginners in Accounting since there is no practice questions and the time is not enough! But try to do more textbook exercises!
Me: 68/80（above1.2sd）
High 79 Mean 51.28 SD 13.67
Assignment(12%)
As he said, challenging in an interesting way. Discussed several times with my friends before Getting the most appropriate answers (Dizzy)
Me: 57/60 (above1sd)
High 57 Mean 44.7 SD 12.29
Final(67%-68%) 60 MC in 70 minutes online. As the midterm and Assignment was Difficult, I got used to it, and I found the final is not as difficult as I thought before hhhh
Me: unknown/60
I GET A+, unexpected as I didn’t do perfectly in my Midterm! But I believe I do quite well in both Assignment and Final. My hard work finally paid off!
reviews.comment_workload:
Depend on what grade you want to get.
Light as there is only one assignment (but still spend some time).
Quite heavy as you should read the textbook, do the exercise assigned after you learn a new chapter.
Overall is OK

reviews.author: ElioH
reviews.title: Highly recommended if you truly want to learn something about ACCT.
reviews.comment_content:
Clear, logical and inspiring.
(He really has a deep understanding of accounting so in his class you can learn much more than just the textbook and get to the core value/philosophy of accounting. Also, because he has been devoted to teaching for so many years, he knows where the students may get lost/confused and will provide examples and more illustrations when needed. )
reviews.comment_teaching:
A+ (if not A++++++++)
Words fail to express how excellent his teaching is. I am thinking to enrol in his other acct class in the future.
---------
He is so nice and patient when answering your questions so don't hesitate!
reviews.comment_grading: Fair. I think for ACCT2010, practice makes perfect and your efforts=grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Largely depends on your own actually, because he won't check whether you finish all the textbook questions he assigned at the end of ppt and the reading stuff. But as I stated before, if you haven't learnt acct before (just like me), I highly recommend you to follow his instruction and do the suggested tasks, which include textbook reading, some MCs and exercise questions. This might take a while, but I think it is worth it.
For the hand-in work he is kind and gives us adequate time to finish it so no need to worry. But again this statement is based on the assumption that you manage your time properly.

reviews.author: dpsn
reviews.comment_content: Basic knowledge of Financial Accounting
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Chen is really nice and explains the concepts clearly in class. Plus, she is willing to answer students' questions after class. Definitely one of the best professors I've met in UST.
reviews.comment_grading:
She is quite lenient at giving grades. As long as you don't screw up your quizzes and FINAL, you have a great chance to receive a good score compared to other BBA foundation courses.

In-class exercises 24%
(Basically, most people get full marks if you finish them on time since she will talk about most of the questions in class. )

Class participation 6%
(She will tell students which day they will be picked in class to answer questions, remember to go to one of the two classes then you can get full marks.)

Quiz 1 10%
Quiz 2 20%
Final exam 40%

Quiz 1 and 2 are relatively easy so most students get high scores. However, please be well prepared for the final because it is gonna be really hard, its nothing like the quizzes. She will let you bring a cheat sheet but it is pretty useless.
reviews.comment_workload: Not too much workload, but make sure to practice the questions she recommends and the questions provided in her PPTs, they are helpful for the final.

reviews.author: Cherrygd
reviews.title: A good professor
reviews.comment_content:
It is easy for those who take hkdse bafs. The only difference is that hkdse focus on British accounting while in this course we have to learn American accounting.

For those who are new in accounting, hard work is required for better understandings.
reviews.comment_teaching: She is a really nice and helpful professor. You can feel her passion in teaching and accounting. She does take care students who are new to accounting and really explains the terms in details.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is okay. (It can reflect your real performance in the course). People get really high marks in midterms and final. Her final exam is harder than her midterms (quite similar to the assignments)
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not heavy. You only need to do three exercises from the selected questions every week. Professor also provides the answer with some brief explanations. You can refer to this file if you are new to accounting. Assignment only counts for 10% of the courses.
Moreover, professor also asks for volunteers who can make a review of different chapter during lessons. There will be bonus marks for those who are willing to do it.
Class participation is also required in the courses. You have to make sure that the professor can recognise you.

reviews.author: boi
reviews.title: final exam = le big oof
reviews.comment_content:
*If you haven't taken accounting before, read carefully!!

You gon get wrecked boi.

Nearly the whole class has already taken accounting somehow. You HAVE to study ahead if you don't wanna die. Learn PV and depreciation way ahead of time, and make sure you have the last 3 chapters down 100% because a lot of points in the final exam comes down to that.

The key to doing well is catching up to the class and getting ahead. Mainland chinese nibbas won't go easy on the math and since most locals already know accounting from DSEs or whatever, it's up to you to not get your ass handed to you.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaches very well.
One of the better lecturers for this course.

I recommend choosing this prof for lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterms - Easy af. High mean though watch out.

YO IF YOU ARE ABOUT TO PICK SZU FAN, YOU MUST KNOW THIS.

Schedule a psychiatrist for after the final exam because her exam will destroy you and give you lasting PTSD. If you thought you did well on the midterms and that you'd be fine for the finals - yeah that's where you're wrong. Study hard, do all the textbook questions and more.

Above mean on both midterms, full grades on all assignments and mean or below mean on final will give you a C.
reviews.comment_workload: Couple homework assignments, nothing much.

reviews.author: Pikapi
reviews.comment_content:
DSE BAFS 嘅 Content
主要都係教一啲入門嘅野
冇讀過嘅可能要用多少少時間去跟返，不過都唔會太辛苦
主要係由overview 到line items 再到analysis
reviews.comment_teaching: 好好人，基本上有問題問佢佢都會好詳細咁答你，每次上堂都會用10-20 分鐘去review 返上一堂cover左嘅野。 就快mid term 或者final 嗰陣都會喺canvas搵啲問題上堂討論，清到concept 又可以幫自己溫書。雖然教複雜嘅concept嘅時候會教得幾快，不過返去用少少時間溫返就OK。
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation                                          5%
After-class Practice  Problems              5%
Quiz 1                                                    15%
Quiz 2                                                    15%
Final exam                                             60%
Total                                                       100%

Participation主要要你上堂答問題或者參與canvas嘅discussion。

自己participation淨係喺canvas答過一條問題
Quiz1   95.5/100
Quiz2    96/100
Final     102.5/120
Grade: A
中學冇讀過BAFS，所以冇讀過嘅同學唔使太擔心會比讀過嘅屈grade。
reviews.comment_workload: 每個星期做3題，有交有分，而且provide埋solution 比你對答案。不過就算自己做都唔會用你太多時間，而且assignment啲題目同quiz 嘅題目都係大同小異。最好就盡量自己做啦。

reviews.author: yymic
reviews.comment_content: Accounting Principals, u will learn to study things very similar to accounting in secondary schools, not hard to handle (only if u learnt them before)
reviews.comment_teaching:
It is boring. Didn't fell asleep, but he doesn't have a loud voice. Also, the slides have TINY fonts. Move to the front if you don't have good eyesight.
He will ask questions in class.
The power points in classes have answers which he may or may not post on canvas. Just copy those down.
He will answer your questions during lessons.
Tries to be interactive but, nah.
reviews.comment_grading:
I guess it is fair.
However, the SD seems to be large.
People having accounting basis shall get good scores tho.

Attendance counts, please don't skip lessons.
reviews.comment_workload: Homework mainly, just hand in something and you will be graded fully. Some extra practice questions are prepared for good students.

reviews.author: B.T.
reviews.title: A strict killer, don’t seems equipped with well knowledge on his own, but still, has heart in teaching
reviews.comment_content: Basic accounting contents, but he taught in a relatively strange way, seems that his classes follow a different track compared with others’ classes, but overall contents are more or less the same
reviews.comment_teaching: He got heart in teaching, willing to answer any question, but quite strict. He does not allow students to chat or sleep or eat or being late in class, otherwise you risk being deducted your performance score, which contribute to some percentage of gradings.
reviews.comment_grading: A very difficult final exam, although gradings should follow normal curve, but seems that all my friends that I know is in his class got very poor grade (at most B even quite much above the mean in midterms and final). The final is quite demanding, and it is an exam on how well your observation and calculation, but not how much accounting principles you have revised before. But anyway, though midterms are of standard levels, the grades are very poor, it’s just a killer
reviews.comment_workload: 8 assignments throughout sememster, 7 of it will be graded. Though you can do your homework not quite seriously (because he won’t check much and as long as you hand in, full score willl be granted), it is still too demanding for a year 1 student, such that every week you get a new homework. He has 2 midterms, which is also another demanding point, and you need to keep up to his track at any time in order to do well in midterms. Moreover, attendance is another very demanding point, he took 5 attendance RANDOMLY throughout the semester, that means if you wanna score high, you can’t skip any of it or else your grade would be even poor than me and my friends!!!!

reviews.author: KentLung
reviews.title: Basic Accounting knowledge
reviews.comment_content: The beginning contents (some basic accounting concepts) are taught in DSE and IB. Buy a TEXTBOOK, can be really helpful. Loads of definition to memorize but all related to the 4 financial statements.
reviews.comment_teaching: The BEST professor in my first semester in UST. Nice teaching skill, sufficient before-class preparation, patient tutorial... Mrs Li speaks excellent English with clear ppt.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 5%
After-class Practice Problems 5%
Quizzes 30% (Two quizzes in total, each 15%)
Final exam 60%

Quizzes are noncumulative.
AGAIN, final weights 60%, plz pay all your effort to this, because this basically determines whether you will get an A or B. Cumulative btw.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is actually acceptable given that we can only take 15 credits in the first semester as a yr 1 SBM student.
Have to do a weekly assignment, submit at least 10 out of 11 problem sets to qualify for a full score. AND the quality of the assignment is NOT important as long as you submit it.
No attendance is required.
No project is required.
No presentation is required.
No essay is required.

reviews.author: Laura
reviews.comment_content: It is a foundation of accounting. The content mainly include the DSE BAFS syllabus. Therefore, it is easy for BAFS student to catch up and get a good grade.   However, the term she used maybe different from what we learn from secondary school.
reviews.comment_teaching: She will use some current business issue in her teaching which made what she teach is useful and applicable. She care whether student can catch up with the content. If you have any question, you can ask her in canvas discussion. She will respond you in detail.
reviews.comment_grading:
24% In-class exercise
6% attendance (Only answer 2 of her question in class which she will help you a lot. Each carry out 3points)
Quiz 1 10%(easy mean>80%)
Quiz 2 14%(easy mean>80%)
Exam 40%(cheat sheet is allowed but the exam is difficult so it may not help you a lot)
Good grade. Quiz 1,2 and Exam above 1sd. Full mark in attendance. Forget hand in 15% in class exercise. Final grade B
reviews.comment_workload: Relatively low. She didn’t assign any project. Only have to do the in-class exercise that she assign in class once a week in canvas which is easy and simple.

reviews.author: kchl
reviews.comment_content: Simple accounting concept. Should be manageable even if you did not take bafs.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very helpful and kind. She always teaches materials that are not included in the textbook, so do attend lectures. Will recommend taking her classes if you want to build a solid foundation in accounting.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grading. The two midterms are in MC format and are relatively easy. The exam is extremely difficult with mean ~40.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fair for a first-year course. 2 midterms, final exam and weekly homework. Class participation is required so try to ask or answer questions during class. No group projects required, unlike other classes.

reviews.author: Terry98120
reviews.title: ACCT 2010
reviews.comment_content:
The class content seems to be narrower than other professors. He teaches the content quiet slowly and have cut some syllabus.

The content of this course is more conceptual than the DSE BAFS accounting module. There are some difference on accounting treatments between DSE and ACCT2010 course. But Who had accounting background should catch up easily. While who don't have the background should spend more time to understand the concept and accounting procedures.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor teaches the concept quiet clearly and patiently. He could always provides interesting examples for explaining accounting concepts, but his tone is somehow boring.

He is also willing to share his advice and experience in accounting industry to students after classes. Who are passionate on accountancy may get interesting insight from him.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class activities and participation 10%
Case about professional ethics 15%
Mid-term exam 25%
Final exam(50%)

The score of final exam and case study were not disclosed by professors. It is hard to guess his grading percentage. But personally I think his grading is fair.

Try to be more active in his classes, he could really recognize students faces and their participation in his classes.
reviews.comment_workload:
There is only one homework assignment throughout this course.The assignment is a case study about ethics in accountancy. The scale of assignment is restricted within 3 pages but the working time is plenty (about one month).

Example in class may be tested on exams.

reviews.author: dhlee
reviews.title: acct 2010
reviews.comment_content: contents are very good and maybe hard to follow if you miss classes later. But still, I could understand basic accounting through this course and was satisfied.
reviews.comment_teaching: i loved teaching from the professor
reviews.comment_grading: there were three tests: two midterms and one final term. I did 1sd above on the first midterm and the final. But I got below mean on the second midterm. But I ended up with b+. You should always attend classes.
reviews.comment_workload: there were no many works to do. If you attend class, there are no hard things to do.

reviews.author: nerd
reviews.title: Teaches quite well but workload is heavy
reviews.comment_content:
Content of the course is pretty useful
I still can gain insight even i studied accounting before
It does not only emphasise in calculation but also concepts

Distribution:
Miniexams x 3 (13%@)
Final exam 40%
Participation 5%
In Class Assignment 10% (1%@)
Project 6%
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Ho teaches quite well
A lot of examples with a clear ppt
You can find a lot of description right below the notes of the ppt
reviews.comment_grading:
GRADING IS NOT TRANSPARENT AT ALL
I got nearly full mark for 1 mini exam and full mark for another one
Got A range finally but the point is that you can never know your marks in final exam, participation and even the project
Which means you have no way to argue the grade with the professor
Thats not very fair tbh
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is pretty heavy compare with other professors
1) Random in class assignments for lectures and you must hand them in within the lecture (thats her way to take attendance actually because you dare not to skip any lectures so to avoid missing any assignments)
2) Project workload is heavy
- She expects 3 people to hand in more than 2000 words assignment and the case study is actually quite difficult if you have not read through any sources
3) 3 mini exams is way too  much
- One month per exam is very demanding.

reviews.author: Trilogie
reviews.comment_content: If you have studied BAFS before, it would be easier for you . If not , you don't need to worry a lot because it is not that difficult to understand the content. So, do not feel discouraged to study ACCT because BAFS students do not gain much advantage
reviews.comment_teaching:
Easy to follow
Non-BAFS students may have to spend some time on understanding the accounting basis , after all , it is easy to follow also .
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is positively related to your effort paid because accounting can be trained through exercise.
reviews.comment_workload:
Reasonable workload
If you want good grading, you should do more exercise yourself

reviews.author: Ball
reviews.title: Summary
reviews.comment_content: NIce. 不難明白. 有上課就可以. 不明可以問tony. 他很樂意回答
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony教得不錯. 人有好.不過會記住所有人的名字. 回答一下問題有助印象分.
reviews.comment_grading: quite good. Account. Being a ACCT student, only need know how to do is fine. Survive in every single course.
reviews.comment_workload: no workloa. there are some time group exercises during the class. But the exercise is quite easy to catch up.

reviews.author: lmfao
reviews.comment_content: Basically, it is a accounting course for the beginner. Just need spend sometime in doing the exercises.
reviews.comment_teaching: Great professor with clear ppt. The notes are pretty straightforward and easy for understanding. He speak very very slow, and quite boring for students.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grading to students but some ppl claim that he is actually a killer.
My mid-term score above the mean for like 1sd and finally total score is 91%.And finally he gave me B+.
reviews.comment_workload: Without any assignment in the course,but you are going to have 5 quizzes throughout the semester.

reviews.author: Kikiwithcat
reviews.title: Great Professor but not an easy course for student with no accounting background
reviews.comment_content: Not very difficult, but lots of stuff and rules to remember. Ok for beginners (I am also a beginner) but need to spend time in doing exercises.
reviews.comment_teaching:
LI, Xi is a good professor. He is quite humorous and he provides lots of examples when explaining a difficult concepts. The only thing to complain is that the Powerpoint sildes are really boring (which are not prepared by him but the publisher)

He also understand that not every student need to learn these fundamental knowledge of accounting and therefore he does not require students to attend his class. He is fine with students who seldom/ never appear in class but able to get high marks in exams.
reviews.comment_grading: He gives the grade you deserved. My mid-terms are all below mean (less than 1 SD) and I have mean in final. My final grade is B-, which is really good instead.
reviews.comment_workload: Not many homework to do. Just a few exercise every time and you can do the extra tasks (Share the news related to accounting) to earn extra points. It is completely voluntary and simple to do!

reviews.author: Alex50d
reviews.title: Cheat sheet doesn't mean anything
reviews.comment_content: The course provides us first insight towards Accounting stuff. If you are a new guy towards accounting, perhaps you'd better buy a textbook for your reference to build your concept. Only relying the powerpoint notes is not sufficient to deal with Homework and Quizzes.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is fine, fluctuated teaching speed. But if you have anything don't understand COMPLETELY, don't hesitate to find Prof CHEN, she is quite nice to clear your misconceptions. Be Active!
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is good and fair generally. What impressed me most is the "cheat sheet" allowance. For Quizzes and tests, and even final exams, cheat sheets were allowed. The mid-term exams were easy to get good grades, but contradictorily the final exam was extremely difficult (to me maybe) provided that 3 A4 cheat sheets were allowed. So be alerted!
reviews.comment_workload: Quite light workload, only some easy group-homework

reviews.author: Florence Huang
reviews.comment_content:
Basic Accounting. Debit and Credit, Financial Statements, Bonds, Inventories, Deppreciation System, Present Value and Future Value of Money, etc

Prof skipped a lot of chapters. It's nice but if there's a lot to catch up if you want to major in acct.

i find it useful
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof was emphasizing on the basic, Debit Credit. So, it would be easier for you learning the next chapters. He went super fast on the following chapters though. Listen to him carefully because he emphasizes on particular things that will come out at the exams,.

Prof is very open to questions and he's nice. He also relates the syllabus to the worldwide news and everyday life.
If you ever learned accounting before then he's right for you. But if you haven't then ... you will find it a bit hard to catch what he's saying.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is pretty generous but you have to be  extremely careful in doing the midterm and final.
No attendance
Midterm : 45%
Final      : 55%
Midterm was easy, so it really helps you.  Lots of textbook-ish questions appeared in midterm. Make sure that you come to the midterm. If not, your final would be 100% your grade.

Final was a lot harder. No more questions similar to textbook qs. Prof took it to another new level, new forms of questions. You really must understand the whole concept. I took accounting on secondary so it wasn't that bad.

You can gain extra 4 bonus points by actively asking & answering questions, solving the problem on the stage, and bringing financial news to the class.

I got 98 on midterm, 95 on final and 2 extra points and finally got an A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
not so busy. There are homework but none of them are submitted, so it's optional.
The most workload is exam weeks. :)

reviews.author: Hakster
reviews.comment_content: Prof. Hsu deals largest amount of contents from chapter 1 to 12 of the Accounting textbook. I recommend you taking other prof. courses to get good grade as his final is 1. cumulative, 2. no open book test, 3. curve is bad 4. large amount of chapters.
reviews.comment_teaching:
His presentation is not bad at all but if you are the first time listening to accounting lecture, you might be confused.
He does not allow computers, phones or any electronic devices in the class, even to take picture or to see ppt. He demands you to print required ppt every chapter.
reviews.comment_grading:
3 mid terms (120)
1 Final (115)
Attendance (15)
Group Excercise (30)
Homework Assignment or cases (20)
reviews.comment_workload: He takes attendance and gives three cases a semester. mid terms are comparatively easier than the final, but finaal is cumulative and is more difficult.

reviews.author: samuelhe
reviews.title: Very light workload
reviews.comment_content: Compulsory course for business students, very basic financial accounting, should have no problem to understand the course content.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Li not only teaches accounting in class. He also discuss something related to the current financial markets to us, which I think was quite interesting.
reviews.comment_grading: 45%midterm and 55% final. No assignments, projects whatever at all. Very good grade. He said in the first class that he will give the best grade allowed by the University, and he did. I was above mean 2/3 SD in both midterm and final, and got A-.
reviews.comment_workload: Almost zero workload. All you need to do is to attend all lectures, spend several hours to go through the in-class exercises before exams, and that will suffice.

reviews.author: Mark
reviews.comment_content:
This is an introductory course of financial accounting.
If you have studied BAFS in DSE, it is very easy to get an A cuz many of the topics have learnt already.
reviews.comment_teaching:
gd lecturer
easy to understand the concept
ppt gd looking, concise
reviews.comment_grading:
gd grading
two mt are easy
final a little bit hard
I got full mark in both mt
and above mean 1.4sd in final
and got an A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much workload
sometimes will have in-class ex.
mt and final work hard and do all the suggested questions he posted is just fine.

reviews.author: Angela Lois
reviews.title: Best ACCT Prof
reviews.comment_content: All fundamental accounting stuffs. I would say that the content is quite packed, and the pace of the lecture is quite fast. So, having previous knowledge of accounting before taking this course would be a great advantage.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof CHEN, Zhihong is a very great professor. I like his  teaching style very much. He gave us a preview questions (required, counted as assignments) of new materials that are going to be discussed in the class. He wanted us to at least do a preview ourselves, and try to solve the problem. I found this very useful, since it actually helps us to understand better and faster during his lecture.
Prof also gave a series of selected problem sets from the textbook that he recommended us to do it. This is where the textbook comes in handy, since one of the essay questions in the exam was taken from the textbook. (The rest exam questions was actually harder than the textbook problem sets, but doing all them will help you understand the accounting concept much easier, which will eventually help you do the exams.)
reviews.comment_grading: The grade are distributed between the 3 lectures Prof CHEN, Zhihong was teaching that time. Fair grading, the final letter grade was heavily determined by mid and final exams. I think, having a grade in the mean range will be enough to get you at least a B-.
reviews.comment_workload: Low workload, we just have to submit through LMES the required questions every time before the class starts.

reviews.author: s1210018
reviews.title: Nice professor to take
reviews.comment_content: very structured content, easy to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: he teaches nicely, in-depth. content plan The content is easy to understand, and easy to follow. Even you didnt take BAFS in secondary school, you can still follow,
reviews.comment_grading: Very nice grading, A grade at the end. Forgot all the mid term and final marks. But if you above means, should be good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Not really that heavy, 1 assignment per week. 2 mid term, and 1 final exam. No attandance is needed at that time, but really encourage to attend his lecture, very nice professor.

reviews.author: Selim.S
reviews.comment_content:
The first thing that I would like to say is that even non-BAFS students, like me, can handle this, though those who studied BAFS in DSE would definitely gain some advantage. So don't feel sad even if you're a non-accounting high school student!

This course covers some basic concepts for accounting, such as four financial statements and components. I believe other people from the forum has already copy and pasted the info, so I won't do it here.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Sorry for the upcoming rambling guys, I just want to tell you how awful he is!!!!!

Dennis is not bad in teaching. He does teach us something, and his English is proficient compared to other prof. Rather, I often found Dennis being utterly rude, which really affected the learning atmosphere. Many people in this page praised Dennis for being a great teacher and you'll probably think I'm just a 打手 who got a bad grade (though merely an A-). So allow me to explain.

Dennis Chan is an impatient, strict and stubborn man who gets all-defensive easily, which often put me and my classmates off. One time I asked about why my classwork was deducted by 30% in a neutral manner, & he responded with a very long message condemning me about not reading the guidelines... To be frank, I did not intentionally put my full name in wrong order, and that you didn't write in the rules that the order is to be put right, but merely 'full name as stated in student ID card'. Both of us have the responsibility to fix the issue, and besides, it is my grading that is affected, but not yours. There is no reason for him to be so angry :)

Second, he loses patience easily when you ask him more questions in depth, and it often feels like he is angry with students. After such undesirable experience with him, I just feel frightened whenever I ask him something via email. (Ironically, he only smiles and nods with know-it-all non-locals who interrupts in the middle of his sentence and raise questions.) I really wanted to learn more about the accounting mechanics, but unfortunately Dennis is not the prof that I should ask for.
reviews.comment_grading:
pdate: Eventually an A- for this course.

We got 8 classwork,
3 homework assignments &
a final assessment with 50 questions that are to be completed in 60 minutes.
The grading policy is super intransparent. He gives no details after the finals.

By the way, don't, and NEVER, ask Dennis about grading policies (absolute/relative, request for paper-checking), whether via email or in person. Otherwise, be prepared to be scolded by him :)))
reviews.comment_workload:
homework and classwork assignments are mostly done on MH connect, an online website that gives you access to our e-book (though most of us don't read it as it's lengthy) and online assignments.

The workload is not that heavy -- no mandatory readings or questions, but only several open-book online assignments during class (meaning, you have to attend classes even there's no attendance) as well as homework. But these are okay as it also helps you consolidate concepts that you've learnt in class.

Homework assignments are more time-consuming - it requires us to do a full accounting process. The third one regarding inventory systems was the hardest. I used like 3-4 hours cumulatively to complete it.

reviews.author: Hi there!
reviews.comment_content: Most of the contents are covered in the DSE syllabus so it's quite easy for those who have BAFS as electives in high school. For those who didn't study BAFS, do consider spending more time on this course to catch up.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tang is a really good teacher. His english is nice and clear. He explains all the concept quite well.
reviews.comment_grading:
Four homework, 1 midterm and 1 final in total.
Homework: full mark
midterm: touch mean
final: 1 SD above mean
Final grade: A-

The grading is quite general as a intro course. The midterm is quite easy but the final is time-consuming and hard.
reviews.comment_workload: As it is only a intro course, the workload is quite light. Homework is quite easy in general.

reviews.author: bonsoirbabe
reviews.comment_content:
Pretty much the same as syllabus
Ppt are uploaded on canvas
reviews.comment_teaching: Just reading from the ppt
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance: signing on papers so you can tell your friends to sign for you

Final: His final paper was just fill in the blanks last year and when it's my semester he changed to all long questions without giving us a sample paper. As a person who have never studied BAFS before, I fucked up pretty much because it was my first time doing his long questions and I have no idea about his marking.

Midterm: all MC

I got mean for midterm but don't know my score for final (probably fucked up very much though), got C+ at last
reviews.comment_workload:
Moderate
Unlimited attempts for assignments

reviews.author: kyra22
reviews.comment_content: Basic knowledge about accounting
reviews.comment_teaching:
Really organized PPT, which is helpful for reviewing the final exam.
The professor is very patient, you can ask him any question after the class.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grades for common homework, but not really good for the exams. You can get at least B if you do every assignment carefully. The exam question type is similar with the homework.
reviews.comment_workload: An assignment every week, which takes about 2-3h per assignment. I wouldn’t say this is a very huge workload, but you need to take time to digest class materials.

basic accounting learnt in bafs plus some additional information
the ways are a bit different only.

iqrs for attendence

reviews.comment_teaching:
He is a nive professor and willing to answer questions after class. I usually gather all the questions about the homework and ask him.
As I took BAFS in DSE, this course is easy for me. The mid term exam is 35 mc and the difficulty of the final exam is the same as the Paper 1 of BAFS DSE Exam. You just need to build the balance sheet and income statement base on the information given.

I got 32 out of 35 in mid term, full in assignment and class participation. I end up got a A+ in this course.
Btw, patrick will provide zoom recording. So, you dont really need to show up in the class unless you have friends to help you sign attendance sheet.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment: 25%

Midterm Test: 20%
Final Exam: 50%
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is manageable and you can try many times until you get all the answer correct.

reviews.author: Ericca
reviews.title: Short review summary
reviews.comment_content: The content of the course adequately covers a substantial portion of accounting knowledge in BAFS. However, I found it challenging at times. It would be beneficial to have a basic understanding of accounting before attending the class, as the professor occasionally assumes prior knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor's teaching style assumes some familiarity with accounting concepts. It is advisable to have a brief understanding of the subject matter before attending the lectures. However, the professor is knowledgeable and provides valuable insights during class discussions.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading system employed in the course is relatively good. One notable aspect is that we were allowed to bring both sides of an A4 paper as a cheat sheet, which was helpful during exams. This policy allowed us to consolidate key concepts and formulas, enhancing our performance.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload for the course is manageable and quite relaxed. Throughout the semester, we had an assignment every two weeks, which allowed for ample time to complete the tasks without feeling overwhelmed.

reviews.author: SunnyZZ
reviews.comment_content: quite competitive for those who haven't leant accounting before. The pace of teaching is fast and most importantly lecture slides are not given during lecture, so focus is needed.
reviews.comment_teaching: His quizzes indeed improve understandings of the topic and also helps strengthening memory. however as mentioned the pace is fast hence keeping on is not an east task. revision after every lecture is needed and crucial for getting a good grade.
reviews.comment_grading: Since Wilbur is a new professor, his misterm exam is insanely difficult, causing a relatively easy final exam. the grade is therefore not bad considering the difficulties of both exam. moreover there's a portion of grading depends on attendance and homework which is not hard to fulfil.
reviews.comment_workload: workload is kind of heavy for rookies in accounting, homework per topic is demanding, there are multiple questions and each question requires time to finish. revision is also needed as mentioned, hence the workload is heavy as conclusion.

reviews.author: Henie Wong
reviews.comment_content: Most of the contents taught are quite similar to those in the high school, such as the preparation of financial statements, journal entries, cash flows, concepts of debits and credits.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is a nice professor with a little Hong Kong accent. He mostly uses Excel for the illustration of different topics (therefore the powerpoints are not very important). You can freely ask him questions during the lessons and he will come to you immediately. If you are not confident about your English, just directly ask him in Cantonese.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very nice grading!!
I would say the mid-term and the final is quite difficult. (even though I am the one who have studied BAFS in high school)
Very comprehensive final- requires you to study every topic. However, the grading is super good, probably 80 is already enough to secure an A.
For myself
Assignment: full
Mid-term: 94/100
Attendance: full
Final: not released
Final grading: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Not a heavy workload, just an assignment before the mid-term ( but like 4 to 5 long questions)
He will make random attendance checks, maybe 4 to 5 times.

reviews.author: hcc
reviews.comment_content:
the syllubus is similiar to the dse, so if you studied account in secondary school, the course should be easy for you.
However, you may need to put more effort on it if you have not studied it before, since students are studying in the same class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lots of example were given in class for clearly understand the teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
normal grading, average student will be given a B
the midterm and final are not hard
no attendance
reviews.comment_workload:
not muvh workload only, very reasonable
around 1 hour to finish each exercise

reviews.author: C_M
reviews.title: Professor is really nice and helpful, doable assignments, uploads lectures and fairly easy midterm but the final exam will definitely fuck you up.
reviews.comment_content: I had done accounting in high school before and therefore could manage keeping up with the content but if you have no prior knowledge of accounting - good luck for this course as it is SO HARD AND SO EXTENSIVE. they make you complete 1 year worth of content in 3 months.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tang Chao is the best professor in terms of teaching, provides amazing materials and explains everything in detail. I used to ask questions every class and he was very happy to answer all of them. He is extremely friendly and the best teacher imo.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments are given via Pearson and they have unlimited attempts so its easy to get full in them.
He has some marks for class participation and iprs so make sure you attend most classes. I do not recommend skipping classes.
Midterm is fairly easy and you should be able to score above mean in it if you prepare well. Final is extremely fucked up and no matter how much you study, you will perform terribly because the questions are so hard I wouldn't expect a proper accounting major to do well in it. Very hard to get A range but luckily he has a huge B range so if you manage to be around the mean then at least B- is guaranteed.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload isn't much in terms of the class as you get assignments once in every two weeks. One midterm and one final. However regular practice outside of class is required otherwise you will forget the concepts taught.

reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 25% (unlimited attempts, so most people got full marks)
participation 5% (just sign your name)
Mid-term 20% (29/32, mean 25.5) Format: all mc
Final 50% (not disclosed, I guess around 85%) Format: writing different balance (no mc), 6 pages of cheat sheets are allowed
--> A-

I think your grade would depend on whether you have studied BAFS in high school before because it really reduces the time you have to learn those new concepts. Try to finish the assignment by yourself in order to get a good grade.

If you want to get good grades instead of learning things, Patrick would be a pretty good choice.
reviews.comment_workload: Need to spend some time finishing the assignments. Try to start earlier.

reviews.comment_grading: Very lenient grading, I had 76% on midterm and 83% on final and got an A. Our professor told us that he gave us grades that he did not believe matched our actual ability though.
reviews.comment_workload: Somewhat manageable, just need to complete weekly homework but have to do a lot of catchup if you don't pay attention in class like me.

reviews.author: n1l0h3i0
reviews.title: He is GRADE GOD! Reg him if you can! I love Steven!
reviews.comment_content:
Topics:
1. Investing, financing decisions & balance sheet
2. Operating decisions & income statement  
3. Adjustments, financial statements & quality of earnings
4. Sales revenue; receivables & cash  
5. Cost of goods sold & inventory  
6. Property, plant & equipment (“PPE”)  
7. Current liabilities  
8. Long-term debts & Present Value applications
9. Owners’ equity  
10. Statement of Cash Flows

After the course, you need to know how to create journal entries, do a trial balance, and create the 3 main financial statements: Income Statement, Balance Sheet, and Statement of Cash Flows. Alongside other basic accounting/finance tools, like bonds and stocks, and the above accounting concepts.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Steven is an incredibly patient teacher who takes the time to explain each concept clearly and thoroughly. He provides detailed explanations and walks through every case to ensure that you understand the logic behind each concept. Additionally, he uses Excel to help clarify and demonstrate concepts, and always provides at least one worked example to illustrate each concept. What's more, is that he answers your email quickly. I once asked him a question at the midnight, and he immediately answered me and helped me work through the exercise.

If you are a non-BAFS student or student with no prior accounting experience like me, you can rest assured that you won't give enough exercise. He allocates time during class for students to practice selected questions that are relevant and essential for this course and their learning.
reviews.comment_grading:
Extremely good grading!
Didn't expect to get an A+ as a non-BAFS student.

Participation: 5% (Attending the lessons alone is sufficient to obtain this 5% mark. There is no requirement to score 100% for the in-class exercise, in which students are simply encouraged to do their best.)

Individual assignment: 20%
Mid-term exam: 25%
Final exam: 50%
reviews.comment_workload: There is only 1 assignment for Steven's lesson. Although there is only one assignment foe the entire course, it is crucial to put in effort, especially if you learnt accounting before.

reviews.author: Prison Survivor
reviews.title: Don't choose Sidd
reviews.comment_content:
For the students who studied BAFS in secondary school, this course should be easy to follow. Since I studied BAFS in secondary school, I didn't take any lesson and just prepared the exam two weeks before the exam starts, and the result of exam is still satisfactory.

However, for the students who did not study BAFS before, it will be quite hard to follow. Since the syllabus of Acct 2010 are divided to 2 years in secondary school, and you have to study whole syllabus in 4 months.
reviews.comment_teaching: Actually I think most of the local cannot follow what he say since his English is super hard to follow
reviews.comment_grading: My total mark is 88.9 and the cut-off of A- is 89, my final grading is B+. I have emailed to the professor for the paper checking but he rejected
reviews.comment_workload: Not high workload, only have 3 hws, 1 midterm exam and 1 final exam

reviews.author: Elemerh
reviews.title: Good course. Take it.
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction & Financial Statements and Business Decisions
Investing and Financing Decisions and the Accounting System
Operating Decisions and the Accounting System
Adjustments, Financial Statements, and the Quality of Earnings
Sales Revenue, Receivables, and Cash
Cost of Goods Sold and Inventory
Property, Plant and Equipment
Time Value of Money
Corporate Bonds
Reporting Liabilities
Owner's Equity
Statement of Cash Flows
reviews.comment_teaching: really clear explanation and well-taught in proper English. The prof is previously an official CPA member in HK so he is not only professional in the accounting field but also got adequate experience in the work. Therefore the example given in the lecture is hands-on. Really practical and easy to understand "why the principle". I heard other professors did not have those sorts of experiences but 'journal experience'. From my perspective, the later is better and make so much sense.
reviews.comment_grading: really good as long as you study hard and put effort to the lecture and assignment.
reviews.comment_workload: one assignment per week and the workload is not that much as I expected but it really worth to take it seriously.

reviews.author: timeflies
reviews.title: kelvin is good
reviews.comment_content:
Basics of financial accounting

All chapters in the textbook but not ch5 and ch 10: because kelvin decided to skip them maybe coz too hard or smth, other classes had to learn those so giving B.

Overview of financial accounting
Balance sheet
Income statement
Adjustments, earnings
Sales, revenue, receeiables
COGS, inventory
PPE
Liabilities
Stockholders' equity
Statement of cash flow

not hard, u can do well
reviews.comment_teaching:
Kelvin is a very good teacher. No accent. He's patient, explains concepts well and gives vivid examples. But sometimes repeated examples might be too much. We can ask questions throughout the lectures and he will definitely answer them.

He teaches relatively slower than other classes, so it is easier to do well in the midterms in my opinion. He prefers to slowly teach the basics and so we get familiar with everything before rolling in the complex stuff, which I appreciate. Good for those who've never done accounting before like me.
reviews.comment_grading:
5 assignments in throughout the sem, take best 4, 7.5% each so 30%
midterm 20%
finals 50%

assignments' class mean always very high, almost full marks
midterms mean not that high around 70% if i rmb correctly
finals wont know

my score:
Assignment 1  43/50
Assignment 2 45/50
Assignment 3 33/35
Assignment 4 40/40
Assignment 5 56.5/60
Mid-term         56/60
Finals               not disclosed
--> got A+ at the end. thank you kelvin
reviews.comment_workload:
If you've never done accounting before, then u have to review stuff once in a while and prep a bit for midterms and finals. Need to do some practice. but overall not heavy workload at all.

Assignments are pretty simple and don't take much time to complete. u can also check with ur friends so no need to worry.

reviews.author: HC123
reviews.comment_content:
An introduction to the financial accounting and reporting process from the perspective of external decision-makers. The course focuses on fundamental accounting concepts and principles. You will learn how the economic transactions of an enterprise are reported in the financial statements and related disclosures. The course is designed to provide an overview of financial accounting so that, upon completion of the course, you should be able to read, interpret, and analyze corporate financial reports.

Chapter Topic
1 Financial Statements and Business Decisions
2 Investing and financing decisions and the accounting system
3 Operating decisions and the accounting system
4 Adjustments, financial statements, and the quality of earnings
5 Communicating and  Analyzing Accounting Information
6 Sales revenue, receivables, and bad debt
Midterm Exam
7 Cost of goods sold and inventory
8 Property, plant, and equipment
9 Reporting liabilities
10 Bonds
11 Reporting and interpreting stockholders’ equity
12 Statement of cash flows

I enjoy the materials. However, they are just about theory. You need to do the tutorial questions. Theory will not be tested in the exam.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Boring, sleepy, many people skip the class because you can see the attendance score is veryyy small.

You can understand the materials without attending the class. However, make sure you do the tutorial question practice. They are very helpful.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 5/5% mean: ?
3% is attendance
2% is exercise
Homework 25/25% mean: ?
Midterm exam 8.35/20% mean: 9.4
Final exam ?/50% mean: ?
Grade C+

Midterm is very time consuming. I could do quite well for the essay, but MC has a lot of trap. There is so many unnecessary info for calculation. So, make sure you really understand how to calculate.

The final score is not released. I bet I am below mean too, but I am very sure I am not the lowest one. There are no MC question, all essay.
reviews.comment_workload:
5 assignments in total using McGraw-Hill.

The assignments are time-consuming, because each assignment can have 15 questions with sub-questions a, b, c.

reviews.author: shrimpdumplings
reviews.title: I LOVE STEVEN CHEUNG!!! ❤️❤️❤️ A real role model for other UST prof
reviews.comment_content:
Introductory accounting course, starting from the basics (such as debit, credit, t-accounts) to intermediate content (including inventory handling, bank rec, bonds and stocks etc.) {Idk why I can't attach a file below, so please refer to other's posts}

The content at the beginning is easy for DSE BAFS students. Those without business background in high school may need more effort.

However, be aware that the teaching progress is fast (talking like one lecture per chapter, only sometimes harder topics will use two or three lectures).
So, make sure you pay attention to the lectures in order not to miss the content.

⭐⭐Another reason for that is that random in-class practices will be given by Steven after add/drop period in order to count for participation marks (does not matter if you answer them wrong, it is just for attendance-taking)⭐⭐

There is only 1 assignment throughout the term, and content is basically covered in lectures.

Just to be careful of the question asking accounting concepts. It is unclear how the TA marks this question. But this only counts for a few marks in the hw, no worries✨✨
reviews.comment_teaching:
Steven is extremely patient in explaining different concepts. He uses excel every lesson to perform accounting practices and will upload them to Canvas. He would also ask time to time whether we could follow his pace of teaching. A real role model for other UST professors💯💯

You can ask him questions before, during and after the lessons in English, Cantonese and Putonghua🥰🥰 He welcomes questions and after every lesson there must be a queue waiting to ask him.

Btw, he likes to use Inbox function of Canvas. (he would remind us some important announcement, and even asks us for helping to fill in the SFQ feedback🤣🤣)

Lucky if you are in his class!
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation (random in-class practice mentioned above) 5%
1 Individual assignment (mentioned above)  20%
Mid-term exam 25%
Final exam 50%
Total 100%

Mid-term is really easy. Revise and you will get high marks.

Final exam is not cumulative. But just like other comments below, I find the questions quite hard (cannot meet a balance eventually!!😭😭) I even could not finish the parts of the last question

BUT!! Luckily it turns out the grade come out quite good [A range]
To sum up: I LOVE YOU STEVEN💖💖 Best prof in UST
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload.
No readings. No online homework and weekly assignment (I heard that other lecturers require students to do weekly online hw)

Only 1 assignment throughout the term (but with like almost 10 parts, so do not procrastinate to the last day to do it)

Just simply pay attention in class, revise the concept and accounting measures if needed and you'll be fine😎😎

reviews.author: sleep
reviews.title: worth to choose
reviews.comment_content: Relatively easy for an introductory course for beginners to study ACCT. You can follow his PowerPoint and ignore the ebook. Although PowerPoint is quite simple, it is enough if you pay attention during class or study alone.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is a funny professor. Sometimes he would make some jokes to help you focus on the material. And you are welcome to ask any questions during or after the class. He is lovely and willing to explain things twice if you still need to get the concept right.

However, it may take some time to understand ACCT if you have yet to study BAFS in DSE. In the beginning, you may feel frustrated about what he is teaching. But after introducing all the basic knowledge and moving on to a few difficult things, you will finally catch up if you have studied his PowerPoint.
reviews.comment_grading:
(have studied BAFS with accounting as elective before)
30% take-home assignments (only the best 4 will be counted)   95.9/100

20%MT
51/60 mean 44.5

50% Final ( no disclosure) but feels ok ( not hard at all)
overall got an A in this course
reviews.comment_workload: Its workload for a three-credit course is very light. I only got 5-6 assignments. And every assignment only contains a few questions. No other assignments or quizzes. So the workload of this course is light.

reviews.author: keya
reviews.comment_content: content was easy to understand as I had taken accounting before in high school. For a beginner the course can be a lot.
reviews.comment_teaching: teaching was bad as he only referred to his slides and did not explain accounting in a logical chronological manner starting from journal entries to the final statements.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading was very easy as the homework made an adequate percentage of the grade and final was very easy.
reviews.comment_workload: workload was not a lot as all the assignments were online and you could check your answers before submitting. The midterm was hard however the final was very easy as he told us what could come in the paper.

reviews.author: 芹菜
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction of financial statements and principles of financial accounting. A bit boring but still difficult for those who didn't learn accounting before cuz there is a lot to remember.
You need to buy the eBook to get access to the assignment system.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Wilbur's English accent is excellent.
Most of the time, he is just reading from the PowerPoint, which is why I give him a B. However, he always tries to make everyone understand and is willing to answer our questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think the grading is not so good.

Participation 5%
Homework 20%
Midterm exam 25%
Final exam 50%

It's easy to get 25% in participation and homework.
I scored above the mean on mt and got almost the same answer as another student, but he got an A while I was B+. I thought at least I could get an A-. It was a difference of just one subgrade but still a shock to me.
Since the final results were not given, maybe I messed up my final and didn't realize it. (I don't think so TT)
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light. Only 5 assignments.
We had 2 weeks to finish each.

reviews.author: patatalam
reviews.title: Best teacher ever!!!! Very lucky if youre in his class!!!!
reviews.comment_content: Useful content, meaningful course! Didnt take DSE BAFS, but still managed to catch up with the progress (credit to the instructor's wonderful teaching!)
reviews.comment_teaching: I like the instructor's teaching style very much! He is very orgainsed, and teaches very clearly. He likes using Excel to demonstrate and explain different question types. He is also very patient and willing to answer questions after class or when he gives the class time to do practice questions (he chooses the questions which are useful and important). Amazing teacher!!!! Another good thing: No $300 CONNECT Account required for doing assignments!
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grading! Quite lenient! Got A- finally

Participation 5% (just counting attendance, no need to score 100% in the in-class exercises in order to get this 5%, just do your best)

Individual assignment 20% (only 1 hw for the whole course! but really need to put in effort, especially if you havent learnt acct before)

Mid-term exam 25%
Final exam 50%
reviews.comment_workload: The main workload is to prepare for the mid-term and final exams, but the instructor will help you review in the lessons right before the exams, which is very very nice. Only 1 hw, which makes his class's workload much lighter than the others! The hw is also very useful in helping you grasp the important concepts and follow up with the course.

reviews.author: lindaynz
reviews.title: Compulsory business core
reviews.comment_content: I’ll say it covers all the basic concepts in ACCT. Should be useful if you are doing this major, wasnt that interesting but acceptable. Intellectually not extremely difficult, but to covers everything and understand all topics is quite a bit of work. Need lots of time & effort, compare to other first sem classes.
reviews.comment_teaching: Robin is p good. He is quite serious when teaching ppt but I could tell he tried to interact. Hes’s also patient hen you ask questions. However, it still makes me fall asleep… because the content isn’t very interesting and the teach kinda just reads off the power point.
reviews.comment_grading: I didn’t get a good  grade for acct. It’s really competitive because most people in this class is students from dse who learnt everything in highschool. Also the test was pretty hard + time constricted + I don’t understand why we’re doing balance sheet on paper while nowadays people only do it on excel. Anyways, not my favorite course.
reviews.comment_workload: Manageable. We only have homework that’s all online. It’s quite a lot each time but you have 2 weeks to finish, also there’s unliminated attempt so you can totally get a lot of mark from assignments alone.

reviews.author: ExplosiveP
reviews.title: Heavy workload, but because of Patrick, it becomes much easier!!!!!!!!! REG PATRICK
reviews.comment_content:
Basic Accounting Stuff: 4 financial statements and some common valuation ratios. Very useful for future ACCT or FINA courses.

Note: You have to purchase an e-book or something in order to have access to the assignments.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He talks a bit slow, just because he explains everything in detail. Though this causes his lectures to be a bit boring, even confusing sometimes.

But his powerpoint is detailed enough for handling assignments and exams, so you could self-learn without any lectures.

He is kind, willing to answer students' questions after lesson.

He even released some practise quizzes, with detailed explanation for tricky questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Weighting:
Assignments 25%
Class participation 5%
Midterm 20%
Final exam 50%

Midterm Stats (All MC, with a bit tricky questions):
High: 32
Low: 14
Average: 25.5039
SD: 5.0109

Final(SQ + LQ: difficulty is rather easy---You could check if you're correct by balancing and matching your statements):
No stats available

Tips on getting better grades: Keep revising and re-doing all the assignments before final---This really helps you go through the sheer amount of content in 1-2 days. For formats, the cheat sheets would come in handy :)
reviews.comment_workload:
If you didn't take BAFS in HKDSE, the workload is going to be very very heavy. 12 chapters in 1 semester (about 1 chapter per week), with a ton of new concepts and jargon.

Luckily, Patrick allows 1 cheat sheet for midterm, and 3 cheat sheets for final!! (My semester). This way you don't have to memorise all the format and content!!! This reason should be enough for you to reg him (Most of other profs only allow 1 cheat sheet)

1 assignment per week, unlimited attempts (Time needed varies from around 1 hr to 4 hrs)

reviews.author: lcw
reviews.comment_content: quite boring for students wif bafs background
reviews.comment_teaching: boring
reviews.comment_grading: quite good I think. I got an A eventually even i blanked a few questions in the final. Mean of mid term and quizzes are quite high, but not difficult.
reviews.comment_workload: hv homework nearly every week but have unlimited attempts before deadline and will count the one with highest, the assignment will show the part you are wrong so it is easier to get full marks. one or two quiz in the semester, one midterm and one final, acceptable workload I guess

reviews.author: sliverstar
reviews.title: great for those who have studied accounting before, unfriendly for beginners
reviews.comment_content:
Most of the content has been learned if you had taken BAFS in dse, so it will be easy for you.
Topics:
(all the chapter in financial accounting except chap 5 and 10)

I am a completely beginners in accounting. I am not familiar to those topics so I have to spend more time to catch up what he said in class.

But I would suggest you to self-learn in YouTube, search related topics. It is more clear than professor MAK.
reviews.comment_teaching:
To be honest, I think the course is really unfriendly to the beginners. It took several lessons at the beginner to introduce you the whole course and give examples(eg analyse Cathay pacific financial report).   
But as a beginner, you will easily be out-focused as you will hear many terms you don't know and lose you patience and interest.

My friend, who studied bafs before, found it really informative and interesting. Professor Mak always made jokes in the class and raise questions to try to be interactive.

So the learning experience really depends on whether you have learnt accounting.

ps. I sometime didn't listen to him and skip his lectures :P
reviews.comment_grading:
Hw 30 %
mid term 20%
final 50%

For your reference,
assignment 1 47/50
assignment 2 46/50
assignment 3 31/35
assignment 4 40/40
assignment 5 58/60

mid term 50/60
mean 44.5
