reviews.comment_workload:
assignments are great for testing yourself.
Please double check and discuss with your classmates if you aim score high.

reviews.author: David111200
reviews.comment_content: Everything taught in this course was quite useful for future learning, and it is related to many other subjects that you may explore in the future.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor was excellent, she explained all content in great details and using more time in class to help us go through some sample questions so we can grasp the idea more thoroughly.
reviews.comment_grading: I think the grading was acceptable since I put a lot of effort into this course and performed very well in the final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload depends on how much you want to grasp the knowledge. If you want to understand all content deeply, then you may need to do plenty of extra homework on your own.

reviews.author: Kerstin
reviews.title: Very recommended!!!
reviews.comment_content:
Week 2: Investing, financing decisions & balance sheet
3: Operating decisions & income statement
4: Adjustments, financial statements  & quality of earnings
5: Sales revenue; receivables & cash
6: Cost of goods sold & inventory
7: Property, plant & equipment (“PPE”)
8-9: Current liabilities
10: Owners’ equity
11-12: Statement of Cash Flows
reviews.comment_teaching:
Firstly, his ppt is very detailed.
Secondly, he provides mini quizzes (no marks are counted) after teaching every topics that can deepen the knowledge we hv learnt.
Also, Kelvin is very patient that he explains every single word shown in ppt (that sometime is a bit boring to students who already know it, but it is very useful to those who don’t know it) and answer every questions very detailed.
More importantly, he is very nice and approachable that you can talk with talk in Cantonese.
Overall, the teaching ambience is good that kelvin always makes joke in lesson and interacts with students.
reviews.comment_grading:
No participation scores are counted
20% Take home assignments (only the best 4 are counted in whole assessment)
30% Midterm
50% Final
Very easy to get a good grade
reviews.comment_workload:
Very low workload
Only have 5 assignments in total and each assignment only has 2 questions
And those questions are quite easy that most of us can complete them after reading his ppt and textbook
One midterm and one final
It is very easy to students who have studied bafs in secondary school, but those who did not learn accounting before can also easily catch up as Kelvin teaches it very detailed

reviews.author: Peter00731
reviews.title: not bad
reviews.comment_content: some basic accouting stuff such as financial statements, statement of cash flows income statements etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: kinda boring as he only focus on reading powerpoint but he is willing to answer every questions and lots of review session before mid term or final.
reviews.comment_grading:
need to take attendance which is 5% of the whole course grade
the midterm and final is really easy so the mean is high but still can easily get a good grade
reviews.comment_workload: the workload is light as there are only 5-6 assignments in the whole semester and each of them have 2weeks to do with unlimited chances.

reviews.author: jshs
reviews.comment_content: Fairly easy and basic content for accounting. Teaches how to create journal entries, do a trial balance, and create the 3 main financial statements: Income Statement, Balance Sheet, Statement of Cash Flows. Midterm was very easy and mean was very high but final was slightly more difficult and tricky because he combines everything and asks you to first create journal entries and reflect that in an Income Statement, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow Statement.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor explains the content very clearly! He would stop every now and then to make sure everyone understands the lesson and provides you with an excel sheet to do some practice exercises.

Sometimes his accent might be a little difficult to understand but other than that, everything was very clear and easy to follow. He's super lenient with attendance also, I don't recall him taking any attendance but still highly recommend to attend his class!
reviews.comment_grading: I think grading is quite lenient. While midterm mean was very high, most of the class agreed that the finals was fairly difficult (as described in the content portion above). He didn't release the grade breakdowns but my recommendation is just to make sure to practice the final exam format described above. Midterm he only tested us on Chapter 6, so it was fairly easy to prepare as well!
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is very light; he gives occasional mcgraw-hill homework but they're not difficult by any means. They're really good to just practice the concepts taught in class. But I would say that doing the homework isn't enough to score high in this course. Probably need to do more exercise from the book to master the concepts better.

reviews.author: Human_01
reviews.comment_content:
See attachment.

Prof use the GAAP accounting standard instead of IFRS to make the course more fair. Because some students have studied BAFS before(like me), which is under IFRS Format, so he use GAAP to reduce the advantage of BAFS student.

However, as a BAFS student, I think two standard is quite similar, like 80-90% similar, just changed the presenting format a little bit. So BAFS students still have a huge advantage.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very good professor. He is a mainland Prof who have fluent English with NO accent.

He is very patient and welcome to any question. His teaching skills is good, able to explain concepts clearly with examples

He is willing to change his teaching style to suit student need. He would conduct survey before(ask student's accounting background, suggestion) , in the middle(teaching pace, difficulty of midterm exam, suggestion)  and after semester (difficulty, suggestion) to ask for suggestions and not only that he will also change. (eg. he slower his teaching pace when the majority of the class think the topic is difficult/ will add more in-class exercise in the ppt upon request).

He also let the class to decide whether to have a cheatsheet for the Final or not by voting.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation (IPRS submission) 5%
5 Individual HW (Unlimited attempt)  20% (each 4%)
Midterm 25%
Final Exam (with 1 A4 cheatsheet) 50%
Bonus 2% (By asking meaningful question in class)
Me: Overall ~82% A+

Final is not user friendly lol. It consists of 30 pages, single sided printed. The question, reading appendix and answer margin are all stapled together, making it a bit thick and not user-friendly. I waste lotssss of time dealing with the paper thing... I kinda regret not tearing the questions and appendix off so that I can read them side by side with my answer...lmao

Grading is surprisingly good. I was quite sad after the final exam because I left a whole section(~20mark) blank due to not enough time. I thought I would get a B /B+/A-. But still get an A+. WOW THANKS PROF TANG SO MUCHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_workload:
Very Light for me.
Participation is graded on completion.
HW is Easy. The system will highlight where you get the answer wrong(but not showing the correct ans) and you can then redo that part and submit again, until you get full mark. I suggest taking a screenshot of all your ans before the final submission for revision.

reviews.author: Alexto
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite easy for BAFS students. For students who had not taken BAFS before during DSE this coures may be somehow difficult .The content would not be too much for the final exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is good and clear. Tech always interacts with students to answer questions and share opinions.
reviews.comment_grading:
3 Homework Quizzes 30%
Midterm 30%
Final exam 40%

Score:A-
Reasonal grading.
reviews.comment_workload: Fairly light workload. After every 1/2 Chapters, the professor will give a homework set for you to do. It is graded based on effort. Good platform for you to revise and know what are the important concepts of the chapter.

reviews.author: Stephanie Lo
reviews.title: Difficult content after midterm examination
reviews.comment_content: Content is in good detail with some exercises in powerpoint for us to do during lessons. Although I couldnt pick them up quickly in lessons, they are good practices for exams and mid-terms. Would suggest more effort to be put in the content after midterm, they are more difficult and of cross topics.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tang Chao teaches in class with a very clear and distinct voice. He would repeat sentences when students could not understand for a certain part. This allows us to jot our notes in a timely manner.
reviews.comment_grading: I got 1 SD above mean for midterm but below mean for exam. I would say the grading is fair. Since I only studied the day before the final exam date. However, since the exam paper is different between professors, particularly, Tang Chao's exam includes a part called fill in a blank (2.5 marks @1 question, total 25  questions), that part I think i got 0, it is very difficult, no marks for doing calculation steps, and you have to integrate from the long balance sheets and income statements listed at the end of the paper. It was a disaster for me.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is acceptable. Weekly online assignments with infinite answer available til you got 100. I manage to got 100 for all. The online assignments are also useful for your midterm and exams, as they have similar question types.

reviews.comment_grading:
normal grading
midterm is easy, most people got full mark.
final is hard

Midterm      30%
Final exam 40%

HW1:9.5/10
HW2:10/10
HW3:14.25/15
MT: 100/100
Final: 83/100

Letter Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
not much, 3 hw, 1 mt, 1 final
no attendance
mt and final can bring cheatsheet

reviews.author: MisterCommand
reviews.title: Be prepared to spend more time if you are not familiar with Accounting
reviews.comment_content:
- Covered almost the entire book (some other professors do not)
- Required eBook for submitting homework
reviews.comment_teaching:
- Started teaching in HKUST this semester
- Due to time constraints, he went through the content pretty quickly
- Ended class on time, somethings early
- Delivered content precisely and concisely
- Explained common misconceptions and confusing terms in detail, which is good for beginners
- Answered students' questions actively
reviews.comment_grading:
Difficult midterm (I believe it was because he was new to HKUST and this course), had to +20 mark for everyone.

Questions in the final had moderate difficulty, but a lot of time was given, so overall it could be considered easy.
1 double-sided A4 cheatsheet is permitted in the final exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
I had no prior knowledge of Accounting (I didn't study BAFS in HKDSE)
- Some terms were difficult to comprehend and required you to do some research (via professor/friend/online)
- Homework could be considered time-consuming especially if you are new to Accounting

Expected time spent (new to Accounting):
Homework: 2 - 5 hrs / 2 weeks
Research and revision: 1 - 3 hrs / week

reviews.author: lwt03
reviews.comment_content:
1 Financial Statements and Business Decisions (SKIP Chapter
Supplements) 2%
2 Investing and Financing Decisions and the Accounting System 2%
3 Operating Decisions and the Accounting System 2%
4 Adjustments, Financial Statements, and the Quality of Earnings  
1–4 Comprehensive review and quiz 7%
6 Sales Revenue, Receivables, and Cash (SKIP “reconciliation of
the cash accounts and the bank statements”) 2%
7 Cost of goods sold and inventory 2%
8 Property, plant, and equipment   
6–8 Comprehensive review and quiz 7%
9 Reporting liabilities (SKIP Chapter Supplements) 2%
10  Corporate bonds (SKIP Chapter Supplements) 2%
11 Owners’ equity (SKIP Chapter Supplement） 2%
12 Statement of cash flows (SKIP Chapter Supplements A and C)  
1–12 (-5) Final exam 25%

reviews.author: usthing
reviews.comment_content:
A lot of content in one semester
gets harder after midterm
especially when it comes to bonds and the direct method in the last two chapters.
The content is interesting and useful to build a foundation in accounting.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching is very good, with very clear content planned out each lecture and lots of in class practice that the professor will explain in detail. He always welcomes questions and answers them clearly, it also counts as participation bonus points if your questions are novel and thoughtful.
I really enjoyed his teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
midterm paper is relatively easy, and the concepts covered are elementary before you get to the second half of the sem. There are minimum challenging questions in the midterm so all you have to do is be careful and make sure you don't make stupid mistakes.
final paper is very challenging, and the time is not sufficient for the hard questions in the end.
To be more specific, the final is focused on the content covered after midterm (which is the hardest). 20 MCQ, 20 for bonds, 20 for cash flow, 20 for a comprehensive question, 20 for challenging questions.
reviews.comment_workload: There are only 5 assignments. BUT don't think the workload light. Assignments are from the ebook and you have to fill in the blanks from different accounts. However, if you don't review the lecture and his powerpoints, you will have no clue how to do the assignments. So the workload is mostly self review and study before you truely understand the concepts and be able to finish the assignments in full marks (you can submit it unlimited times).

reviews.author: Jimmylo1314
reviews.comment_content: Basic accounting knowledge, which would be easy for students who took BAFS in HKDSE.
reviews.comment_teaching: Great teaching. The instructor always ask us questions that are outside the powerpoints to stimulate our thinking. It is never bored to listen to his teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is good.
HW: 100/100
Midterm: 100/100
Final: 89.5/100
Final grade is A.
I thought I would be able to get an A+ but the curve is really high.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light with 3 assignments. They are really easy to get full mark. Simply work for the midterm and final is fine.

reviews.author: Roslyn
reviews.comment_content:
Basic principles of accounting. (Balance sheet, cash flows, stockholders’ equity, cash reconciliation, the changes of them in various situations)
Quite hard to understand at first for students who’ve never learnt accounting before.
reviews.comment_teaching:
GOOD FOR BEGINNERS!
Steven is really patient and he teaches slowly by explaining each concept clearly. He would go through every cases in detail and tell you the logic. But it might be quite boring for students who’ve learnt accounting before, cause he would ask students to complete the tasks first and later explain it
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair(seems to have a lot Brange?)

Participation 5% (6 times total.don’t know when will he take participation, better attend every lecture)
Individual assignment 20% (easy to get high score if you check the answer with your friends.)
(Mean:88.3/100 High:100 me:90.5)
Midterm25% (easy as long as you review all the questions practiced in class)
(Mean:77.5/100 High:100 Low:30 me:95)
Final50% (HARD AS HELL, nothing is balanced and can’t finish in time)
(Grade not given)

Letter grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
SUPER LIGHT!
No homework except the individual assignment
Slightly go through the question discussed before mt would be alright
Make sure you understand the past paper of Final cuz it’s really really hard

reviews.author: buwy
reviews.title: foundation course
reviews.comment_content:
nice course with rich accounting fundamental knowledge.
generally have 10 topics in common,
including
A. Introduction to Accounting
B. Principles of Accounting
C. Accounting Formula
D. Application of Accounting in the real business world
reviews.comment_teaching:
nice teaching.
not bad sound, not boring, wont sleep at least haha,
he always like to ask question during class, but guys, just answer and do not need be afraid, because he actually does not give any mark for class participation and yes, a thing for sure is, there is really no attendance. so in case if you really have any stuffs to do, just skip will be fine haha,
for your information, there is definitely lecture videos for you to review, and his ppt is pretty complete with all the info that we need to know for the exam

just review it and it really helps :> no matter in mc or long question, so good grade if you are a good student (in my point of view, it is guaranteed to get A range from Tang Chao), so guys, just enroll it, or else you may feel regret hahahaha
reviews.comment_grading:
quite nice grade,
no need to take attendance,
the percentages of each quiz and homework and midterm and final will be presented and stated clearly in his syllabus, since every year is different, the following stats is just for reference
A. Quiz (10%)
B. Homework (10%)
C. Midterm (30%)
D. Final (50%)
didn't do much revision but still got A grade at the end, perhaps because his marking is not that "tight" and he gives marks easily to students, is a nice professor thank you him for letting me having a good grade in my transcript :>
reviews.comment_workload:
there are 3-4 assignments (depends on the lecture progress),
usually have weekly quiz, total around 5 quizzes there,
there are 1 mid term and 1 final exam,
0 presentation and project needed,
also no need to submit essay, so the workload is quite similar to others' professors'

reviews.author: yanyanb
reviews.comment_content:
The syllabus prior to the midterm is essentially identical to the ACCT DSE. Non-ACCT students will struggle to catch up because the chapters are structured in an unusual order, in my opinion.

I believe one of the chapters on modifying entries is the most difficult to understand. This chapter demands students with no accounting background to categorize various products, which takes a lot of time and effort. However, for certain chapters following the final, the chapter synopsis directly contradicts the preceding chapter on modifying entries.

In general, my friends who had previously studied accounting received nearly full grades. This is really aggravating for students like myself.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was fair, with reasonably high means, and the midterm was simple to complete, but the time limit for the final was much more rigorous. There is homework, but it is also doable; simply consult the textbook.
reviews.comment_workload:
Little.
Only some in-class group tasks every other week, as well as mid-term and final exams. However, it is crucial to highlight that ONLY kelvin's class includes a CASE STUDY REPORT, which has been circulated for over a month, giving us plenty of time to complete and is very simple provided you have done specific research on the given topic. There are also examples of good works from the previous year.

reviews.author: Rachael_
reviews.comment_content: For me, the content is really complicated and I could not catch up.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof TANG Chao always explain the content in detail (though I did not quiet understand) and is always glad to answer students' question.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is just acceptable.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not quite heavy. We have 5 homework assignments in total. For each assignment, although the question might be difficult, we have unlimited attempts, in other words, it is always easy to earn full mark in the homework assignment part as long as you keep trying.

reviews.author: Suki Au
reviews.title: Nice professor!
reviews.comment_content:
The course involves most topics taught in DSE BAFS curriculum, so students who studied BAFS in high school might have some advantages.

Here are some of the topics:
- Investing and financing decisions and the accounting system
- Operating decisions and the accounting system
-  Adjustments, financial statements, and the quality of earnings
- Sales revenue, receivables, the bad debt
- Cost of goods sold and inventory
- Property, plant, and equipment
- Reporting liabilities
- Bonds
- Reporting and interpreting stockholders’ equity
- Statement of cash flows
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Tang explains accounting concepts detailedly with examples. He also provides some exercises for students to finish in class, which can consolidate our learning. He is very nice and is very willing to answer students' questions. He has a high proficiency in English. The accent is clear. Overall, his teaching is good!!
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 5%:
IPRS during lecture, answers are not graded based on the accuracy

Homework 20%:
The deadline is usually two weeks after the release day, so we have sufficient time to finish them.

Midterm exam  25%:
Mean 71
Median 74
Max         98
Standard Deviation 16

Final exam 50%:
The final exam is cumulative. Prof Tang allows us to bring a two-sided one-page cheat sheet this year, yet the exam becomes more difficult.  
The mean and median are 47, and the standard deviation is 13.8.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite light. There are 5 problem sets in total (distributed every 2-3 weeks) and we have unlimited attempts.

reviews.author: kkhehe
reviews.comment_content:
No attendance but participation is real good: loves students asking questions (dk it this affects marks). Helpful content all on "Principals of Financial Accounting" (CONNECT HILL).

BONUS TIP: do NOT buy the connect hill software/system/ textbook IF YOU ARE in KELVIN's sessions. His homework does not require that.

Grade: C+ without any background knowledge and tried my best in everything
reviews.comment_teaching: Okay but many times he knows more than the student (of course) but explains in such a way by oversimplifying e.g. "man" means "man"/"a man is a man". Or he could overcomplicate something extremely simple. His Qualtrics are great to address any immediate questions, though. Pretty detailed teachings of material, could see he enjoys the job.
reviews.comment_grading: Can't say anything about the curves because that is UST and up to each prof's discretion :)
reviews.comment_workload: Till the end of the term (around) November all homework assignments piled up and are only max. 5 days apart from each other...

reviews.author: saanchi shah
reviews.title: Good learning experience, patient teacher
reviews.comment_content: Reasonable level of difficulty. Students with a Business / Accounting background have some advantage as they may be more well versed in the basics. however, if you work hard, the content is not very hard to cope with.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very clear and patient. Far better than other teachers in clarity and explanations. Good resources.
reviews.comment_grading: Mid term was graded pretty leniently although the exam itself was relatively easy. Final was very difficult but graded well.
reviews.comment_workload: Just 1 HW, 1 Mid-term and 1 Final Exam - very manageable. The main challenge is ensuring that you are running on par with his teaching and understanding content.

reviews.author: 科大廢青
reviews.title: Nice professor but difficult mt and final
reviews.comment_content: Basic BAFS content.
reviews.comment_teaching: I'm a local but even I could not bear with his Hong Kong accent. It's very disturbing to hear his voice with his heavy Hong Kong accent. But overall, he is super nice and he is willing to answer questions from students. He basically tells many examples on Excel which I think it's good.
reviews.comment_grading:
I don't have any prior knowledge of BAFS, so I'm completely new to accounting.
I would say... the individual assignment was ridiculous.... not beginner friendly. Mid-term and final were hard AF. Even my friends who took BAFS in DSE also said that.
So I would say, if you don't wanna f**k up your cga, don't reg him.
Letter grade: C
reviews.comment_workload:
Fair. Just a little rush for the first assignment.
I literally just learnt accounting for about 4 weeks and the difficulty level is horrible...
Also, he took attendance randomly, which counts towards your 5% participation marks. So, even if you got 5** in BAFS, don't skip a class, cuz he won't tell you when he's gonna take attendance.

reviews.author: 狄更斯
reviews.title: A passionate professor
reviews.comment_content:
Investing, financing decisions & balance sheet
Operating decisions & income statement  
Adjustments, financial statements & quality of earnings
Sales revenue; receivables & cash  
Cost of goods sold & inventory  
Property, plant & equipment (“PPE”)  
Current liabilities  
Long-term debts & Present Value applications
Owners’ equity  
Statement of Cash Flows

Quite a lot of topics have been covered in the HKDSE syllabus.

For students with no accounting background, you are recommended to do trainings every week.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Cheung explains concepts clearly with the aid of Excel. He demonstrates each concept with at least one worked example. After that, he usually provides some time for students to work on the textbook exercises. If you have any questions, feel free to raise your hand and he will come immediately. You can talk to him with Cantonese, English or Putonghua.

After the lesson, if you still have any questions, you can send an email to him. He usually replies in a few hours. One time I sent him an email at 12:30 am, and he replied me in just 5 minutes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 5%
Individual assignment 20%
Mid-term exam 25%
Final exam 50% (A piece of cheat sheet is allowed)
Total 100%

Professor Cheung counts attendance randomly.

The revision questions for final exam is extremely similar to the actual ones.

Statisitics for final grading were not posted, but I guess SBM courses are generally more lenient. Probably around 25% A range.

For people with an accounting background, especially HKDSE, the assignment and exams are not difficult at all. Getting an A range is not difficult.
reviews.comment_workload:
1 Assignment about journal entries, T accounts, income statement, and balance sheet, collected in late September.
1 Mid term exam
1 Final exam

Very light workload.

reviews.author: Jacey
reviews.comment_content: All content taught in lecture is good and easy to understand. The knowledge also taught in secondary BAFS, such as ratio. Only a few topic is new.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good teaching. Easy to follow. Have practices in class. Willing to answer students question. For example, in class, there will be excel excerises, we will use excel to solve problem. The prof will walk away and trying to hep students who have question.
reviews.comment_grading: Good Grade. 100% to get A. Most students score full mark in homwork and midterm.
reviews.comment_workload: Normal workload. Have assigments and final and midterm.

reviews.author: KNN
reviews.comment_content: Basically just all the things in the textbook. This is more likely a self-learning course. Most of the knowledge has to be learned by yourself. If you unfortunately enrolled this one, just read the textbook.
reviews.comment_teaching: Everyone knows that Patrick's teaching is bad. If you want to get better sleep, you can choose Patrick. He is not suitable to teach lessons, though he is willing to answer your question.
reviews.comment_grading: I haven't learned anything about accounting before. The teaching was so bad that I have to read the textbook on my own. The grade was the lowest of mine.
reviews.comment_workload: Regarding self-learning after the class, the workload is as big as an honor math course.

reviews.author: WONG Yat Kit
reviews.comment_content: I did not take accounting before and I think content is okay. The difficulty is appropriate. Basically depends on teaching materials. If you can pay attention to every lecture and finish homework carefully then it will be easy for you to handle these knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor TANG is really good at teaching. He is very patient and willing to solve students' accounting problem in the lecture. His lecture has a good rhythm and always has appropriate examples to help students understand solutions. Although some students may think he is relatively fast, his PPTs are clear enough for students to learn these contents by themselves.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 5% + Homework 20% + Midterm exam 25% +Final exam 50%
Participation is counted by IPRS so don't forget answering questions on IPRS.
Unlimited attempts for homework. It will be easy for you to get full credits if you have enough patience to try.
Midterm is relatively difficult but acceptable. The mean of midterm is about72.
There's no doubt that Tang Chao's final is a piece of shit. I believe that about 95% of Tang Chao's students want to kill him after finishing final. It is more like a reading test. It is really arduous to understand and solve these questions.
However, Professor Tang Chao is kind at last. My overall grade is B. Although this grade may not good enough for you, I think Tang Chao's exams can always change your opinion about grading. In his lecture, you may feel satisfied when you are just around mean.
reviews.comment_workload: Homework once a week. It is difficult for new ACCTers. However, these questions are really representative. If you are not a student of Tang, Chao it will be easy for you to get high in exams after finishing these questions.

reviews.author: TO Junheng
reviews.title: Final is Challenging but Generally Good Grade
reviews.comment_content:
This course focuses on Generally Accepted Accounting Principle and teaches you basic stuffs in accounting. After fully absorbing the course material, you are expected to:
1. know basic professional ethics of accounting
2. book journal entries (80% of this course, in different situations)
3. post the journal entries to a ledger
4. find useful information from 4 types of basic financial statements
5. construct simple financial statements (BS, IS, and Statement of Cash Flows)
The difficulty of the items above is ascending.

I am a Mainland Gaokao student and I have no background in any business subjects. From my perspective, the course is newbie friendly and intellectually rewarding enough.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Tang explains each concept very clearly and always provides student with concrete cases. He answers students' questions patiently and listens to students' advice. He also sends warm encouraging messages to students after the midterm. Generally speaking, he is a really nice and respectable professor.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme:
Attendance (iPRS): 5%
Homework (unlimited attempts): 20%
Midterm (easy): 25%
Final (difficult like hell): 50%

!!! Get mentally prepared for the final !!!
The MCs are long and need your clear knowledge with some intuition.
For long questions, Professor Tang will tell his students in advance what is going to be tested. You REALLY need to pay GREAT ATTENTION to this and do much exercise.
There is also a module of questions defined by Professor Tang called "challenging question". This semester, the challenging questions are heavily associated with T-accounts, which is a great surprise to me and makes me feel like dying in the exam venue.  

I won't be surprised in the future if I hear someone in LG-1 cafeteria saying that "Oh, Professor Tang put a WHOLE K-10 report into the appendix of his final paper this year."

The grade is actually very good. I got full marks in homework, 98/100 in midterm, 4/5 (maybe) in attendance. The score of the final is not released. According to my estimation, I may get 40-70%, but I still got an A. Thank you Professor Tang!
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not so heavy. You only need to get yourself familiar with the course materials and do exercises when you think it is needed.

reviews.author: Ireneee
reviews.title: Miserable experience but somehow good grade
reviews.comment_content:
Investing, financing decisions & balance sheet; operating decisions & income statement; adjustments, financial statements & quality of earnings; sales revenue; receivables & cash; cost of good sold & inventory; PPE; current liabilities; owners’ equity; statement of cash flows.

*Kelvin left out bonds for the sake of not confusing us.

As I have absolutely no ACCT background, it was challenging at the beginning, but then as time goes by, it becomes a lot easier to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Although Kelvin claimed that he was trying to bring everyone to the same page, the first few lectures were extremely difficult to follow as he just mentioned the terminologies without any proper explanation. It was absolutely not beginner friendly at all.

He once used an entire lecture on balance sheet before midterm and tried to rush through the cash flow using slightly more than one lecture, but then cash flow was tested heavily, so the allocation of time to materials was not quite balance.

One good thing is that I attended all the lectures and I found the PPTs he provided were quite useful to review.
reviews.comment_grading:
Take-home assignment (30%, best 4 out of 5): The mark schemes for the first two were not very transparent about points allocation, but improvements later on.

Midterm (20%): MCQ with short answer questions. Not very tricky questions but time was tensed, better be very familiar with the content.

Final (50%): Scores were not revealed. Compared to the questions in the textbook, the final had many more tricky questions. I have absolutely no idea why a number typo would occur during the exam, and one TA had to come to us one by one for this correction. Time was tensed so I literally thought I would fail this class.

My final grade was expected in A range, so not as disapointed.
reviews.comment_workload:
I spent very long time on the take-home assignments even though most of them eventually scored around lower quartile.

There are some suggested exercise listed in the syllabus, not graded, but meaningful to have a try. I finished them all and many additional ones within 5 days before the final as intensive practice. Probably because of this I got a better grade than expected.

reviews.author: dos0_282
reviews.title: meh
reviews.comment_content: Not much difference from last year. Too lazy to type here.
reviews.comment_teaching:
VERY VERY strong Canton (or Hong Kong) accent. Very uncomfortable to listen to.
Boring lectures. Didn't pay attention most of the time. Rather self-studied in the library instead.
reviews.comment_grading:
I studied BAFS in my secondary school in Hong Kong and I got a 5** in the 2022 HKDSE so I found the first half of the syllabus pretty easy because I have already learnt them.

Assignment (20%): 95/100

Mid-term (25%): 90/100

Final (50%):
Haven't posted the marks until now. Consisted of 4 parts. 10 MCQs, 1 long question about the statement of cash flows, 1 long question about adjustment of errors, income statement and balance sheet, and another one about bond amortisation table.
The paper was very hard and the cheat sheet was literally useless. No idea how to balance the statement of cash flows.

Participation (5%):  
He takes attendance randomly so make sure to attend all the lessons.

Letter grade: A+
No idea how I got an A+ wtf.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light with only 1 assignment throughout the semester. Not sure if it was good as that assignment accounted for 20% of total marks.

reviews.author: Crockett
reviews.title: Good luck if you've never studied accounting before.
reviews.comment_content:
Introductory accounting course for accounting beginners.
Textbook used: Financial Accounting, Robert Libby, 11e.
If you have studied BAFS in high school, you have already learnt most of the 'concepts' in the course.
I use the word 'concept' rather than knowledge because some of the knowledge is different from what we learned in HKDSE. For example, the methods of calculating allowance of doubtful accounts differ from those taught in HKDSE. There are also new depreciation methods such as the double-declining balance method. New topics related to bond, share, dividend and statement of cash flow are taught.
  Once again, if you have studied BAFS in high school, things will be easy.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nothing to say about the professor as he leaves UST after this semester.
reviews.comment_grading: I paid not too much effort but did have a thorough look at all lecture slides before exams and finally got A-.
reviews.comment_workload: 5 online assignments, filling in the blanks.

reviews.author: sanh
reviews.comment_content:
Week - Subject
1 Course outline & overview of financial accounting
Adjustments, financial statements
2 Investing, financing decisions & balance sheet
3 Operating decisions & income statement
4 Adjustments, financial statements& quality of earnings
5 Sales revenue; receivables & cash
6 Cost of goods sold & inventory
7 Property, plant & equipment (“PPE”)
8-9 Current liabilities
10 Owners’ equity
11-12 Statement of Cash Flows

Accounting was created by people to simplify existing problems in business. As long as you understand that it is nothing more than a set of rules made by people and start to think within these rules, the class becomes easy.

Most accounting is just remembering/knowing things, which is why it becomes boring quickly.
reviews.comment_teaching:
In comparison to other professors, Kelvin would spend more time for the first few chapters to make sure that people with no accounting background would understand the topics.

While other groups were writing a midterm for the first 7 chapters, we only did it for the first 4 chapters.

Kelvin would always stay after class to discuss any questions related to accounting.
reviews.comment_grading:
30% - Take-home assignment exercise (the best 4 submissions counted towards the total assessment)
20% - Mid-term exam
50% - Final exam period of Fall Term

Midterm mean: 44.5/60
Final mean: not yet published

Midterm was really easy with no challenging questions.

Kelvin has mentioned that he has not seen a significant difference between people who studied accounting in high school and people who started in college, and I agree.
reviews.comment_workload:
Kelvin provides Practice problems for every chapter we are studying. Although he does not emphasize doing them during the class, and would not grade them, I strongly suggest you do them all. The midterm questions were somewhat similar.

The final was disproportionally confusing compared to the Midterm. Some questions were hard to understand, but none were super challenging.

You can finish each problem set after each chapter in 1-2h, and every assignment takes around 1-2h.

reviews.author: lalalalam
reviews.comment_content:
One mid-term exam and one final exam in total
Around 30 MCs for the mid-term exam (No cheat sheet allowed)
5 long questions for the final exam (6 pages of cheat sheet allowed)
The time allowed is quite adequate for both exams
-
You have to do 8 assignments in order to get full credit for assignment grading
reviews.comment_teaching:
Reading PowerPoint word by word
Sometimes he did the problem sets wrongly
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite nice, you could get B- even if you are below mean. The range for B is large. No worries
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not that harsh, you could finish the homework within 2 hours

reviews.author: clyak
reviews.comment_content:
The course is very easy for students who took BAFS at secondary school as most of the syllabus covers those we learnt from the HKDSE syllabus. Something new are statement of cash flow, issuance of bonds and reducing balance method -> double declining method. Basically only need to study for 1-2 chapters for the final and nothing for the midterm. Might be a bit difficult for non-BAFS students as the fundamental concepts are go through very quickly and are expected to be memorised so you can understand the next lesson.

For the first month no attendance is required so feel free to skip the lectures. Attendance is taken since October.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite boring. He just reads out the PowerPoint and nothing else. Had once asked a question and he told me to read the book myself. The other time he did try to explain to me just I didn’t really understood what he meant.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme:
Assignments 25%
Class participation 5%
Midterm test 20%
Final exam 50%

Only 1 midterm for this semester.
10 assignments excluding trial assignment (does not count towards total so nvm about that), you only have to do 8 out of 10 to score full marks.

My grade: A
Midterm: 29; Highest 32; Lowest 14
Average 25.5039; SD 5.0109
(The full mark should be 35 originally just he printed 3 repeated questions accidentally)

Final: Unknown
reviews.comment_workload:
Only requires you to finish 8 out of 10 assignments so the workload isn’t heavy.
Some questions includes hints so you can just follow the hints and finish the question very easily.
Every homework requires around 1-1.5 hours to finish. If you really cannot finish one before deadline, just don’t miss the others. Do NOT skip the first 5 assignments though as they’re the easiest.

reviews.author: Messy
reviews.title: easy if you attend classes
reviews.comment_content:
Basic accounting from debit and credit to financial statements and in depth learning of assets and liabilities.
the first 8 chapters are pretty easy and understandable with practise. The later 5-6 demand more of your time but are still manageable with practise
reviews.comment_teaching: The accent might throw you off from time to time but his way of teaching is pretty good. he gives in class questions for you to practise and even answers doubts in a good way.
reviews.comment_grading:
The mean for the mid term is quite high so you have to study a bit more for it to get good grades.
I got 82/90 with mean 75 and SD-3
The homework on connect is quite basic as well and you'll also find the answers in the book itself ( with different numbers and company's but same concept.
The final is what messes up everything... the homework and mid terms makes the course seem so easy and the final is nothing in comparison to it. the homework is one chapter at a time whereas the final is all the chapters in question and if you havent practised a full length paper before hand you wont be able to finish the final on time.
all in all the grading is lenient to some extent but youll have to practise regularly.
I got an A as my final letter grade
reviews.comment_workload:
Pretty low comparing it to other courses.
Each chapter having one Homework set so nearly 10-12 homework set. and you have enough time and considering you have friends itll be even more easier.

reviews.author: JTT
reviews.comment_content: Easy, will not be too hard, especially since I did accounting back then in high school. But need to be really careful because there is a difference between IFRS and GAAP, but should be quick to adapt to it
reviews.comment_teaching: Not bad, pretty detailed, good slides and good verbal explanation, willing to answer student's questions quickly
reviews.comment_grading: Good, Got A, competitive courses. I missed A+ because I did not do those quizzes well
reviews.comment_workload: Normal, won't be too demanding, but expect some HW from time to time, need some time to study for mid-term as well.

reviews.author: Hahahahahaha999
reviews.comment_content:
Ch1. Welcome and Overview of ACCT 2010
Ch2. Financial Statements
Ch3,4. T-Accounts and Journal Entries
Ch5,6. Creating the Balance Sheet, Income Statement, Cash Flow Statement, and Ratios.
Ch7. Matching Principle
Ch8. Financial Statement Concepts
Ch9, 10. Sales Revenue, Receivables, and Cash (Bad debt expense, credit sales, uncollectable receivables)
Ch12. Cost of goods sold and inventory  
Ch13. Property, plant, and equipment + Goodwill
Ch14. Operating Cycle (inventory turnover, payables outstanding, sales turnover, cash conversion)
Ch15. Revenue recognition and accounting cases
Ch16. Time value of money
Ch18. Reporting liabilities
Ch19. Corporate Bonds

Ch21. Shareholders’ Equity (Treasury stock, stock splits, dividends, etc.)
reviews.comment_teaching: His English is good as an Indian, quite boring if you have some basic knowledge or you have studied BAFS in your HKDSE because of the content. He is willing to answer questions both in emails and after class with detailed answers. Just ask if you do not understand anything. He said there are no stupid questions. The only thing to remind is not do cheating. He would be headache about writing reports.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment nearly 98%
Midterm: 100%
Final: 60%
Grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload with 3 assignments, 1 midterm, 1 final exam only

reviews.author: fishyy1234
reviews.comment_content: This is the first course of the principles of accounting sequence. Introduction to the concepts and principles of financial accounting, including the analysis, recording, and reporting of business transactions and preparation of financial statements.
reviews.comment_teaching: 佢教得唔差，上佢堂幾輕鬆，間唔中會用下一啲大企業嘅financial statements 做例子，算係幾用心教嘅一個lecturer
reviews.comment_grading: 只要有溫書一定有唔差
reviews.comment_workload: 唔大，only asm+midterm+final

reviews.author: Kristy Yu
reviews.comment_content: The course is easy to handle if you have studied accounting before. Just like doing revision for the whole dse ba syllabus. Tang is patient and explain each concept with detailed and concrete daily example. You can always email him for questions regarding concepts and exercises.
reviews.comment_teaching: No attendance is counted. You can rewatch lecture video anytime.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading. Be careful with careless mistakes. Normally only answers are required for midterm and final. Your steps in calculating will not be reviewed. So make sure you check your steps for accurate answers. Hard works did pay off.
reviews.comment_workload: Just some assignments with quizzes. Assignments are quoted from the text books. Better check your answer before submitting your work. Google will help. Mid term and final were required.

reviews.author: horhey
reviews.comment_content:
This course provides an introduction to the financial accounting and reporting process from the perspective of
external decision-makers. The course focuses on fundamental accounting concepts and principles. You will
learn  how  the  economic  transactions  of  an  enterprise  are  reported  in  the  financial  statements  and  related
disclosures. The course is designed to provide an overview of financial accounting so that, upon completion
of the course, you should be able to read, interpret, and analyze corporate financial reports.
reviews.comment_teaching: Straightforward but fast paced. Each class covers a new chapter and the slides covered are usually 30-50 slides with explanation.
reviews.comment_grading:
Standard across all accounting classes (refer to syllabus)

Participation is worth 5%
Homework  is worth 25%
Midterm exam  is worth 20%
Final exam is worth 50%. There is a heavy emphasis on the exams but the homework is supposed to help you gauge your understanding.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is manageable as long as you keep up with tutorial homework as well as self-study, reading textbook.

reviews.author: janjan
reviews.title: short review
reviews.comment_content: not friendly to non-BAFS students, have to pay more heed reviewing and revising the content weekly in order to follow the steps of other BAFS students
reviews.comment_teaching: the teacher is willing to teach students and answer their questions considerately, and also friendly attitude to students.can ask the teacher questions after courses end
reviews.comment_grading: as most students studied BAFS in their secondary school, the mean is rather ok, but also it is not friendly to non-BAFS students because it's easy to get low marks
reviews.comment_workload: not really heavy workload, weekly homework needed

reviews.author: claclaclacla
reviews.comment_content: Content is average, all are included in the PowerPoint which is the only material you would need for revision.
reviews.comment_teaching: teaching is a bit boring, he goes through PowerPoint which could be read at home and makes no difference.
reviews.comment_grading: Nice grading all the way, with sufficient revision both the midterm and final are easy and the homework has unlimited attempts. He takes attendance so showing up to class is a must
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload, if you listened in class the homework is light work. The midterm is in multiple choice.

reviews.author: uwu
reviews.comment_content: simple and fundamental accounting knowledge. Required simple calculation only. students who studied bafs in secondary school will find it easy and mostly covered.
reviews.comment_teaching: His English is not quite fluent and sometimes difficult to listen to. Moreover he often get off topic, not by the good means. As a student who learnt most content in secondary school I found the teaching boring to me and usually regard it as lullaby.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is highly based on exams, only very small portion is on attendance. However, as some students has the fundamental knowledge from secondary school, the score required for A or above is quite high.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is mainly on studying, not as heavy compared to the ust average. If you have studied bafs, the workload reduces more, just a few lectures video that are not covered.

reviews.author: small potato404
reviews.title: Grade 神
reviews.comment_content:
1. Investing, financing decisions & balance sheet
2. Operating decisions & income statement
3. Adjustments, financial statements & quality of earnings
4. Sales revenue; receivables & cash
5. Cost of goods sold & inventory
6. Property, plant & equipment
7. Current liabilities
MIDTERM
8. Long-term debts & present value applications
9. Owners' equity

reviews.comment_teaching:
I can tell he is a very sincere teacher. He will answer all your questions fast and patiently, which I like.

He has a secondary school teaching style, somehow like spoon-feeding you, for example he will illustrate different concepts including the basic ones using different scenarios on excel in great details, and make sure all students get it before he moved on. This is very different from other professors who assume you understand the basics and only teach those abstract concepts. I personally like his style though his lectures are a bit boring because I can fully understand the things I'm learning and can do well in exams.

No participation mark so good for those who don't like answering questions during class lol.
reviews.comment_grading:
He came to UST in 2021-22 fall so we were his first batch of students, not sure if this will affect his grading.

Around 8 assignments throughout the semester.
I got an average 95% on my assignments.

Midterm: 90%
Finals: He didn't release the score and mark.

Final grade: A+ (really happy for this grade as a non-bafs student)
reviews.comment_workload:
Light.

But you need to practice quite a lot if you wanna get a good grade :) true for all courses

reviews.author: revennanddi
reviews.comment_content: Most of the subjects covered at the beginning of the lesson have already been covered in the DSE BAFs curriculum and tested on. For BAFs students, catching up is simpler. However, the terminology and accounting structure could be slightly different, so it might take some time for you to become used to it.
reviews.comment_teaching: There was a lot of discussion in class. Encourage kids to speak up frequently in class. Answerers will receive points for their efforts.
reviews.comment_grading:
In class 24%
Participation 6%
Quiz 1 10%
Quiz 2 20%
Final 40%
reviews.comment_workload: There is not much to be done. There might be some in-class exercises, but they are generally simple and don't take very long. In addition, tests are given.

reviews.author: StellaNgai
reviews.title: Heavy workload
reviews.comment_content: Half of the class topics have been taught and tested in the DSE BAFS knowledge. It is easier for BAFs students to catch up before mid-term.
reviews.comment_teaching: I wouldn't say I like online teaching, but the content was delivered clearly. The prof uses a lot of real-life examples in class and for assignments.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 5%
Assignment 10%
Midterm 1 25%
Midterm 2 30%
Online final exam 30%
reviews.comment_workload:
SO HEAVY! I need to finish an assignment in at least 3 hours. (the frequency is almost a week)
You really need to understand concepts well in order to answer the questions correctly.

reviews.author: Manya
reviews.title: cool dude

Just do past papers and you will receive a good grade! you don't need to do too much for a decent grade, just understand the basics and go to all his lessons!
reviews.comment_teaching: Very entertaining! 10/10 would recommend!
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is based on a curve! Not too hard to reach above mean.
reviews.comment_workload: I would say it's roughly a B, not too much nor too little. Pro tip; practice his pratice material like 3-4 times it will help you understand stuff much more easier.

content is practical, good basic for sbm student

reviews.author: 泰戈
reviews.title: Need self-tutoring
reviews.comment_content: The content is really important, and Chao made it logical and thus easy to understand. Everything seems good before the final. The mid-term was easy, and you can try to do your homework as many times as you liked. However when it comes to final exam, you would find it really hard to deal with, you need to understand the concepts, the principles of GAAP, and how to do accounting calculations. The exercises provided in the book might be not enough, although I only finished a few.
reviews.comment_teaching: Chao's style is a bit more like what I experienced in my high school (in mainland). I guess he intended to make it serious to create a better learning atmosphere because I felt he is good at telling cold jokes. In general, I recommend you to choose his lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is higher than I expected.
I got a full mark on my homework and attendance(10%),
97/100 on the midterm (35%, mean 77, sd 19)
78.5/100 on the final (55%, mean 46.5, sd 16.7).

The final grade is A+, which I thought I would get an A or sth.
reviews.comment_workload: If you want a good grade, you need to work hard. It is not easy to get an A range in this course, especially if you are learning accounting for the first time.

The video is quite clear and funny as well
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite fair, but the workload is quite heavy compared to the grade

reviews.author: Exvalender
reviews.comment_content: Quite hard
reviews.comment_teaching: Good overall. He is eloquent and quite nice to students. And he teaches several classes in one day.

reviews.comment_grading:
Fair
Take-home assignment exercise (the best 5 submissions counted towards total assessment) 35%

Final exam 40%
Total 100%

- It's ok, not to heavy.

Nice teacher, answers to questions promptly.

reviews.comment_grading:
Participation: 5% (through irregular Zoom polling, it doesn't matter that even you got all answers wrong in the poll as the responses will not be graded, 志在參與)

reviews.comment_workload: Just 5 sets of Connect HW (but each takes a few hours to complete)

reviews.author: hcl
reviews.title: VERY LENG GRADE
reviews.comment_content: The content is similar to the DSE BAFS Accounting elective according to my friend who studied accounting in DSE.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Fast-paced
Even though there's a lot of content to be covered, Steven still would spend some time doing exercises with us in lessons
Very nice, he is willing to answer students' questions after class/ by making appointments.
reviews.comment_grading:
25% Mid-term
35% Assignments (only count best 5 out of 7)
40% Final

My score
mid-term: 100/100
assignments: 100/100 x5 (best 5)
final: not released
Final grade: A+

Mid-term and the assignments are easy if you understand everything from the lecture slides.
The Final is a little bit harder, not that straightforward but still manageable if you understand the lecture slides thoroughly.
I found this course manageable as even I did not study BAFS in secondary school, I still got A+. If you studied accounting before, this course will be super easy for you.
reviews.comment_workload:
Average workload.
7 assignments in total, each would be given a week to complete
Less than an hour is needed to complete each assignment.
No attendance is required for lectures. But I recommend attending them as you can understand better with his verbal explanation and try out some exercises in class.
Took me about a few days to revise for mid-term and final, given that I attended all lectures.

He teaches well with good accent and explains concepts clearly but too fast for me to catch up even as a DSE BAFS student.

reviews.author: mikefromthedike
reviews.comment_content: The Course covers basically the basics of Accounting from the ground up. It is useful as basic e.g. reading a Balance sheet/Income statement are things one should know if one wants to go into business or just simply understand the newspapers (e.g. why is it a problem if company xyz has a negative cashflow even though it turned a profit?).
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is alright, it was nothing special but also not especially bad. Core concepts were explained well. However, especially if you never had accouting before you will need to put some time into going through the materials by yourself.
reviews.comment_grading: If you had beend thought accounting before (e.g. High School) you should be able to get into A range if you invest some time. If you never had accounting before,  A range might be difficult but possible if you really invest the time. Also, keep in mind that some students (like me) had accounting before which would put you at a disadvantage if you never heard of it before.
reviews.comment_workload: Overall fair. If you had accouting before in High School it's proably easy, if not you might have to invest some time.

reviews.author: Just Chilling
reviews.title: Pick this professor if you wanna chill
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite easily understandable, if you work on the assignments, you will be fine in midterm and final exams. Another point deserves mentioning is that the final is non-cumulative, in other words, what was tested in midterm won't be tested in final. This really alleviates your pressure in final exam in my opinion.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is quite a passionate professor. He really wants us to understand the content rather than just memorizing the book and he is more than willing to answer questions after classes in a detailed manner. Nevertheless, his lessons are quite boring and you can probably handle the midterm and final even without attending his lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
Got a B at last.

reviews.comment_workload:
In terms of the workload to prepare for the final, I believe the workload is quite light compared to other courses as the final is non-cumulative.

In terms of regular assignments, there are weekly  assignments you have to complete. These assignments help you understand basic concepts which is quite useful. I think the workload is handleable but could get stressful sometimes if you have many assignments at the same week while you have no clue when doing these assignments.

Final: 40%

The midterm is easy so try to score as high as you can since the final is extremely difficult.

reviews.author: Anonymous_9785

He also answers all doubts put in the zoom chatbox during class. You can also email him separately for  queries and he will reply promptly.
reviews.comment_grading:

Take-home assignment exercise (the best 5 submissions counted towards total assessment) 35%
Mid-term exam 25%
Final exam  40%

Overall the grading is amazing.
I got an A+
reviews.comment_workload:

However , if you have learned it before , the workload is very light.

reviews.author: Etoile

Great professor! Nice, hardworking and humorous.

Before the exam, he provided the sample paper and a study guide which covered all the question types. But the sample paper was quite different from the real exam ( sample was relatively easy).

reviews.comment_grading:
attendance&homework&midterm&final

reviews.author: Roselia
reviews.comment_content: Teach the basic of accounting. Trial balance, income statement, etc. It is nearly the same as the DSE syllabus of BAFs. The only different is that this course also include cash flow statement, but it would be easy if you have learned BAFs before.
reviews.comment_teaching: Extremely boring, strange accent. I don't really pay attention to him as I have learned BAFs before. I just read the powerpoint on my own every lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
A-
I don't know if I should say it is reasonable.
If you have studied accounting before, it would be so easy to get A range. I only revise a few hours for each quiz and final.
But if you study accounting for the first time, I would think it is difficult for you to get even B range.
FYI, I get +1~1.5 sd in both quiz.
Full mark in homework (which takes more percentage than quiz in total score)
8x% attendance (which don't count much) (He starts taking attendance a month after add/drop period)
Final counts for 40%, but I don't know my score.
reviews.comment_workload:
9 homework which we have to finish at least 8 of them to get full marks. You can try as many time as you want so most of the students get full marks. Every homework includes 3~4 long questions. It takes me about 1.5~3 hours.
The quiz are MC which is quite difficult when it comes to asking about definition and situation. Overall, the difficulty is reasonable so you don't need to revise for much. The quiz and exam also do not repeat the range of the previous one.

reviews.author: blublublubluu
reviews.comment_content: Mostly dse syllabus, like depreciation, income statement, balance sheet, inventory counting and some ratio analysing. If you have studied accounting in your high school, it is easy to get a good grade. But if you don't, you can still do so by doing exercise and past paper.
reviews.comment_teaching: Acceptable. I only attended few lessons. Many students raise their hands during classes and find him after class to ask questions. Prof. Mak answer students' questions detailed and patiently. He is nice.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fair. I got a B+ in this course. I didn't spend many time on it. I just redo some of  assignments questions before exam. But it turns out the exam questions are quite similar with them.
Prof Mak did not release the final exam score. But i did get one sd higher than the mean in mid term.
reviews.comment_workload: It is quite light for me. There will be an assignment for each topic. Each of them contains few mc questions and one or two long questions. You can  finished them within an hour.

reviews.author: shshsh11
reviews.comment_content: This course covers the basic concepts of accounting. The course is not that difficult, but you definitely need to study.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is extremely kind and does his best to give help to his students. He also tries to explain everything as possible to make us comprehend. He actually doesn't care if you are paying attention during his class or not, but he is quite sensitive when there are loud noises during his class or he sees us talking to friends sitting next to us. The only problem I felt during his class was his pronunciation. It may be hard for international students to understand what he is trying to say. Other than that, his teaching is outstanding.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme:
Assignments: 24%
Class participation: 6%
Quiz 1: 10%
Quiz 2: 20%
Final exam: 40%

His grading is very generous. Although I got a B for this course, which is not an exceptional score, I felt his grading standards are fair enough. There were two quizzes, and they were all multiple choice questions, which is quite generous compared to other courses. During the final exam, 6-page cheat sheets were allowed.
reviews.comment_workload: There were 9 online assignments in total, where at least 8 of them should be done to get full credits. They are all easy to get full marks if you are not lazy. It may sound there are too many assignments, but they actually help when preparing quizzes and final exam so I recommend taking screenshots before submitting your assignments cuz you cannot go back and see them again once you get a full mark.

reviews.author: heeseung

reviews.comment_content: This was my first time to learn accounting. I understand just basic materials in this class. It means it is hard to find what he wants to talk and teach. I want to recommend you to study accounting before you take this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: If you are an international student, Pronunciation is really bad. He has traditional HK style pronunciation. Also, it's quite boring which makes it hard to concentrate.
reviews.comment_grading: Homeworks are not so bad to fulfill your score. It is limitless. Also, there is twice a quiz so you can make up after quiz 1 when you make a mistake. Also, attendance is essential for all.
reviews.comment_workload: It is quite not bad. It has just light homework that you just have to solve a few questions. Sometimes it takes quite a long time, but it takes 2 hours per homework on average. Also, the homework is 1 Chapter per 1 homework and it has a total of 12 chapters.

reviews.author: 求學? 不! 是求分數
reviews.comment_content:
As a 求學為求分數 student, here's the content of hw, midterm and final.
Homework: ~8 Mcdrill textbook mc questions plus at most 3 long questions about financial statements. Remember to revise the textbook before doing them!
Midterm: 30 mc questions plus choose 1 long question out of 2 and the long questions are income statement and the journal and one short one about the definition and application of one accounting ratio
PS paper checking is only applicable to long questions cuz your mc answer sheet won't be distributed
Final: ~20 mc questions (?) plus 4 long questions. Got the easiest mc compared to hw and midterm. Just make sure to read hrough his ppt cuz the long questions are 90% the same loll...also got some definition related questions about stock split but it worths 4 marks only so you can just skip it if you don't wanna memorise wordssssssss
reviews.comment_teaching:
I studied BAFS before so my comment towards him might not be that objective?

Again.. As a 求學為求分數 student, his lessons are super boring. I attended 90% of his lessons to make sure that I wouldn't miss something interesting (jk) but he got a lot of lan gag. Plus any extra thing not included in his ppt won't be tested! So don't be afraid to skip his lessons:D I will still give him a B for his exam-oriented ppt!!
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework: lost 2 marks in one homework and missed one deadline...  
Full mark of each homework: 60 or 30 depends on the number of questions
(only count the best 7 homework out of 8) (mean: about 56/60)
Midterm: 37/40, mean: 30.61/40, sd: 6.14
Final: Quite well.
FInal grade: A+
Got a friend midterm 34/40 and 75% in final, still manage to get an A.
reviews.comment_workload: The first few homework is quite challenging and it takes me 2 hours to finish. Once you get more familiar with the topics, you will find questions repeating in later chapters!

reviews.author: Moooooon
reviews.title: Good Grade
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1 Course Outline and Overview of Financial Accounting
Week 2 Investing, financing decision and balance sheet
Week 3 Operation decision and income statement
Week 4 Adjustments, Financing statement and quality of earnings
Week 5 Sales revenue, receivable and cash
Week 6 Cost of good sold and inventory
Week 7 Property Plant and equipment
Week 8 Current liabilities
Week 9 Long term debt and present value application
Week 10 Owner's equity
Week 11 statement of cash flows

Mainly HKDSE content. However, he introduces double entries in week 3 or 4 and I think it is not friendly to non-BAFS student.

There are some new contents such as cash flow statement, present value (to be used for calculating bond value) and it is not hard to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
-Strong Hong Kong accent, but not difficult to understand
-Patient and willing to answer your questions until you fully understand the content
-quick response on email

Teaching mode:
1. Demonstrate the concept through examples in Excel
2. May give some time for you to do classwork. He will check your work during class time and point out your misconceptions.
3. Online videos of explaining the assignments and extra exercises
reviews.comment_grading:
Description Weight
Take-home assignment exercise (the best 5 submissions counted towards total assessment) 35%
Mid-term exam (23 October 2021, Saturday, 10:30am – 11:30am) 25%
Final exam (7 – 18 December 2021) 40%


Grade God Steven !!!

My grade is A+ (for reference only: my DSE BAFS is level 5)
--Full mark best 5 submission for assignment
--Mid-term exam: 83/100 (median is 87/100, Mean is about 80/100)
--Final exam: marks are not disclosed

P.S
Mid-term is easy but a tiny careless mistakes can let you lose 10 marks ( by the way, no partial credit for steps, the only important thing is the answer)

P.S 2
Final exam questions is super complicated, I guess the mean is super low.
I forgot the double entries of bond dividend and impairment in the exam and I am sure that I lost lots of marks. Surprisingly, I got an A grade. Thanks Steven!!!!!!
reviews.comment_workload:
7 assignments per week (it costs $350 and you must buy it)
Assignment content: one long question/4-5 short questions
Time consumed: 1-2 hours per assignment (it is hard to type statements in a blank sheet!)

P.S. please keep your own record of your assignment as you cannot find them in the CONNECT account.

reviews.comment_teaching: Sidd is a good prof. He explains the concept very clearly with many real-life examples and is willing to answer questions. He will introduce a lot about accounting in real life, not just for exams. And he is fun.
reviews.comment_grading:

Midterm      30%
Final exam  40%

The final exam is long and much more difficult than the HWQ&MT and the grade is almost depends on the final, so do well in the final is very important if you want a good grade.
But overall he is quite lenient.
reviews.comment_workload:

only 3 hw, 1 midterm, 1 final, hw&miderm are easy

reviews.author: j.2315_12

reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Chen is passionate about teaching. I may not be performing well but I appreciate her efforts in teaching.
reviews.comment_grading: She is a nice and kind professor but her quizzes are honestly hard. I should say that she gives grades really nicely but her exams are really hard. reviews.author: bitcold

patient, willing to answer your questions
some guides to help you do homework

reviews.author: hehehe6
reviews.comment_content:
1. Introduction
2. Balance sheet
3. Income statement
4. Adjustments
