The prof skips several chapters in the textbook, so it's not a lot of content compared to other classes.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Well... I wouldn't say too bad, but not so good.
During class, he would explain everything step-by-step. But it would sometimes just get really boring with him just rambling on without having a focus.
But he would really answer you well if you want to clarify something or want to ask him questions after class.
reviews.comment_grading:
As a person who has never taken accounting in secondary school, I found the grading to be a bit harsh. You would be competing with other people who have spent their secondary school years studying for pretty much similar things. Having talked to those people, they say the grading is not so harsh. So it really depends on your background in secondary school.

Here are the grade breakdowns:
1. Take-home assignment exercise (best 7 submissions counted towards total assessment) - 35%
2. Mid-term exam - 20%
3. Final exam - 45%
reviews.comment_workload:
If this is also your first time studying accounting, then you would need to spend some time outside of class to review and study the materials yourself. Otherwise, there's not so much workload.

There are 8 take-home assignments from the textbook on Canvas. The best 7 would count towards your final grade. The assignment takes quite a big part of your grade (35%) so people try their best to get full marks on each assignment.

reviews.author: Amogha
reviews.comment_content: Sidd liked to present his lectures through slides and they were easily accessible at all times on Canvas. If you don't attend his lectures or the class, it can be a little difficult to understand the slides without context and the structuring can be a little messy but overall it's succinct and he only provides the necessary information needed for the exams. His real-life application of the content with companies such as Apple and Google gave a more in-depth insight and understanding to accounting in the real world.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching was overall fine but personally, I think the talking pace was quite slow for me and he would repeat his sentences multiple times but he explains the concepts well and is willing to answer questions at all times.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading for ACC2010 in Sidd's class was broken down clearly for us at the beginning of the sem. It is as follows:
Homework 30%
- Only 3 assignments in the entire semester (About a week or at least 5 days provided to complete the assignments)
- Hints and assistance were included within the slide and material
- Assignment 3 + Either Assignment 1 or 2 were counted (The better one)
- Quite easy tasks
Midterm 30%
- Very very very lenient with the cheatsheet
- Can ace this midterm as he uses a lot of past paper questions
Final Exam 40%
- Quite difficult to crack in a short amount of time
- The grade I had originally was lowered immensely by my final but to be honest, with the way he was easy overall, I don't mind the harsh paper at the end.

*Just ace your homework and midterms to guarantee you'll pass!*
reviews.comment_workload: The workload honestly is very manageable as throughout the semester there are only 3 assignments. It's a breezy course as long as you stick to the syllabus timeline he provides and go with his pace. If not, towards the end, it can get difficult to catch up and go through all the content. Also, he doesn't care if you attend classes or not so long that you finish all your work and secure yourself a decent grade in his course.

reviews.author: BusyBee
reviews.title: A good introductory course for financial accounting
reviews.comment_content:
It covers the four basic financial statements in modern accounting—the income statement, the balance sheet, the statement of stockholder's equity and the statement of cash flows.

In terms of the difficulty of content, I wouldn't say the content, per se, is difficult. In fact, it's quite manageable for most. What's hard for most students is the tricky aspects when multiple new contents come together. However, following the course and doing all the work in a timely manner will get you there. (although bear in mind TANG Chao's finals are notoriously a killer... don't be fooled by the relatively easier midterms)

Another thing I liked about this course is that it does not test your memorization skills. Whenever they tested theory (in midterms or finals), they would make the answer obvious, in the sense that you didn't need to memorize exact or word-for-word phrases in preparation. They focus more on testing your understanding of how accounting actually works.

If you have DSE BAFS background, you definitely have a competitive edge, as I've seen my friends with no accounting background struggle a bit more with this course than those with some type of accounting background in high school.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor TANG, Chao was extremely nice and helpful throughout the course and was always willing to stay behind and answer your questions.

He also conducts multiple surveys (I believe one was in the beginning, one in the middle and one at the end) to get a better sense of how his students are feeling about the content/ workload/ pace etc. I liked this about him, as it shows that he takes student feedback into consideration.

One thing I really liked about this course is how he would make us do practice questions at the beginning of the lecture "recapping" things we learnt last class, as well as a few questions at the end of the lecture, helping us consolidate our understanding of what we learnt for that class.

There's no prominent accent or anything, and his teaching is easy to follow.
reviews.comment_grading:
In terms of the grade composition:

Homework - 25%
Mid-Term - 30%
Final Exam - 40%
Participation/ Attendance - 5%

↑ for the "participation" marks, you just have to answer his Zoom polls. You don't need to get the questions correct, but just answer them all!

For the homework, you have unlimited tries, so although some of them may be time-consuming I think it really consolidates your understanding and isn't all bad!
reviews.comment_workload:
Out of all the aspects, the workload would have to be the biggest downside of this course as it is simply the truth that practice makes perfect! You could do the bare minimum, in which case you can't expect high grades.

In my opinion, though, it's not a matter of this course but just accounting in general which requires much practice for you to be able to tackle different exam questions in a timed environment.

It also depends on how self-motivated you are, as I know different students spend vastly different amounts of time preparing for this course (and usually that correlates with your final grade in this course as well...)

reviews.author: mljarvis
reviews.comment_content: less than other instructors. friends warned be about a bonds chapter (supposed to be only difficult part of this class), MakDaddy doesn't teach this which is nice.
reviews.comment_teaching:
MakDaddy definitely cares about the material, and is passionate. However, his tone in monotone and the slides are screenshots/directly from textbook, making his classes pretty boring unless you've popped down to Pacific.

I learnt majority of class from textbook
reviews.comment_grading: very fair, make sure you ace homeworks.
reviews.comment_workload: 1 homework quiz per week which would take about an hour. midterm and final exams arent bad.

reviews.author: Aminahemin
reviews.title: Choose Professor Chen!
reviews.comment_content: I had never taken an accounting course before this, but the content was manageable. A couple of the last chapters take more brain power but Professor Chen’s explanations in class are very helpful.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Chen is a great teacher. She goes above and beyond by creating video explanations for each chapter. She does a very good job explaining concepts in class and conducts review and Q&A right before quizzes. She wants us to succeed so her review is helpful.
reviews.comment_grading:
The homework and group exercises are an easy A. If you put in the effort, the quizzes should be quite manageable.

There is no mid-term, just a cumulative quiz of a few chapters worth 7%. Each weekly quiz on a chapter is worth 2%. All the easy mini assignments makes the final exam worth only 25%.

75% of my grade was about 97%
The final exam was very hard and I felt like I got a 50% but thanks to the curve I got a B on the final and ended up with an A- in the course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Every week there is online homework and a very short in-class quiz that relates to the homework and the chapter of the week. Although the homework takes a bit of time, it really helps with understanding and is an easy A assignment as you have more than one attempt.

I recommend studying for the quizzes by doing the homework and the optional concept checks on the online platform where homework is posted. Additionally, attendance is only required on quiz days but you should attend class because she explains concepts well and answers all questions. Attending all the classes helps show initiative, but if you have a complete grasp of material Professor Chen’s class would mean you don’t have to attend as much.

reviews.author: 唔知叫咩好
reviews.title: Not recommended for students without any accounting backgrounds
reviews.comment_content:
The content is quite condensed with the first few weeks learning the basics of the four financial statements and the following weeks, each covers a certain more advanced topics like shares and bonds.
Quite useful if you don't have any accounting background.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is teaching with passion. She is willing to answer questions even on the weekends. The explanatory video posted on canvas is clear and with a unique sense of humor.
reviews.comment_grading:
the grading scheme is as follows:
class participation:
interactions and discussions                               (3%)
in-class group exercises (10 sessions)              (22%)
in-class quizzes (10 sessions)                           (30%)

Homework assignments (10 assignments)        (20%)
Final exam                                                          (25%)

Most of the quizzes are easy except for the two comprehensive ones which are a bit more challenging, especially for the second one.
However, the final exam is extremely difficult where the professor announced that "the exam marks will not be released to avoid unnecessary panic"...

The letter grade basically depends on the final exam as most of the students can attain a satisfactory grade in the everyday work which already takes up 75% of the total grading.
reviews.comment_workload:
the content of the course is delivered in a mixed learning mode. It is recommended to go through pre-released explanatory videos every week before lesson time. The lesson time is reserved for the explanation of the key concepts and asking questions.

Students have to finish one quiz, one in-class group exercise, and probably one assignment per week in Oct and Nov. The workload is not really heavy but you just have to make sure some time is spent on this course every week just to clear all the concepts for that particular week.

reviews.author: NS
reviews.title: Is relativley good, but better than other acct classes
reviews.comment_content:
Relatively easy to understand if you keep up with the class. Below is the syllabus that you need for the course. It will be required to buy the online accounting textbook which is around HKD$300.

Ch1: Financial Statements and Business Decisions (SKIP Chapter
Supplements)
Ch2: Investing and Financing Decisions and the Accounting System
Ch3: Operating Decisions and the Accounting System
Ch4: Adjustments, Financial Statements, and the Quality of Earnings
Ch6: Sales Revenue, Receivables, and Cash (SKIP “reconciliation of the cash accounts and the bank statements”)
Ch7: Cost of goods sold and inventory
Ch8: Property, plant, and equipment  
Ch9: Reporting liabilities (SKIP Chapter Supplements)
Ch10: Corporate bonds (SKIP Chapter Supplements)
Ch11: Owners’ equity (SKIP Chapter Supplement
Ch12: Statement of cash flows (SKIP Chapter Supplements A and C)
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching videos are extremely helpful, but better to stick to the textbook teaching for additional exercises because sometimes her teaching can be a bit confusing and hard to keep up with in class. Attendance is also kind of optional, you just need to make sure you have four pictures with the teacher, and show up to quiz days, otherwise, you don't need to show up to the rest of the clases.
reviews.comment_grading: She makes it impossible for you to fail because of the number of quizzes you have throughout the year, no midterms, and final exam is relatively hard but is only worth 25%
reviews.comment_workload: Quizzes worth 2%, homework worth 2%, and group exercises worth 2% due in every week of the course, with some quizzes weighing 6%, but other than that she makes sure you balance your workload throughout the sem, and is quite manageable.

reviews.author: Oleta
reviews.comment_content: Useful for year 1
reviews.comment_teaching: he teaches good and he got good english and clear pronounciations so very good grade!!
reviews.comment_grading: good grading!! I did not remember my grade exactly but he got good grading and he basically examines everything that he taught nothing is new that you don’t know if u did enough revision
reviews.comment_workload: the workload is a big high because you need to do the homework every week and also it count marks, personally i have lost quite a lot of marks because i made careless mistakes so be careful and check for few times

reviews.author: goodluck
reviews.comment_content:
There are loads of exercises provided including practice papers and quizzes. Chao also mentioned daily examples or hot topics that are not included in the textbook yet definitely facilitate me in better understanding the accounting concept behind.

He usually teaches based on his own PowerPoint, students are not required to read the textbook yet he would choose some questions from the textbook and put them in a pdf for your reference. He would basically just ask concepts that are included in his notes in mid-terms and finals.
reviews.comment_teaching: Chao is a really good professor, he cares a lot about students' understanding and progress, making sure we could catch up. Yet he has stated clearly that for academic question he only accept face-to-face mode but not email. Chao is a really patient professor who answers all questions either in class or after-class, you could definitely feel his passion for accounting.
reviews.comment_grading: His mid-term is of acceptable difficulty yet for the final it is way too difficult in my opinion. The final average is just about 45%. Although students could usually get high marks in homework, but you still need to ensure an acceptable grade in the final to get A range, which is pretty hard. The mid-term paper is of moderate difficulty yet the final is unexpectedly difficult with lots of concepts mixed together and a super long length.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is acceptable. Only 5 homework are compulsory and other practices are just for students' own practice with answers included, so basically there is not much work to do except doing homework and studying for mid-term/finals.

reviews.author: hilarylui
reviews.title: Not a Non-BAFS student friendly course
reviews.comment_content: Really takes time to understand the accounting concept, especially hard for students who didn't take BAFS in secondary school like me. Very much of the concepts are taught in secondary school, so congraz to those who have studied BAFS u will have a high advantage.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. teaching is good and clear, speaks fluent English with no accent. His teaching is based on case studies which help us to understand the concept more clearly.
reviews.comment_grading:
3 Homework assignments 30%
Midterm      30%
midterm is easy, so...
median 100...
Mean 97...
99/100

Final exam 40%
Very Much harder than midterm...
Mean 58
60/100

Total 100%

Overall grade:B
I would say reasonable.
reviews.comment_workload:
3 assignments, midterm and final.
No attendance

reviews.author: heart
reviews.title: Interesting professor with bad grades❤️
reviews.comment_content:
The content is very simple for those who have studied in BAFS.
They will destroy your grade if you have some careless mistakes, as the mean is very high.
Still, it is fairly easy to catch up.
I suggest those who have studied in BAFS SWAP TO other professors' timeslot. Everyone gets high marks in quizzes and midterm.

The content basically covers the basics of accounting such as the preparation of financial statements and accounting concepts. There are some slightly difficult stuff such as bond calculations.

Just be careful of the bond calculations and be familiar with everything mentioned in the powerpoints for your quizzes and exam, and you will be good.

Financial Accounting
Class 1: Overview
Class 2: Financial Statements
Class 3 4: Transactions and the reporting process
Class 5 6: Income Statement, Balance Sheet, Ratios and Cash Flow Statement
Class 7: Deferred, Prepaid and Accrued transactions
Class 8: Financial Statement Concepts
Class 9 10: Example 2 Journal Entries
Class 11 12: More detailed in contents of Class 5 6
Class 12 13: Other Journal Entries
Class 14: Operating Cycles
Class 15: Revenue Recognition
Class 16: Time Value Loans
Class 17: Liabilities
Class 18 19: Bonds
Class 20: Equity
Class 21: Conservatism
reviews.comment_teaching:
Sidd is a good professor. His powerpoint have some memes pics and jokes that makes his lecture more fun. But make sure you understand every concept, and don't be shy to ask questions. He will be glad to answer. Some claims that his accent is uneasy to listen, but I'm good with it.

Aww... just love my indian professor >3<
reviews.comment_grading:
3 Homework Quizzes 30%
The lowest score of homework quiz #1 or #2 will be dropped. Homework Quiz #3 cannot be dropped.
Q3 (15%) + the higher of Q1 and Q2 (15%)

Quiz #1: 9.5/10, Mean 9.25/10
Quiz #2: 9.75/10, Mean 8.76/10
Quiz #3: 14.25/15, Mean 12.88/15

Midterm 30%
Very easy. Over half of the students get full marks. Median is 100.
Midterm: 100/100, Mean: 97.4/100

Final exam 40%
Quite challenging.
Final exam: 78.5/100, Mean: 58.46/100 SD: 16

Since the quizzes and midterm is way too easy for everyone to get high marks, the grades almost only depend on your performance in final. So good luck. I got an A.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload especially for those who have accounting background. The homework quizzes does not waste you too much time. I revise this course two days before the exam. I have studied BAFS before. So a easy A.

reviews.author: fuwafuwa
reviews.comment_content:
Since Im a non-BAFS student, I found the content quite difficult, tbh I dont understand quite a lot of content and I just regurgitate them for exam. This course is reaaaaally challenging for non-BAFS student. I think the coverage of this course is very large too, feel so good that I finished this course eventually.
- journal entries
- income statement, balance sheet, statement of cash flow
- bond, share
- property, plant and equipment, depreciation
- bad debt, etc
I found cash flow statement and the bond parts particularly difficult for me, as a non-BAFS student. The concept of present values and future values are equally tough, which involve financial mathematics.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching speed for me is really fast, I couldnt catch up the content, especially after the mid-term. The teaching speed became even faster, worse still, with even more difficult content, which made me felt quite hopeless and I had to spend extrrra effort in this course.

He also used Excel frequently to explain the concepts, maybe its more straightforward, but for me, some steps maybe skipped in Excel, and some details may be missed (the things he typed in Excel were different in different sessions) , so personally I didnt really like this. However, he gave us in-class exercise to do sometimes and walked around the lecture hall to check our answer, which definitely helped us !

In general, he is a really friendly professor, who is really to answer students' questions. I asked him questions after the lecture for a few times and I had also made an appointment to ask him questions, so I strongly suggest non-BAFS students to ask him questions directly if you come across any questions, he is more than willing to answer your questions!
reviews.comment_grading:
I think it's normal that the grade of non-BAFS student is lower than those who studied accounting before, which is quite unfair tbh.

Assignments: 35%, 5 out of 7 assignments are graded
Mid-term: 25%
Final:40%

The best part is that assignments account for 35% of the grade, so hard-working students can definitely guarantee their marks. I got around 80- 90 marks in all 7 assignments (I spent like 8 hours on doing 1 assignment, some of them were really difficult)   

The mid-term is quite easy, cuz only one chapter is examined, I got 95/100. The mean was 80

The final is VERY difficult, I couldnt finish the whole paper. The time is really tight. I couldnt even figured out how to write some of the journal entries, and couldnt get balanced for all finanicial statements questions.

I think the mean of the final is very low tho the stats wasnt released. The grade kinda reflected that hardwork pays off. So non-BAFS student dont give up!!!
reviews.comment_workload: 7 assignments in total, which maybe more comparing to other professors, but I think they are definitely useful. These assignments push me to revise the topics he taught around biweekly, so I wont have to be very panic right before mid-term/ final

reviews.author: Kaisa
reviews.title: Sad to fall below line
reviews.comment_content:
No need to mention again I think. Content has been explained clearly.
Useful content.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Tang explains things clearly, no accent. PPT is clear and easy to catch important points.
But his tone keeps the same for the whole class which makes me sleepy :(
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair, but the cutting line is so strict so I am not willing to give an A remark for this part.
Participation 5% (Using zoom pollings on classes and appearing time is random. So just take all the lectures)
Homework 25%
Midterm exam  30%
Final exam 40%

My grade:
Participation 5/5
Homework 25/25
Midterm exam  88/100
Final exam 61/100
Final score B+. Just below the cutting line of A-. So disappointed. So sad.

What is more, although sometimes the announcement says you cannot argue for your grade during paper checking, you can have a try. I got 6 marks back in midterm.
reviews.comment_workload:
Hard for students who did not take accounting before. First homework is disaster. I spent 8 hours... But after getting used to them, they are easy and can be finished within one hour.
Need review and PRACTICE. You need to be really familiar with skills or you cannot finish final exam or have no time to check.
I highly recommend reading textbook(although it is really time consuming) and do as much as practice you can.

reviews.author: M&A
reviews.title: The nicest professor ever
reviews.comment_content: The content of the first half of this course is similar to that in DSE BAFS(accounting), including the preparation of financial statements and adjusting entries. The second half is about long-term financing, including the issuance of bonds and stocks, which are not covered in DSE. However, some of these topics are covered in FINA1303 (so I highly recommend you to take FINA1303 at the same time).
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Chen adopted a blended-learning mode, where we watched the lecture videos filmed by herself before we attended classes and she would just do some review on the content during lessons. There would be a chapter quiz once a week/every 1.5 weeks, all of which were held in class.

To me, Prof. Chen is just super nice and passionate. You can literally feel her passion in teaching when you watch her lecture videos, and that she was able to condense all the key concepts in her lecture videos in a clear and concise manner (it only took me around 15-20 mins to finish watching her lecture videos for every chapter). Whenever I encountered difficulty in completing the assignments, I would send an email to her and she would reply in a timely manner with detailed examples and explanations given (even during the weekend!), making sure that I didn't have any misconceptions.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are a total of 11 chapters, with 8 chapter quizzes (4 questions each) where each of them constitutes 2% of your total grade and 2 comprehensive quizzes where each of them constitutes 7% of your total grade. The questions for the 2% quizzes are really basic (for students with an accounting background) while the 7% quizzes require more thinking and are pretty challenging.
There are 10 assignments that you have to complete individually, one per chapter and none for the last chapter. Each assignment constitutes 2% of your total grade and you get 2 attempts for each of them. Even though you screwed up in your first attempt, you do not have to worry as aforementioned, you may email her and she would teach you patiently.
There is also a group exercise for each chapter, where you have to read news articles and finish the questions assigned by Prof. Chen. Those questions are easy in general, some of them are thought-provoking though. The 10 group exercises constitute 22% of your total grade, and you would secure the score as long as you submit them on time.
Besides, there would be participation scores awarded which constitute 3% of your total grade. You can either raise questions on the discussion board in Canvas or answer her questions during lessons and take a selfie with her after the lesson ends to earn a participation mark. You only have to do these four times in order to be awarded full marks for participation.
Lastly, the final exam constitutes 25% of your total grade. There are 3 sections in the final exam paper, namely basic, intermediate and advanced levels. The full mark of the final exam was 148. While she said that the basic level questions were similar to that in those 2% quizzes, I felt like those so-called "basic level questions" were already more difficult than those in the 7% quizzes, and I am pretty sure you just can't imagine how hard the questions in the rest of the exam paper could be. What made me find the exam exceptionally difficult was that each question required extremely complicated calculations, yet no marks would be awarded if your final answer was wrong.
For your reference, I got full marks in all quizzes and assignments except for one 2% quiz. I also secured the 22% from group assignments as well as the 3% from participation. The score for the final exam was not released "in order to avoid unnecessary panic" as quoted from Prof. Chen. While I bet I did not score any higher than 30% in the final exam, I managed to get an A+ at last. Therefore, my suggestion would be to try your best to secure the 75% from quizzes, assignments, group exercises, as well as participation so that you can have some sort of "safety net".
reviews.comment_workload: While the workload was relatively large compared with other professors/courses, I would say that it was manageable (may be biased because I learned accounting in high school and I took FINA1303 in the same semester so I didn't have to spend so much time understanding most of the concepts). Also, Prof. Chen's arrangement makes you do revision for the content of each chapter every week, and you would find that a lot of time could be saved when you study for the final exam. Moreover, it was the workload that allowed me to get a good grade. Therefore, I actually love the way Prof. Chen designed this course

reviews.author: Vera624_
reviews.title: Nice professor
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite easy as it is similar to DSE content.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Chen is so nice that she answers your questions with details promptly. She adds some behind scene in the lecture video.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is good as she would adjust our scores based on our overall performance. Originally the full score of the exam is 200, but later she adjusted it to be 150 after the exam. Finally I got A+ for this course.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite light. However, you have to watch the videos before her lecture in order to follow closely.

reviews.author: heybro
reviews.comment_content:
Most of the topics are covered in the DSE. It is very easy for students who have studied BAFS to catch up and learn faster.
The Powerpoint is great that she highlight all the key points and list out most of the challenging questions.
reviews.comment_teaching: She answers our questions patiently that she always advice us to raise questions on or even off lesson through email or canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
Interactions and discussions: 3%

In-class group exercises (10 sessions): 22%

In-class quizzes (10 quizzes): 30%
- Quizzes  will  be  conducted  during  the  class  time  and  there  will  not  be  any  make-up
quiz.
-You may request up to 7% of the weight be  shifted  to  the  final  exam.  
-The  weight  of  quiz  is  2%  for  each  of  the  following  eight  
chapters (1, 2, 3, 6, 7, 9, 10, and 11)
-And 7% for each of the comprehensive quizzes (one for
Chapters 1-4 and the other for Chapters 6-8).

Homework assignments (10 assignments): 20%
Final exam: 25%

Since there is no mid-term exam, the final exam is really difficult. All questions are in form of MC and fill in the blanks, and each questions counted for 7-9 marks.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is quite huge. Since every week has one homework and one in-class quiz need to be done, this mean that you need to spend many times in doing them.
Also, the number of attempts of homework are limited that you need to be careful to read the instructions and questions before handing in.
Moreover, there are also group projects that the projects is easy and would not consider the quality of group projects. Once your group has handed in, you can receive full marks in the item of the group projects.

reviews.author: Lok07
reviews.title: Grade 神 Steven
reviews.comment_content:
The content is quite similar to BAFS, but formats of financial statements are different from those I have learned in high school. Cash flow statement is the  most difficult part to me, as a BAFS student. Some new content to me are issuance of bonds and stock with present values and future values, but the calculation method was quite similar to the financial mathematics part in MATH1003.

The lecture notes covered content in the textbook, unlike some other professors that they did not follow the textbook content. So even if you could not catch up with the content in class or missed any lectures, you could read the textbook and lecture notes before exams to have better understanding.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is a very friendly professor. Although the pace in lesson was quite fast, sometimes I could not understand the content in class, the professor would walk around to explain the concepts patiently while we were doing the in-class exercises. And because 35% of the grade relies on assignments, some students would queue up outside the classroom to ask questions. The professor would explain to us in Cantonese, English or Putonghua.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading scheme is quite lenient, try your best to get full marks in assignments.

Assignments:35%, 5 out of 7 assignments are graded
Mid-term: 25%
Final:40%

No attendance.
Cheatsheets are not allowed in mid-term and final.

My scores:
Assignments: Full marks in 4 assignments and 90+ in remaining 3. Students were queuing up to ask the professor about the assignments after class.

Mid-term: Full marks. The paper included two questions related to bad debts and bank reconciliation statement.
Mean: 80 SD: 20  

Final: The score of final was not released, so I have no ideas about the mean and SD. The final covered 20 MC questions and 2 long questions related to journal entries, income statement, balance sheet and cash flow statement. It was quite difficult and long. I could not manage to get balanced totals for both questions and could not finish the whole paper.

Turned out I got A+. Probably the assignments and mid-term saved my grade. Indeed, BAFS students would get some advantages.
Some of my friends did not study BAFS in high school, got 90% in both assignments and mid-term and had similar situation as me in final, but still got A range. So don't worry even if you did not study BAFS.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload. No quizzes, but only assignments (once a week or maybe twice a week), mid- term and final.
For those who did not study accounting before, I guess it would take more time to understand the concepts.

reviews.author: dailo
reviews.comment_content:
I took bafs in dse so there were only a few new things like cash flow statement and issuing bonds at premium/discount, but overall I think the content shouldn't be too difficult for beginners as well cuz his lecture notes are quite easy to understand.

This is everything we learnt:
Investing and financing decisions and the accounting system
Operating decisions and the accounting system
Adjustments, financial statements, and the quality of earnings
Sales revenue, receivables, the bad debt
Cost of goods sold and inventory
Property, plant, and equipment
Reporting liabilities
Bonds
Reporting and interpreting stockholders’ equity
Statement of cash flows
reviews.comment_teaching:
He's a good professor and he explains the content quite clearly, his accent is also easy to understand. He also allows you to ask any questions you have at the end of each lecture which is great.

But sometimes he talks about stuff which I feel is too advanced for this course and is actually unnecessary to talk about since it doesn't even appear in the exam, so you might be bored sometimes lol but overall a good professor.
reviews.comment_grading:
Weighting:
Participation=5%
Homework=25%
Mid term=30%
Finals=40%

My scores:
Participation (3/5)
Homework (25/25)
Mid term (100/100) mean was nearly 80/100, forgot the exact mean
Final (75/100) mean was only 46.5/100

At the end, I still managed to get A+ because the final was way harder than expected.
reviews.comment_workload: We only had 5 homeworks to complete in the whole semester and it takes around 1-2 hours to complete each hw so its not bad at all. There's also unlimited attempts for the hw so ensure that you get full marks. Also, if you wanna get full marks in participation, attend all the lectures as he takes attendance through zoom polling randomly. I only got 3/5 for participation as I missed a few lectures.

reviews.author: wsdg
reviews.comment_content: Good basic content of acct. Easy and manageable.
reviews.comment_teaching: Sidd was a great prof. He taught well and clearly. He was helpful and willing to solve every problem that students have. He even wrote me a letter of recommendation for a job application.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is fair. The exams are open-book and relatively easy. You should get almost all marks in order to get a satisfying grade. I got an A- in the course and I didn't spend much time on the course so I think it's a good course overall.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload. Exams are open-booked. No attendance is mandatory.

reviews.author: skyfundjr
reviews.comment_content: Although it was first time to take accounting class in my life, the great content that the professor provided was enough to understand. The explanations were great and detailed, and he also gave a lot of practice questions that help me.
reviews.comment_teaching: It is an uncontroversial topic that the professor's teaching skill is above the level. However, considering that many students are beginners to the accounting, the tempo of the class might be quite fast.
reviews.comment_grading: For sure, grading is tough. You should prepare a lot for the midterm and final in order to achieve your anticipated grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Some can say his workload is heavy, but I don't think so. It is reasonable and he always give enough time to finish it.

reviews.author: Bowling0314
reviews.title: Non-BAFS students don’t give up!
reviews.comment_content:
1. Course outline & overview of financial
accounting
2. Class activities: Interactive discussion on
selected annual reports
Investing, financing decisions &
balance sheet
3. Operating decisions & income statement
4. Adjustments, financial statements & quality of earnings
5. Sales revenue; receivables & cash
6. Cost of goods sold & inventory
7. Property, plant & equipment (“PPE”)
8. Current liabilities
9. Long-term debts & Present Value applications
10. Owners’ equity
11-12. Statement of Cash Flows

Kelvin skips some difficult parts (bonds and direct method ) so the syllabus is easier than other class.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Kelvin’s teaching is interesting and practical but lots of times, it is out of the syllabus and makes students confusing. He likes to share some practical issues with us. For example, he always talks about franchise business which is unrelated to our syllabus. But this kind of knowledge is useful if you want to study deeply in accounting.

You must attend his lecture to know what is going on. Because his ppt is too concise. You won't be able to know what does he means by just reading the ppt. During our lesson, Kelvin just shows a ppt slide and does a lot of explanations. We have to write down the main points! He speaks very fast and seldom repeats. You have to write very very very fast to catch up his speed.

If you have no accounting background like me, it is very hard to understand what is going on. For example, in the first few lectures, Kelvin will assume we all know some accounting terms e.g. Credit and debit, fair value, historical cost, residuals. I don't know what is going on... He speaks very fast with lots of accounting terms. I can just stare at him. I want to cry when I was looking at those T accounts. However, if you pay enough effort, you can tackle it! I watch his lecture video many times and read the textbook. Actually, the textbook is better than the professor. I learn everything from the textbook before I attend the lecture. So I could catch up and understand the accounting issues. Therefore! Don't give up!

Kelvin is a very nice and kind professor. He is very willing to answer your questions. Even some stupid questions e.g. What is net realizable value? He explained it very clearly. One time, he chatted with us and answered our questions until 8 p.m. So he is very responsible! The best handsome professor in UST!

He always asks questions during the lessons. These are easy questions. You can just shout out the answers. if no one answers, Kelvin will answer them by himself but he is so poor! So remember to respond to his questions!
reviews.comment_grading:
35% Take-home assignment exercise (the best 7 submissions counted towards total assessment)
20% Mid-term exam
45% Final exam
No attendance needed. However I suggest you not to skip any lesson.
Take home assignment exercises are on the connect (e-book, need to purchase). Only one attempt for each!
I got 37/40 in mid term exam ; nearly full credit for take home assignments ; unknown final exam results (not to be released) . Grade: A+
I think the final and midterm exams are easier than the take home assignment! Kelvin didn’t give us any extra practices and past-paper, he just uploaded some after chapter exercises on canvas. I didn’t do any of it because I think it is unnecessary. Understand his lectures and read the textbooks are enough to score a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only 8 take home assignment but only one attempt. Each takes me 2 hours on average in order to get good marks. You will have 5 days to finish an assignment.

Highly recommend Kelvin!!!

reviews.author: Smurfing in UST
reviews.title: Not difficult but bad grade
reviews.comment_content:
-Basic stuff of accounting, like T-accounts, journal entries.
-Creating financial statements: income statement, balance sheet, cash flow statement.
-Calculating inventory (first-in-first-out, etc.), loans, annuity, bonds.
-Other things about accounting, like what do the auditors do, what is accounting fraud and its consequence.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Sidd is quite fun and could explain the content clearly. Despite his accent, we can still know what he is talking about with the help of his ppt. (not strong accent tho)

In the first lecture, he has already mentioned that you can choose not to attend the class and attendance will not be taken. He said everything you need to learn is on his ppt. But I think attending the class helps you understand better.

Besides, Sidd is very helpful. He pointed out the common error of us after we submitted the first homework.
reviews.comment_grading:
Components:
30% homework
(15% of the highest of HW1 or HW2, 15% of HW3)
30% midterm
40% final exam

The homework and the midterm are very easy. He supposes we can get 100%. The median of the midterm is 100%, and the mean is around 97%. The final is much more difficult. The mean is 59 and the s.d. is 16.

The grading is pretty bad. It might not be the Professor's fault but the curve is high. I get 28.5/30 in homework, 100% in the midterm, and 67 in the final (above mean 0.5sd). I get 85% overall but my final grade is B-? I think the course is easy for most of the students so you will not get a good grade if you cannot stand out.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is light compared to other lecturers.

I heard students from other sections complaining they have weekly quizzes and some other things. But Sidd only gives monthly homework and 2 exams. The only thing you have to worry about is to study hard and understand the course to score higher in the exams.

(The midterm is easy so make sure you know everything.)

(The final is determinative as it is hard. Below mean will kick you into C range.)

reviews.author: whoeveriam

30%-midterm (mean: 97.4 ; median 100)

Grade: B+

reviews.author: ansonhk

However, he sometimes talks gags during class which was quite funny and make our class more energetic.

Attendance is needed.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is excellent.

All assignments have unlimited attempts and it is easy for us to achieve full marks. It is required to turn in at least 8 assignments to get full credit for this part.

For the two midterm tests, the level is at the range of easy to intermediate, so it is quite easy for students to get a satisfying mark after doing revision.

For the final exam, the level is a bit harder than the tests but it is still manageable to achieve high marks after revision. Cheat sheets are allowed and it definitely saves many people's lives when there is a huge amount of formulae to memorize.

Quiz 1: 18/25 (Mean: 18.86)
Quiz 2: 19/25 (Mean: 16.75)
9 Assignments: full credit (20%)
Exam: N.A
Final Grade: A-

reviews.author: Alex bbg
reviews.comment_content:
The first thing that I would like to say is that even non-BAFS students, like me, can handle this, though those who studied BAFS in DSE would definitely gain some advantage. So don't feel sad even if you're a non-accounting high school student!

This course covers some basic concepts for accounting, such as four financial statements and components. I believe other people from the forum has already copy and pasted the info, so I won't do it here.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Sorry for the upcoming rambling guys, I just want to tell you how awful he is!!!!!

Dennis is not bad in teaching. He does teach us something, and his English is proficient compared to other prof. Rather, I often found Dennis being utterly rude, which really affected the learning atmosphere. Many people in this page praised Dennis for being a great teacher and you'll probably think I'm just a 打手 who got a bad grade (though merely an A-). So allow me to explain.

Dennis Chan is an impatient, strict and stubborn man who gets all-defensive easily, which often put me and my classmates off. One time I asked about why my classwork was deducted by 30% in a neutral manner, & he responded with a very long message condemning me about not reading the guidelines... To be frank, I did not intentionally put my full name in wrong order, and that you didn't write in the rules that the order is to be put right, but merely 'full name as stated in student ID card'. Both of us have the responsibility to fix the issue, and besides, it is my grading that is affected, but not yours. There is no reason for him to be so angry :)

Second, he loses patience easily when you ask him more questions in depth, and it often feels like he is angry with students. After such undesirable experience with him, I just feel frightened whenever I ask him something via email. (Ironically, he only smiles and nods with know-it-all non-locals who interrupts in the middle of his sentence and raise questions.) I really wanted to learn more about the accounting mechanics, but unfortunately Dennis is not the prof that I should ask for.

Third, he sometimes puts up classwork that are not even mentioned in class (he mentioned compensation expenses, but not the whole procedure). This is totally unfair to those who are willing to learn but don't have related knowledge, compared to those who had learnt such in high school ! By the way, his policy of having sudden quizzes at the end of some classes without prior notice makes me really nervous. But I guess it's just my problem lol

Lastly, remember to preview the slides before lectures because he assumes us to already know something about the concepts and thus will not explain the basic ideas. For instance, he won't tell you what a 'write-off' is, and he just jumps right into the journal entry steps, assuming that you already know it. He only kept giving us trivia that are only useful when you get the gist of the content/ want to get into accounting major.
reviews.comment_grading:
update: Eventually an A- for this course.

We got 8 classwork,
3 homework assignments &
a final assessment with 50 questions that are to be completed in 60 minutes.
The grading policy is super intransparent. He gives no details after the finals.

By the way, don't, and NEVER, ask Dennis about grading policies (absolute/relative, request for paper-checking), whether via email or in person. Otherwise, be prepared to be scolded by him :)))
reviews.comment_workload:
homework and classwork assignments are mostly done on MH connect, an online website that gives you access to our e-book (though most of us don't read it as it's lengthy) and online assignments.

The workload is not that heavy -- no mandatory readings or questions, but only several open-book online assignments during class (meaning, you have to attend classes even there's no attendance) as well as homework. But these are okay as it also helps you consolidate concepts that you've learnt in class.

Homework assignments are more time-consuming - it requires us to do a full accounting process. The third one regarding inventory systems was the hardest. I used like 3-4 hours cumulatively to complete it.

The homework is selected from the book and you can get full mark as long as you submit it.

reviews.author: hahaha_
reviews.comment_content: if you have studied BAFS (Accounting) before in HKDSE, it will be easier for you to follow. However, some accounting terms are different so it may also cause some troubles.
reviews.comment_teaching:
quite good
attendance is required only in lessons with group work and quizzes
she is quite nice and will answer students' questions immediately during lessons
reviews.comment_grading:
grading is quite good as there are many quizzes, homework and group work to guarantee your result
unlimited attempt for homework and she will teach you how to do in the consultation lesson(only for those who have further questions)
the final exam is quite difficult compared to the quizzes and midterm
but the grading is still reasonable
reviews.comment_workload:
have group work and homework but the workload is light
group work and quizzes appear in the same lesson while the quizzes are quite easy as long as you pay attention in the group work

reviews.author: xd45
reviews.comment_content:
I think it is the basic knowledge of accounting.
The content would not be too much for the final exam.
Accounting 2010 will provide you with a better understanding of accounting's role within
the business world and its influence on society in general. Accounting impacts all areas of
society and it is therefore an enormous advantage for you to have an understanding of basic
accounting principles
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is willing to use the after-class time to help his students in their studies. he also has patient to answer students questions, so please don't hesitate to ask question.
You can ask questions at any time on the Discussion board of Canvas and she will answer all of them very promptly. She can most of the time explains stuff very clearly on the discussion board and I find her answers particularly useful. She also patiently answers questions after class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 5%
Assignment 10%
Midterm 1 25%
Midterm 2 30%
Online final exam 30%

I get ~83.65/100 and get an A-
reviews.comment_workload:
the workload is acceptable. However, there are two midterms. if you want to get a good grade. u must study hard and finish all the exercises after class.
I discussed with a friend numerous times before we figured out the most appropriate answers, not to mention if you try to finish it all by yourself.

reviews.author: dlqp
reviews.title: really liked the professor
reviews.comment_content: since locals studied acct in high school the mean is very high but students with no background can also follow especially since professor chen's teaching is very good
reviews.comment_teaching:
she's really nice and friendly
she answers all questions during classes & emails
she is also very organized
reviews.comment_grading:
better than expected
the final was really hard so it's important to get good grades for midterm & quizzes
reviews.comment_workload:
a lot of work
weekly quizzes (only 3 points per quiz) + homework (could find answers in textbook but still important for exams)
there was in-class exercises with group (points for attendance so don't need to attend all classes)

reviews.author: tarobao
reviews.comment_content: Basic accounting stuff, it's boring but useful.
reviews.comment_teaching:
She is a really nice professors, her lectures arent too boring since it is rather interacive (she make sures everyone answers questions every lecture, which is both good and bad). She answers all my questions in email within 24 hours.
She teaches efficiently as well, easily understood and could finish lectures on time or even early.
reviews.comment_grading:
Super good. Full mark on hw as long as you finished it. Exams are super simple as well (all MC and short questions).
Good grades overall
reviews.comment_workload: A hw after every lecture, but the hw is short so should be able to finish within an hour. 1 midterm 1 final exam, both 2 hours.

reviews.author: AusC
reviews.comment_content: It is easy to grasp in the beginning, but gets hard later on. You need to make sure that you got the basics down in the beginning of the course in order to not get stuck later on in the course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good teaching. Makes the learning easier, as he gives a lot of material we can use to study with.
reviews.comment_grading: Ok grading, expected. Nothing much else that changes with the grading, as most of our grading was from quizzes and the tests.
reviews.comment_workload: Not heavy, just maximum using an hour or 2 a week to study and finish assignments.

reviews.author: TrivanGo
reviews.comment_content:
Basic accounting principle
Financial Statements
Accounting for IPO, stock split ...
Inventory value methods
Accounting Ratio Analysis
Not hard at all if you have study accounting in high school

Very good
Use a lot of real-life examples e.g. using US companies Financial Statements for teaching as well as some assignments questions
He gave a break during the lesson
The pace of learning is not fast
Funny teaching (He like to tell us some jokes during the lesson)
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite lenient
Score I have attained:

homework 2 - above mean
homework 3- above mean
midterm - full marks
exam above mean (around 70%)
I got an A- eventually
reviews.comment_workload:

only the Exam is difficult

3 assignments
1 midterm
1 exam

reviews.author: wklmao
reviews.comment_content: Much more intense than other professors. Would not recommend if you just want good grades. It is also quite difficult to catch up if you skip lectures.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nice and willing to answer students'  questions after class.
reviews.comment_grading: The mean is pretty high for the regular quizzes. Grade depends mostly on the Finals. However, you only get to input the final answers in the exam, no marks for workings.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload falls mostly on revising and preparing for tests. Very few homework but you must spend time to revise hard for decent marks.

reviews.author: ghjk245
reviews.title: good course good teacher
reviews.comment_content: Basic knowledge of Financial Accounting. Most parts of the course cover topics taught in the DSE BAFS curriculum. Students who studied it in secondary school would have an easier time catching up. However, some of the terms and accounting concept used are different from what you have learnt in the DSE curriculum.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Chen's explanation and teaching are very clear and oriented. She is a kind teacher so don't be afraid to ask questions during the lessons. The powerpoints and notes that she provided on Canvas are inadequate so I suggest taking your own notes to facilitate your revision process.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is fair.
Contains 3 comprehensive quizzes/ quizzes for each chapter/ Final examination. *no midterm

quizzes are very easy but the Final examination is difficult
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload. 1 chapter 1 homework. No group projects but there are group tasks in lessons.

reviews.author: Apricity
reviews.title: bad grade course

Financial Statements
T-Accounts and Journal Entries

reviews.comment_teaching:
His English is not bad but speaks toooooo fast.
His goal is just to make sure you can recognize some basic information. Therefore, if you want to learn something deeper or aim to major acct, don't choose his class. If you just want to know what accounting is and wish to learn some basic concepts, then his class is a not bad choice.
reviews.comment_grading:
3 Homework Quizzes 30%
Midterm     30%
Final exam40%

The final is almost impossible for me to finish all the questions. I type quite slowly. By the way, do not make stupid mistakes in the midterm, which has a mean of more than 95 and the median is 100:)
Very large C range. I know I didn't do well in the final. I expected a C+ or B-, but a C in the end. So I think the mean should be C+ or B-.
reviews.comment_workload:
Almost no workload.
the workload of 3 quizzes + 1 midterm is less than the final:)

reviews.author: christinecccc
reviews.comment_content:
Not hard to understand

around 21 chapters in total

Reading PowerPoint is enough
Kinda boring
speak fast
will end the class earlier

bad-fair grading

reviews.comment_workload:
HW*3
Midterm*1
Final
Light workload

reviews.author: Tofu:)
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite easy for those who have taken acct in dse, maybe with some changes as dse is using the UK version while US version is taught in class.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is good I would say. Mak is extremely patient and he wants to explain every single thing clear.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is good as the homework part is not that difficult and the midterms and finals are quite easy as long as you understand the materials he taught in class.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy at all, he wont count attendance. Occasionally some homework and one midterm one final. You have like about three hours to finish four very easy questions in the final. The best class I took in fall sem.

reviews.author: Art3mis
reviews.title: Good grade and easy
reviews.comment_content:
Principles of Accounting
Ch.1 Financial Statements and Business Decisions
Ch.2 Investing and Financing Decisions and the Accounting System
Ch.3 Operating Decisions and the Accounting System
Ch.4 Adjustments, Financial Statements, and the Quality of Earnings

reviews.comment_teaching:
Mixed Mode Teaching.
Have videos uploaded and Q&A sessions during classes.
One quiz during classes each week. Very easy.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is not bad.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is acceptable.
One assignment and one quiz per week.

reviews.author: Stustu
reviews.comment_content: The content was alright. It introduces the necessary concepts for later courses in business, and I rather enjoyed learning it.
reviews.comment_teaching: It is tough if you are new to accounting. But if you do some of the reading before class, the teaching is easier to follow. I liked his enthusiasm.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is rather generous. You might not even have to study the last few chapters if you are able to understand the concept well from the earlier chapters. Perhaps this is under the influence of the online learning.
reviews.comment_workload: I didn't feel that the workload was very heavy. Just some work to do once in a while.

reviews.author: LazyLam
reviews.comment_content: Most of the content can be found in BA in HKDSE, not a big problem for BA students with good grades in HKDSE. For students without accounting background, Professor Mak is a good choice as he will simplify the content and make the concepts easy-to-understand, very friendly to these students
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Mak is passionate at teaching and always answer students' questions immediately with several simple examples to make sure everyone is on the right track. He also prepares easy-to-understand ppt for students and go through them thoroughly in class time. However, his teaching is quite slow to cater students' questions, so sometimes it is be boring to attend his lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
No attendance required
Not all assignments are counted towards the grade, not a big problem not to score full marks or miss one or two assignments.
Mid-term conducted through McGraw-Hill Connect with 20 MCQ and 4 short questions. Some may be tricky but I think the paper's difficulties is reasonable.
Final has 4 structured questions with some fill-in-the-blanks. Mostly testing the topics after MT.
reviews.comment_workload:
Reasonable workload
One assignment with 4-5 elementary or intermediate-level questions for each chapter taught, require less than an hour to complete.
There are some supplementary classes on Saturdays where he teaches something not in the syllabus, but it is not mandatory.

reviews.author: anonywho
reviews.comment_content: It is an introductory course for accounting, including the accounting knowledge of BAFS in high school
reviews.comment_teaching:
Classes were online cuz of COVID

She is very helpful whenever you have a question, so don't hesitate to ask

She adopts blended learning mode, so you don't have to attend all the lectures, in the beginning of the course she'll tell you which lectures require compulsory attendance
reviews.comment_grading:
Try your best in the homework, weekly quizzes and group exercises they aren't hard to score high in. The final exam is gonna be tight in terms of time, so don't expect to score very high.

The grading is fair I guess


30% Weekly Quizzes
20% Homework
25% Group Exercises
25% Final Exam
reviews.comment_workload:
One homework per chapter (once a week) you have a week to finish it

Weekly quizzes (regarding the chapter being learnt)
These are MC quizzes there are about 3-5 questions you should be fine as long as you understand the concept.

reviews.author: Kinalinglala
reviews.title: he would be a great instructor for you if you have studied bafs in dse

reviews.comment_teaching:
His English accent is quite good and it is easy to understand.
he didn't say things apart from the teaching content so I think it's good
he is willing to answer questions from students.
reviews.comment_grading:
a very good grade course for me
there are around 6 quizzes in total and I got full marks for all of them(as they are quite straight-forward)
there is no mid-term so I like it!
I got 68 in my final exam as it is relatively much more difficult than quizzes, most of the questions are scenario  question and I use quite a long time to understand it
it is normal to not finish all but it turns out got an A GRADE that I never expected!
reviews.comment_workload:
about 5 asg with unlimited try
and we need to do some mc question after reading textbook.


attendance is recorded through polling

reviews.author: lpyyy
reviews.comment_content: I think the content are pretty much the same. But as Kelvin teaches very slowly, he cut some topics in the last two weeks.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kelvin's teaching is very detailed. He spent a lot of time to explain the foundation of accounting, especially during the first few weeks. That's why he cannot finished all the topics during the semester.
reviews.comment_grading: All my asm and mid term and exam are just above mean, and I got B in the end.
reviews.comment_workload: Just around 7 asm, one mid term and one exam, not heavy at all.

reviews.author: Wonjae Roh
reviews.comment_content: The content was overall useful to get started on accounting. However, things get a little confusing at the end of the semester. If you miss some concepts in previous lectures, it would be hard to catch up.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is excellent. He clearly introduces concepts so that we can fully understand them. He answeres all of our questions well.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is not bad since you can get a 100 on every homework assignment. There are a few quizzes and the final. There are no midterm nor group assignments. However the final was so difficult for me. Before the final my grade was ok, but the final ruined my overall score. It was too difficult for me. You can not solve a single question with basic knowledge. You have to be able to really know concepts and apply them to real-world examples.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload for HW is ok, but it depends on how much you study for your quizzes and the final

The basic concept of accounting learned in high school

Interesting
Ask questions

Speak clearly

reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good actually
There are assignments, midterm, and the final
Assignments are very easy
midterm and the final are not difficult as well

reviews.comment_workload:
Not heavy ( low in ust)

Attend classes and do the random IPRS to record attendance

reviews.author: whtever

Chapter 1: Financial Statements

reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Sidd explains concepts really well and speaks really good English as uses a lot of real-life examples in class.

He tries to make dad jokes in class. I don't think many people understand them, but at least he tries.

Funny and interactive lesson
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework (2 assignments: 10% each) 20%
Midterm 1      20%

High mean for both midterm
Barely get to mean

reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload
2 assignment (easy)
2 midterm (have cheat sheets)
1 final (take-home final)

reviews.author: jonnydawong
reviews.comment_content: The content covers the basic fundamentals of accounting.   The first few weeks Professor Chen takes her time explaining the basic concepts.  However, the second half expands on these topics very quickly, so stay ahead of the curve.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Chen gives all of the new content in pre-recorded videos that you have to watch before class.  In class she reviews any questions students have while also providing support on the homework questions.  She is hard to understand and doesn't always directly answer questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Midterm exams and final is very hard, class average for both was under 50%.  It is critical to maximize your participation points on group-work, homework, and weekly quizzes.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is manageable: weekly homework and group discussion exercises during lectures.

reviews.author: Nicolasw
reviews.comment_content: If you studied BAFS, this will be a piece of cake for you, but then if not, it is quite hard to catch up. If you listen to every lessons carefully and do every assignments by yourself, then getting above mean will be a piece of cake.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is good and the professor is nice and willing to teach.
reviews.comment_grading: C+ even I got mean in every exam and quizs. My friend got c with mid term above mean a bit and final above mean a bit.
reviews.comment_workload:
not heavy, a few assignments, a mid term, and a final.
The assignments are quite simple.

reviews.title: ACCT 2010
reviews.comment_content: Similar to DSE Accounting, with a few new topics, like more topics on bonds, cash flow statement. Data entries, Income Statement, Balance Sheer, ect. Most contents are included in the notes so the book is not that important.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nice, easy to understand and willing to answer questions. Has provided some sample exam questions and practices which are similar to the format of exam.
reviews.comment_grading: Most people score very high score so every mark can change the grade. But the grade is quite good actually.
reviews.comment_workload: Two short assignments only. 2 Midterms and 1 final. Most questions are numerical.

reviews.author: Dhzbsjj
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction course of Accounting.
Similar to the HKDSE content.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Q&A lectures (not compulsory so I skip most of them) can help if you have problems with the assignments or recorded videos.
Prof. Chen is nice.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grade.
Quiz: nearly full marks.
Assignments: full marks (usually can submit 2 or 3 times)
Final exam: mean +0.5sd
Got an A- at last.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload.
1 quiz and 1 assignment per chapter, which are quite easy.
The final exam is a bit difficult.
Attendance is not required, but there are group discussions and quiz during the lecture, you have to attend those lectures to get the points.

reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme:
-Class participation (6%) Not released
-HW assignments (24%) Full marks
-Test 1 (10%) 200/200
-Test 2 (15%) 234.9/270
-Test 3 (15%) 290/300
-Final Exam (30%) Not released
Grade:A
reviews.comment_workload:
Connect code is needed for the HW and test
There are 11 HW assignments (one for each chapter ) and only 8 of them will be graded.You can have 3 attempts for every HW and every HW consist of many MC questions and long question which is time-consuming. Similar questions will be asked in the test and the final.

reviews.author: Aththth
reviews.title: Great Professor, horrible grading
reviews.comment_content:
大部分都係DSE學過嘅topics不過深化作，未學過accouting嘅人可能要花多啲時間catch up。
（Full syllabus 見attachment）
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Chen is a super passionate teacher and tries to explain every concept as clear as possible. She will post the video (record and edit by HERSELF) on Canvas to let students study before lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
BAD as the Final exam is super difficult.

Class participation:
In-class discussions and exercises (10 sessions) 25% (超容易，100%攞滿分因為prof係交之前會對答案）

In-class quizzes (10 quizzes) 30%
（2-3條MC，都係問basic concept，唔難唔易, 其中兩個係comprehensive quiz，都係MC+longQ不過會難好多）

Homework assignments (10 assignments) 20% （要係McGrill Hill Connect到做嘅assignment，通常有2-3次機會比你做到滿分為止）

Final exam  25% （HARD AF)
reviews.comment_workload:
Medium
No attendance needed. You only need to attend some special lessons that contain in-class quiz and discussions. As prof Chen will upload her teaching video on Canvas, you can get the basic knowledge by watching them and reading the notes. (不過建議乖乖地上堂因為Prof會係堂上解功課+清concept，無讀過Acct嘅都係乖乖地上堂聽書）

每個chapter都有一份assignment，有一個星期做（usually you will spend around 30-60mins/assignment)

Final 好難！

reviews.author: Hzy
reviews.comment_content: Principles of financial accounting. School required courses for SBM students. only contains part of the chapters of the textbook and there are a lot of small points not covered. but sometimes we need to know them to do well in the final exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: his pace is quite slow compared to other professors. but really kind to students with no accounting background. Teaching is really clear and good.
reviews.comment_grading: quite fair, most are MCs and filling blanks.
reviews.comment_workload: a little hard for students without acct background. need to read the textbook carefully to fully understand the content.

reviews.author: Natalie321
reviews.comment_content: the account knowledge is not that hard but needs to practice, those content are quite useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: very patient to answer student's questions and she would reply to our message immediately.
reviews.comment_grading: the grading is satisfaction, if you can finish all the homework and group exercises, you can get a high grade in quizzes as they are similar questions, and that already help you to get a good grade, the exam would be hard as you may not get enough time to finish the test but not all the questions are difficult.
reviews.comment_workload: many group discussions and in-class exercises, also,  it would have a quiz every week by topic.

reviews.author: Paradoxx
reviews.comment_content: Not difficult but just like DSE Econ which requires a clear concept. But once you lose track then it will be hard for you to trace back
reviews.comment_teaching: Explain every concept clearly. Willing to answer students' questions and patient to explain the answer and provide extra knowledge. In my personal thought, Kelvin is a hearted and funny professor.
reviews.comment_grading: Both midterm and final got below mean and turn out has a B. Not bad.
reviews.comment_workload: Only chapter exercises and the first 4/5 exercises have the 'check my answer' option, overall each exercise is short and can be done in a short time if you cal follow the progress well.

reviews.author: lokheiho888
reviews.title: 5 quizzes and 1 exam. GG
reviews.comment_content: The course covers the basic accounting concept like a different kind of statements (Cash Flow Statement, Income Statement, Statement of Financial Position and SE). For students who take BAFS before, I think they will not find the content difficult. But for students are new to Accounting, you will need to spend a lot of time to understand those new concepts which may be a little bit demanding.
reviews.comment_teaching: Fairly speaking, Tang Chao did a great job in teaching. He would have some Zoom polling questions in the beginning and at the end of the lesson to let us recap the concept in the last lecture and the concept we have just learnt. He also speaks clearly in the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading was fair and acceptable. However, it may be a little bit demanding. Unlike other Professor which may have only at most 2 midterms or quizzes, Tang Chao classes will have 5 quizzes throughout the semester and the mean is really high (Around 80 sth)! Despite the fact that you can drop one of the quizzes with the lowest marks, you will be screwed up when other courses have a midterm in the same week.

The final is a nightmare!!!!!!!
I am wondering I am doing English comprehension paper or ACCT final lol. The difficulty is totally different from the quiz and practice paper. You will need to spend a lot of time in studying the final (mean: 40 sth only)

My Grade: B
I think is acceptable as I got and B but not really good.
All my quizzes are above mean or even median. My final above mean for around 5 marks. So if you want to achieve a, you should at least 60 sth in the final but it is hard to so.
reviews.comment_workload: There are tons of problem set for each chapter but I think the workload is not really high.

reviews.author: Vic123
reviews.comment_content: Good for an introductory Accounting course, especially for those who never underexposed of this.
reviews.comment_teaching: Answer question in a short, sometimes 'mean', way.
reviews.comment_grading:
I suppose grading scheme change largely under COVID-19 style of teaching.

Classwork-30%
No midterm
Three sets of online homework-40%
Final-30%

Final is a bit running-out-of-time.
I suppose you can get a good grade if you ace in the Final.
As for me, I got around 1 sd away from the average for classwork and homework, and finished off final with a good feeling(no access to final score tho), ending up an A+ for this course.

Gotta work hard : )
reviews.comment_workload:
Light.

Remember to do preview and review.

It's a definite answer that you don't want to miss a class.

reviews.author: cup
reviews.comment_content:
Basic accounting topic
balance sheet
income statement
cash flow statement
ratio
accounting principle
most learned in secondary school
reviews.comment_teaching: easy to catch up. interactive and the professor encourage student to ask questions. since accounting is a built-up process, make sure understand all the concept and how it works.
reviews.comment_grading: assignment is easy and the exam is a bit difficult. the exam is overwhelming. it requires good time management and totally familiar with the class topic.
reviews.comment_workload: acceptable. participate in class and review the content after each lesson is enough to achieve a good grading

reviews.author: Yannihaha
reviews.title: It requires continuous effort but you can get good grades long as you work hard
reviews.comment_content: I didn’t study any accounting courses in secondary school but I follow up with the progress guided by the professor which is one chapter per week and I managed to get good grades finally. As long as you work hard, you will be fine. It would be quit confusing at the beginning but YouTube videos and asking the professor or TA would surely help.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is nice and open to questions. I asked her many questions through email and she could always respond me quickly and thoroughly. But her final is really difficult.
reviews.comment_grading: The professor is very lenient when grading homework and quizzes and the content of the webwork and quizzes are quiz simple and straightforward as well. However the final exam is extremely time-limited which requires thorough understanding on course materials quick response to questions. I got near full marks for all homework and quizzes but not the final. I eventually got A.
reviews.comment_workload: You have to hand in one piece of homework and attend one 2% quiz every week plus a 7% quiz every three weeks. I personally think that the workload is fine but you have to keep up with the progress which is one chapter per week if you want to score good grades in the quizzes and thus the final exam.

reviews.author: chloew
reviews.title: It's meh.
reviews.comment_content:
This course is taught in AMERICAN style of accounting, you will notice a slight difference to your DSE taught HK style of accounting.

This course is not for folks who are new to accounting, even though it says it is.

Very weird organization of content, you do not start from the basics.
======================================
0 Introduction / Overview of Financial Statements

1 Financial Statements and Business Decisions
2 Investing and Financing Decisions and the
Accounting System
3 Operating Decisions and the Accounting System
4 Adjustments, Financial Statements, and the Quality of Earnings
---------------------------------------
Test 1 (Chapters 1-4)
---------------------------------------
6 Sales Revenue, Receivables, and Cash
7 Cost of goods sold and inventory E7-1, 4, 5,
8 Property, plant, and equipment
---------------------------------------
Test 2 (Chapters 6-8)
---------------------------------------
9 Reporting liabilities; Time value of money
10 Corporate bonds
11 Owners’ equity
---------------------------------------
Test 3 (Chapters 9 - 11)
---------------------------------------
12 Statement of cash flows
---------------------------------------
Final exam: all of the course content.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very slow teaching. Depending on what you want in a teacher, you might find his teaching very clear and easy to follow, or you might find it boring and a waste of time.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme:

Class Participation 6%
- Class participation is based on:
- a. attendance record;
- b. whether the webcam is turned on;
- c. frequency & quality of questions you raise in class;
- d. frequency and quality of your responses to questions raised by the instructor or other fellow
students;
- e. participation in group discussion;
- f. Any behaviour that causes disturbances to the class (negative)

Homework 24%
- 11 homework assignments
- You will be graded based on the best 8 homework exercises out of 11.
- You get three attempts for each assignment and the attempt with the highest score will be graded.

Test 1 10%
- Chapters 1-4

Test 2 15%
- Chapters 6-8

Test 3 15%
- Chapters 9-11

Final exam 30%
- Chapters 1-12

You will need to buy the Connect code to complete the homework exercise and tests.

The final exam was a written exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light but frequent workload.
1 HW assignment every week, 1 test every 3 weeks.

The assignments are not difficult but they are frustrating to get right. There are also MANY questions in each HW.

Many non-graded practices are available.

(Just to clarify, I did not forget to grade the four categories, this course simply gets a solid C from me. It's better than a pass, but it's just not a particularly good course as well.)

reviews.author: Heather
reviews.comment_content:
The course was organised in a complex way so it turns out a bit difficult for students who have no BAFS background to catch up .
Advise students to do the textbooks exercise frequently to revise.
reviews.comment_teaching: quite boring but Q&A sessions works if you have any questions regarding the lectures and homework.
reviews.comment_grading: She was quite lenient in grading. All the homework and in class exercise were counted so you can get some marks even you do not do well in mid term and exams.
reviews.comment_workload: a bit heavy. you have to watch all the lecture video before the lesson and you got homework and quizzes every week.

reviews.author: Simster
reviews.comment_content:
1. Course outline & overview of financial accounting
2. Class activities: Interactive discussion on selected annual reports
Investing, financing decisions & balance sheet
3. Operating decisions & income statement
4. Adjustments, financial statements & quality of earnings
5. Sales revenue; receivables & cash
6. Cost of goods sold & inventory
