too many assignments
but it wont affect the grading to a large extent
cuz its based on efforts and you will not be stricktly assessed

reviews.title: Good grade course
reviews.comment_content:
Easy contents, especially for those with BAFS background. But I believe even without a basic knowledge in accounting, you can still handle it.

1. Introduction;Financial Statements and Business Decisions
2. Investing and Financing Decisions and the Accounting System
3. Operating Decisions and the Accounting System
4. Adjustments, Financial Statements, and the Quality of Earnings
5. Sales Revenue, Receivables, and Cash
6. Cost of Goods Sold and Inventory
7. Property, Plant, and Equipment; Intangibles; and Natural Resources
8. Liabilities
9. Bond Securities
10. Stockholders’ Equity
11. Statement of Cash Flows
12. Analyzing Financial Statements;Final Exam Review Session
reviews.comment_teaching:
She is a passionate professor and would organise some individual consultation session before exams for us to ask questions. However, she has some mainland accents, but I guess it doesn't cause much difficulties in understanding her.

She also likes to have class discussion time, she would break people into groups for 10-20 minutes for discussion.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading
She mentioned in class that 92 can get a A

Class participation 8/8
In-class quizzes 29/30
After-class Practice Problems 32/32
Midterm 10/10
Final exam unknown/20

Final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Class participation 8%
In-class quizzes 30%
After-class Practice Problems 32%
Midterm 10%
Final exam 20%

The workload is light. For class participation, full credit will be granted if you have at least twice active participations.You need to submit exercise after each class but she would only count 8/11 (more importantly is that she doesn't care about correctness, just based on submission). For in-class quiz, they are all MCs and are pretty straight forward.

Both midterm and final are open book, they consist of mainly MC and some calculation questions. Due to online lesson, she provided a standardised format for the calculation questions.

reviews.author: clearance147
reviews.comment_content:
Mainly following the textbook, doing practice questions on it is helpful.

He provided plenty of materials on canvas and I haven't viewed them, but I guess they should be helpful
reviews.comment_teaching:
quite friendly and responsible, conducted non-compulsory tutorial sessions in weekends and was always welcome for all kinds of questions
closed book exams for both midterm and the online final
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm mean78 I got 76
Final not shown(there was tech problem for all of us)
Three 10-point in-class quizzes I got 8.5/10/10(mean 8.7/9.6/10)
CSR(Case Study Report on Corporate Social Responsibility)
I got 14.5/15, mean 13.3
I got A-
reviews.comment_workload:
working hard on the essay shall be worthy
several graded in-class group discussion with paper-based submissions required, but I guess this is how he conducted attendance-check

reviews.author: awesomedoncic
reviews.title: Easier final
reviews.comment_content:
the content is quit easy, slides are also quit easy to understand
Usually, her ACCT class is known for a very tough final exam. But the quiz 2 this year is more difficult than before, so professor adjust the final exam to be easier. Good adjustment !
nice professor !
reviews.comment_teaching:
At least no accent issue
Comparing to other professor teaching ACCT 2010, Chen Szu Fan teaches contents in a more simple way. The contents in the slides is only needed for the test.
reviews.comment_grading:
Depending on what marks you want to receive, A range might be a little bit harder but still easier to get it
My grade:
attendance and hw all full marks
quiz 1 i got 10/10, the mean is 9
quiz 2 i got 19/25, the mean is like 16
final i seems to got a grade a little bit higher than mean, but the grading method seems to let my score move forward.
I got an A- although i have never learn ACCT before.
Honestly i do not know what is the mean for the final letter grade. Most of my friends got B+.  It might be a course that is easier to reach B+ comparing to other business school course.
reviews.comment_workload:
12 assignment, take the highest 10
the workload of each assignment would not be very heavy
maybe only  30 minutes or less to finish it

reviews.author: tm498
reviews.comment_content: Introduction to basic accounting concepts (covered most chapters of the textbook used). Initial weeks may be a little challenging for people who've never studied accounting before, but it is manageable.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor's explanations were good, used lots of examples to help simplify abstract accounting concepts.
reviews.comment_grading:
Bell curve grading.
- Midterm = 25%
- Final = 50%
- Assignment = 15%
- Worksheets = 10%
reviews.comment_workload:
Midterm, final and one class assignment.

Some class exercises were also graded and counted towards the final. Attendance is required for sessions with worksheets in order to gain marks.

The assignment is not very taxing and does not require much research to be completed.

reviews.author: BekzhanTBS
reviews.comment_content: The content is pretty easy. Just go through her PPT slides – they are very detailed and it will be more than enough.
reviews.comment_teaching: She always tries her best to make sure everyone understands everything clearly. PPTs slides are very detailed and easy to read. In-class exercises are a good way to learn everything.
reviews.comment_grading: Not bad, although there are many students who took acct before and the mean is really high.
reviews.comment_workload: Study hard for the final exam as quizzes are nothing compared to the final. Overall, pretty easy if you are good at memorizing things.

reviews.author: jame
reviews.comment_content: Most of the course content overlap with the secondary school accounting content.  It would be an advantage for  BAFs students to master the exams but terms and accounting format would be a bit different
reviews.comment_teaching: Good teaching and moderate pace. The professor is very nice and willing to answer our questions. She use some daily business example to make us understand more about the principle.
reviews.comment_grading:
In class 24%
Participation 6%
Quiz 1 10%
Quiz 2 20%
Final 40%
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is moderate and easy to handle. The in-class exercise is easy.  Just review the PPT she provided to study the midterm and final exams then will be fine.

reviews.author: Serena0824
reviews.comment_content: It is just about basic accounting knowledge, covered all secondary school accounting syllabus. It will not be hard to handle even you didn't study accounting before.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very good English and I like his accent. He is passionate about accounting and willing to answer your questions after the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
Take attendance randomly
You can easily get full mark in homework
MIdterms are easy but the SD will be large
Final is super difficult, totally different from midterms
reviews.comment_workload:
Two midterms and one final
5 attendance will be taken
10 sets of homework in total

reviews.author: 試伏大師
reviews.comment_content: my friend told me that it's dse acct. i have no idea at all as i didnt study bafs. but not hard at all.
reviews.comment_teaching:
nice teacher, able to answer ur question and reli helpful. He gave many examples in the lesson so you can know the concept quite well.
the overall atmosphere in the lesson is pretty good. you can go to other lectures as long as the instructor is him.
reviews.comment_grading: ok? for me, I don't have any accounting experience and I am able to get a b-, I have to admit that I didn't study hard.
reviews.comment_workload: no work at all, one quiz and a few lesson work. also, you can chat wif ur friends during the lesson work, so it's very ez. but u don't know when is the lesson work so you must need to attend every lesson.

reviews.author: mang
reviews.comment_content: It’s an introductory course for business student. It just introduce all general topics like PPE, depreciation but not get in too deep.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching is quite boring. Sometimes she will write down the accounting procedures on a paper and explain step by step. But those content are quite easy, you can easily find the solution or explaination on the internet, no need listen to her carefully.
reviews.comment_grading: A few assignments and midterm and final. No attendance is needed.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not big. Just review the PPT she provided before midterm and final is enough.

reviews.author: TJNJ
reviews.comment_content:
Basic structures of accounting.
If youre new to accounting it may be hard to grasp at first, but by the end you'll get a hold of it.
reviews.comment_teaching: He tries to answer all students' questions raised during the class. He also tries to incorporate his knowledge and teaches us using real life examples to understand the topic. However, to an extent, he simply reads the ppt slides to us. He speaks clear English compared to other professors.
reviews.comment_grading:
Weightings allocated to different modes of assessment are as follow:
Classworks8%
Assignment12%
Term Test30%
Final Examination50%

Grading is fair, and he is quite strict with turning in assignments on time and not cheating.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload other than the two assignments he handed out. There are classworks but he basically guides you through it step by step.

reviews.author: Jared_pie
reviews.comment_content:
more of less same with the DSE BAFS
but the DSE syllabus is taught using the British accounting standard IFRS and this course is the American standard GAAP. So there are some minor differences in various accounting treatment
reviews.comment_teaching:
teaching is fairly good
his English is quite fluent and accent is easy to understand
reviews.comment_grading:
the 2 midterms are too easy, about half of the class get over 90%
the online final is a disaster
reviews.comment_workload:
7 homework which will not be marked in detail, but the TA will really check if you have finished most questions.
so workload is fine

reviews.author: ThisIsMe
reviews.comment_content: The content was relatively easy to grasp with the focus being on understanding the basics of accounting in terms of the different types of financial documents such as balance sheet and income statement. Further on in the course, we focused on journal entries and T-accounts with details about recordings different types of accounts.
reviews.comment_teaching: She was a pretty helpful professor and would try and answer all the questions. However, at times it would be hard to focus as her voice can become very monotonous.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was pretty fair with there being two mid-terms and one final exam. There were 10 homework assignments which we had to submit throughout the semester but the professor went through all of them in class so it was mostly about listening to her about the assignments and then just submitting them later. The attendance part is covered by her assigning us two days and we have to show up to one of those days to answer two questions.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is pretty light as most of the focus was on the exams. However, it would be important to complete the homework as it's pretty easy and can be completed in class.

reviews.author: mxyh1904
reviews.title: You'll do a lot of self study
reviews.comment_content: Basic principles of accounting that covers basic terminology, balance sheets, income statement, statement of shareholder's equity, and statement of cashflows. The content is all in the textbook that is recommended for the course and the book is honestly very good-- super straightforward with a lot of examples to help you understand the concepts.
reviews.comment_teaching: Honestly I stopped going to class after the first few lectures. I read the textbook before class and when I went to class I just got really really confused. Professor Chen isn't super clear sometimes and has a hard time teaching away from the slides (as in, she has a difficult time specifically addressing questions). So in conclusion. READ THE TEXTBOOK! And do the practice problems because that's going to be the most helpful thing for preparing for exams.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is actually pretty decent. It's based on one attendance participation question, your two midterms and your final exam. The first midterm is pretty easy but midterm two is where it all goes downhill. For the final and midterm, you will be put in a time crunch and the questions will be worded so that it's more like solving a scavenger hunt than doing an exam. So try your best. But this semester, our final average was 30% so don't worry if you score really low. This is a mandatory class so...good luck everyone.
reviews.comment_workload: I spent a lot of time reading the textbook and doing the problems to try to understand the content. So I spent a ton of time on this class. It's not necessary if the lectures make perfect sense to you but I recommend the book--there's no need to double the time you spend on this class when one method will get you an A

reviews.author: bj
reviews.title: Great content, but requires self discipline
reviews.comment_content: Content is meant for non-BAFS students, and I can agree with that. Some quizzes had questions out of syllabus, and it was unfair for non-BAFS students.
reviews.comment_teaching: Great at explaining, patient with students, friendly professor after all. However, he had a tendency of testing students with questions that are out of syllabus in quizzes, which was slightly unfair for students who didn't study BAFS. Class is generally pretty interesting though.
reviews.comment_grading: Achieved A- at last, despite not doing too well for my midterms. I believe this is an easy course for most, but will require self-discipline and hard work if you want to achieve a high grade in this course.
reviews.comment_workload: Minimal workload, classwork given occasionally, but can be tackled with great ease.

reviews.author: ustkatielaw
reviews.comment_content: the contents are rather easy to understand as long as you read all the powerpoint slides by sidd. most of them are already included in the hkdse accounting syllabus. however, sidd's contents seem to be much simpler and not so in-depth compared to other professors (dennis, tang chao etc.), so if you take future ACCT courses it may affect your learning progress(?)
reviews.comment_teaching: being a new professor, sidd is quite passionate in class and are willing to explain the materials in an in-depth way. He is also willing to answer all of your enquiries. Is kind in gradings as well.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term 1: 100/100
Mid-term 2: 99/100
Final: 179.5/200
Homework: 18/20
overall grade: A-

Mid-term 1 is super easy, more than half of all the students taking the class got full marks. basically study the mid-term practice and you are guaranteed to get a good score.

Mid-term 2 is more difficult, but since sidd gives out a practice (the real exam is 80% based on the practice and the rest can be found in the slides)

the 2 homeworks are super easy since Sidd explains everything in class. the mean is about 19/20 so please don't screw it up.

due to the special circumstances, sidd's final is a 48-hour take-home exam. He said it should take no more than 3-4 hours but everyone ends up using more than 10 hours. still, you can find all the answers within the slides and online. follow the instructions hopefully you can score above mean.
reviews.comment_workload: the workload is super light in this course. Basically go over the materials once and make sure you understand the concepts will do. Since Sidd only tests your knowledge on his slides, the textbook only serves as a reference.

reviews.author: Jenniferlui
reviews.comment_content:
similar to dse but harder
i skipped 80% lessons but still fine
basically a little more than the dse syllabus
reviews.comment_teaching:
he's friendly and willing to talk to students
easy to understand
saw him teaching individually to a foreign student in patience
and i thoughts hes so charm
reviews.comment_grading:
Ive got B with little effort
to me its leng grade already
so its not too bad
reviews.comment_workload:
its ok actually not heavy
only one essay and 4 pieces of in class assignment
essay is quite easy as it is max 3 pages and not minimum

reviews.author: Heliumet
reviews.title: Good Grade. Good Lecturer. Not so good exam.
reviews.comment_content: It is 50% of the DSE syllabus of BAFS accounting module. No partnerships, no bank reconciliation statements, no costing, etc. Concepts are less too. One minor difference is the reducing balance method changed. But nothing big matters.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kelvin is nice and his teaching is wonderful. He can take care both types of students -- those who study accounting before and those who do not. He always introduces extra optional reading material that arouses our interest on accounting. He personally is a friendly person too.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is lenient.
10% inclass participation, which is doing coursework. Pick 2 out of 3. You will have partners, but you can easily do it without the aid of any partner if you have study BAFS before.
15% case study report, 3 pages on social responsibility. Actually the average standard is not high so you don't need to put too much effort. Mark range is 10-14.5 out of 15.
P.S. I spent 3 hours and got a 14.5.

25% midterm, comprises of MC and LQ. LQs are very easy, just beware of tricky MCs. Full mark is possible, but mean is not very high.

50% final, due to the cancellation of face to face class, it becomes an online MC exam. It is a bit difficult, but never mind, everyone gets not so high mark, so it won't affect your grade.

And finally I got an A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
The only workload is mentioned above in the grading -- Case Study Report.
And if you (or your group) cannot finish the coursework within lesson time, you also have to do it as homework, but it won't bring much workload. Normally speaking, revision time associated with this course isn't much either.

reviews.author: Singsingsing
reviews.comment_content:
It is easy for students who have studied Accounting in their high-school. The syllabus is similar to HKDSE. Non-accounting students might need some time to catch up.

Topic 1 Financial Accounting around us
Topic 2 Balance Sheet
Topic 3 Income Statement
Topic 4 Year-end Adjustment
Topic 5 Sales Revenue & Receivable
Topic 6 COGS & Inventory
Topic 7 PPE
Topic 8 Liabilities
Topic 9 Owners' Equity
Topic 10 Statement of Cash Flow
reviews.comment_teaching:
Kelvin is patient and willing to explain everything. However, his teaching is somehow boring that you might fall asleep easily.

He is a Hong Kong professor and he may use Cantonese to explain some unclear concepts, which may be good and bad for local and non-local students respectively.

Also, Kelvin often uses some difficult terms to explain some unclear concepts, which might be hard for non-accounting students to follow his pace.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grading

In-class exercise 10%
Case Study Report 15%
Mid-term Examination 25%
Final 50%

I got:
in-class exercise 10/10
Case Study Report 13.5/15
Mid-term 96/100
Final 59/75

Finally A+ in the course.
reviews.comment_workload:
One to two in-class exercise(s) after finishing the teaching of each chapter, on a group basis (each row in a group). Not so difficult (Kelvin will guide you to finish so).

The most difficult part will be the case study report (in which other professors teaching ACCT2010 do not require you to do so). You will have to write 3 pages based on the topic of corporate social responsibilities. You should not choose Kelvin if you do not want to write essay. :)

Examination is fine.

reviews.author: Jadenchan19
reviews.comment_content:
The syllabus content is a simplified version of A level accounting, so this course is easy for those who took accounting before in secondary school.

You will learn about income statements, balance sheets, statement of cash flows, journal entries, bonds, depreciation and basic accounting policies.

However, the content may be confusing for those who are new to accounting
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Sidd explains accounting concepts very well, and he likes to use real life examples to explain them. He speaks with a clear voice, and he responds fast to emails. Attendance is not counted
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments - 20%
Midterm 1 - 20%
Midterm 2 - 20%
Final exam - 40%

Assignments are mainly fill in the blanks.
Midterms are easy, as it is similar to the practice exercises. However, do expect the mean to be very high, so please prepare good cheat sheets and check your paper to make sure you don’t make careless mistakes.

Mean for Midterm 1: 96.9
Mean for midterm 2: 92.4
reviews.comment_workload:
2 assignments, very light workload, it’s just fill in the blanks. There are also 2 practice exercises for Midterm Exam. However, I’m disappointed that Professor Sidd didn’t give any practice questions to prepare for Final exam

If you’re new to accounting, allocate some time to understand journal entries and how the accounting system works.

reviews.author: Yoon Joo Chae
reviews.comment_content: Since it is the basic course for accounting and slightly related to other courses, it is very useful to learn.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He teaches very well.
I love his way of teaching.
reviews.comment_grading: All the local students have already studied this course at secondary school, so international students are at the different starting with them. It is hard to get good grades for international students.
reviews.comment_workload: It is very important to go through problems that he suggests us to try. He provides answers of the problems. It take quite bit of time, but they are very useful to apply concepts and be ready for both midterm and final.

reviews.author: noneedtoknowwho
reviews.title: Best professor!!!
reviews.comment_content: it is rather easy compared to other courses for Year 1 students. Even if I didn't study BAFS for my DSE, I still found it easy to follow.
reviews.comment_teaching:
EXCELLENT!!!
Funny teaching. He simplified the content and explained it deeply with different resources. He will also explain in detail in class if only 1 student didn't get the idea.
reviews.comment_grading:
Too easy midterms.
If you did some careless mistakes you won't be too happy with the score as the mean score is extremely high.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much workload.
Only 2 assignments which are only fill in the numbers. But it already counts for 20% of the course score.

reviews.author: Daisychun32
reviews.title: definitely a course for students with related background, they seem like they don needa study and get full mark in midterm
reviews.comment_content: some said he teaches badly but personally i like his style and he is willing to answer every goddamn questions . the contents are mainly high school stuff. but i didnt take acct in high school so its complicated for me
reviews.comment_teaching: super great. hes so funnt that i don wanna skip the classes
reviews.comment_grading: the midterm is very hard in comparison to other professors. other fds got 100 marks in midterm in other classes. but mine? no way . you gotta work hard to hv gd mark in midterm
reviews.comment_workload: nearly no workload. just have some class work to do which are really easy. rmb not to skip class too often coz he wont give a hint on whether he ll test . just make sure you go to class

reviews.author: tungcc
reviews.title: Easy course for dse BAFS students
reviews.comment_content: Topics are mostly related to BAFS ACCT module. Only a few new topics are added. Can bring up to 5 cheat sheet (with double sided pages meaning 10 pages) to midterm and final
reviews.comment_teaching: His lessons are quite boring. He will guide you with your hw and midterm/final. But the TA is probably very rude.
reviews.comment_grading:
His exams are rather easy so many people will get full marks, which means one mark lost will tend to receive a lower grade.

The final is super hard so not many people score high marks.

Very bad grade.
reviews.comment_workload: It’s ok because there are only two homework which only requires filling in blanks. Not much to study for midterm and final since you can have cheat sheets.

reviews.author: Aritro
reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment_content: One of the best professors I have ever been taught by in HKUST.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Great style of teaching not limited to the book. Very important to attend classes as gives a lot of information that may not be on the slides or in the book.
Gives a lot of time to explain each concept carefully so that you don't need to mug up everything.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is very lineant.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is very light
Will be taking some attendance in class in the form of some assignments that are done at the end of the class
Midterm and Final will be fairly easy if you read the book carefully and pay attention in class and the way he tells you to solve problems
Will have a case study on a particular company.

reviews.author: matthew.io
reviews.comment_content:
Kinda difficult for me since this is the first time I learn it. When he was on chap4, I actually started studying and turns out the concept is pretty simple.

Chapter 1 : Introduction
Chapter 2 : Fundamentals of accounting
Chapter 3 : Accounting systems and how to write basic journal entries
Chapter 4 : Adjusting entries, Balance Sheet, Income Statement
(we skipped chapter 5)
Chapter 6 : Accounts Receivables, Bad debts, Allowance for doubtful accounts (we skipped the second half of the chapter)
Chapter 7 : Inventory, FIFO, LIFO (we skipped the latter part of the chapter)
Chapter 8 : Property, Plant, Equipment (we skipped a lot of the content in this chapter)
Chapter 9 : Liabilities
Chapter 10 : Bonds and Accounting for bonds purchased at premium and at discount
Chapter 11 : Stockholders' Equity
Chapter 12 : Statement of Cash Flows
Chapter 13 : Analyzing financial statements
reviews.comment_teaching: The pace is a bit fast for beginner. The difficulty is manageable if you pre-study. Some of the lesson, I did not understand 80% just because I was new about it.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 5%
Homework 10%
Midterm 15%
Midterm 20%
Final exam 50%
reviews.comment_workload: Around 1 hw every 2 weeks. It took me around 2 hours to finish it because I really don't know how to do it, ending up reading the notes all over again finish the hw.

reviews.author: Vivek
reviews.title: Financial Accounting
reviews.comment_content: General basic accounting in the GAAP system, credit and debit, and PV of money, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is brilliant, can understand her accent, and honestly she must be one of the best professors ever to teach me in university.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is a bit strict, she strongly wants class participation and asks about things talked in class on the final. I got around mean in both quizzes and more than 1 SD above in the final. I probably got low in class participation though, because I rarely attended classes, still ended up with a B+.
reviews.comment_workload: There are weekly assignments and 2 quizzes and a final, workload is kind of high.

reviews.author: John Yuan
reviews.comment_content: similar to secondary school accounting. a bit different but easy to adapt.
reviews.comment_teaching: Ms Chen is an nice person. always willing to answer the questions of student.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good for students who have studied acct before.

Even for students who do not studied acct before it is easy to get a satisfied score in the mid term exams.

But the final is quite difficult. The mean is about 50% only. Anyway score itself is not important as long as it is used to compared.
reviews.comment_workload: only two mid term and one final. very light workload.

reviews.author: ejh
reviews.title: Great teacher!
reviews.comment_content: Interesting but raw. I just started taking this course but I heard mixed things about it. She is a great professor but make sure to do your part.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dry but answers every question:) Very straightforward participation policy and happy to accomodate real exam conflicts.
reviews.comment_grading: Final is very hard! Study! Make sure to not lose points along the way and study hard for the final. There might be surprising structures and it will be significantly harder than the quizzes.
reviews.comment_workload: Manageable. Do your part and you will be fine! You need to buy or share the 10th edition book because she gives practice problems out of it.

reviews.author: aaaaaaaaaaa
reviews.title: Fair
reviews.comment_content: Basic things that are included in DSE BAFS. It teaches GAAP, a useless accounting system that is going to be replaced soon. Not very hard to understand the content.
reviews.comment_teaching: Average, at least the tutor taught you how to draw T-account step-by-step. Her English was not bad.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair. It is clear that it is not a very good grade course.
reviews.comment_workload: Not heavy. Simply finish at least 3 long questions for each homework. No need to take it serious as the content would not be graded.

reviews.author: Binvant
reviews.title: Decent Intro Course
reviews.comment_content:
Pretty standard content. If you've done acct in high school (DSE, CBSE, A levels, etc), you'll have a decent head start, but you definitely won't know all of the content.

Semester starts with covering basic financial statements, some financial ratios. Then moves on to discuss inventory, different accounting systems, and ending with Statement of Cash Flow. (gets challenging towards the end)
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching was alright, nothing great, but not bad either. He followed the textbook pretty closely, so I'd recommend just reading + underlining the chapters before coming to class. Don't expect much help in questions, as he won't answer questions that well. To be fair, it was his first year as a full professor, so I'm sure he'll improve.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pretty fair, the mean was all over the place, sometimes in the 70s, other times in the high 80s, with a massive SD. Put in effort for the hw and do all the end of chapter review problems and you should be good for midterms+final.
Attendance is taken 5 times per semester randomly, so be sure to go to the lectures.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite a bit to be honest. Reading the textbook takes a LOT of time, so be prepared to spend lots of time doing that. Preparing for exams becomes easier that way too. The practice problems are easy if you've really grasped the material in the textbook.

reviews.author: charlotte_90
reviews.comment_content:
The content was easy to understanding if yiu had studied BAFS in high-school.
Simply teaching you how to prepare balance sheet and income statement.
you could get a good grade if u put effort.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor was quite boringand speaking in a flat tone. and it was really hard to focus on what he was saying.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was just depends on the mid-term exam, final and the participation. midterm was really easy to get an excellent score while final was a bit harder. The overall grading is good.
reviews.comment_workload: Not really much workload as there is no any assignment as i remember. But it was recommend to pitch a stock and you would get bonus points for the course.

reviews.author: Jacob_dumdum
reviews.title: Good Grade
reviews.comment_content:
A bit rush if you didnt study accounting in HKDSE.
The beginning of the class involves mostly topics that have been taught and tested in the DSE BAFs curriculum. It is easier for BAFs students to catch up. Nonetheless, terms and accounting format may be a little bit different, so it may take some time for you to adapt to it.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Good.
Quite a lot of interaction in class. Often encourage students to answer questions during class. Marks will be awarded to those who answered..
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good.
Generally, not getting bad grades.
In class 24%
Participation 6%
Quiz 1 10%
Quiz 2 20%
Final 40%
reviews.comment_workload: Not much.

reviews.author: Jason_0305
reviews.comment_content:
Tell clearly what is insyl and outsyl
So you wont waste lots of time to revise sth useless
reviews.comment_teaching: All written clearly with the correct concept, easy to follow,Willing to answer questions from us, spending lots of time after lesson!
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grade.
I got an A though.
with fair midterm and slightly good exam (102/120) i think.
reviews.comment_workload:
low work load
Only a few homework with answers provided at the back of the book.
And what u need to do is to complete the work, and revise is not that required.

reviews.author: jayhuggg
reviews.comment_content: The content is really good, just some basic accounting knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Chen is a good professor, she always answers the question after class. Feel free to ask her if you don't understand some specific topic.
reviews.comment_grading: Although her midterms are pretty easy, her final is hard af. Make sure you prepare well for your final.
reviews.comment_workload: Her workload is pretty small, basically no hard assignment, whats more she'll post the answer for the assignment on the canvas. If you're puzzled by the assignment just go check the canvas's answer.

reviews.author: diermolaieva
reviews.comment_content: Basic intro to financial accounting course. The content is exactly what you would expect in such course, covering broad fin acc topics
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony is an enthusiastic professor who tries to keep classes interesting, though since the content is quite dull inherently he does not always manage to keep attention of the entire class. He is reasonably helpful if you have additional questions and he will remember you if you speak frequently.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading, there are some quizzes, MT and final
reviews.comment_workload: Medium workload. Some preparation for quizzes required although they are open book

reviews.comment_content:
Detailed.
Topic 1 Introduction
Topic 2 Balance Sheet
Topic 3 Income Statement
Topic 4 Year End Adjustment
Topic 5 Sales Revenue & Receivable
Topic 6 COGS & Inventory
Topic 7 PPE
Topic 8 Liabilities
Topic 9 Owners Equity
Topic 10 Cash Flows
I have studied BAFS before in secondary school so the course content is quite familiar but there are slight differences in the detailed part of each topic, so try not to skip lectures.
reviews.comment_teaching: Easy to understand and he is patient to explain anything. His teaching is not boring so you wont fall asleep easily.
reviews.comment_grading:
midterm: 8x
final: 8x
Grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload: A midterm and a final exam, as well as some in-class assignments for participation mark.

reviews.author: asbhnjwqw
reviews.title: Nice
reviews.comment_content: Libby, Libby, and Hodge. Financial Accounting, 9th edition (2017)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Fairly good.
Since the topics were categorised according to the accounts' nature, the teaching sequence was quite different from that in BAFS.
The teaching pace is a bit too fast for student who without accounting background. However, I do think the this professor is very passionate in teaching. She is willing to answer question after lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very good.
In-class exercises 24%
Class participation 6%
Quiz 1 10%
Quiz 2 20%
Final exam 40%
I got nearly high in 3 exams, so that's a A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not heavy.
2 Midterms
1 Final

I did not spend much time on this course because my other courses ate up so much of my time; still managed to do well though.

reviews.author: jfhclee
reviews.comment_content:
Not sure what had I learnt.

Some said it's DSE stuff. I don't know that as I did not study BAFS before. All are new to me.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He said we can get a good result if we follow his lecture well and understand the content in the lect slide well.

I don't know that because I did not quite study for that course.

Quite a number of students left a negative comment for him.
reviews.comment_grading:
10%+10% 2 Quizzes (30MCQ for each)
20% Midterm
40% Final
10% HW (5 sets of selected textbook question)
10% Attendance & Participation

My grade: C-
1st quiz mean
2nd quiz, midterm below mean 2 sd
HW nearly full
Attendance missed 2 lect
He kind of remembered me so I don't know if the Participation marks saved me from D grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not very light workload

2 during-lecture quiz on top of 1 midterm so 3 midterm-liked stuff.
And the 5 sets of HW would not stop before the quiz and midterm.

In fact, a quiz and midterm always come with a submission date of a HW. He said HW can be a mean of revision.

He had this absolute-fair attendance-taking method -- to call our name one by one. As he remembered all our name, there is little possibility to cheat.

reviews.author: Ritika
reviews.comment_content: The content covers the basics of financial accounting and can seem difficult at first, but is pretty simple once you get the hang of it.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Mak is a good teacher but can be a little too fast at times. He is always willing to clarify doubts and is quite patient.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is decent. Not too hard to get a B/B+
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not too high. There is a midterm, a final and in-class assignments based on the content taught in that particular class.

reviews.author: YYSW
reviews.comment_content:
Basically just something similar to what we Hong Kong students have learnt in secondary schools, the only difference should be the format of  financial statements. If you take BAFS, accounting course before, you could probably get some advantages.

Nothing special. Just make sure that you understand all the concepts and you will be fine.
reviews.comment_teaching: Maybe he is a good accountant, but he is not a good professor for sure. He supposed everyone in his class knew everything about accounting. He just briefly talked about the content with his PowerPoint slides and asked students to do exercises. He would always be surprised if you didn't know the answers. That's why if you are new to this field, DON'T choose his class!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance & Participation 10%
Homework (2% each) 10% 5 submitted assignments
Quiz 1 10% (30MC)
Mid-term Examination 20%
Quiz 2 10% (30MC)
Final Examination 40%
Total: 100%

Fair. Got a B+ finally with 1SD below mean in one of the quizzes and about 1SD in the rest of exams and quizz
reviews.comment_workload: Not heavy. Not many assignments you have to do but you need to do a lot of self-study in order to get good grade.

reviews.author: Everest
reviews.comment_content: By using the book, the content is quite easy to understand. But it will be more difficult after teaching some basic concepts.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teacher is always available after class if you have questions to ask.He will also be able to give you special care if you fall behind.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is largely depend on your final exam. So just be prepared. To some degree, the grading system is quite strict.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is small because homework is only once a week.But a good grade need more affort.

reviews.author: twinkle
reviews.title: Practice makes perfect
reviews.comment_content:
Topic 1 Introduction
Topic 2 Balance Sheet
Topic 3 Income Statement
Topic 4 Year End Adjustment
Topic 5 Sales Revenue & Receivable
Topic 6 COGS & Inventory
Topic 7 PPE
Topic 8 Liabilities
Topic 9 Owners Equity
Topic 10 Cash Flows
reviews.comment_teaching: Kelvin's English is acceptable with only a little bit local accent. His lecture notes do not contain many details so taking notes during lectures is important. However, Kelvin sometimes explain things in Cantonese. This is not very friendly to non-local students.
reviews.comment_grading:
Personally I don't have any opinion on the grading. Some of my friends thought the grading was quite good while some thought it harsh. But I think if you perform well in the two exams, you'll definitely get a decent grade.
Grading scheme: 10% in-class exercise (group) + 15% CSR report + 25% midterm + 50% final
My score:
in-class exercise 9.47/10 slightly above mean
CSR report 99/135 mean = 97.8(I don't know why ... I think my essay is comprehensive and profound enough. Maybe you need to consult the TA for advice)
midterm 95/100 above mean 1SD
final score was not disclosed, but should be high.
Finally got A+
I don't have any accounting background before taking the course. So you may see that it is definitely possible for you to get a good grade as long as you make efforts.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload. The only assignment is the CSR case which you need to analyze carefully and comprehensively. But you need to do the end-chapter exercises in the textbook in order to perform well in the exams since Kelvin will not assign any homework during the semester. For the in-class exercise, plz DON'T rely on your teammates. The best way to get good marks for the in-class exercise is reviewing carefully and trying to become the leader in your group.

reviews.author: Christopher7777
reviews.comment_content: Well written and presented content that is always related to the course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is quite interactive and it does not get boring. In class homework with classmates helps understand the subject better as you can get an explanation from both fellow classmates and professor.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is done well and it is quite fair, although the essay grading was a bit harsh, but not unreasonable.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is quite light and the only thing needed is to read the book and do all the homework. This will get you a decent grade. Follow the pace of the class and you will be just fine.

reviews.author: 離都岸久
reviews.title: Very good grade course.
reviews.comment_content: Not difficult. Just attend every class and do some revision before final and midterm are enough to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_teaching: A little bit boring and sometimes you can get lost if not 100% focused. But the overall teaching is good.
reviews.comment_grading: Very good grading. Above mean 1.X sd in two midterms and final. Got an A at the end. One doubled size cheat sheet is allowed in the final exam. You can type the equations in case you forget.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload. Just finish the in-class exercises and you will be fine. And don't forget to attend the class which you are assigned to answer questions for credit.

reviews.author: Martin.....
reviews.comment_content: Moderate workload, one quiz per week.
reviews.comment_teaching: Accent quiet hard to understand. He may use a little bit cantonese to explain what he said. So for hong kong student he is quit good.
reviews.comment_grading: Grade largely depends on your mid term and final examination. If have learn BAFS during secondnary school, it is quite easy to catch up. If no, you may need more time to understand and revise. But his grading is not good.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload not high, but need to attend all lesson as have one pop up assignment per week.

reviews.author: PoisonNoMajorJJ
reviews.title: Bad for no accounting background students
reviews.comment_content:
From those with account background, the content is rather fair. Basic accounting stuffs. People with accounting background should be able to manage it well. For those who don't (that's me), add oil~ you will find yourself lagged behind unless you pay a lot of extra effort.

I really hope that SBM would open another course for students who did not study accounting in high school (Just like ECON2103  or ECON2113).
reviews.comment_teaching:
I myself hate accounting as it is very boring to me.
However, I can notice that Kelvin has already tried his best to make the lesson less boring.
Still, the syllabus is not appealing to me.
reviews.comment_grading:
I do think that Kelvin has a nice grade, at least it is not bad.

Me:
In class work: Slightly above mean
Individual CSR Project: Slightly above mean
Midterm : Mean -2SD (coz I hate accounting and did not revise at all)
Final: Mean -0.5SD

Final Grade: C+

I would say my grade matches my effort put and I am satisfied.
reviews.comment_workload: Little workload. Just random in-class exercise for attendance checking, one midterm, one mini CSR project, and one final.

reviews.author: grateful grade
reviews.comment_content:
-So similar to DSE BAFS
-students who had studied BAFS may find it boring
-didn’t cover very deep, theoretical kind of things
-teaching materials combine with some real-life examples
-the textbook is not necessary, just reading the powerpoint slides for revision is more than enough
reviews.comment_teaching: She is a very good teacher. Even though she looks harsh, but there are some interesting interactions in class. Also, she is willing to respond to people's questions on canvas (so even u did not ask, u can see the questions raised by other students and szu fan's response at the canvas). She will also give out some points to be tested for midterms(but not final). She is really a good teacher and should register her course!!!!
reviews.comment_grading:
splendid
If you upload in-class exercise to the canvas on time and attempt those 2 questions, you can easily get the basic 30%of the course.
Even Quiz1&2 just get mean and
final getting below mean 0.2 S.D. still get a B
reviews.comment_workload:
Around 1 in class exercise per week, which are the examples in the ppt slide. She will teach you how to do or even give you the answer. (According to Szu Fan, she mentioned that no matter you submit a blank word file or full of text document, she will give you marks for homework anyways)

The extra workload is that you can make a two-sided cheatsheet for final but it is completely useless.

reviews.author: cep
reviews.comment_content:
Similar to HKDSE Accounting
Should be manageable if have prior background
Yet need some self-revision to differentiate some principal differences
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is very clear and detailed, easy to catch up even for beginners
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair. Has random classwork to grade attendance, need to be attentive to complete it and it affects quite a lot of your grade.
Can go to other parallel sessions if missed.

Mid-term is easy, but little percentage
Final exam is challenging

Class activities and participation 10%
Case about business ethics/CSR 15%
Mid-term exam 25%
Final exam 50%
Total 100%

Final grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload: More workload from this professor, with an essay as an assignment and some class work as well.

reviews.author: bigboi
reviews.title: Nice teacher to start the year
reviews.comment_content:
For policy:
Homework - 24%
Class participation - 6%
Quiz 1 - 10%
Quiz 2 - 20%
Final exam - 40%

Topic taught including:
financial statements
accounting system
adjustments
sales revenue, receivables and cash
cost of goods sold and inventory
property, plant and equipment
time value of money
corporate bonds
liabilities
owners' equity
statement of cash flows
reviews.comment_teaching: She gives hints for exam so do not miss her lessons. She is very nice and patient, answering all the questions we had.
reviews.comment_grading:
It is easy to get a pass as the final worth 40% only. The final is difficult though. Participation is easy to get as she will ask questions and give you marks no matter what you answer.
The grading is nice, I was just above mean in the quiz 1, 1 sd in quiz 2 and 1.5 sd in final. I got an A.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is negligible, 1 question per week. They are very useful for exams. The only bad thing (or a good thing) is that she gives 2 quizzes, extra time is dedicated to revision.

reviews.author: Pucca
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite difficult to grasp if you do not have accounting background.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is NOT a good professor. He can be funny and he remembers most of his students' names, so I really appreciate that. However, he does not know how to explain the concepts and he gets frustrated with you when you do not understand. He does try to explain it to you again if you ask him after lectures, but still, the explaination is not clear.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is straightforward.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light. There are 5 assignments to finish, but they are not very difficult to finish if you have the sources. If you do not understand the concepts from lectures and you do not have the sources, the assignments could be quite difficult to finish (but he does not look at the accuracy of the answers so it should not be too difficult).

reviews.author: leaf
reviews.comment_content: The content is on the basics of accounting covering the four financial statements. Many people in the class knows accounting beforehand so it will be all new for those who never studied accounting before.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor's is teaching is confusing so just read the textbook. His slides are also the same from the textbooks. He likes to make jokes in class and could memorize all the students name by the end of the semester. Though he takes attendance, you can go to a different section or attend the lecture late.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good grading.
Attendance
5 homeworks assignment
2 in class quiz (multiple choice)
1 midterm
1 final
reviews.comment_workload: Not too much, homework are textbook questions. If you haven't studied accounting before, you might need to work hard to catch up with the pace. The format of written questions are similar to those questions in the textbook so try to attempt to do the questions that he includes. And try to do all the past papers.

reviews.author: cwhr
reviews.comment_content:
Basic accounting concepts
Financial statements, different assets and liabilities, etc.

Most course content are covered in HKDSE BAFS (Accounting) syllabus, so it would be easy for students who had previously studied accounting to catch up.

However, Prof. Mak used the US GAAP standard for his course. Therefore, students have to be aware of the formats and wordings, as they are slightly different from the IFAC standard.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Since the topics were categorised according to the accounts' nature, the teaching sequence was quite different from that in BAFS. Students without accounting background require greater effort to understand the content. It would be better to study the course in a comprehensive way.

In terms of the teaching quality, the lecture PowerPoints were prepared in an organised way. You need to be attentive in class to fill in some blanks and drop down the answers of the in-class discussions.

Prof. Mak was nice and patient. He explained the concepts clearly with daily examples. When someone had doubts on a certain topic, he would explain it again until everyone understands the content.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is fair

10% Class activities and participation
15% Case about business ethics/CSR
25% Mid-term exam
50% Final exam
Total 100%

Mid-term exam mainly examines financial statements, which is easy to handle

Final exam was not cumulative, however the questions were quite tricky and demanding

No statistics were given for the final exam

It would be fine to score a good grade if you studied hard and did adequate exercises. Students with accounting background also need practices and revision in order to score A- or above.
reviews.comment_workload:
I can say the workload is light if you compare with other courses.

No homework, only chapter exercises were given, but they were not compulsory.

No attendance would be taken, but there will be some in-class practices which counts into "Class activities and participation". You have attend those lessons and form groups with other classmates in order to get those marks.

While other professors had quizzes and regular assignments, we only had to write a CSR report before final exam (though I think there was nothing to do with the course). It would take you some time to finish the report.

reviews.author: 少林寺第一帅
reviews.title: Do not choose Gerry unless you have some basic knowledge of BAFS
reviews.comment_content: Quite easy for DSE BAFS students as most of the contents are covered in their DSE syllabus. For other students, you should work very hard to get a good grade. I haven't studied BAFS before, and it was quite hard for me.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is bullshit. As a part of students haven't studied accounting before, but he expects you all have studied. His teaching pace is very fast and he always said "easy, right?" But it is not easy at all because you haven't learnt it before. In spite of his poor teaching, his lesson is not boring. He always makes some not funny jokes. What I appreciate him the most is that he can memorize our names.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance & Participation 10%
Homework (2% each) 10% 5 submitted assignments
Quiz 1 10% (30MC)
Mid-term Examination 20%
Quiz 2 10% (30MC)
Final Examination 40%
Total: 100%

For attendance, you just need to attend his class and do not skip more than around 3 to 4 lessons, then you can get full mark.

Non-cumulative areas for quizzes and tests. Due to his poor teaching, self-study is important. I suggest you to buy the book or borrow from others because the exercises are good. You also have to memorize some minor parts of the book (such as the advantages and disadvantages of issuing bond and shares) because it will be covered in final (around 10 marks).

My Grades:
Quiz 1 26/30
Quiz 2 29/30
Midterm 82.5/100
Attendance and Assignment Full
Final Not Disclosed (I guess around 40-50/100) due to my mistake (I don't have time to do all exercises and still confuse about some topics)

Final Grade: B- (quite disappointed because of the failure of final)
reviews.comment_workload:
To be honest, the workload is not very heavy. Only five assignments for the whole semester, the most crucial thing is you should have sources (from your joba joma). However, if you haven't studied accounting before, you should work very hard. (double or triple time when compared with BAFS students)

If you want a good grade, make sure you finish all the past papers!!!

reviews.author: Ust fishman
reviews.comment_content: Basic accounting concepts. Easy to understand even for those who have not taken BAFS in HKDSE, but that requires hard work like doing exercises as it covers a lot of concepts within a short period of time. It may be a bit hard to compete with the people who have studied. They can handle it easily even they miss most of the lessons. But to be honest, the syllabus is not that hard.
reviews.comment_teaching: His tone is pretty boring and flat. It is hard for me to not fall to sleep even though he is teaching crucial things. There are also some in-class mini practice. You must attend  the lessons so that you wont miss any participation mark.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair. I just slightly above the mean in the mid term, but i still got A.The grading would be quite good if you really attend all the lessons and pay attention.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy. There is only one homework in the whole semester. However, the homework is quite demanding. It is an essay about accounting ethics. Students are required to write max. 2 pages.

reviews.author: gracey
reviews.title: this review is for people who have never taken accounting before
reviews.comment_content: I immediately realized that a lot of the other people in class have taken accounting before, so if you haven't, you're at an immediate disadvantage. that being said, the content itself wasn't hard to absorb - it was mostly the teacher's teaching style that threw me off.
reviews.comment_teaching: szu fan has a really robotic voice that makes it really hard to focus in class. she tries to make class engaging by incorporating participation regularly and cracking a joke or two, but I can honestly say that I retained zero information during class. I legitimately tried my best to focus in the beginning, but her logic kind of bounced from place to place and her lectures became really hard to follow. I learned mostly everything from the textbook because I had no idea what was going on in class. other than that, she's a really nice lady who tries her best to help you out
reviews.comment_grading:
this is off the top of my head, I can't remember for sure if this is correct:

final exam - 40%
midterm 1 - 10%
midterm 2 - 20%
participation - 15%
in-class exercises - 15%

the two midterms, in-class exercises, and participation are basically given to you. it's super easy to score well on the two midterms, and in-class exercises are completion-based. you just have to show up to class and attempt to answer questions to get the participation points. HOWEVER, the final exam was so absurdly difficult and by no means tested the accounting we had learned in class. the entire exam was a curveball, and the people who have taken accounting already will wreck the curve for you. a cheatsheet was allowed for the final exam, but it didn't help at all. I felt like all the effort I put into the rest of the class was wasted. my entire grade was ruined by the final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: there is basically no work outside of class other than in-class exercises. really easy, recommend reading the textbook if ur prof sucks.

reviews.author: calvinwcl
reviews.comment_content: introduction to accounting and its very similar to hkdse bafs accounting module. If you have studied accounting in secondary school, you will find the content very easy to understand. most of them were just content of dse exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: he explained things very clearly and used many examples to tell you what accounting is about
reviews.comment_grading: the midterm and final are not easy. if you have not studied accounting in the past, you might find it extremely difficult. The mc questions were very very difficult.
reviews.comment_workload: no assignments at all, only some classwork is needed

reviews.author: aloafofmeat
reviews.comment_content: The beginning portions of the syllabus involve DSE BAFS topics, so DSE students are going to have a better time in adjusting, albeit some terminology changes and integrations.
reviews.comment_teaching: Detailed in explaining stuff. Will answer a lot of questions in canvas and in class to appropriate length.
reviews.comment_grading:
In class exercises 24%
Class Participation 6%
Quiz 1 10%
Quiz 2 20%
Final 40%

Be advised that the final is a lot harder than the quizzes, but a cheat sheet is allowed to cover everything.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much to do. In class exercises need to hand in roughly per week, but you could probably do it in 10 minutes if you're quick.

reviews.author: xxxxxxxxxhahaha
reviews.comment_content: The content are quite hard for a student without accounting background as the professor will skip very quickly for those terms. I guess she assumed you will read the book for those terms by yourself.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching pace is a bit too fast for student who without accounting background. However, I do think the this professor is very passionate in teaching. She is willing to answer question after lesson.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is good but the means are very high too. Usually if you have accounting background, you will get a better grade than other students. I would say this course is quite unfair too students who did not take BAFS in DSE.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload. 3 Questions required for each chapter and answer are provided. However, it not enough if you want to get a good grade. It is a subject depends on your efforts.

reviews.author: lmc20051308
reviews.title: Work Hard
reviews.comment_content: The course in not that hard for students who learnt account before in the DSE, it is all around the basic accounting
reviews.comment_teaching: Gerry is not a good professor. he treats girl and foreigners good but he will always ignore the local boy. Also, his english is not fluent that you may be unavailable to concentrate during the class which lead to bad grade finally
reviews.comment_grading: As the course is actually not very hard, the grade requirement of the course is actually quite high that you may be easily below mean with a careless mistake
reviews.comment_workload: Not really high actually

reviews.author: Shawnnn
reviews.comment_content:
Basic contents in accounting, introductory course
Two classes a chapter, and skip some contents of the book
Most of the grades u earn are based on self-learning (seems to be the same in every ACCT 2010 class, no matter who the professor is)
reviews.comment_teaching:
His class is relaxing, he will make jokes with students siting in the front raws and try to remember all the students' names
Interacting with him is sometimes interesting
Most of the contents of his ppst are from your book
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade is high, many students have basic understanding of these concepts before, so it's hard to get an A if your grade is not above 90 ( I cannot remember exactly)
Your grades are based on 5 homework, 2 in-class quizzes, attendance, midterm and final
If you skip 1 or 2 classes, you'll still get full mark in attendance, but not if you skip too many
reviews.comment_workload:
Almost no workload
If you have studied these stuffs during your high school, this course is definitely easy for you
For those who don't, it's important to read the concepts before each class, and then you'll understand what he says easily, because you can find the same words and pictures in the ppts as those in your book
Always remember to submit the homework online

reviews.author: Yuri
reviews.title: Acct 2010
reviews.comment_content:
Dse Bafs syllabus with some advanced stuff
Not difficult to understand but hard to apply
reviews.comment_teaching:
Easy with simple examples
only need to refer to powerpoint
reviews.comment_grading:
all above mean but only B
not very good grade
Great competitors many people get full mark in mid terms
reviews.comment_workload:
little
not required to hand in quality in class exercise
Mid term very easy
difficult final examination
only fill in the blank and mc with cheat sheet for final but useless
Hard to make all answers correct
A minor mistake may cause continuous errors in the following questions

reviews.author: Stellaaaaʕ•ٹ•ʔ
reviews.title: a bit unfair to those who haven't learn acct before
reviews.comment_content: I haven't learnt account before. It is hard for me to remember all the account rules within a semester and the mean of exams are quite high as some other students in the same class learnt it before. I only got a B at the end. I heard from my friend that the course content is quite similar to the HKDSE syllabus.
reviews.comment_teaching: She is really kind and nice. Although her teaching isn't very organised, I can still understand the main points. You can ask her questions after class if you don't understand the content.

reviews.comment_content:
Chapter 1 Overview of Financial Statements

Chapter 9 Time-Value of Money and Liabilities

reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Chen teaches a bit slowly but she can finish all the course material on time so I suppose it is okay. She teaches with enthusiasm and encourage the class to discuss on different topics during the lectures. Clear elaboration makes even beginners easy to understand the concept without getting confused.
reviews.comment_grading:
24% In-class exercise
6% Participation
10% Mid Term 1
20% Mid Term 2
40% Final

The course is a fundamental introduction to the basic theory in Accounting and therefore it would not be difficult to handle even you have not studied Accounting previously. I personally did not take BAFS in HKDSE but I still found the course quite easy to be honest.

Grading is good.
She will give the answer of the in-class exercise during the lecture before deadline so I suppose all students can get full credit as long as they attend all the lectures. You just have to answer 2 basic questions to get all 6 marks in the participation category. Two mid-terms are easy but the final is quite challenging.

For mid-term and final
Mid-term 1 My score: 31/32 Mean around 28/32 SD around 4
Mid-term 2 My score 84/84 Mean around 72/84 SD around 9
Final My score: 119/150 Mean 78/150 SD 22

Final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is low compared to other courses.
She will show you how to do the in-class exercises during lectures so you just need a few minutes to complete all the tasks.

Attendance is not taken. She will disclose the date for each student to answer the participation question so remember to attend that particular lesson but feel free to skip all other lessons.

reviews.author: Bryan Lo
reviews.title: If you want awesome grades, don't take this course unless you are confident in your acct knowledge.
reviews.comment_content:

I didn't take BAFS in DSE but I somehow can follow the materials taught, so if you put enough effort you should be alright.

Materials taught relates to our real life so the stuff isn't useless, but you may not find it interesting, in fact, I find it slightly boring compared to other subjects (like programming or ELEC course, tho not as boring as maths).
reviews.comment_teaching:
She is a passionate prof that's for sure but her accent makes the lesson slightly boring, but the lessons were one of the most active I had ever seen in my entire life (maybe that's because there was a lot of foreign students) but the atmosphere is good I have to say. Thought her voice is a bit weak so sit in the front is the most ideal.
***NEVER SIT AT THE BACK OR YOU CANNOT HEAR ANYTHING**

reviews.author: lc09
reviews.title: Patient and kind professor
reviews.comment_content:
1. Basic accounting entry
Need to understand different accounts. Note that some terms or accounts are different from the BAFS in secondary school.

Professor goes through all basic entry skills in just two weeks, so it may be challenging for students without accounting background.


2. Sales and bad debt
Not difficult to understand.


3. Liabilities: Bonds and present value
Pay attention to professor as this part involves a bit complex calculation. Remember to consider the present value when calculating the net value of bonds.


4. Shareholders' equity
Just something about shares. Not difficult.


5. Cash flow
Remember to understand the principle of indirect method. Especially pay attention when calculating operating cash flow as you need to minus the financing and investing cash flow.
reviews.comment_teaching:
A bit too fast for students without accounting background knowledge. I cannot understand what she taught at the beginning few lectures.

However, she is very patient and is willing to answer questions from students. All questions must be asked face-to-face or through Canvas discussion board. That's a great thing as you can know what others are asking

Read the questions in discussion board before exams as this may help you.
reviews.comment_grading:
My score and grade:
In class exercise: 24/24
Attendance: 6/6
Quiz 1: 26.5/32 [Mean 28]
Quiz 2: 79/85 [Mean 71]
Final exam: 104/150 [Mean 75]
Grade: A-


In class exercise 24%
Remember to finish 8 out of 10 in Class Exercise. Professor would discuss the answer in class, but you need to type of write the answer and upload your answer (no need to be correct) to Canvas.



Answering questions + attendance 6%
Professor would tell you when she take your attendance. Just attend lecture that day, answer questions to get full credit (no need to be correct).


Quiz 1 10%
Quiz 2 20%
Two quizzes are much easier than the final exam, but the mean is extraordinarily high. No cheat sheet. Make sure to revise and be careful.



Final exam 40%
Although more difficult than quizzes, it's not that difficult compared with last few years. One cheat sheet (A4 both side) is allowed so don't recite too much. She tend to ask more practical questions, so do more exercise instead.

She divides the final exam to 3 parts: Basic questions (~30%), Intermediate questions (~50%) and challenging questions (~20%). Those challenging questions are all about effects of accounts when mistakes are made, which indeed not that scary.
reviews.comment_workload:
In class exercise sometimes require quite a long time to write although she would discuss the answer (especially preparing all T-accounts), so don't wait until the last minute to do if you want.

However you can just write something and submit and still get full credit :) Make sure to understand the in class exercise as similar questions would appear in quizzes and exam


No projects.

reviews.author: jangzzan
reviews.title: Nice Professor and Teaching
reviews.comment_content: The content is very useful about accounting. The difficulty is just right, which is suitable for both beginners and students which have learnt accounting in secondary school before. Some people say that people who have learnt BAFS before will have advantage. This is not totally true as much content covered is not taught in the DSE Syllabus. Even for the parts that were covered, a lot of them were modified and different from that of before.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Li Xinlei teaches very well. Her accent is easily understandable and her pronunciation is very clear. Moreover, she delivers her ideas clearly and concisely. Teaching pace is quick and you may find it hard to catch up, but she has to do that in order to cover all the content.

Professor Li Xinlei will give concise reviews during the start of every lesson to consolidate students' knowledge about the previous lesson's content. She also patiently answers students' questions. She also provides students with extended knowledge so that students can get the full picture and understanding of how the accounting functions works.
reviews.comment_grading:
5% Participation
5% HW
15% Quiz 1
15% Quiz 2
60% Final Exam
No attendance taken
reviews.comment_workload: Low workload. There are only a set of practice problems each week and you can choose to do a minimum of 3 questions out of all of them and you will get the mark for homework. Each week covers about 40 powerpoint slides.

reviews.author: SM
reviews.comment_content: Content is alright, he expects you to have prior knowledge of the course, but even if you don't, going through the textbook and understanding it is good enough, until the final exam, which is absolutely dreadful.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is a nice guy, entertaining, will try to keep your interest levels high, remembers everyone's names, which is really nice. However, since he expects you to know the course, it always feels like there is no room for error. It is hard to understand him sometimes, especially if you have no prior accounting background.
reviews.comment_grading: His examination system is rather different. He will have 2 quizzes and 1 midterm, homework, attendance and the final exam. It is relatively easy to score a high mark in the quizzes, midterm and homework, however, even if you get above the mean in most of his tests, it doesn't mean that you'll get a good grade. The final pulls everyone down, and the final is really hard, most of it, you can't understand, even if you go through the textbook thoroughly.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is alright. There will be times when it gets a bit stressful, but as long as you keep yourself updated every week or two, it should be okay. Since his course has multiple quizzes/exams, sometimes it may feel like you're always studying accounting. Initially, it seems to be overwhelming, since he expects a certain amount of knowledge and does reduce your confidence levels, which isn't the best thing considering you're doing accounting for the first time in your life.

reviews.author: pinkckwc
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite harsh, but it is easy for those who have learnt accounting in high school
reviews.comment_teaching: She is very patient, but sometimes ask you questions during the lesson. She also talked about other information that are not included in the powerpoint and had a brief review of what had we learnt before every lesson. It was good for me because sometimes I easily forget things.
reviews.comment_workload: You need to submit one assignment on Canvas per week but the questions are from the textbook and there are answers for you to check every time.

reviews.author: 森姆
reviews.title: Interesting Foundation Course
reviews.comment_content:
It covers the basic accounting concepts. If students have studied BAFS in the DSE will find it very easy to pick up the concepts covered in the course, including the basic balance sheet and income statement, accrual account, adjustment of earning and financial statement, varies sub-items in accounting like revenue, "property, plant and equipment"(PPE), liabilities, time value of money, owners' equity.
Besides these technical calculation and concept, the course also relates these to the investment decision making and how these can be applied to the business operation. I think that this course is very useful foundation course in accounting to let students have a taste on accounting.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Due to the course nature of accounting, it might a bit be boring as it can only quickly cover the accounting principles and concepts during the lecture. During the lecture it do not have enough time to work on the exercise, the lecturer explained the concept with simple case and example.
You may find that the concepts in the class is easy to understand. However, when you go home working on questions in textbook, these examples are more difficult. So probably you have to spend more time in reading the lecture note and working on the exercises to master this subject.
reviews.comment_grading:
2 quizzes (20%, 10% each)
midterm (25%)
final (35%)
project (10%)
class participation (10%)
reviews.comment_workload: The required workload is not heavy as it only got a small project throughout the whole semester, which simply require doing some research on the related topic in Accounting. But if you want to get A-range, definitely you have to keep practicing the questions in the textbook. So the workload depends on how hardly you want to get A-range.

reviews.author: curtismai
reviews.title: Clearing Concepts is Important
reviews.comment_content: Generally easy even to accounting beginners. Try to use your brain and internalise the materials, reciting blindly is no use for your exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite useful, she could explain clearly with sufficient examples. If you encounter any problems about the course materials or you want to ask for marks for the quizzes, feel free to approach her as she is very friendly and kind to solve your problems. My friend and I had some grading problems for one quiz, I spoke to her after class and wrote emails, and got a few marks back. She is a very reasonable professor. Her classes are worth going and you could learn a lot if you don't fall asleep. (She could be a bit boring at times)
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework 24% (You only need to do 8 out of 10 online homework and you get full credit)
Class Participation 6% (Answer two questions on one or two specified days, you will be notified well in advance and make-up participation is allowed)
Quiz 1 10% (Super Easy, mean was about 28 out of 32)
Quiz 2 (Midterm) 20% (Quite simple as well, mean was about 70 out of 84)

reviews.comment_content:
about 70% of the course is the same as DSE BAFS syllabus, so it will be easy if you have taken BAFS in DSE while its hard for those who haven't

Accounting is the language of business. In this course, you will learn how to "speak" and "read" this new language. The course is designed to provide an overview of the financial accounting frameworks and processes leading to the preparation of financial statements and develop your relevant skills to read, interpret and analyze corporate financial reports from various dynamic business perspectives.

weakness and problems are immediately
