reviews.author: gazelle
reviews.comment_content: Not much difference from other professors'. Basic Accounting skills including journal entries, T-account, interpretation and adjustment of financial statement, cost of goods sold, bank reconciliation, bond securities........ are covered. It is 60% similar to the BAFS under DSE curriculum. If you think all these already bombard you, then you might not be suitable for majoring Accounting.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gerry's teaching is ineffective in my opinion. He teaches from his own point of view instead of from students' or beginners'. He supposes us knowing everything, thus rarely do live demonstration on perplexing problems. What he does every lecture is just explaining concepts and definitions that are not very important and share his own experience. After that he directly asks students to do his assigned practices from textbook and starts reading out students' name one by one to take attendance. I have sit for Chen Szu Fan's lecture and I found her teaching is rather easier to follow for beginners. Gerry's unappealing lecture could be reflected by the attendance rate. I realised that after midterm, the attendance soon dropped to 60-70% though attendance is 10% of the course grade. Yet, the good thing is Gerry will provide full solution for his suggested practices of every chapter. After all, it is better to count on your hard-work instead of professor's teaching to earn your course grade.
reviews.comment_grading:
Score distribution

Attendance & Participation   10%
Homework (5@2%)   10%
Quiz 1  10%
Quiz 2  10%
Midterm Exam  20%
Final Exam  40%


My score

HW: 10/10 (mean 9.7/10)
Quiz 1: 18/30 (mean 22.6/30)
Quiz 2:  30/30  (mean 23.6/30)
Attendance: only missed 2 lectures
Mid-term exam: 87.5/100  (mean 83/100, sd 12)
Final exam: not released  (I guess mine ~60/100)

Final grade: C+

To me, the grading is fine. I am a Business minor student (from Science School) with no prior high school background. Some people said it is hard to survive Gerry's Accounting course if you only are a beginner (because of the terrible teaching), making it impossible to get a C grade or above. This is not the real case if you are hard working enough and using the right way for studying, understanding every concept thoroughly. That is why after my disastrous performance in Quiz 1, my results for other tests improved drastically. Unfortunately, I have no time for revision of the final exam (my Organic Chemistry exam was on the same morning!!!) -- I only studied for 4 hours right before the final exam!!! It is great that Gerry did not give me a C grade. If I were in Chen Szu Fan's class, I would probably end up a D grade!!!
reviews.comment_workload:
If you are not aiming high and you already have some Accounting background, I would say the workload is low. Basically when grading the homework, the TA wouldn't care about the correctness of your answers and figures. As long as you finish all the assigned problems, the TA would give you full score. All the tests are not difficult as well when compared to other professors'. However, such easiness implies difficulty to achieve good grade. If you aim high, it is better to read through the textbook carefully and finish every single problem, which is rather time-consuming. Remember, practice makes perfect!

There are several points that you need to pay attention with. For the two quizzes, rather than being application-oriented, Gerry also covers some subtle concepts from notes and textbooks that students normally skip. Only being able to do calculations is likely to cause you below mean (or at most slightly above mean). Don't think quizzes with MCQs only are that easy!

For the midterm exam, as long as you can do all calculations without mistakes, you will be fine. For the final exam, although only the last five chapters are covered, please don't forget the fundamental concepts taught in the first half of the course. Don't be satisfied with the illusion that you are able to complete all the practice exercises on textbook. Otherwise you will cry in the final exam! Plus, unlike the midterm, there are several questions that require you to give definitions, provide examples, and do comparisons. I guess most students won't pay much attention to such details. I guess Gerry use these to differentiate between A+ and A grade students.

All chapters taught are required in the final examination but cheat sheet is allowed, so the most challenging part is the questions themselves but not the knowledge to learn. Making sure you understood well the methods in tackling the textbook questions are enough for getting good grades in this course.

She explained the concepts well, and her answers to questions asked in the discussion board are often very useful for understanding basic concepts and skills.

reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Li knows his accounting knowledge quite well and is experienced in the accounting field as well. However, he is not very good at answering questions that students raise thus maybe hard to learn from him at times if you are confused about a topic
reviews.comment_grading:
Abusive use of past papers for exams and quizzes!

For both the mid-terms and the two quizzes, Professor Li used past papers which made it very easy for students to study for. Hence, there was a clear difference between students who studied using past papers and simply from the textbook. And it was unfair for students who did not study the past papers.

Of course, this course still comes down to how much work you put into studying but just keep in mind that it is most likely that Professor Li will use previous past papers that you can find on the internet.

Assignment Grade: 10% of final grade.

Topics covered:

Financial Statements

Accounting equation
Journal and adjustment entries
Cash and accounts receivables
Inventory and Cost of goods sold
Long-term assets
Current Liabilities and Contingencies

He likes asking questions in class and people are active to answer them in order to get participation marks. But it seems he wasted too much time on it and made him have to rush in the latter of part of the course (especially for the statement of cash flows).

It is hard to fall asleep in his class because his voice is really strong @_@.

He posted solutions of quizzes and group exercises that helped us make revision a lot.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading scheme:
Attendance and Participation  5%
5-6 In-class Group Exercises  10%
3 In-class quizzes (Take the best two) 10%
Midterm 35%
Final 40%


What I heard from others is that Tony is not giving a good grade, A-range is quite narrow.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not that much because he did not give any assignments.

Group exercises are relatively easier than quizzes because you could find some groupmates to "carry" you. He would tell you there would be group exercises/ quizzes beforehand, so that you can prepare well before the class.

But I suggest taking some time to have a look at those accounting principles before the class, especially if you have not learned Accounting before, it helps you understand the concepts. Also, you should spend some time working those practice problems. (solutions provided)

I don't really remember he had taken any attendance, but I suggest you go to his class. First, Something is missing in the lecture notes, you have to go to the class. Second, It might be difficult to comprehend the knowledge just by reading the notes, listening to his explanation is certainly a better choice. Third, if you perform actively in the class (e.g. asking/ answering questions), it helps him recognize you, and you will score higher in participation :)

Just make sure he knows your name cos he likes to call students name and chat with them. For those who didn't have any prior knowledge to accounting, DONT CHOOSE HIM.
reviews.comment_grading: haven't had any grade yet
reviews.comment_workload: so far no homework. but during lesson, he did give some classwork

reviews.author: Tigery
reviews.comment_content: all you need to do is to recite and memorize, the workload is acceptable
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching style is quite well. He seldom talks about stuff that are over the scope. But the powerpoint slides are too many words to absorb immediately
reviews.comment_grading: Most of the content of examination are related to the teaching materials and textbook.
reviews.comment_workload: Exercises are held in class which is counted. So you really need to do revision frequently or else your marks would be deducted. And dont try to depend on your groupmates cuz too many discussions lower the effectiveness.

reviews.author: henry87927
reviews.comment_content:
introduction to basic accounting knowledge.
Heaven to those who took Accounting class in high school, but a little difficult or those who are not familiar with accounting phrase and principle of accounting.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kelvin is really a nice professor. He is really responsible for every student's learning experience. He even opens a question session on Saturday morning for every student to come and ask a question and he will answer you "in person". also, He's teaching is fun and full of example, which helps you understand better.
reviews.comment_grading: Hard to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Kelvin only requires us to do the group work in class. No Assignment but a little essay to write

reviews.author: Sophia Z
reviews.comment_content: Content is not that easy but working hard can help you manage those contents better.
reviews.comment_teaching:
GOOD instructor!
His teaching is really clear. You can fully understand it as long as you focus on the class.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is highly depending on the grade of exams. Because the quizs’s grades are similar.
reviews.comment_workload: Homework is always optional. He never collects homework but it is better to focus on those exercises because they are kind of similar to those exam questions. He will also answer the questions from your homework very patiently. The grade only depends on quizs and exams (midterm and final).

reviews.author: year2 student
reviews.comment_content: The content covered during the class is acceptable, since the professor would do quite some exercises with the class in each lesson. If you pay attention and do not fall asleep in 9am lesson, it should not be hard for you to understand the learning materials even you did not study bafs back in high school.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor often goes off track and makes jokes that are of his own style, which might distract the students slightly. But if you find his jokes funny, you may have a lot of fun in his lesson.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is a bit harsh. The mean would be B-. If you want to get an A or A+, you got to be at least 2sd above the mean.
reviews.comment_workload: There is almost no homework at all. The professor would ask you to study some of the materials that are going to be taught in the next lesson, but this is completely optional.

reviews.author: Hihihihihihihi
reviews.comment_content:
Useful. It helps comprehensive and well-founded knowledge of financial accounting but better for students with accounting background.

Content before midterm is what we learnt in secondary and after that is new things.
reviews.comment_teaching: Fast-paced.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance and Participation 5%
In-class Group Exercises  10%
Three  In-class Quizzes @ 20 points each (drop the lowest one) 10%
Mid-term Exam 35%
Final Examination (non-cumulative) 40%

Each group exercise is worth 10 marks and only the top five individual performances will be counted toward.
reviews.comment_workload: Have quiz, in-class group exercise. No assignment, project and presentation. I think the workload is fair.

reviews.author: winnie1234567
reviews.comment_content:
Income statement
Balance Sheet
Bad debt
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very good teach. She is passionate at teaching and explains things very well. Even for student who have no accounting background can follow it pretty well.

She is a very nice teacher, she is very welling to answer students' questions, she encourages us to ask questions and participate in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Reasonable, higher then mean 0.5 sd in final and got mean in Quiz 1 and 2 and I got a B.

The final exam is extremely difficult. The two quizzes are much easier.
reviews.comment_workload: take-home exercise. Only a few questions, very easy, able to finish it if you attend the lesson. Only two quiz, the questions from the questions are similar to the exercises we did in the lesson.

reviews.author: kelchanaa
reviews.comment_content: Content for beginners. Even you have not studied Accounting before, you still can catch up. And relatively easy for those who studied BAFS before.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching is very good! The concepts she explains are clear. Even though you haven't studied accounting before, you can still understand and follow. She also provides office hours and she will answer you patiently.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is average. The quizzes are not that difficult so the mean is quite high and the final exam is much more difficult.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not that heavy. After one chapter, you are required to do a few questions as exercise. There are 2 quizzes and a final exam.

reviews.author: Steven_Lin
reviews.comment_content:
1. Financial Statements and Business Decisions
2. Investing and Financing Decisions and the Accounting System
3. Operating Decisions and the Accounting System
4. Adjustments, Financial Statements, and the Quality of Earnings
---------------------------------Quiz 1------------------------------------- 1. Sales Revenue, Receivables, and Cash
2. Cost of Goods Sold and Inventory
3. Property, Plant, and Equipment; Intangibles and Natural Resources
4. Liabilities
5. Bond Securities
---------------------------------Quiz 2-------------------------------------
1. Stockholders’ Equity
2. Statement of Cash Flows
3. Analyzing Financial Statements
---------------------------------Final-------------------------------------
reviews.comment_teaching:
I love her teaching since at the beginning of each class, she would review the content taught in last class by either asking important questions or inviting students to go to the front to solve the problem.

In class, she prepared several exercises right after teaching one concept. While we were doing exercises, she would pause for a few minutes and walk around the classroom to solve our questions and clarify our confusions. She always made sure everyone in the class understands the concept enough before she started teaching the next chapter.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 5%
After-class Practice Problems   5%
Quiz 1 (7:30 pm – 9 pm, 3rd Oct, Tuesday) 15%
Quiz 2 (7:30 pm – 9 pm, 9th Nov, Thursday) 15%
Final exam 60%
Total 100%

The quizzes are moderate while the final is super hard. However, as long as you understand the concept well and do several practice questions, I think everyone will get good grade in this course.
reviews.comment_workload: The only homework is the after-class practice problem and usually, everyone can finish it within 30 mins, so I guess this workload will be light and acceptable for everyone.

reviews.author: john1209
reviews.comment_content:
The beginning of the class involves mostly topics that have been taught and tested in the DSE BAFs curriculum.If you are a new guy towards accounting, perhaps you'd better buy a textbook for your reference to build your concept. and if you are interested in ACCT, buying a textbook is fine

However, the term he used
reviews.comment_teaching:
his teaching style is fine, fluctuated teaching speed.he always teaches materials that are not included in the textbook, so do attend lectures. Will recommend taking his classes if you want to build a solid foundation in accounting.
Sometimes, the instructor just copied words from the textbook and didn't really understand them. So, you'd better spend some time after class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term is 45%
Final is 55%
4 bonus points are given to students who do news sharing or solve problems in class
I got 95/100 in mt, 85/100 in final and no bonus points. I got an A.
In the first lesson, he said he would give as many As as possible, and he kept his promise.
reviews.comment_workload:
Easy workload
There may be some in-class exercises but they are relatively easy and takes very little time. Apart from that, quizzes are given.

reviews.author: hjk
reviews.comment_content: The content of ACCT 2010 is generally: EASY for those with experience, HARD for those without. Although this may as well applies for other courses, it is especially so for this course. For beginners the course material can be complicated and confusing. Studying in advanced & good revision is recommended for them.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is nice and tries to get everyone involved in class. However he may not offer appropriate helps needed by beginners and in this case external helps may be seek.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is typical of HKUST grading system, but for beginners the boundary may seem rather high, making it hard to reach grade above C. Failing the course is a high possibility for those inexperienced and not ready for accounting.
reviews.comment_workload: There is no homework, but there are quizzes apart from mid&final exam. preparing well for those are a do-musts in order to get good grades. Also the professor takes attendance, so too much absence won't be healthy.

reviews.author: LeoLam
reviews.comment_content: overall useful
reviews.comment_teaching:
His voice is kinda boring...
Every lesson i was very sleepy..
but he is willing to answer any question and will give some practice
reviews.comment_grading:
Not good... if you dont have any concept about accounting before it is very hard to follow.
but if you do have some concept it is very easy to catch up.
reviews.comment_workload:
No Homework but the final exam is quite hard
ok if you did attend the lesson and keep revising
and no attendance checking so if you are confident you can just revise by yourself.

reviews.author: Karmen
reviews.comment_content: Basic accounting concepts, fairly easy to understand and handle but requires more work on exercises.
reviews.comment_teaching: He tries to make the lessons interesting through interactive discussions and telling jokes. Willing to answer students' questions with patience.
reviews.comment_grading: Mid-term exams are quite tricky so have to be careful to avoid mistakes. The mean is usually high as there are quite a lot of capable students with BAFS background in HKDSE. Need to work hard if you want an A
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload. Just some practise questions and have to take attendance to secure a good course grade.

reviews.author: Billizzz
reviews.comment_content: Not too complicated to study...just make sure you do spend time on it.(And don't miss any class)
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is pretty comprehensive, given many class exercise. If you got questions, just ask.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pretty fair. You gain what you sowed. Be attended during the lessons for the participation part.
There are few people in summer class, which means your face is easily recognised to evaluate your performance.

Class Participation and Discussion 10%
Homework 20%
Mid-term exam (Closed book) 30%
Final exam (Closed book) 40%
Total 100%
reviews.comment_workload: Usually after each chapter there is homework to finish but not much. Finish them all and you are guaranteed 20% marks.

reviews.author: hahahhahhahahah
reviews.comment_content: Basic accounting concepts. Easy to understand even for those who have not taken BAFS in HKDSE, but that requires hard work like doing exercises as it covers a lot of concepts within a short period of time.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is willing to answer students questions after class. A professor who is willing to pay effort and trying to make the class more interactive and interesting through jokes.
reviews.comment_grading: Can get good grading if you are diligent enough. But the mean is usually high and you have to be careful in exams to prevent unnecessary mistakes
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload, easy to handle.

reviews.author: Winston
reviews.comment_content:
Pretty easy if you have studied BAFS in DSE.

There are also some area that is excluded in DSE, but its still very easy (for example LIFO FIFO)
reviews.comment_teaching: One of the nicest prof in HKUST. very interesting.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pretty good. Questions are almost same as hw and lectures.

Class activities and participation 10%
Case about professional ethics 15%
Mid-term exam 25%
Final exam(50%)

The score of final exam and case study were not disclosed by professors. It is hard to guess his grading percentage. But personally I think his grading is fair.

Try to be more active in his classes, he could really recognize students faces and their participation in his classes.
reviews.comment_workload: Normal, the case study might be more time consuming.

reviews.author: Kenexex
reviews.comment_content:
Basic Acct.
But You need to remember a lot of ratio which is taught in DSE .
reviews.comment_teaching:
Focusing on interaction in class.
Teacher is great.Teacher will explain the concepts behind those acct ratio which will in the exam and be not taught in the note. Don't skip class if you are not DSE ACCT students.
reviews.comment_grading: Not really good. It is because the exam is not really hard. Many students get nearly perfect scores. Be careful to every questions.
reviews.comment_workload:
One assignment a week. However, there are many quizzes in class.
Overall, the workload is not really heavy.

reviews.author: wly
reviews.comment_content: The content is mostly designed for beginner. Even if you do not study BAFS in secondary school, you could still handle it.
reviews.comment_teaching: She will explain all questions patiently and thoughtfully. She will read and reply all questions in canvas and give help to those do not understand the content on class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 5%
After-class Practice Problems 5%
Quiz 1 15%
Quiz 2 15%
Final exam 60%
reviews.comment_workload: Only three questions per week. Workload is not heavy. Those questions allow you understand the concept more. Suggested do all questions on your own to see your understanding on the topic.

reviews.author: cece
reviews.title: is alright
reviews.comment_content:
there is some quizzes and a final in the format of the mc and short questions
Questions will be provided by the professor before the exam to let you practice, do more u can get a good grade

there are mainly three different topics
reviews.comment_teaching: not interesting at all but is clear, and want student to have good grade
reviews.comment_grading: i dont understand why my grade is so bad
reviews.comment_workload: is alright, the quiz is quite easy, the mid term is also very very very easy. however, final is totally different, no matter about format or other, and the mark distribution is very weird.

reviews.author: xxxx.
reviews.comment_content: principle of Accounting--basic knowledge of four accounting statements, like their structures and terms.
reviews.comment_teaching: Always telling something not related to lesson, like his prior experience and his own story in secondary school.At the end of the class, he will take attendance by asking students questions,  however asking questions without answering it(or say correcting the answer) is not helpful to those who want to learn from questions at all.
reviews.comment_grading:
grading is fair, however, mainland students have no related knowledges before while local and international students have already learnt basic principle of ACCT in their secondary school.
Mainland students then have to study harder.
reviews.comment_workload: As I said in the "teaching" part, actually mainly learnt by myself. You should read the textbook carefully to get the important points and understand the concepts well.

reviews.author: ykyk01
reviews.comment_content:
Part of the curriculum is about HKDSE BAFS, such as preparing the financial statements and the methods of recording entries or transactions.
this course will be relatively easy for students with bafs background.
reviews.comment_teaching: She is so nice and kind. She is so willing to adjust her teaching pace and answer students' questions with patience. It is important to attend her lessons attentively so as to catch up with course.
reviews.comment_grading:
Answer her questions during the lesson is important for participation rate, as they are also used to determine your grade.
Work harder for the quizzes as the Final Exam and the Mid term one will be much more difficult.
reviews.comment_workload:
Little workload
As she will discuss the answer of the exercise with you during the lesson, and you can easy to follow or even simply copy the answer.

reviews.author: flaviakwan
reviews.comment_content:
Fundamental knowledge of accounting. Asset = Liability + Equity balance check, differed liabilities, bank reconciliation, revenue and expense, cash flow statement., etc.

The DSE people said that they have learned the content in high school and think that this is a very basic and easy course indeed.

If you have never studied accounting before I can say that you need to put more effort to catch up with others. Getting a good grade by starting from zero is totally possible for this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Gerry is a very funny guy. He reads his power-point slides while improvising with a slight touch of humor. He always has this attendance check 30~40 min after the class starts so I often came late to class.

For participation, just make sure that he knows your name, i guess. He really likes it when you are the one who actively asks for further questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
The mean is quite high since all of the students that have learned accounting before are so skilled already.

- Participation (10%)
- Quiz 1: Mean: 22.4 High: 30 Low: 12  (10%)
- Quiz 2: Mean: 20.5 High: 30 Low: 6 (15%)
- Midterm: Mean: 83.4     High: 100 Low: 27   (25%)
- Final score: grading is not released. (40%)

My scores:

Mid-term exam: 97/100
Quiz 1: 27/30
Quiz 2:  24/30
Final grade: A

I have never taken any accounting class before but managed to get a good grade. Just do every question for each chapter that is included in the exams from the textbook.
reviews.comment_workload:
We didn't have any homework or project but we had 2 quizzes in total.

I think other professors have 2 midterms without any quiz.

reviews.author: 兔比比比
reviews.comment_content:
Course Roadmap
F/S overview
1. Financial Statements and Business Decisions
2. Investing and Financing Decisions and the Accounting System
3. Operating Decisions and the Accounting System
4. Adjustments, Financial Statements, and the Quality of Earnings
Quiz 1
F/S Line items
1. Sales Revenue, Receivables, and Cash
2. Cost of Goods Sold and Inventory
3. Property, Plant, and Equipment; Intangibles and Natural Resources
4. Liabilities
5. Bond Securities
Quiz 2
SSE, SCF and F/S Analyses
1. Stockholders’ Equity
2. Statement of Cash Flows
3. Analyzing Financial Statements
Final exam

The above is the teaching roadmap. Personally, the whole course is not too difficult as I have studied BAFS at HKDSE. Items before Quiz 2 include lots of calculation and the last three chapter are more conceptual. For me, the last three chapter is the most difficult and the content of the final are mainly from the last three chapter.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor's teaching is fine which me us easy to understand the materials. She also tells us things related to the topic but out of syllabus which help us to understand the topic and the accounting field.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is fair but the mean is quite high.
1st and 2nd midterm means are about 90/100.
Final exam mean is about 120/200.
The 1st and 2nd midterm are very easy while comparing to the final exam.

Course Assessment
Participation 5%
After-class Practice Problems 5%
Quiz 1 1.5hour15%
Quiz 2 1.5hour15%
Final exam60%
reviews.comment_workload:
1 set of questions per week, but only required to finish 3 of them.
Little workload. There are totally 10 sets of after-class practice problems. One set per week. All questions are from the textbook. Professor will upload the pdf file of the questions also the answer. So it is not necessary to buy the textbook.

reviews.author: lindawong107
reviews.comment_content: It is the fundamental course for Accounting. The syllabus is more or less the same as that of BAFS ( Accounting module) in DSE. If you have learnt BAFS, you will think it is easy.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gerry is quite hilarious. But if you are new to ACCT, you may feel hard to follow the lesson. Gerry will go through several questions after he taught each chapter.
reviews.comment_grading: I think he gave good grading cuz I got A+.
reviews.comment_workload: Very low. We do not have homework. But he count our attendance each lesson.

reviews.author: Mandylcm
reviews.comment_content:
Some of the parts are the DSE syllabus.
It is easier for you to handle if you have taken accounting in the secondary school.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching of Tony was quite good and clear. He always asked for questions of students and nice to answer your questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance and Participation 5
In-class Group Exercises  10
Three  In-class Quizzes 10
Mid-term Exam 35
Final Examination (non-cumulative) 40
The grade is not very good. You need to get a higher marks to have A range as many people get very high marks.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not too much. No homework. No presentation.
Only in-class exercises, quiz, mid-term and final.

reviews.author: T.A.T
reviews.comment_content:
If you have studied BAFS in HKDSE, the content of this course will be easy for you as you have learnt 80% of the content before. However, some of terms are different from the terms we used when learning BAFS.
Even that you have not studied BAFS before, the things are quite straight forward and easy to follow so i think the content is simple.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He usually spend quite a lot of time on explaining some terms that will not be commonly appear in mid-term examination or final examination.
However, i think his teaching is fair, sometimes too slow sometimes too fast.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are 2 quizzes and 1 mid-term examination and 1 final examination.
Quiz 1: 24/30
Quiz 2: 27/30
Mid-term examination: 94/100
He did not release the result of final examination but i think i get about 95 marks out of 100.
My final grade is A+
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is small in my own opinion.(I have studied BAFS before)
There are no homework and no project. He will take attendance every lesson but it only deduct attendance mark when you skip too many lessons.
The quiz is not so straight forward but still easy to get a high mark. Final examination is not cumulative that you do not have to revise a lot of things before final examination.

reviews.author: Sum8
reviews.comment_content: Many of the content is on DSE syllabus and not very difficult for me with prior knowledge.There is one topic which is totally new and not included in DSE accounting.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very boring and useless.He takes attendance very seriously and it is better to learn myself. Many skipped his lesson and complained his teachings are tedious and inadequate to help us understand Accounting.
reviews.comment_grading: Worse than I expected.I expected to get an A range with my prior knowledge in accounting but he asked a question in final exam which occupies around ten percent of final, which requires us to explain a very new and never heard of concept with the knowledge taught in lesson, in which I didn't attend and got 0 for that question. So in order to get a great grade, attend every lesson and take notes seriously to avoid such questions. He forces students to attend his lessons with endless annoying tests.Did quite a lot of work but only get b plus, which is disappointing to me and even maddening.
reviews.comment_workload: quite a lot with a report on accounting concept and midterm and final.

reviews.author: tony123411
reviews.comment_content: This is a fina course. Professor always talks about stocks, how he short them and earn a fortune. At last, he didnt have enough time to finish the whole acct syllabus. This was a good news to me because those were not in the exam.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Zero workload. No assignments, no projects.
All you need is to prepare for your exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term is 45%
Final is 55%
4 bonus points are given to students who do news sharing or solve problems in class
I got 90/100 in mt, 94.5/100 in final and no bonus points. I got an A.
In the first lesson, he said he would give as many As as possible, and he kept his promise.
reviews.comment_workload:
Zero workload. No assignments, no projects.
All you need is to prepare for your exams.

reviews.author: lonelyguy
reviews.comment_content: Few chapters are all about DSE BAFS stuff but afterwards are not really related to DSE stuff. So no worry for non-bafs student. P.S. I am also a non-bafs student in secondary school.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Extremely patient and nice. Always have many examples to explain. Quite funny sometimes but she is a bit too fast for the teaching pace. As some students reflected her fast pace in teaching which caused them hard to catch up, she did think of some teaching ways for us to choose from.

She did not take attendance. Also, she had 3 classes on the same two days. So you can choose to attend other classes as well if you miss your class. I was pre-reg the 9:00 session but i was also too lazy so i always attended her lessons in the afternoon. Same content for every class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Components:
24% In-class Exercise
6% Class Participation
10% Quiz 1
20% Quiz 2
40% Final

In-Class Exercise: 24/24
Class Participation: 6/6
Quiz 1: 78/100, Mean: 88/100
Quiz 2: 79/100, Mean: 82/100
Final: 56/172, Mean: 88/172

Final Grade: B-

Super good grade!!
reviews.comment_workload:
Small workload. She will discuss the in-class exercise with us on the deadline day and even gave us all the answer. So we just need to copy the answer and hand in again but it contains 24% of the grade. So easy to get full mark.

There are no projects and presentation at all. However, the workload comes from revising the content. This course is too competitive. If you want to get a good grade, revision is needed.

reviews.author: hungrypotato
reviews.comment_content: Covers the basic concepts of accounting, such as the four financial statements and how to record entries in different formats. The content is pretty easy and self-explanatory actually, if you read the textbook before class.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Szu Fan is very kind, although she always seems expressionless. But when I asked questions, she is so patient and smiles a little bit (even though you might not notice). She is one of the kindest professors I've seen in UST, although she doesn't look like it most of the time.

However, Szu Fan's powerpoints are extremely plain, so you have to attend classes attentively - which is hard because her voice is sometimes too soft to be heard. However, if you can hear her speaking, class is easy to follow. Sze Fan always asks her students for feedback and will go back to topics that students voted as hard to understand. She also slows down the pace significantly if students request for it.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pretty good grade.

In-class exercise: 24%
Class participation: 6%
Quiz 1: 10%
Quiz 2: 20%
Final Exam: 40%

Szu Fan does the in-class exercise with us in class, so just copy all the answers and submit them onto canvas. Sometimes she even sends us the file, and all you have to do is submit what she sends to us. She allows her students to skip one or two assignments I think. Basically everyone can get all 24%.

Class participation is easy to get too. If you answer her question once, you get 3%. So you only have to answer her questions 2 times out of the ENTIRE semester. Once she asked what page we were up to and gave the student 3% who answered her. She tells the whole class it is "participation mark time" before asking, so make sure you don't fall asleep in class and miss the chance. By the last few lessons, she only asks students who haven't got full credit, so all students can score full mark for this part.

Quiz 1 is quite easy, most people score very high, so make sure you don't screw up. Quiz 2 is much more difficult, but people still score really well. Final is EXTREMELY HARD and CANNOT BE COMPARED to her quizzes. Her finals are only fill-in-the-blanks. She allowed us to bring a 2-sided A4 cheat sheet, but I honestly didn't even have to USE it. Her final is mostly on concepts, so don't only drill exercises, but make sure you get the concepts straight!!! I screwed up finals because I just did exercise without knowing the concepts well enough.

I got full mark for class participation, in-class exercise and quiz 1. But only got a few marks above mean for quiz 2 and finals. Still got B+ luckily.
reviews.comment_workload: Almost none. There is one in-class exercise one week approximately. But since Szu Fan gives out the answer, you just have to submit what she gives out. Basically no homework.

reviews.author: Mike0099
reviews.title: Good Professor
reviews.comment_content:
Multiple In Class "Practice" Questions: Remember to Find Good Group-mates For This Part.
1 Case Study
One Midterm
One Final
The overall course was well-structured, providing a sufficient foundation for accounting.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Kelvin is an excellent professor when it comes to accounting knowledge and prowess. His notes are not that good though so it is a good idea to review before or after a lecture of the given chapter. The practice questions in the textbook are good practice for the midterm and final exam.

A good and funny teacher. Its best to understand cantonese to get his jokes though. Kevin is not a "mean" professor and he has a good accent when compared to other lectures. International students and mainland students may not like his jokes sometimes, but he is considered one of the best accounting professors. One will have no problem in understanding his ideas and thoughts.
reviews.comment_grading:
Depends on the individual. Studying using the Accounting 2010 textbook got me an A. I learned basic accounting before, but it is definitely possible to get an A if enough time and effort is put in. Attend lectures as Kelvin will tell you throughout the semester of what he expects for the midterm and final in terms of showing one's work.

Anyone that desires a good grade and is willing to put in the time and effort will see themselves rewarded. The mean for this class is usually mid 70's~, aim for high 80's to low 90's if you wish to get an A. One SD should be enough, unless there are HKDSE students that manage to ruin the curve.
reviews.comment_workload:
Decently workload, just the case study that required research and time. A good case study generally takes about 1 week to finish. Always consult your classmates, very helpful, especially those who have taken accounting before. Always show up for class as practice questions are used to measure one's grade and to record attendance.

Lots of studying to be done before exam time in order to ensure a good grade. It is a manageable course if one spends enough time. The first few sections are easy once you've begun accustomed to basic principles and concepts.

reviews.author: inwook1210
reviews.title: A great course
reviews.comment_content: Her course is focused on GAAP. I had no accounting background at all at the beginning of the semester. Yet, the content wasn't too difficult for me to understand. As long as you pay attention during class and complete her assignments, you would have no problem keeping up with this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: So far, she is the most passionate and patient professor I've ever seen. Whenever she got any feedback saying she went too fast, she slowed down and explained the concept again, in a clearer way and with an easier example. Her power points are organized and thorough. To sum up, she is adorable as a professor and a person.
reviews.comment_grading: Her grading scheme is understandable, but most of the students have accounting backgrounds. This will make it harder for those without any backgrounds to get a high score. But still, try hard. Hard work pays off in this course for sure.
reviews.comment_workload: To be honest the workload is just alright. It's not way too much yet still enough to help you understand the concepts. Just do the assignments every week. You'll be fine.

reviews.author: wangyayi
reviews.comment_content: A bit hard for a starter in accounting but actually the content is basic knowledge so if one spends some time on it, it won't be that hard. Need to memorize and practice a lot. An essay is required and I don't get the point of it, whose focus is about the ethics in accounting, not much concerned about what we have learnt in class nor is it quite meaningful for the real life accounting issues.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The lecture is ok,because the professor illustrates the points clearly and will provide some useful additional information.  But sometimes his voice is quite plain so it's easy to feel bored, unable to concentrate.
Tutorials will sometimes be held on weekends or holidays, but the content will only be helpful for those who don't understand the previous lectures.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is not good. What makes it worse is that the grades of the assignment and final will not be given. You never know why you get such a low grade. It seems like grade just by your midterm and problem sets.
reviews.comment_workload: As I said, for beginners, you need to put great effort after class. For example, read the book thoroughly to help yourself acquire better understanding and do all the practice questions either on the book or provided by professor.

reviews.author: Seoyoung
reviews.comment_content: It's pretty challenging for those who haven't studied Accounting before. However, if you put enough time and effort on revising the material, it'll be fine.
reviews.comment_teaching: She's really good at teaching and humorous.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is pretty fair but the final was extremely difficult - the cheat sheet didn't even help. I felt like I would've received the same grade even if I didn't revise.
reviews.comment_workload: There isnt't much workload - she gives out some practice questions/ examples to solve but she doesn't really check them.

reviews.author: Anson123
reviews.title: A very interesting class to study
reviews.comment_content: The content is ok in terms of the difficulties. This course is pretty informative. If you have studied BAFS in your secondary school, congratulations, as you will probably know all of the course content, it is pretty much the same as the secondary school level. I guess all of the year-one students will love having this ACCT 2010 course.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching style is very good, there are many interactions and activities. Tony loves to ask different interesting questions so his lessons are never boring, I bet you will not fall asleep in his lessons. I have a lot of friends who are also in the class of Tony, they all love him very much as his teaching style is really good, and he is not to harsh to the new students.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pretty good grading.
If you are willing to study hard and pay a lot of effort, then this course is easy for you to handle. If you can get the mean score, you can get a B or B+, it is also pretty easy for you to get an A if you study hard. If you have studied BAFS in the secondary school, you will easily get an A.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is acceptable for a 3-credit course. There is not much work to do after class. All you have to do is to do your own revision and to do more exercises as the exercises can help you a lot. In my opinion, I think the workload is pretty small as I do not need to spend a lot of time doing the after-class practices.

reviews.author: newk2
reviews.comment_content: Very simple accounting stuff, I understand it even if I didn’t take bafs in the past
reviews.comment_teaching: A bit boring but she is helpful. She will always answer your questions and explain it clearly after class. She’ll also make survey to know whether students can keep on track or not.
reviews.comment_grading:
24% In-class exercise (usually she’ll told us the ans in class)
6% attendance (answer two questions in class)
Quiz 1 10% (not difficult)
Quiz 2 14% (not difficult)
Exam 40% (very very hard)
reviews.comment_workload: Only in class exercises once a week, no other assignment or projects

reviews.author: hwch
reviews.comment_content: Rich content! Helpful for students who did not study accounting before!
reviews.comment_teaching: You can ask questions after teaching hours. She is nice to answer all your questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Easy term tests with low SD however careless mistakes may result in a bad grade. Final is extremely difficult. Do not recommend to buy the textbooks, even if you have bought it, please do not spent much time on the exercises there because they are irrelevant to the questions types in the exam.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workloads. Just remember to attend lessons and finish the in-class exercises. Do not miss any of them!

reviews.author: whalewhalewhale
reviews.comment_content: He covers basic concepts, and the content is comparatively less than other professors. For instance, unlike other professors, he does not cover the chapter on bonds. Understanding how to write journal entries and making adjustments are important if you take his course, and will appear often in the exams. It's also important to understand and remember the formulas used throughout the course, such as current ratio, as well as the accounting equation (Assets = Liabilities + Stockholders' Equity)
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor's teaching pace is good, and covers enough concepts without exhausting the students. He also really urges for the students to understand his teachings and holds optional tutorials on Saturdays to recap on concepts taught in previous lectures or learning additional information. He always makes time to answer students' questions after lesson as well.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class Participation & In-Class Assignments = 10%
Case about Professional Ethics = 15%
Mid-terms = 25%
Finals = 50%

The finals and the case study homework is not disclosed to students, so you are only able to receive your marks from the mid-terms and the in-class group assignments.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not that much. The only assignment you have would be the case about professional ethics, but he gives you a very long time to complete it, and it does not take too much time to do, since the case does not have to be written in essay format. The rest of the assignments are done in class with a group, and you may feel free to ask the professor questions regarding the assignments.

reviews.author: charlottebless
reviews.title: Easy for BAFS students, relatively hard for beginners
reviews.comment_content: I would say the content is generally useful as it touches the fundamentals of accounting, including financial statements.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is not satisfactory as he doesn't manage to talk the concepts in a clear and structured way. But he gives useful classwork that enable the students to learn more about accounting.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is generally good as I am under the perception that he gives a lot of A-range?
reviews.comment_workload: When compared to other professors, the workload is light as there are no homeworks. The quizzes are generally easy as well, given that you pay effort. The final is manageable as well.

reviews.author: Anonymashit
reviews.title: Only for people who will attend classes
reviews.comment_content:
Only some new concepts such as Statement of cash flow, method of depreciation which is new to students who studied BAFS (accounting) in secondary school.
He didn't mention anything about T-account, which makes it more difficult for people to understand the credit debit thing.
reviews.comment_teaching: It is hard to focus in his lesson. He tried to be humorous but he failed. I hate his strange accent.
reviews.comment_grading: Not good. 15% of marks from an individual assignment about analyzing a case. 10% from assignments completed in lessons with groupmates. And in the final exam, you'll need to explain a concepts that taught in his lesson through the example he used to explain. I didn't attend his lesson and that question cost me 9 marks in the 100 marks exam.
reviews.comment_workload: Well, you have to attend every lesson if you want to get that 9 marks. Moreover, his powerpoint did not cover everything he taught in the lesson, and many mainpoints were not included in the powerpoint. So you need to focus in his lesson which is another challenge as I've mentioned above.

reviews.author: dMuffin
reviews.comment_content:
The content was pretty close to what was taught in high school.
Fairly straight forward if you pay attention to the first few lectures.
reviews.comment_teaching: Loved his classes, always interactive with the students and tries his best to make the experience two-way instead of the traditional "boring" sense.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair, I got a B+.
reviews.comment_workload:
1 Mid term, 1 Final, 1 small Assignment.
There are weekly in-class exercises you do with other classmates.
I'd recommend reading up on the exercise beforehand to familiarize the question style and answer method because it's the same long-Q for the mid term and final anyways.
Also the exercises counts towards total grade so doing well on them would be advised.

reviews.author: tachyu
reviews.comment_content:
Teach GAAP. The content is not difficult.
But if you never learned accounting before, You need to work hard on this one .
reviews.comment_teaching: Great professor, try to make every one in class to understand the content and give good explanation. I think this is her first year of teaching so there's a lot of patience and passion in her teaching. The lectures sometimes go a little bit too fast before the quizzes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 5%
After-class Practice Problems 5%
Quizzes 30%
Final exam 60%

Two quizzes in total, each 15%.
Quiz 1 covers all sessions before quiz 1. Quiz 2 covers all sessions between quiz1 and quiz2.
Final weights 60%, which is a lot, and covers all the sessions from day 1.

11 practice problems assignment in total. You only need to hand in ten of them to get full mark.

For the participation score, try to be active in class and let the professor to remember you. Leave a good impression.

The mean of the quizzes are usually really high, there are lots of student with accounting knowledge already. So it needs lots of effort to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite a lot of workload.
Need to submit assignment every week.
The final covers everything in class, so there is a lot to review.

reviews.author: A random guy
reviews.title: Good course, good professor (in my opinion)
reviews.comment_content:
Welcome to ACCT2010, just another business common core that need to study... The content is actually quite different then HKDSE as Tony used GAAP instead of IFRS.

Content including:

Introduction; Overview of corporate financial reporting
The Financial Statements

The measurement fundamentals of financial accounting
The measurement fundamentals of financial accounting
Accounting Equation, Journal Entries and Adjustment Entries
Cash and Accounts Receivables
Merchandise Inventory and Cost of Goods Sold
Long-Term Assets
Current Liabilities and Contingencies
Long-Term Liabilities: Notes, Bonds, and Leases
Shareholder’s Equity
Statement of Cash Flows
Statement of Cash Flows

Actually you would found it quite useful if you take ACCT as major. BTW, Tony taught more of the LT liabilities than other prof, so if you are new to ACCT, better study more
reviews.comment_teaching:
There is one policy that I did not like about the course: class participation... you will use all sorts of students asking some useless questions so as to get Tony attention, so he taught slower than others.
His PPT are quite all-rounded and clear so you will have no problem about the ACCT concept, but make sure to buy the book and do exercises.
His accent is quite wield...sth like Bery instead of Very, but I think it does not make a difference as this course is just doing ACCT.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance and Participation 5
In-class Group Exercises 10
Three In-class Quizzes @ 20 points each (drop the lowest one) 10
Mid-term Exam 35
Final Examination (non-cumulative) 40

The great thing of this course is the final is non-cumulative, if you stuck at things before mid-term, you still have a chance have a good grade. Make sure you have a good group mates as the in-class group exercises really make a difference for grading.

The grading is actually not that good, my advice is to get every mark that you can get, especially in the quiz and exercises.

I get all quizs above 1sd and the mid-term above 0.75sd (not quite sure about the final as no marks are shown, overall A.
reviews.comment_workload: Actually no HW to submit, just need to attend group exercises and quiz, not much workload. Still, suggest to do exercises for each chapter no matter you have learnt ACCT or not, or else you are screwed.

reviews.author: edisonlam
reviews.comment_content: Content similar with those in HKDSE. Normally you will get good grade if you finish most of the textbook exercise since “practice makes perfect” is really true especially in Accounting.
reviews.comment_teaching: Clear explanation and sometime will have interaction with you. Gerry is very nice and sometime will talk with you if you arrive the classroom early. But be careful that he will remember all your name and will ask questions if you fall asleep on lessons.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading. There is two quiz which consist of around 30 MCQ. There is also one midterm and one Final exam with long Questions which require calculation and explanation on some accounting concepts and principles.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not many workload. There is classwork in every lesson as to check your learning progress. No homework unless classwork is not done on class.
Note that he will take attendance on every lessons.

reviews.author: slimiu
reviews.comment_content:
Follows GAAP instead of IFRS. Need to go through a bit of transition if you study BAFS(Accounting) under HKDSE.

If you study BAFS in secondary school, basically this course helps you to review everything you have learnt in your S4-6 years.

Mainly covers the following financial statements and relevant knowledge:
1. Income Statement
2. Balance Sheet (Statement of Financial Position)
3. Statement of Cash Flow
4. Statement of Stockholders' Equity (capital account)
reviews.comment_teaching: Very passionate towards teaching. Content well explained. Makes time for students to ask questions and do in-class exercises.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 5%
After-class Practice Problems 5%
Quizzes 30%
Final exam 60%

There are 2 quizzes in total, equal in weighting. They work as midterms so study hard for them. No make-up exams so you  should take precautionary actions to avoid missing the quizzes.
"Quizzes and final exam are all closed-book. Quiz 1 will cover all class sessions before Quiz 1. Quiz 2 will cover all sessions between Quiz 1 and Quiz 2. The final exam will cover everything we have discussed in the class."

For participation marks, ask the professor questions directly in class or on canvas. (instead of asking the TA)
It would be best to give the professor a good impression by being active in class and on the Canvas discussion board.
reviews.comment_workload:
Acceptable. 1 homework per week with assigned questions. Attempt a minimum of 3 questions for each assignment and you'll get full marks.

"After-class practice problems are listed at the end of the syllabus in the class schedule. Attempt at least the first 3 problems and hand it in on Canvas by the due date. Grades are given based on submission and effort. Submit at least 10 out of 11 problem sets to qualify for a full score."

reviews.author: Kuou
reviews.comment_content: Basic financial accounting, time is kind of tight, therefore some contents are not covered.  Attendance were taken each lecture.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gerry is a nice person. However his lecture may be hard for beginners to understand. He emphasize much on examples which lead to less coverage on key points.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not good grade for beginners, you need to work hard to get good grade.
The final contributed to a large portion of the grade. If did bad before, then work hard for the final.
reviews.comment_workload: Heavy workload for beginners, you need to do some readings on textbook in advance and spend some time to review.

reviews.author: JacobHCH
reviews.title: average
reviews.comment_content: If you have studied BAFS in DSE, you would find it pretty boring in class. However, there are some places quite different from BAFS, for instance, the way you treat the allowance for doubtful debts is actually differentiated from DSE
reviews.comment_teaching: His tone is pretty boring and flat. It is hard for me to not fall to sleep even though he is teaching crucial things. There are also some in-class mini quizzes but I cannot sure whether they help the count of attendance or not.
reviews.comment_grading: I think you could expect B range if you have already studied BAFS without any preparation.
reviews.comment_workload: There are literally not homework for you. However,  there is a case study but it is not that hard and easy to understand the scenario.

reviews.author: luick
reviews.comment_content:
about the four financial statement: income statement, balance sheet, statement of cash flow, statement of stockholder's equity
if you had learnt in secondary school bafs lesson, it will be easy for you even you do not show up in class
reviews.comment_teaching:
well explanation
will give time for students to do exercise together
willing to answer student's question
reviews.comment_grading:
participation: 5%(ans and ask question in class or on canvas)
2 quizzes
1 final

grading is ok, I got a A- as some of them were taught in secondary school bafs lesson.
reviews.comment_workload:
not quite heavy, have 10 hw, which means 1 hw per week
2 mid-term and 1 final

reviews.author: milkydoggy
reviews.comment_content:
Tidy and clear ppt
He teaches the easiest content comparing to other professors
Always give classwork(group assignment) to ensure that the students understand all the concept
Students can meet new friends easily
reviews.comment_teaching:
One of the best professor I have seen in UST
Will tell jokes and use some simple daily examples to explain complicated ideas
He will ensure that most of the students understand the concept before he moves on.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good. Especially if you have studied BAFS in secondary school
Over 80% of things that he teaches is covered in the DSE syllabus
But as the thing he teaches is easy, most of the students can get high marks and therefore the exams are with a quite high mean
But the exam is really easy comparing to other professors'
If you work hard, you will get really good grade.

If you don't want to get broken grade, Kelvin must be the best professor.
reviews.comment_workload:
Kelvin is the only professor who requires students to write an essay  about accountants' ethics. But the essay is really not difficult to write. 1-2 day(s) must be enough
The midterm and final exam is easy so students don't really need a lot of time to do revision.

reviews.author: Gene
reviews.comment_content: I took BAFS (Accounting) in high school as my elective, so it's quite easy for me. However, the content is in US GAAP instead of IFRS (Internation Financial Reporting Standards), so there were a few minor difference in format and concepts. Other than this, I think everyone can get a good grade as long as they put in some effort.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Chen is a great teacher, she 'tried' to make us laugh but in vain. She is very patient in answering our questions and she is not that kind of professor who always has a long face; she is friendly, so feel free to ask her questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Grades are quite lenient. If you forgot to hand in your homework, just email her and apologize, then she will let you go. But still, make sure to hand in every in-class exercise and get all the participation points. I guess as long as you got full credit for in-class exercise and participation, with mid-term and final above 1s.d., an A is guaranteed.
reviews.comment_workload: Usually, 1 in-class exercise per week, which she literally tells you the answer, of course, you can get participation points by answering her questions. And you will get full credit for HW as long as you hand-in everything (no matter if you got it right or not).

reviews.author: peanut
reviews.comment_content: most of the content in the course is actually what you have learnt in NSS bafs accounting.  so it would be quite easy for students with bafs accounting background.  however, there is also some divergences between the two courses that there might be some formatting differences and so on.
reviews.comment_teaching: the professor is quite interesting
reviews.comment_grading:
mid term above one sd
no final exam result release
but final grade B
reviews.comment_workload: there's no homework.  there is only some in-class exercise which you can actually prepared before the lesson.  there is no attendance taking

reviews.author: eli
reviews.title: acct 2010 szu fan
reviews.comment_content: basic acct knowledge like inventory control, bonds and shares, depreciation. just some acct concepts that were taught in dse bafs acct module.
reviews.comment_teaching: a little fast, but prof chen is patient and kind to answer your questions after class. require participation (6marks-->3hands up in class, just answer her questions, not difficult). she will just read out the ppt very quickly in class. make sure you do not talk too loudly in her class.
reviews.comment_grading:
super difficult finals, even the mean is a failed score haha. you can get a good grade only by reaching above mean in her two midterm exams. the mean for her midterms are quite high though.
1st mt: 87/100
2nd mt: 82/100
final: forgot but failed mean (one a4 note sheet can be taken but tbh it was totally useless as the exam was too unexpectedly hard)
she is quite lenient in grades, just do not underperform too much will be find. getting a b range is not that difficult. good luck.
reviews.comment_workload: just short assignment after each chapter which has to be uploaded to canvas. not difficult as prof will provide all answers during class.

reviews.author: Sophia.m
reviews.title: Work hard then u can hv good grade
reviews.comment_content: The content is not difficult if you have learnt BAFS in your use. Even if you don't, don't need to be panic cuz he speaks very slowly for you to catch up.
reviews.comment_teaching: The pace of teaching is quite low and you have time to ask him questions during and after lessons. Also, there is supplemental classes for those who cannot catch up. He is a passionate person. He can explain things quite clearly.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading would be quite good if you really attend all the lessons and pay attention. cuz 9 marks in the final exam is about the examples he mentioned during class so remember to pay attention to his classes to get high marks The in class activities are not difficult if you do revision of the teaching materials regularly.
reviews.comment_workload: Kind of light, only one case study, but it is easy cuz the professor provides super clear guidelines, so u must not skip the lesson when the professor talks about the case.

reviews.author: charmingfishust
reviews.title: Boring for all, good grading for seniors in accouting
reviews.comment_content:
Basic principles of accouting, plus some unteach concepts from high schools like treasury stock etc.
one mid-term, two quizzes on september and november, one final.
reviews.comment_teaching:
straight-forward reading from ppt. from time to time he told jokes but not really funny.
he did respond to students' questions immediately in lesson but sometime we were still confused about his response. but i appreciate his direct response.
reviews.comment_grading:
i have learnt accouting before, so all i have to do is to revise the ppt all over and grab some questions for self-practice and self-checking.
i got above mean in both quizzes and mid-term
final grade B+
reviews.comment_workload:
light.
but highly recommend to spend time doing as much exercises as u can after each lesson, cause the pace is really fast and require much self-practice.
no compulsory homework, and optional self-practice. some people may just keep on doing on phone or self-work

reviews.author: sleeper
reviews.comment_content: The content is different from secondary school in Hong Kong.So no need to worry if you haven't studied BAFS before.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very good and clear teaching.She will repeat what she has taught in previous lesson before teaching new things.She is very patient to read and reply the questions on canvas.
reviews.comment_grading: Very good grading.But the mean is rather high since the quizzes are not really difficult.
reviews.comment_workload: Acceptable and low workload for me.Only need to finish the homework,the number of questions is up to you.

reviews.author: zebra
reviews.title: Nice professor, hard to get good grades though
reviews.comment_content: If haven't studied ACCT before, you'd better work very hard on this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: I can feel that professor tries very hard on making us understand, but in my opinion, it is a bit too fast for those who haven't studied ACCT before. But of course, you can always ask her and she is very willing to answer you.
reviews.comment_grading:
TESTS
2 mid-terms, may not have MCs
Final, no MCs and complicated questions
Means for the midterms are around 80%, a bit lower for final.

PARTICIPATION
1) Ask/answer questions on canvas
2) Be a volunteer in class

I never studied ACCT before, so the tests were quite hard for me, I didn't pass the mean for even once. I scored 60%-70% in all the tests, in the end I got a C.
reviews.comment_workload: Have to submit assignment every week, at least 3 questions from the textbook. Professor will upload the answers to canvas a few days before the deadline, and marks are counted upon submission, so you don't have to worry if you don't have time to do it. As for the questions online, professor won't force you to do it.

reviews.author: Chesnex
reviews.comment_content: The course content is rich and practical. You learn all basic accounting knowledge and something more of higher level accounting expertise.
reviews.comment_teaching: Powerpoint is adopted throughout the entire semester of the course. kelvin is a nice guy. he is willing to solve your problems by either answering your questions or assigning useful practice.
reviews.comment_grading: mid term and final exam are quite straightforward, thus being very easy to score high from. I got like a few marks above those means in the exams and eventually got a b+. meh... not a really satisfactory grade but at least its not like really bad.
reviews.comment_workload: only one mid term and one exam as stated in grading part. not too much homework. just pay attention during class and finish all the homework then you will be safe and sound in exams.

reviews.author: Charlie Chiang
reviews.comment_content: Just basic accounting knowledge and this is mandatory for all business school students.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Gerry is a nice human being in general. He answers all of our questions in class and after class. He teaches the accounting concepts clearly, and the pace is just right. He also memorizes the student's names, which I thought was beneficial for me to engage in the course more.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is quite nice. I studied very hard because I found accounting quite interesting and got an A+. My friends all got nice grades, all As. His tests aren't as difficult as the other professor's, so I think that played a big part in that. Also, he doesn't give out assignments, so you only have to study for the test to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: There aren't any assignments, so the workload is really light. All the grades are decided on your test grade.

reviews.author: uston99
reviews.title: not bad
reviews.comment_content:
some parts are pretty easy to handle if you hv studied accounting in high school. some of my friends who didnt study accounting before said it was difficult.
Yet, as Tony follow US GAAP which is different from what I followed in high school, so some parts might be different from what you learnt before.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Tony is pretty good in general. He will upload all the lecture notes and ex ans in canvas for our study reference.
Yet, sometimes he speaks unclearly which makes me feel confuse.
reviews.comment_grading:
5% attendance and participation (speak more in class to get participation mark!!!)
10% in-class grp ex  (6 grp ex in total)
10% three in-class quizzes @20 points each (drop the lowest)
35% mid-term exam
40% final exam
reviews.comment_workload:
almost no workload as tony's homework wont count and usually many students wont do at all.
Just sometimes there are quizzes which need to study before head.

reviews.author: coconut
reviews.comment_content: Too much to study. All about accounting, its based on the textbook (financial accounting)
reviews.comment_teaching: Good teaching professor. She tried hard all the time, sometimes the lectures goes too fast so its hard to understand.
reviews.comment_grading: Average grading. If you ace the test, you can get high grade. but if you fail the test you can low grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Too many workload, final is from day 1 to last day. Midterm was not bad but final was too much to study becasue it was cumulative unlike other class it was not cumulative.

reviews.author: wyrlau
reviews.comment_content: The content of the course introduced students to the basics of accounting such as the double entry system and the American way of bookeeping.
reviews.comment_teaching: It has taken me some time to adapt to the way of teaching of the professor. He tried to make some jokes in the class but I don't find it funny at all. On top of that, it is his tone that makes the lesson more boring. He teaches in a rapid pace and one may find it difficult to catch up without preparation before the course.
reviews.comment_grading: His grading is relatively good compared to other professors. The final exam is not too difficult and most of the answers are referred(direct copied)from the exercises in the textbook. I believe his grading is lenient.
reviews.comment_workload: There are two quiz in mc and a mid term and final for the course. However if you have studied accounting in secondary school, that should not be a challenge as most of the questions are straight forward compared to DSE exam. For students who has just been introduced to accounting, don't rely on his teaching, buy the textbook and do some exercises and you will get an acceptable grade.

reviews.author: Cindycty
reviews.comment_content: There are two midterms. The midterms are easy but the final exam is terrible. The final exam is just fill in the blanks questions. Cheat sheet is useless in the final exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is fine.
reviews.comment_grading: Cheatsheet is totally useless in the final exam!!!! The paper consists of three parts and the last two parts are extremely difficult although it is just fill in the blanks question.
reviews.comment_workload: Ok. There are about 12 in-class exercises. Sometimes the professor will just upload the answer of the exercise before the submission deadline.

reviews.author: vedantj
reviews.comment_content: Course contains fundamental accounting principles. Does not really matter whether or not you have take BAFS. Textbook can be a helpful as for better clarification on confusing topics.
reviews.comment_teaching: Extremely important to attend class. The lectures are interesting and she is very interactive. Very easy to talk to, anytime there is an issue she is extremely easy to approach.
reviews.comment_grading: In class participation, two quizzes, and a final. Cheat sheets are allowed and does not grade difficulty.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is fairly normal, mostly in class work. Lots of questions classed in class so important to be tentative and answer questions.

reviews.author: dllmon9
reviews.comment_content:
I. Course Description
or by appointment
L03: Mon. & Wed. L13: Mon. & Wed. L14: Mon. & Wed.
09:00 – 10:20 12:00 – 13:20 10:30 – 11:50
LSK 1007 LSK 1007 LSK 1007
ACCT 2010 Principles of Accounting I
Fall 2017
Dr. Gerry K.H. LI
LSK 6048, e-mail: acgerry@ust.hk, Tel. 2358 7564 Monday & Wednesday 2:00 – 3:30 pm
Ms. Sandy TAI
LSK 6066, email: acsandy@ust.hk, Tel. 2358 7582 Accessible via CANVAS
  Accounting is the language of business. In this course you will learn how to "speak" and "read" this new language. The course is designed to provide an overview of the financial accounting frameworks and processes leading to the preparation of financial statements, and develop your relevant skills to read, interpret and analyze corporate financial reports from various dynamic business perspectives.
II. Course Objectives
Upon the completion of this course, you should be able to:
1. Develop a comprehensive understanding and well-founded knowledge of financial accounting, covering:
a. the accounting categories: assets, liabilities, equity, revenues and expenses;
b. the ways an accounting system keeps track of data and information;
c. how generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) influence what is recorded in the books of an entity;
d. the preparation of a balance sheet, income statement and cash flow statement;
e. the reading, interpretation and analysis of a set of financial statements.
2. Understand the role of financial accounting in the decision-making process of business organizations, and apply financial accounting frameworks to business situations.
3. Form critical judgment covering an ability to identify and define accounting and business problems, apply analytical and quantitative techniques, and to make and justify decisions;
Page 1 of 5
4. Communicate effectively through collection, analysis and organization of information and ideas and their clear transmission;
5. Demonstrate teamwork, independence and creativity including working, learning and problem solving as a team and independently; and
6. Develop ethical and social understanding including a knowledge and respect of ethics and ethical standards in accounting and an understanding of social and civic responsibility.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Funny teacher with incredible memory....
He takes attendances during quiz... LMAO
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair Grading.....
Mean = B
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload.
No Homework
2 Quizs
1 MT
1 Final

reviews.author: messixo
reviews.title: An enthusiastic teacher with nice accent
reviews.comment_content: Basically what the DSE curriculum actually covered. I think it is almost the same for every professor so you may view it in others' reviews haha. :) And btw strongly recommend students who never took acct in DSE to buy the textbook to help with your learning cuz powerpoints are a bit too simple and her teaching pace is quite fast as there are many chapters to be covered in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: She has a very good accent which gives a boost to her teaching quality. She is very willing to answer students' questions after lesson. Yet, sometimes I think she talks a little bit too quickly so that students who are babies in accounting like me may found it tough to pick up. In general, she is a nice professor.
reviews.comment_grading: the grading is fine and the quizzes and finals are not too difficult. I think it should be easy for ppl who ever studied acct in DSE to get A-range.
reviews.comment_workload: Well, I think the workload is a bit heavy as she has an assignment every week, which are questions in the textbook. One point to appreciate is that she will provide us with a collection of what questions we have to work on every week, instead of simply giving us the question numbers and asking us to find them ourselves in the textbook. More importantly, she will provide solutions to us together with the collection. Therefore, if you do not want to work on the solution ourselves, time can be saved to directly copy the solutions.

reviews.author: Kirthi Gomatam
reviews.comment_content: I personally don't find accounting particularly thrilling, so I wouldn't say the content was incredibly fascinating. However, the course was well organized and covered the basics of accounting (financial statements, journal entries, ledgers, bad debt expense...etc). I definitely understood the material well and think the knowledge I've gained from the course is useful to have as a business student.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Kelvin is the nicest professor -- he is always willing to answer questions during class and office hours, offers extra tutorials Saturday if students need extra help and is very approachable. However, he sometimes is not clear with his explanations and makes the content more confusing than it is. His classes were not very interesting, slides were similar to the textbook and are uploaded online, so overall you don't really need to go to class. However, he does give practice questions (you work on as a group in class and turn in before the end of class) during many classes which count towards your grade and help understand the material a lot more effectively than the lectures themselves.

So, I enjoyed how his class was structured into lecture and practice questions since he was very helpful in explaining HOW to do questions and the midterm and final short answer questions were very similar to practice questions.

If you are able to learn well on your own, then I would recommend Kelvin. If you need someone to explain concepts very clearly to you, I would not recommend his class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class activities and participation 10%
Case about professional ethics 15%
Mid-term exam 25%
Final exam 50%

Class activities include practice questions which help understand the material, grading can sometimes be weird on these, but they definitely help your grade.

Grading on the tests were fair -- if you know the material very well (not just memorized but can do problems well and really know how to apply it) you will you do fine. I was barely above average on the Mid-term but did well on the Final exam and case. I ended up with an A.
reviews.comment_workload:
Barely any.
