No attendance (although there are Practice Questions that are turned in and can help your grade), textbook reading and suggested practice problems. I tried to read before class but did not always, just study well before the Mid-term and Final and go in for his feedback for the case and you will do well!

reviews.author: Ivan hulk
reviews.comment_content:
If you study BAFS, congratulations.
If you do not study BAFS, good luck.

Frankly speaking, this course is not fair because most of the basic knowledge have been covered in BAFS.

Content:
Introduction; Overview of corporate financial reporting
The Financial Statements
The measurement fundamentals of financial accounting
Accounting Equation, Journal Entries and Adjustment Entries
Cash and Accounts Receivables
Merchandise Inventory and Cost of Goods Sold
Long-Term Assets
Current Liabilities and Contingencies
Long-Term Liabilities: Notes, Bonds, and Leases
Shareholder’s Equity
Statement of Cash Flows
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony SHIEH is a good teacher . He shows different example and interact with the classmates during the lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
From my point of view, it is easy to get B range but it is quite hard to get A range because most of the students get A- or above have basic knowledge in accounting.
The grading mainly composed of quiz, group exercises, participation, mid-term and final exam.

Reminder: It is very easy for BAFS students to get high marks (nearly full marks) without spending much time to revise in the mid-term. You will also have advantage for the final exam because you have strong foundation. Good luck and work hard and you will get A range.
reviews.comment_workload: He doesn't require students to do any homework, but you must need to work hard if you would like to get good grade

reviews.author: lm789bm123
reviews.comment_content: Content is very easy. If you have taken BAFS in HKDSE, you will get an A easily.
reviews.comment_teaching: Great tutor
reviews.comment_grading: As I said since the content is quite easy, so you can get high marks easily. But it is the same story for other students. So you have to aware that you won't lose mark carelessly.
reviews.comment_workload: It is not very high. Though it has some quizzes, since the content is quite easy, you can handle it very easily. However, you may do the practice homework to prepare midterm and final, but it is not mandatory.

reviews.author: maimai
reviews.comment_content: Content maybe a bit difficult to understand for students not taking BAFS in Secondary school, but afterall it is straightforward.
reviews.comment_teaching:
teaching pace is fast
need to pay attention
powerpoint slides may not be enough for you to understand all the stuff
recommend you too read the examples and exercises in textbook during revision
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is quite nice to me.
In-class exercise (24%) - you can get all 24% if you hand in, no matter you did it right or wrong
class-participation (6%) - quite easy to get all, you only need to answer 2 questions in class then you can get all 6%
Mid-term x 2 (30% in total) - both mid-term are easy (I got 97% for the 1st one and 99% for the 2nd one, you just need to be careful as there are quite a lot of traps)
final exam (40%) - for Chen Szu Fan, final exam is extremely difficult, cheat sheet cannot help, and the question are totally different from those in class and textbook. You just need to try your best, and good luck.
reviews.comment_workload:
only around 8-9 in-class exercises.
they are not difficult and she usually provide all the ans to you in class.
you just need to complete 1-2 question each time and you can get full mark.

reviews.author: Vinci Lam
reviews.comment_content: Though I didn't study BAFS in Secondary School , the concept was easy to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: Sometimes it is a bit hard to understand and catch up because of her accent. Yet, she will do class exercise with us, you can try to understand the concept by those application.
reviews.comment_grading: The 2 quizzes were easy to get high marks. However, the final exam was very hard.
reviews.comment_workload: She has class exercise every week but sometimes she will do the questions with us. Also, those question are easy, you can do it quickly if you attend the lessons.

reviews.author: hildawsy
reviews.comment_content: He teaches all the needed information for quiz, tests and exams. He sometimes teach some account related concepts which is not required, but he will mention that is out of syllabus.
reviews.comment_teaching: He explained the concepts well. He is willing to use more time to explained difficult concepts. He welcomes and appreciates students to ask questions and he will answer them immediately. He uses a version of textbook that is different from other instructors. He uses his own powerpoint, showing clearly the principles / concepts, definition, applications, examples, formulas, etc., which make me easy for revision.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is fair. As long as you study well in all the group in-class exercise, quizzes, midterm and final exam, you will score according. The grade is largely reflected by the rank of your midterm and final. Attendance and participation counts 5%, 5 out of 6 in-class group exercise 10%, 2 out of 3 in-class quizzes 10%, mid-term exam 35%, final exam 40%.

The first quiz is rather difficult, but don't be scared by that, his midterm and final are not difficult as long as you study and understand thoroughly every concepts. Final is non-accumulated, meaning what have been tested in midterm will not occur in the final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: There is no homework so workload is not heavy as all. But you should study or at least read the lecture notes of last lesson in order to catch up in the next lecture. You may skip some lessons if you knows everything as long as there is not quizzes or group exercise in that lesson, which will announce earlier before. But I suggest you to attend every lessons so the spare time spent in studying will be greatly reduced.

reviews.author: kalok
reviews.title: easy for student who have bafs background
reviews.comment_content:
same content with dse bafs
This is a fina course. Professor always talks about stocks, how he short them and earn a fortune. At last, he didnt have enough time to finish the whole acct syllabus. This was a good news to me because those were not in the exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: he clearly explains the concept. good professor
reviews.comment_grading:
good grade if you are bafs student before.
Mid term is 45%
Final is 55%
4 bonus points are given to students who do news sharing or solve problems in class
I got 90/100 in mt, 94.5/100 in final and no bonus points. I got an A.
In the first lesson, he said he would give as many As as possible, and he kept his promise.
reviews.comment_workload: nearly no workloads. just mid term and final

reviews.author: Joey Cheung
reviews.comment_content: DSE BAFS stuff, plus some new topics, like the cash flow statement
reviews.comment_teaching: Kelvin is a passionate guy, you can ask him questions literally anytime and get immediate answers from him. The pace is really fast though, better do revisions right after the lecture if you have not studied bafs before. Do attend the lectures because there are questions in exams that require you to explain on his examples mentioned in the lectures (because I didn't attend the lectures, I lost all marks in this part for the final exam, like 8 marks).
reviews.comment_grading:
Good. I studied BAFS before, so I skipped most of the lectures and just did revisions the night before the mid term exam and the final exam.
Slightly above mean for the mid term,
Not sure about the final exam,
for the practice questions that will be finished in lectures, which will also be counted towards your grade, you should search for sources. :)
Finally got a B+ with not many difficulties.
reviews.comment_workload: Not heavy, if you studied bafs before lol. If you haven't, better find someone to carry you.

reviews.author: Anny
reviews.comment_content: The content is pretty basic because it is designed for beginners. So, content-wise there was nothing really that hard except the few chapter just before the second quiz.
reviews.comment_teaching: She is an amazing teacher, she explains really well and is ready to help you anytime you ask her to.  One of the best professors <3
reviews.comment_grading:
There 2 quizzes and 1 final exam.
The first quiz was pretty easy. However, the second quiz was complicated as the content was pretty complicated. The final exam was really twisted but it was doable. Overall, the course was not that bad and her grading is also pretty too the point. In other words, if you understand the content then you get marks easily
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light as we have to submit homework every week but only 3 questions so pretty doable.

reviews.author: Jenyyyyyy
reviews.comment_content: It is similar to DSE. Many chapters have been covered in secondary school. But some of them are new, and some of the instructors would not teach.
reviews.comment_teaching: It is quite boring. He goes through the ppt and seldom shares some cases.
reviews.comment_grading: It is quite good. It includes 2 quizzes, midterm, final and attendance.  In the class, some students have studied accounting before and the mean is quite high.
reviews.comment_workload: It is very low. You don’t need to do any assignments, but sometimes will ask you to complete some classwork and ask everyone to answer question when he takes attendance at the end of lesson.

reviews.author: sdasdasdas
reviews.title: Introduction of Financial Reports and Accounting
reviews.comment_content:
Simple accounting, if you have learnt BAFs accounting in secondary school, this course is absolutely favorable except you have to adapt to some minor differences.
But generally this is just an introduction to accounting and the contents are the most basic.
reviews.comment_teaching:
she welcomes students to ask her questions after questions and reply questions on canvas quite efficient.
She has very clear ppt supplied and other supplementary notes on lessons if needed.
teaching is fair
a bit boring
but have heart
not bad not bad
reviews.comment_grading:
no DSE bg!!!!
skipped 50% lesson!!!
2 mts almost full mark
final quite good
grade : A+!!!!
reviews.comment_workload:
no workload at all
only attendance and hw
hw very easy, just type anything then hand in would do

One thing worth to mention is participation marks in this course, for my instructor, you have to answer two questions in lessons, this is little bit horrifying because there always some aggressive students to answer questions.

reviews.author: ustbba0
reviews.comment_content:
Most of the contents are covered on HKDSE's BAFS, if you learnt accounting in high school, then the content would be easy to pick up.
Some more advanced accounting would be taught. If you are not familiar with accounting, you may find some difficulty on following the course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching is good, but can be improved, she always type something on her excel files and show a bunch of duplicated equations that can mess you up. Moreover, those contents on the excel would not be on the lecture notes, even those contents are quite essential, so you have to drop them down on your notes or on your laptop quickly, if not she would delete them all soon.

However, she are passionate on her teaching and always try to make things clear as hard as she can, lecture notes are quite good.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework 5%
Participation 5%
Quiz 1 15%
Quiz 2 15%
Final 60%
Homework would not be marked and answers would be provided as she treated it as a "self-practice"

Participation score is given in a weird way, she claimed that discussing on Canvas and be a volunteer on the class would get a higher score on participation, but no attendance would be taken. Although she tried to recognize each one's faces, i don't believe she can remember everyone on the class, but if you aim for higher grading, then just try to ask more questions after class and get her attention, at the end of the semester, she told us to submit a .doc about feedback and participation, but i don't know how she knew what was written on that documents were true or not.

For quizzes, there are two quiz in total, quiz 1 and quiz 2 covers two different section and contents would not duplicate each other on these two quizzes.

Final would cover all the topics.

For grades, i got 9X/100 something in both 2 quizzes and 104/120 in the final exam, finally i got A in this course.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is light, you only have to submit self-practice on CANVAS and prove you have done at least 3 questions, don't forgot to submit them in time.

reviews.author: cecilialam
reviews.comment_content: BAFS accounting model includes most of the financial accounting in the US format. Yet it includes statement of cash flow which maybe quite difficult to catch up. The course also has a fast pace. It covers one and a half year in secondary school syllabus so it would be difficult non-BAFS student to catch up as well.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is basically reading from the power point. In my opinion, he could not explain clearly to students, especially for students who did not study accounting before would find it difficult to understand.
reviews.comment_grading: Generally i think he gives good grades. I passed the mean without getting +1 SD in all marked mid term and quizes. But I got A for this course. Cuz the final has not redistributed so i'm not sure for my performance in final.
reviews.comment_workload:
There is no marks for assignment which means he does not require to finish homework after lessons and hand it in. (Yet, self practice would be important for accounting tho.)

but there are one mid term and two quizes within a semester which maybe harsh when compare to other course in Yr 1 fall sem.

reviews.author: Shirley.shark
reviews.comment_content:
Simple accounting, if you have learnt BAFs accounting in secondary school, this course is absolutely favorable except you have to adapt to some minor differences.
But generally this is just an introduction to accounting and the contents are the most basic.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is good, she welcomes students to ask her questions after questions and reply questions on canvas quite efficient.
She has very clear ppt supplied and other supplementary notes on lessons if needed.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think grading is good, the grading includes in-class exercise, participation, quiz 1, quiz 2, and final.

I got full grades in in-class exercise, participation and quiz 1, 90%in quiz 2(also can be called mid-term), and my final's result is above mean 1sd (sorry for not giving accurate no. as i forgotten) and finally i got A. I think this a reasonable grade for myself.

But never think the final is easy, it is much harder than her quizzes, even she allowed we to have cheat sheet, it is definitely useless because the what her required from the questions is not anything you can get from the notes. So, only advise is do more exercises.
reviews.comment_workload:
We have a in-class exercise every week, but generally she will go through it on lessons, so this is not a problem.
One thing worth to mention is participation marks in this course, for my instructor, you have to answer two questions in lessons, this is little bit horrifying because there always some aggressive students to answer questions.

reviews.author: ivonne
reviews.comment_content: The content taught was useful especially for students who want to learn more about accounting and want to major in accounting
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching style was fun and very clear. Personally, I think he is a very good teacher and as long as you pay attention in his class you will be able to get good grades.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading was okay he was a lenient teacher.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is okay but he will recommend you to solve all the suggested questions which were very useful for me.
Attendance and Participation 5 %
In-class Group Exercises  10 %
Three  In-class Quizzes @ 20 points (drop the lowest one) 10%
Mid-term Exam 35%
Final Examination (non-cumulative) 40%

reviews.author: sing8763
reviews.comment_content:
It's mostly the syllabus of HKDSE BAFS
But some of the parts are changed into US format instead of UK format that we learnt in DSE.
And also some new stuffs like statement of cash flows
reviews.comment_teaching:
In my opinion, he didn't teach really well. Most of the parts he only read the powerpoint.
If you are not good at accounting, I am not suggesting you to register his course as he seldom help you to review some old things. He assumes us to know most of the accounting knowledge.
reviews.comment_grading:
2 midterm and 1 final

and get a B+ at last

reviews.author: Orangeee
reviews.comment_content:
Fundamentals of accounting:
Understanding financial statements
How to produce them
reviews.comment_teaching:
Boring lessons. Just read from the ppt.
Have in class exercises which helps to consolidate the learning of the day.
Need to take attendance and I am taking the 9am lesson so it is fking tiring for me.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair. In the final exam, I only know 1 questions out of 5 of them. Objectively, the exam  is not very difficult. Eventually I stilll get a B. However, in exams, no cheatsheet is allowed.
reviews.comment_workload:
No homework.

reviews.author: annanna
reviews.comment_content: Basic accounting stuff, most of them are in the DSE syllabus
reviews.comment_teaching: His pace is acceptable for me who have no knowledge about accounting. He will take attendance and recognize everyone's names. He is a very nice professor and loves chatting with us. You are recommended to approach him if you want to review your mid term or final papers.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading. Mid term and final are not very challenging and quite easy to score high since most of them are very basic accounting skills. As long as you complete all the exercises given by him, you will know how to do the exams. MC quizzes may be a bit challenging and tricky for beginners.
reviews.comment_workload: No workload, Sometimes he may ask us to do a few exercises and check the answers during lessons.

reviews.author: Oscar Wong
reviews.comment_content: Gerry Li covered all the syllabus required.  He did provide some kind of revision for us before final and mid-term.  He taught according to the powerpoint provided by the publisher.  Those powerpoint were just very brief and he did not provide any reference materials.  He took attendance by reading out your name every lesson.  This contributed to your 10% class participation.  If you are aiming A range then don't skip lessons.
reviews.comment_teaching: In my opinion, Gerry Li's teaching is a disastrous. I didn't learn account in my high school.  I can't understand anything in the first few lessons.  He taught too fast and kept on saying "easy".  I didn't think he considered those who didn't learn accounting before like me.  All my accounting knowledge were taught my mother since she is an accountant.  Just recommend those who learnt accounting before to took his course or those who think they were very very smart.
reviews.comment_grading: Although Gerry Li is not good at teaching, his grade are quite good.  I got above mean about 1 sd, final grade is B+.  And from what I know his final exam is easier than other professors.  Really recommend those who learnt accounting before take his class.
reviews.comment_workload:
No homework, no project, no reading, totally nothing.
Just have some in class exercise.  You can do whatever you want when others are doing the in class exercise since he will review the answer at last in every lesson.  However, if you are aiming A range please do much much more practice.  Those in class exercise will just give you a pass.

reviews.author: Cloud51
reviews.title: Tony, a nice professor.
reviews.comment_content:
Same with what other students wrote, it is a course provides you basic accounting knowledge.

Develop a comprehensive and well-founded knowledge of financial accounting, including
1) Understand the accounting categories: assets, iabilities, equity, revenues and expenses.

2) Understand how an accounting system keeps track of information.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Tony is a nice and funny professor. He tried his best to construct a good atmosphere during the classes.

By the way, in Tony's ACCT 2010 class, there were no Mc questions in all quizzes, exercises and mid-term& final.
