reviews.author: ustkidhere
reviews.title: A required course but you're not required to like it
reviews.comment_content:
For someone completely new to Accounting, the content is at an appropriate level.

The powerpoints are a good summary but textbook dives deeper for your understanding of the material.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Personally, Chen's style of teaching method - reading off powerpoint - did not appeal to me. But when she worked through the solutions on the screen together, it was easier to understand the thought process.

A lot of students stay behind class to ask her questions about the lecture. She responds to questions on the discussion forum at a scarily fast pace and is keen to help her students.

However, you may want to buy the textbook since there simply isn't enough time to explain all the material during lectures, so it will help you further understand all the concepts. Definitely pick a few exercises to work on, especially before the quizzes, since she  uses similar question structure on her exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
The midterms are relatively easy, but the final will fuck you up. She lets you bring a cheat sheet to the final but it's useless.

If you're new to this course like I am, just remember there are plenty of people who have taken Accounting before, so if you think you did well in the quizzes and exams but still got a shit grade, it's probably because there are way too many people pulling the curve up.
reviews.comment_workload: There isn't much workload at all. The only required work you do are the in-class exercises, which she goes through in class so all you have to do is copy down what she's writing on the board. You can get the participation marks simply by answering two of her questions in class. If you still don't get the participation marks near the end of semester, she makes sure you get a fair chance by picking you to answer her questions.

reviews.author: Cso2017
reviews.title: Decent
reviews.comment_content: Basic fundamentals of BAFS which is similar to the F.4 and F.5 syllabus of HKDSE. Concepts such as T-account, accruals and prepayments would be introduced, the basic financial statements would be introduced as well. If you studied BAFS in secondary school, this course is a piece of cake, the only new concept would be cash flow statement.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He has a slow pace of teaching, so slow so that even a starter could understand the basic concepts clearly. However, if you want to truly understand how it applies to the exam questions, you really need to work on the accounting exercises in the textbook. His in-class practices and examples are clearly insufficient. His notes would highlight the most important point and I would judge those as decent. You could understand the basics by reading his notes but if you want to know the tricky ones, the notes would not bring you much help.

His tone is dull and boring. So if you register his morning class, endeavour not to fall asleep!

No attendance taken.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is composed of 4 parts.
1. Midterm (25%)
2. Final (50%)
3. ethics case project (15%)
4. Participation (10%)

For midterm and final, if you have a clear mind on all concepts and have gone through sufficient exercises, you would probably excel in those. The marks in midterm are quite close and the mean is around 56/70 for my class. I don't data on final so can't help that.

For ethics case project, you are given sufficient time to do it. Don't rush and fully comprehend the requirements. Dr Mak would give sufficient guidings so it won't be too tough. Make sure you do enough researches. Again, no data on it.

For participation, some would refer to the performance of your in-class practices, some would refer to your participation in answering the questions. For in-class practices, there would be a total of about 8-10 practices and he would only take the highest 4 for grading. The practices would be done in the group format. Find somebody who knows BAFS and there is nothing to worry. the mean of each practice is around 90% of the full mark. For real participation, although he stressed the importance of answering his questions to the final grading, I just ignore him and I still get A- in this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
not much at all. Most probably the ethics case project would be the heaviest workload, though you would be given around one month to work on it. All out-class exercises are voluntary base and answers would be provided on canvas.

In terms of workload, this course and this instructor is a haven.

reviews.author: Gamma Yam
reviews.comment_content:
Accounting is the language of business. In this course you will learn how to "speak" and "read" this new language. The course is designed to provide an overview of financial accounting so that, upon completion of the course, you will be able to read, interpret and analyze corporate financial reports.

Syllabus:
Ch1: Financial Statements and Business Decisions
Ch2: Investing and Financing Decisions and the Accounting System
Ch3: Operating Decisions and the Accounting System
Ch4: Adjustments, Financial Statements, and the Quality of Earnings
Ch6: Sales Revenue, Receivables, and Cash
Ch7: Cost of goods sold and inventory
Ch8: Property, plant, and equipment
Ch9&10: Reporting liabilities
Ch11: Owners’ equity
Ch12: Statement of cash flows

With using the same chapter in the book - Libby, Libby, and Hodge. Financial Accounting, 9th edition (2017), McGraw-Hill/Irwin.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not bad.
reviews.comment_grading:
-In-class exercises 24%
-Class participation 6%
-Quiz 1 10%
-Quiz 2 20%
-Final exam 40%
reviews.comment_workload: Not too much.

reviews.author: Vicky Ip
reviews.title: Cheat sheet means nothing
reviews.comment_content: This course involves basic accounting stuff. It contains many DSE BAFS syllabus. If you have studied BAFS before, probably you will not have many problems in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is willing to answer your questions after the lecture. But she taught very fast so it may be hard to catch up if you are not familiar with basic accounting stuff.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is quite fair I think. Students who didn't study BAFS in secondary schools don't need to worry because the accounting treatment for some topics are different from DSE.
There are 2 quizzes (actually the 2 quizzes are midterm exams) and 1 final exam.  
For the first quiz, I got 93/100 while the mean is 88.2/100, median is 91/100, s.d. is 12.7. For the second quiz, I got 98/100 while the mean is 82.3/100, median is 83/100, s.d. is 12. For the final exam, I got 120/172 while the mean is 88.3/172, s.d. is 28. At last I got an A.
The professor allows to bring 1 cheat sheet to the exam. However, the cheat sheet can't help any in the exam and the final exam is very hard.
reviews.comment_workload:
I don't think there's any workload at all compared to other courses. It is required to do in-class exercise after 1 chapter is finished. But the professor will discuss the answer of the in-class exercise in class. If you attend the lecture, probably you can directly submit the answer. Also, those exercise only carry 1 mark each so no matter you did it correct or wrong you would get full mark of the exercise.
For the class participation mark, you only need to answer 2 questions in class and you will get full mark in class participation.

reviews.author: betweenfragment
reviews.comment_content: This course covers basic accounting principles. The content of this course is not difficult for students with an accounting background. For those of you who studied HKDSE BAFS, you should be able to catch up with little effort. However, the accounting approaches are somehow different from the hkdse syllabus. You should be able to identify the differences and ask questions when you feel you're uncomfortable with the conflicting parts. Rather than testing your ability to write out T-accounts etc, it requires you to analyze financial statements and using class examples to explain certain concepts in midterm/final.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I will advise you not to skip any of the lessons. (I know his tone is kinda flat) Class examples will appear in midterm/final. (I remember it costs 9/100 so yeah)
Kelvin is passionate towards teaching. He helps students by providing extra classes in Saturdays and stays behind to answer students' inquiries after-class. A nice professor who will ensure that his students understand everything so his teaching pace is slower compared to other professors.
reviews.comment_grading:
Only 1 midterm.
Mean for midterm ~75%
Not easy to score above 90% as the MC questions are pretty tricky LQ are straightforward though so make sure you understand every single detail in ppt
The level of difficulty for final is quite high for weaker/ students with no accounting background. Make sure you don't procrastinate and do sufficient exercises. (I felt like I screwed up in final))
My result:
I got 1 SD higher than the mean in midterm
Marks for final and case study are not disclosed to students.
At last, I got an A- for this course.
Don't underestimate the importance of answering questions in class.
Caution: Getting level 5+ in hkdse bafs can also lead you to C range if you skip all classes.
reviews.comment_workload:
1. Participation: practice questions will be distributed in class in which you are required to work in groups of 4-5. You will be working with different people so your groupmates matter (Don't worry, only the best 4 assignments will be counted as your participation mark)
2. Case study- apply ethical concepts (reference materials will be given) to real-life situations, not difficult if you've done sufficient research
3. Midterm- tricky MC questions
4. Final- again, very tricky MC questions. Require some effort to tackle the LQs

reviews.author: Nicole MA
reviews.comment_content:
She teaches more than textbook and is relatively flexible compared to the book because she moves some similar contents together to help us understand better.
Textbook is recommended if you are new to accounting or want to get a good grade.
Sometimes there are too much to understand in one class, so it is a good idea to preview the notes or the book.
reviews.comment_teaching: CHEN is very nice and is willing to answer questions in class and after class. If you are struggling with a specific chapter, you can make an appointment and she is always helpful.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is nice.
In-Class Exercises 24%
Class Participation 6%
Quiz 1 10%
Quiz 2 20%
Final Exam 40%
The marks from participation are hard to get at the beginning but very easy if you wait until later. She makes sure that if you want to get the mark, you will get it.
The quizzes are relatively easy compared to the final. The final has a mean about 50 out of 100.
reviews.comment_workload:
The assigned workload is not very big but if you want to get a good grade you should do the exercises after each chapter. CHEN recommend some questions but it's a good idea to do as many as you can.
There are in-class exercises after each chapter to submit online, but she always shows us how to solve it in class, so the assignment becomes easy to finish.

reviews.author: luminous
reviews.title: teaching is really bad
reviews.comment_content: Quite general with basic accounting principles and knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching: Actually, as a beginner with no knowledge in accounting before, I found it hard to follow at first because his speed is fast. Gerry would choose some questions for exercise in class but he seldom explained it very clearly, I often got confused with some details in some long essay questions and had to work out on my own. Quite a few times I remembered that I was not able to tell how those solutions made sense and I spent some time struggling. And he thinks all questions are so easy that we should work out them instantly. But without guidance and explanation, how are we able to figure them out? I would say you wouldn't learn much by lectures in his course, you have to work on your own really hard.
reviews.comment_grading:
Two quizzes, 30 MC questions in each. The first one takes up 10%, the second 15%,
  One midterm, 25%  4 long essay questions
  Final, 40%  5 long essay questions
  Attendance, 10%
  
  Gerry will take attendance each time so you'd better attend the lecture.
  For me
  quiz 1 21/30 (mean 22.4)
  quiz 2 27/30 (mean 20.5)
  midterm 98/100 (mean 83.4)
  final is unknown since he didn't release the scores but I view my final satisfactory.
  Got A+ at last
  I don't know the grading curve and the mean. To be honest, I spent quite time in this course. In order to get A or above, hard work is necessary; pay attention to details, though long essay questions in final, Gerry tried to test you some small points covered in book.
reviews.comment_workload:
It's all up to you. Gerry will leave some homework but it's optional, you don't have to hand in, just for self-practice. And the homework comes from the book. So it's all your choice.
  For me, I tried to finish the homework, or rather, self-practice after his lecture but later on I only managed to finish it just before exam. If you really want to learn something in this course, practice is necessary. And it WILL take a bit of time to finish the homework.  But as I have mentioned above, it's all up to you.
  According to my personal experience, the workload ranks C.

reviews.author: Sean 翔
reviews.title: Really good course! Highly recommended.
reviews.comment_content: The textbook used in this course is "Financial Accounting 9E", as Xinlei tried really well to introduce almost all the contents included in the textbook, she covered almost all basic topics in accounting. As a Taiwanese, I've never taken any kind of business courses during my secondary school, not to mention Accounting. But, Xinlei all starts with basic stuffs in order to help us form complete and correct concepts for accounting. Therefore, there is no difficulties for people with no accounting background to take this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Xinlei is really an instructor full of passion. Despite being her first year to teach, I still were overwhelmed by her confidence in teaching which was not even close to any other amateur. She is really willing to help students through any aspects. For instance, I clearly remembered that when she was teaching "Balance Sheet", there were quite a lot of new terms for us to recognize. As she found that it was a difficulty for some of us, she uploaded a file full of detailed definitions for all terms for us to study right after class, which was really helpful and considerate. She is also aware of the performance students did, when you didn't do well on quizzes, she will be there for you to ask and vanish all your problems. Really good instructor beyond words.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 5%
-She will try hard to recognize every students' name, which is really respectful. She will ask many questions and ask students to answer in front of the class in almost every lectures, but it will all base on volunteer, so it is quite easy to earn this 5% in class.
P.S. Xinlei like to chat with students before and after the lecture, try to talk to her, she will really help you out much.

After-class Practice Problems 5%
Basically is the assignment part, easy to get full mark.
                                                             
Quiz 1 15% I got 94/100.(Abt 1~1.5 SD)
Quiz 2 15% I got 93/100.(Abt 1~1.5 SD)
Final exam 60% I got 103.5/120 (Abt 1 SD )

Above all I got an A, quite good grading.
reviews.comment_workload:
Almost no workload, no participation but you will not want to miss any lectures since it's really wonderful.
Assignments are based on the questions from the textbook, worth practicing and not hard.

reviews.author: Takeshikanshiro
reviews.comment_content:
I have not studied accounting in secondary school. Some of my friends who studied BAFS(Accounting) in secondary school got very good grades but they say that it is more advanced than that in HKDSE.
The course covers from basic concepts of accounting to a wide range of topics include bonds, statement of cah flow, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Chen's presentation is clear and she is very nice. She likes to have interaction with the students and very willing to answer any questions no matter during or out of the class.
reviews.comment_grading:
around 12 In class exercises that accounts for around 24%
Participation accounts for 6% ( 3% per question answered )
Quiz 1 10%
Quiz 2 20%
Quizzes are quite easy so the mean of them are very high
Final 40%
Final is very very difficult

The grading is quite 'broken' in my opinion. Quiz 1,2 , final above 1 or almost 1 sd yet I got a B
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is okay. Remember to hand in in-class exercises on time otherwise 2-3% of total grade would be deducted per submission missed.

reviews.author: Cherry Kua
reviews.title: Double sided cheat sheet is useless
reviews.comment_content:
Basic accounting concepts
have simple/short ppts
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is good with quite fluent English
have quite a lot of interaction in class
reviews.comment_grading:
In class 24%
Participation 6%
Quiz 1 10%
Quiz 2 20%
Final 40%

only required to answer two questions to fulfill participation mark
2 quizzes are relatively easy to get a good grade, but final is SUPER difficult, cheat sheet is useless in the final exam and the mean is low (8x/160)
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is light, only have some in-class exercise (one in-class exercise is equaled to 3% of in-class)
have some optional before class reading, which some of them are for earning participation mark next class

reviews.author: suet
reviews.comment_content: More than half of the topic had been covered in the HKDSE BAFS (accounting) syllabus, so it's easy for those who studied accounting before. However, the topic on bad debts and allowance for doubtful account will be a different from what students learnt before.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching pace is quite good, as she will ask from time to time whether we understand the topics. Review will also be done after difficult topics are taught. She is a nice professor, and will answer every question you ask her after class.
reviews.comment_grading: As a student who study accounting before, it's easy to have A or above. The mean is a bit high though. The range of this course is quite large and there are many people who are scoring full marks in quizzes.
reviews.comment_workload: There will be in-class exercises for every topic taught, it will be good for learning if you had done those. Most of the answers of the in-class exercise are given in class. Students are required to answer at least two questions in order to gain full mark for participation mark.

reviews.author: Doug Stamper
reviews.title: Not bad
reviews.comment_content:
Frankly speaking, if you have done well in the HKDSE, you have no excuse in failing this course.
First of all, this course is a general ledger-based course, implying that T-accounts AREN'T needed. Thus, if you excel in error correcting and above all, general journal, things would be easier.
Second, there aren't many new concepts. I can only recall the statement of cash flow, division of common stock and repurchase of common stock as new concepts.
Third, the answer is out there. Just don't make things complicated. This course resembles a simplified version of HKDSE, for example, when there is an estimation of allowance for doubtful debt, this course would ask you to Dr. bad debt Cr. allowance for doubtful debt. I have seen many classmates, including myself, of course, struggled to accept this fact. So my suggestion is--find the difference between this course and HKDSE and adapt to it. That's all.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Do not be deceived by this grading. I ain't suggesting that Kelvin is a mediocre instructor, or professor, whatever you like, despite I had seen his title as professor in his office.
He's passionate in teaching. There are a few examples supporting this statement.
1. Janitor on LSK's accounting department has applauded Kelvin as "an humble and amicable professor who is willing to answer anyone's question
2. I have witnessed him staying behind lectures and encompassed by a knot of students for at least an hour.
3. Well, this is on the record, which is he made extra classes on Saturday in LSK, despite the fact that I HAD NEVER attended any of those. Lel.
4. By the way, he focus on "conceptual understanding", which I don't give a **** coz here's the case: if you have studied BAFS, there isn't a need for you to understand A=S+L while if you haven't studied BAFS, may god bless you.
Lamentably, several examples disapproved the above statement.
1. His tone resembles your most boring teacher in secondary or primary school.
2. I have attended all his lectures and I have slept in quite a lot of them.
Here are some tips from me:
1. First, Kelvin speaks English fluently, in my opinion. But, according to my observation, he loves to say "in other words". So, if you find him not saying this, this maybe an impostor. Lel.
2. Second, Kelvin asked us to "pick up the convention" in doing general journals. In other words, follow his order and pick up the convention by writing narratives.
3. Third, there are in-class activities. Those exercises are EXTREMELY simple if you, again, do well in HKDSE's BAFS. So, here's the tip, if you have never got your ass on BAFS, it's my advice to find partners who have BAFS background. But, according to my experience, if you find this difficult, it's either your problem or doomsday of HKUST SBM.
4. Last but not least, well, I am more than certain that I didn't abuse the phrase "last but not least" cause I believe this is really the most crucial. FIND A COMPANY WHO IS HUMOROUS!!! This is really crucial because attending his lectures, given that you excel in secondary's BAFS, would bring you endless sleeps. You need a humorous, or pretty, either of them or both, classmate to keep you awake.
That's all for his teaching part.
reviews.comment_grading:
Frankly speaking, I have forgotten the distribution of percentage of different assessments.
Again, do not be deceived by the grading.
But I would say this course's transparency is an abomination.
Ok, let's go through the four assessments first.
1. in-class participation
2. mid-term
3. case study of ethics study
4. final
So, let me go through the tips briefly,
1. Again, those in-class exercises are nothing except jokes.
They are extremely easy, implying that you limit of score should ALWAYS be tending to 10, which is the maximum score.
2. Again, the mid-term inherited the simplicity.
I would say the SD is rather small, 10 out of 70. IDK
Kelvin loves to assess his students by MC
So, be careful
Long questions aren't the main character
Thus, focus on conceptual understanding.
3. Case study is an abomination.
First, the grades aren't disclosed.
Second, it's difficult
therefore, no tips at all
4. Again, the final is about simplicity again
It resembles part A of HKDSE's BAFS.
That's all
I scored A-
A bit sad, tho
reviews.comment_workload: nothing at all

reviews.author: USTAsiaNo1
reviews.title: Helpful and funny lecturer
reviews.comment_content:
Included all basic thing

/

Reading and preparing balance sheet, income statement, cash flow statement, statement of stockholders' equity
Also included some professional ethics in accounting
reviews.comment_teaching:
BEST

/

I attended every lecture since I love his teaching style.
He always use real-life example to explain what he is teaching
He also explained most detail that you need to know
He is kind and willing to answer your question
reviews.comment_grading:
Average

/

For me, I never studied any business related subject in secondary school. It may be a huge disadvantage for you to catch up since some, or even most of the student had been built up the foundation but you have to start from 0.

/

For the class activity every week, I strongly suggest you look for some strong teammates with you to finish it, it will help you (your grade) a lot.

Also, there is a small case study on professional ethics, which need only a few days to finish, kind of easy job.

/

Class activity 10%
Case study 15%
MT exam 25%, mean:53/70
Final exam 50%, result and stats will not be released (until now)

/

For me,
class activity got abt 8/10
mt got 53/70, which is the mean
the final grade is B-
so... for grading, not good, not bad
reviews.comment_workload:
Fair

/

As I said, I have no business background at all
I spent quite a lot of time to build up my accounting knowledge from 0.

For the average student, It should be light workload. Since no home assignment is required, only 1 case study.

However, since most of the student is having a similar background, you have to work particularly hard to be the best one in the class.

reviews.author: tatgor
reviews.comment_content:
-Very similar to DSE BAFS
-students who had studied BAFS may find it boring
-didn’t cover very deep, theoretical kind of things
-teaching materials combine with some real-life examples
-textbook is not necessary, just reading the powerpoint slides for revision is more than enough
reviews.comment_teaching:
-Boring, but to be fair accounting is quite boring in nature.
- students with no accounting background may find it difficult to follow
- very patient when she is answering questions
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1
Mean: 87.9/100
Standard deviation: 12.7

Quiz 2
Mean: 82/100
Standard deviation: 12

Final
Mean: 88/172
Standard deviation: 28

I got 97,96 and 118 in the mid-terms and final. The final grade is A
reviews.comment_workload:
- one webwork every week
- the webwork are very easy
- the mid-terms are quite easy
- the final is very difficult with unclear and confusing questions

reviews.author: Veronnica
reviews.title: Nice Professor,but large reading task
reviews.comment_content: The professor roughly covered all the required contents.But it's still kind of hard to learn it for the beginners. I see that there are some local students who learnt accounting before in their secondary school. It seems that most of the contents are relevant to what was taught in their high school, so they may handle it relatively relaxed.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very patient, but the speed is kind of fast. I felt hard to follow at the beginning.BTW, Gerry likes to check attendance every lecture a few minutes before it ends. Sometimes I feel it hard to follow the professor since he talks too fast and it takes me, a beginner, quite a long time to understand the content rather than just memory.
reviews.comment_grading:
I feel hard to get satisfactory grades as it is hard for me. But it is easy for the locals with relative learning backgrounds.
There are two quizzes plus one midterm and one final exam.
Each of the quiz has 30 MC choice.
The midterm and final exam covers the questions you need to write and there are no MC questions in midterm exam and final exam.
Frankly speaking, the grading is reasonable, which means, if you want to get an A or above, you have to either learnt it before or work really hard.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload mainly lied in the reading  o the book. If you are the person who has professional reading skills, then no worry is needed.And it did take me much time to prepare for the tests as there are a lot of questions in the books.

reviews.author: Yu012120
reviews.comment_content: Basic accounting stuff. Mostly learnt if you are a DSE BAFS student.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Li welcome questions in class even if it is not quite related to the teaching content. If you have any thing that you dont quite understand, you can just ask him.
reviews.comment_grading: Above mean in quiz, sd were not released, above mean by less than one sd in mid term, final score was not released and got an A-. The grading is not quite bad I suppose.
reviews.comment_workload: Small to none if you are a DSE BAFS student but I imagined it would not be quite relaxing if you knew nothing about accounting.

reviews.author: ducky
reviews.title: Recommend to those who do not have account backgrounds
reviews.comment_content:
Basic accounting topics. Those who studied BAFS in DSE curriculum will benefit a lot. However, there are still some topics that are new and need to spend some time to understand even for those who studied before. For example, statement of cash flow, Owners' equity.
***Kelvin does not cover 'bond' this topic. Most of my friends who are taught by other prof said the topic is very challenging. So for those who do not interest in choosing account as a major or who do not have account background, it is better to choose Kelvin.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kelvin is very passionate, who is willing to answer students' questions during and after lessons and through emails. But he answers email very late (approximately 4-5 days). So it is better to ask him earlier before exams. His class is not very boring, but as mentioned before, for those who studied account before, the class may be too basic. He explains concepts clearly. He also emphasized on the background and reasons for each transaction and accounting equations(tested in exams). It is easy to follow what he is saying. There will be practice questions after each topic which are due on class. It is group works so better to find those who have studied BAFS before. Otherwise, you may find it hard to finish. Just feel free to ask Kelvin when facing difficulties in doing the practice question. However, some of his instructions of the practice questions or the question itself, are not clear. Notes will be uploaded to canvas. Some concepts or points will not be written in the notes, but they will be tests in exams. There is a question in the final, "using the example that I explained in the class to illustrate...(9marks)" so for those who does not attend the class will GG. So better to attend the class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class activities and participation 10%
Case about professional ethics 15% (homework-self work)
Mid term 25%
Final exam 50%

Class activities and participation are gained by the practice questions done in class. No need to answer prof questions during lessons can still score high.
Both midterm and final are not very difficult if you attend every lesson. No tips will be provided before exams.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy. There is only one homework in the whole semester. However, the homework is quite demanding. It is an essay about accounting ethics. Students are required to write max. 2 pages. There will be guideline given in the lesson and on canvas.

reviews.author: lcyxd
reviews.comment_content: Covered some topics in DSE BAFS syllabus (so you definitely have an advantage if you have studied BAFS before) but there are some differences in accounting treatments.The most difficult topics would be bonds, time value of money and statements of cash flow.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is very patient in answering questions and would slow down the teaching pace when requested. She also provides detailed solutions to practice questions covered in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
In class 24%
Participation 6%
Quiz 1 10%
Quiz 2 20%
Final 40%

Quiz 1 max: Quiz 2 above 1 SD; Final above 2 SD
Final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
In-class exercises are covered during lectures - easy to finish.
Class participation marks can be gained by answering questions twice.
The quizzes are relatively easy but final exam is cumulative and much harder (cheat-sheet is allowed)

reviews.author: phoebebeyee
reviews.comment_content: The course provides us first insight towards Accounting stuff. If you are a new guy towards accounting, you'd better buy a textbook for your reference to build your concept. Concept is very important in accounting. Only relying the powerpoint notes is not sufficient to deal with Homework and Quizzes. And there are lots of students studied BAFs before, the mean is quite  high.
reviews.comment_teaching: It is boring, the powerpoint do not present the concept clearly and the professor explain them poorly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term is 45%
Final is 55%
The grading will be different when you got a little difference in your marks.
reviews.comment_workload: Only two exam needed. But it is quite hard to get high marks for new comers.

reviews.author: vino
reviews.comment_content: The content is okay. As a student with no accounting background in high school, it was a bit hard at the beginning. However, the pace of the whole course wasnt too fast which allows students like me to catch up really quick.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Xinlei is a great professor who is able to explain things clearly. The interaction in class was extraordinary good. She cares about students' learning progress and she answers the question after class patiently and tried her very best to explain things as clear as possible.

I like her teaching style very much as I am able to understand most of the content of this course even though i have no acct background in high school.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments(5%)
Weekly textbook exercises
Participation(5%)
Gain from raising/ answering question in class or on canvas discussion board
2 quiz (each 15%)
Both quiz are basically a revision of the in class exercises. It wont be too hard as long as you attend the class
Final(60%)
Some questions are pretty challenging but the difficulty of the exam is acceptable

For me:
Assignment 10/10
Quiz 1:  96/100      mean86.4 SD10
Quiz 2 97/100     mean79.4 SD14
Final 106/120   mean88.6 SD15

Got A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is okay. Homework every week but only 3 questions are required.

Gain points through submission, model ans was provided before deadline.

reviews.author: cwyyy
reviews.comment_content: Basic accounting concepts like writing journal entries, depreciation and inventory systems. Would be good if you have studied BAFS before. I find the professor's notes kind of useless.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite boring. I have not studied BAFS before and I have no clue for what she is doing in lessons. She did not really explain everything clearly during lessons. The professor is patient to answer your questions after lesson though.
reviews.comment_grading:
The first two quizzes (mid-terms) are easy so the mean is pretty high.
Mean for Quiz 1 (counts 10% of course grade) : 87/100
Mean for Quiz 2 (counts 20% of course grade) : 82/100
The final is SUPER SUPER hard and I was not prepared for that. The mean is only 88/172. Your grade heavily depends on final exam as it counts 40% of the course.

For Professor Chen's lesson, you have to answer 2 questions to gain credits for class participation mark. (Class participation mark: 6 credits, 3 credit for each question you answered)
reviews.comment_workload: Only one in-class exercise for each topic. The professor will cover the solution in lesson. Basically you just need to copy the solution she has gone through in lesson in order to gain credits.

reviews.author: kiwifruit
reviews.comment_content: Tony's class is the most difficult class among all other professors, unlike other professors, he uses a different textbook to teach the course, and he includes extra concepts that do not appear in other prof's notes. The things taught before midterm is quite easy because it was quite similar to the DSE BAFS. However, after midterm, the level of difficulty increased and it was nothing like BAFS, especially for the bonds payable part, it drives me crazy to memorize the journal entries for that. If u want to challenge yourself or want to major in acct, his class should fit you a lot.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is humorous and it is hard to fell asleep in his class because he is always enthusiastic and his voice is clear! However, his teaching pace is really quick so u need to catch up with the concepts by yourself if u don't understand. Also, because many people ask useless questions in order to gain participation marks, he sometimes used too much time to answer those questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair. The midterm and final is not hard if u have done the exercises in the book. However, there are always one or two quizzes or in-class exercises that are super difficult.   

Almost all of my quizzes and in-class exercises are above mean. Midterm exam mean: 94.5/130   
I scored 12X/130. Final exam scores not released but I think I did ok.  Finally got an A.
reviews.comment_workload:
Need to work on the book exercise if u want to understand the concepts well. Not many quizzes before midterm but after midterm there was 1 quiz/ 1 in-class exercise every week so the workload was heavy.

PS  Although the 5% participation mark encourages ppl to ask questions in class, it does not really matter because I never asked questions in class (although I did not skip any of his classes), and I eventually got an A, so study well and u will be fine.

reviews.author: checkitonce
reviews.comment_content: Nothing special. It's just same as the other profs.I havn't studied bafs before so i have no ideas if it is similar to the dse syllabus.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite good. As a beginner in accounting, actually i understand what she is saying, at least her english is easy understand. She gave many examples in class which helps understanding
reviews.comment_grading:
first mt:90/100(mean 88)
second mt:77/100(mean 83)
final:73/172 (mean 88.6)
I still manage to get B-, good grade!
class parti and hw full mark
reviews.comment_workload: quite no of in class exercise, but simple and easy. actually even if u did wrong, no marks will be deducted. Class participation is easy to get, just answer 2 questions then you will get full mark in class participation. No attendance taking, if u have learnt bafs before, u can skip the lessons

reviews.author: ip
reviews.comment_content:
deeper than DSE bafs topics + some additional topics

pay attention to several difference in formats/acct rules between DSE and acct 2010
(It's good to get a textbook/ e-book even for previous edition theres not much diff anyway)
reviews.comment_teaching:
The ppt is clear. It serves as a guide for you to read the textbook yourself as it points out the main points of the textbook.

She gives some tips before quizzes.
reviews.comment_grading:
good grade.
normally get a B range.

some statistics:
quiz 1 mean 88
quiz 2 mean 82
final exam mean 88/172 sd 28

I'm above mean 0.3 sd, 0.8 sd and 0.4 sd for quiz 1 2 and final exam respectively, finally a B+.

Thank you Chen Szu Fan.
reviews.comment_workload:
super light.
just upload the in class ex (normally ans will be discussed beforehand during lessons)

reviews.author: economist
reviews.title: Good grade even I don't study BAFS previously
reviews.comment_content:
Textbook: Financial Accounting, Jamie Pratt, 9th edition, Wiley
Chapt. 1-4, 6-7, 9-12, 14
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony teaches quite fast and I need to digest during my leisure time. But it's gd if you are accounting major(like me though I will change it later) as he teaches more than other lecturers > gd for those love learning
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme       %
Attendance and Participation 5
In-class Group Exercises  10
Three  In-class Quizzes @ 20 points each (drop the lowest one) 10
Mid-term Exam 35
Final Examination (non-cumulative) 40    
TOTAL   100
Note: There will be no extra credit assignments under any circumstance.

My grade= A
Attendance and Participation 5(full I guess since I always ask Tony question  :D )
In-class Group Exercises 10+10+7 /30
In-class Quizzes 10(FULL)
Mid-term Exam 84/100 (+0.7sd)
Final Exam # score not released (but I think should be gd as I know nearly all of this) PS Rmb to revise perpetual method in inventory cost flow assumption as not mentioned in note if you have problem in this, go ask Tony <100percent appear in Final exam>
My exam tips to you all if you take Tony lesson!! Very important very important very important
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite large if you don't take BAFS in secondary school like me. But Well begun is half-done. Practice all suggested question in HW(not compulsory) and you will get gd grade( this is the unchanged rule forever)
Do enough practice before quiz!!
Add oil!!

reviews.author: goschoolbybus
reviews.title: Basic knowledge of ACCT
reviews.comment_content:
Four fundamental statements: income statement, balance sheet, statement of stockholders’ equity, statement of cash flow
Inventory, Account Receivable, bonds, value of cash
reviews.comment_teaching: A little bit boring but she is nice and patient to answer any questions even if the answers are obvious.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grade. Mean is B.
Quiz 1:10%
Quiz 2:20%
Class participation: 6%
In class exercise: 24%
Final: 40%
Just need to answer 2 easy questions in class, you can get full marks of class participation.
I got full marks on class participation, in class exercise, and quiz 1; 92/100 on quiz 2 which mean is 82 with 12 sd; 132/172 on final which mean is 88 with 28 sd and I got A.
reviews.comment_workload: Just 12 in class exercises which are the questions on PPTs and she will give answers on the class before the ddl.

reviews.author: smallpotatoes
reviews.title: Light workload but fair teaching
reviews.comment_content: Fair.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is fair. But i gave him C is because he doesn't care about what you are doing in lesson, even though he asks you questions in lesson, you can simply say idk so you can choose not to answer.
reviews.comment_grading:
He takes attendance so you have to attend most of his lessons.
Also, unlike some professors, we have non-accumulative scope so only 5 chapters are in the scope in final while others need to revise the whole book. And his papers are easy if you have done some of the textbook exercise.
Midterm: 92/100
Quiz1: 25/30
Quiz2: 22/30
Final: unknown

Grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload: No assignments at all.

reviews.author: Goldfish
reviews.title: ACCT2010
reviews.comment_content:
24%in-class exercise
6%class participation(answer 2 question during lesson)
10%Quiz1
20%Quiz2
40%Final
reviews.comment_teaching:
ordinary dun expect too much
Reading textbook by yourself is recommended.
reviews.comment_grading:
splendid
If you upload in-class exercise to canvas on time and attempt those 2 questions , you can easily get the basic 30%of the course.
Even Quiz1&2 just get mean and
final getting below mean 0.2 S.D. still get a B
reviews.comment_workload:
very low
Just copy in-class material then upload them to canvas as in-class exercise Quiz1 is a piece of cake
Quiz2 is ordinary paper
Final is mission impossible

reviews.author: wen moon ser
reviews.comment_content: Content is basically DSE accounting part plus some extension parts. If you have accounting backgrounds, it will definitely easy for you to catch up, but some knowledge would be very difficult to handle if you don’t have some business background. Not very difficult overall.
reviews.comment_teaching: Xinlei provides good and clear explanation for every concepts. On the other hand, she provides classwork for us to do as a concept checker. Besides, she will do together with us step by step.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework 5%(only consider whether you have handed in)
Participation 5%(discussion on canvas, volunteer to answer questions and raise questions)
Quiz 1 15% ( first 1/3 of the syllabus)
Quiz 2 15% ( next 1/3 of the syllabus)
Final 60% (cover all topics)

I got 94/100 and 93/100 in quiz 1 and 2 respectively both are around mean plus 1SD. My final got a 118/120 which is mean plus 2SD. With all homework handed in and active participation, I got an A+ finally. (Really fierce competition)
reviews.comment_workload: Not so heavy. Only three questions per week. And 2 quizzes and 1 final.

reviews.author: Sigggggggg
reviews.comment_content: The course is about the fundamentals of accounting, it would be great for those who have studied it before in high school. However, there are some differences in between so be careful as the accounting rules will change. Szu Fan does not take attendance or in class quiz. She only ask questions and u need to respond 2 questions to get a full mark in participation. (She will offer chance for those who skip class to answer question at the last 2 weeks of semester, and she will tell you which question to be asked and how to respond , what a good teacher) By the way she will use some interesting examples, like tesla and more.
reviews.comment_teaching: She is a very good teacher. Even though she looks harsh, but there are some interesting interactions in class. Also, she is willing to respond to people's questions on canvas (so even u did not ask , u can see the questions raised by other students and szu fan's response at the canvas). She will also give out some points to be tested for midterms(but not final). She is really a good teacher and should register her course!!!!
reviews.comment_grading:
Weighting :
In-class exercises 24%
Class participation 6%
Quiz 1 10%
Quiz 2 20%
Final exam 40%
Total 100%

For in-class exercise, all people get full mark
For class participation, you answer 1 question and you get 3 marks, the mean for the class is 5.1/6 (Well if you are not shy to ask Szu Fan ,you should get 6/6)
Szu Fan's mid terms are not too hard
mt 1 : mean:88.2/100 sd: 12
mt 2 : mean:82.3/100 sd: 12
But her final is hard af
final : mean: 88.3/172 sd: 28
I got full mark in in-class exercise+participation=30/30
full mark in mt 1 =10/10
91/100 in mt 2 = 18.2/20
125/172 in final = 29.04/40
Total : 87.27/100
Guess what, i got an A from the course, which is very good grade!!!! (P.S. i haven't studied any bit of accounting in my high school)
reviews.comment_workload:
Around 1 in class exercise per week, which are the examples in the ppt slide. She will teach you how to do or even give you the answer.(According to Szu Fan, she mentioned that no matter you submit a blank word file or full of text document, she will give you marks for homework anyways)

Extra workload is that you can make a two sided cheatsheet for final but it is completely useless.

reviews.author: ReBoom
reviews.title: Beautiful and friendly professor
reviews.comment_content: This course is all about the basic accounting principle. It is easy for those who have studied BAFS in high school. However, for those who have never ever learned accounting may find it a little bit difficult at the beginning.
reviews.comment_teaching: She is an excellent professor. Not only because she speaks English really clearly; furthermore, she is extremely a friendly and careful professor. She would try her best to let everyone know what she teaches in her class. If you don't know some part in  her class and ask her after class, she would always be really willing to answer your questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
ASSIGNMENT(5%)
You need to hand in your homework every week for the chapter she taught last week. She would give you a list of exercises and you need to choose at least three of them every time.

PARTICIPATION(5%)
You need to raise your hand to answer questions in the class or you can answer and ask questions on the Canvas discussion board. At the end of the semester she would ask all of you to write a participation feedback and you need to write how many time have you answered questions in the class or on the canvas. Don't cheat on this because she is really good at remembering ppl's face and name.

2*QUIZ(each 15%)
Both quizzes are very easy as long as you do study.

FINAL(60%)
Final is hard. Very very hard.

For me:
Assignment 10/10
1quiz 94/100      mean86.4 SD10
2quiz 91/100.     mean79.4 SD14
final 100.5/120   mean88.6 SD15
and I got A at the end.
reviews.comment_workload: It is heavy compared to other lectures. However, you can learn a lot by doing the homework or asking as well as answering questions in the class and canvas, which I think its a good thing.

reviews.author: Tyy⭐️
reviews.comment_content:
To students who do not have any accounting basis, it will be a little bit difficult to catch up. Put more effort at the beginning will be better.

To students who have accounting basis, the course is similar but not completely the same with the secondary school ones. But working hard will definitely have a good grade.

I knew someone who works really hard after class and use a lot of time to study but still don't get a satisfactory result due to no accounting background. It is important to ask the prof questions if the concept is not clear.
reviews.comment_teaching:
She is a good professor who can explain the concept clearly. She has a lot of interactions with students in the class. She is willing to answer questions after class as well.

She will invite someone every lesson to be the volunteer and review the last lecture with us, very kind!

She even actively talked to most of us independently and ask for our feelings and performance after the final exam, a caring professor!
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is good.
2 quiz and 1 midterm, also some HW and participation marks.
The mean of quizzes are quite high, very straight forward questions. Finish all the homework problems provided and be familiar with them is enough to get a good result.
Final exam will be more difficult and a slight different from what we learnt in class.

She said at least answer one question in class in the whole term will be OK.

Getting around full mark in mid term and about 1.5SD in the final will have an A+.

No attendance taken
reviews.comment_workload: Homework every week. But only three questions are required.

reviews.author: Kabe
reviews.title: Good instructor
reviews.comment_content: The course cover basic accounting principle, including the four financial statements, journal entry and ledgers. Then the course focus on different items on those statements, namely Sales Revenue, Receivables, and Cash; Cost of Goods Sold and Inventory; Property, Plant, and Equipment; Intangibles; and Natural Resources; Liabilities; Bond Securities. Finally the course focus on Stockholders’ Equity, Statement of Cash Flows, and Analyzing Financial Statements, basically just calculating ratios and write short paragraph.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is a new professor just graduated this year, so I can feel her passion in teaching. She taught in a way that is easy to understand without talking much unrelated stuff, her teaching is really about the accounting content of the course. I have no accounting background in secondary school, so I will say she really taught great.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 5%
After-class Practice Problems 5%
Quiz 1 15%
Quiz 2 15%
Final exam 60%

For participation, she said if she remember your face then you can get full credit.
After-class Practice Problems is essentially one assignment per week, for each assignment, the accuracy is not counted, so if you hand in all assignments, you get full credit.
For Quiz 1, I get 100/100. Mean: 86;  Median: 89; SD: 10
For Quiz 2, I get 95/100. Mean: 79;  Median: 81; SD: 14
For final, I get 113/120. Mean: 88;  Median: 92; SD: 15.
Finally got an A+.
As far as I know, a score slightly lower than 90% still give you an A, so I will say the grading is quite generous given the high mean.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is fair. Two midterm and one final. Midterm is noncumulative while final cover all materials. You really need some exercise to familiarize yourself with the topic for good result. The required workload is basically the assignment each week, but I will say it is very light as she upload the solution along with the assignment which allow us just to copy the answer. Of course even not copying the answer three short exercises per week is still light.

reviews.author: thyc0309_
reviews.title: introduction to financial accounting
reviews.comment_content:
- Accounting records
- Sales & accounts receivable
- Inventory
- Long-term assets and depreciation
- Time value of money, liabilities and bonds
- Shareholders' equity
- Statement of cash flows (indirect method only)

Those who have studied DSE BAFS will find it not hard to manage
reviews.comment_teaching: She explained the concepts clearly and attempted to make the class less boring by adding real-life examples (Tesla, VW, Disney...). Also, don't be afraid to ask her questions as she is very nice and responsive in answering you.
reviews.comment_grading:
24% In-class exercises
6% Class participation (everyone should get full credit I think)
10% Quiz 1
20% Quiz 2
40% Final exam

Quiz 1: 87/100 (mean 88)
Quiz 2: 83/100 (mean 82)
Final: 100/172 (mean 88, SD 28)
Final grade: B
reviews.comment_workload: As long as you complete the in-class exercises on time and do adequate revision before quizzes and the final exam, not much to worry about

reviews.author: Colas9
reviews.title: Good Teacher
reviews.comment_content: <Financial Accounting> (Libby) is our textbook
reviews.comment_teaching:
Nice guy; always willing to answer questions after class.
- makes sure students are paying attn by asking "yes or no" after each question
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term is 25%
In-class prac q's 10%
15% take home case study
Final is 50%

Class activities:
-Practice questions are easy
-teacher is willing to help you to answer your questions.
-It is better to work with your classmates
- though you can also do it by yourself if you like.

Midterm:
mean 53
sd: 9.8 or something

pay attention in class and read the lecture slides. you'll be fine
reviews.comment_workload: Little workload. You basically just do practice questions in groups during class and there's only one take home case study.

reviews.author: Mandy0605
reviews.comment_content:
We use <Financial Accounting> (Libby) as our book for this semester and the class content is almost same with the chapter in the book.
However, we skipped Chapter 10, since we will learn it in another accounting class.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I really love his teaching style.
He will give you many real-life examples, trying to make the class more interesting.
Also, he explains everything in great detail which will help you get a better understanding of the concept.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class activities and participation 10%
Case about professional ethics 15%
Mid-term exam 25%
Final exam 50%
Class activities:
Practice questions are quite easy and the teacher is willing to help you to work it out.
It is better to work with your classmates, however, you can also do it by yourself if you like.
Mid-term:
It is really easy if you attend every lecture and review your notes. It is even easier than the practice questions in class. (Mean: 53 SD:9+)
Case:
The case is not hard, however, you need to figure out what the main issues are.
reviews.comment_workload:
you ONLY need to finish THE CASE!
But you can also
1. read your books
2. review your notes
3. study some small cases
4. attend supplement classes
5. communicate with your friends

reviews.author: Ise
reviews.comment_content: This course gives a general explanation of what accounting is. And we can also get an impression of what business interaction is. For a beginner without any basis knowledge, it's not that easy and needs practice. Still, everything is acceptable.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor taught exactly in the same pace with the book. So if you have anything unclear, it can be made up afterwards by contributing your time to reading the accounting book. Namely, there is no teaching at all! You maybe confused on first couple of classes, but things will turn out to be clearer if you work on afterwards.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% participation
10% Quiz I
25%Midterm
15%Quiz II
40%Final
What I can't understand is there are no paper checking and I don't even know my final score.
Be careful with Quiz II and final cuz things will get harder.
More importantly, both occupy large proportion.
reviews.comment_workload:
In my class, there is no hwk.
But to get an acceptable score, you must work hard and practice more especially for those beginners.
Many have learned accounting before, and some beginners will do all the exercises attached behind every chapter which are really heavy workload!!!

reviews.author: AABBCC/=
reviews.comment_content: Basic accounting principles as stated in the course name.
reviews.comment_teaching: He speaks very clearly and he tries to make jokes (but for some of them only local students can understand). He always stays behind and answer students questions. Voluntary Supplementary Classes are held almost every Saturday. He always posts discussions on canvas to clarify the concepts and explain some extra contents to sharpen out business sense.
reviews.comment_grading: Not easy to get an above mean score as the mid-term is tricky.
reviews.comment_workload: Very slight workload. Only some Practice Q in class (group work and you can choose your groupmate yourselves) to take attendance and are being counted in part of the course grade. There is also one assignment on ethics, 1 A4 paper only. The mid-term is fairly easy.

reviews.author: MrBlueWhale
reviews.title: (don't) skip all lessons!!11 gogo ogo!
reviews.comment_content: Cancer, i mean i dont like acct so i might be biased. i didn't revise a lot, nor did i learn acct b4, but then it just ez math and a lot of common sense so ok la i think.
reviews.comment_teaching: i have no idea i skipped all lessons after the first quiz. i mean i hate acct. HALP!!!!
reviews.comment_grading:
There is always random assignments that you must hand in. each assignment is worth 3% and u have 10 assignments, and in total the homework covers for 24% of the total grade. in the homework u don't have to get any questions right, in fact u can hand in a blank sheet of paper, which i did. So now u might be thinking 10*3 should be 30%. actually one can skip two homework assignments. but i didn't hand in a blank sheet of paper 3 times, so i fucked up. there is also 6% of the grade that is in class participation, u can get that by answering random stupid questions. ez 30%. most importantly she is so kind when she marks! like u get shit wrong she give error carried forward and don't take marks off. u get shit wrong u decduct only a few points

quiz 1 was easy but the mean is so high dough
quiz 2 was easy i skipped all lessons after quiz 1 but still ok lor her powerpoints are good but doing exercise from book is going to help cuz the exercise in powerpoint are easy in comparison to the test
final I fucked up here. Higher than mean but only 1/3 of S.D. BUT FUCK ME THE FINAL WAS HARD U GOTTA LISTEN IN CLASS AND DO EXCERCISES MAN! FUCK U GOTTA DO THAT OK?!!!! DON'T FUCK UP LIKE ME.
Overall I got B+ at the end. Although my grade is not that good I still think the grading is good. BUT LISTEN IN CLASS MAN! NO SKIP IF U WANT A+

but overall its ok la! but i mean u have to take the course anyways so i mean like why are u reading this??? NANI?
reviews.comment_workload: blank sheet of paper for homework and still get full marks. great! oK I actually tried handing in a blank sheet of paper, and i got caught. fuck. HOWEVER, it doesn't matter if u hand in bullshit. I hand in wrong answers, wrong questions, YES WRONG QUESTIONS, EVERYTIME. And it was still ok.

reviews.author: staceylsy
reviews.comment_content: The chapters cover basic concepts of accounting, I didn't study BAFS in secondary school but still find it okay to follow. Those who have studied BAFS before might find the pace of his teaching slow since he will explain the concepts again and again.
reviews.comment_teaching: The powerpoint is neat and clear, most of them are from textbooks. Sometimes he tells jokes (in cantonese) during class, making the morning classes not so boring. He does not take attendance.
reviews.comment_grading:
midterm is 40 mc with 2 long questions.
the average is 53 with 70 full mark.
grading of the practice questions depends on your groupmates.
reviews.comment_workload: Fair workload, only one midterm, one final and some practice questions in class. And a case study about writing an ethical essay.

reviews.author: xxx
reviews.comment_content: The content is appropriate. There isn't a lot of things to memorize and need some understanding. But the case analysis in the final exam is a bit hard.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very nice. His teaching style is easy to follow for a nonbusiness school students and those without any background.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is OK. There is a group project, but only ppt is required. We do not really need to do the presentation so just do a ppt and pretending that we have done the presentation..

reviews.author: jdub___
reviews.title: Accounting becomes less challenging for students who haven't done it before :)
reviews.comment_content: The topics are quite organised but it would be better if there were more coherence between topics.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Mak uses many concepts to explain different accounting concepts. He will explain in more detail if a student does not understand, and he strongly encourages students to ask and answer questions in order to strengthen their concepts. Also, he is readily willing to patiently answer students' questions after class, no matter how many there are or how complicated they are, and he will help students whenever they are in need. A great professor.
reviews.comment_grading: I've only done a few practice questions in a group, but clearly the grading depends on your groupmates, as some might or might not have taken accounting courses in the past, and your groupmates might even be different each time. For the mid-term exam, i guess it wil be ok if you have done the practice questions, as the format is similar to those, and paid attention to the lectures. For students who haven't done accounting in the past, i strongly recommend you not to hesitate and ask Prof. Mak any questions you have in class or after class, as i've been doing so a few times and it really helped me strengthen my concepts and knowledge. Of course you can certainly ask any friends who have studied accounting, but i'd rather directly ask Prof. Mak instead.
reviews.comment_workload: Currently we only need to complete practice questions in class in groups every few lessons. We also need to complete a case study individually, which Prof. Mak will give around a month and a half for you to complete. So overall the workload is ok.

reviews.author: Jackie0925
reviews.title: Clear teaching
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite interesting to me. This course covers different financial statements (mainly focus on the income statement, statement of financial position and statement of cash flow), accounting concepts, inventory valuation method and three different depreciating methods. I think the content is quite practical and easy to understand. For those who have taken BAFS in HKDSE, I think they will be slightly advantaged but not much difference.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kelvin teaches quite slowly, but I love his speed. He teaches each concept thoroughly and clearly. It is very easy to follow what he is teaching. Also, He often uses real-life examples to demonstrate different situations, which attracts me so much. When I feel confused, he examples do clarify my misconceptions. His lessons are relaxing and you can learn so much from him. Also, he focuses on every little detail that may cover in the exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class activities and participation 10%
Case about professional ethics 15%
Mid-term exam 25%
Final exam 50%

In the mid-term exam, there are 30 multiple-choice questions that carry 1 mark each and 2 short questions that carry 20 marks each.

The final exam is much more difficult than the mid-term exam. 30 multiple-choice questions that carry 1 mark each and 4 short questions that carry 70 marks in total. You should pay attention to his in-class activities and examples.

The score of the case about professional ethics and final exam are not released. Therefore, it's hard to determine the grading policy. Personally, I think the course is poor in terms of grading.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy. Not much exercise and homework and essays. Only very little work has to be done every single week. In the lectures, simple questions will be asked by Kelvin. Some practice questions will be done in the lecture. In the semester, one 2-page homework on accounting ethical issues. Not really heavy workload.

reviews.author: terenceeee
reviews.comment_content: for those learnt bafs before will be easier to understand the course. But it is ok for those who don't. basic accounting methods are taught which includes income statements t account of partnership corrections of error etc. however there are lots of topics so it takes time to remember and learn all the topics.
reviews.comment_teaching: ppt is simple but the presentation is great. focusing in class can help understand the whole course. it will be better to have a book to do the exercise as the exercise provided is not enough for you to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_grading: stepping on the mean in exam can get a b if the quizzes are not bad, in class exercise will be part of your grade but it is easy and he will not stop you from discussing with other groups.
reviews.comment_workload: no attendance but there will be in class exercise. it will be fine if you only attend those course with exercise. the average time of an in class exercise is one in three lesson. the in class exercise will be done by a group and it is not difficult.

reviews.author: jasminelaw
reviews.comment_content: its mainly about things people learnt in HKDSE BAFS, just got 10% new things that you need to know.
reviews.comment_teaching: quite bored so i didnt go to most of the lessons.
reviews.comment_grading: good grading according to the curve but people's marks are usually very high so getting a high mark doesnt mean that you can get a good grade. i think getting above mean is just B so i am not sure is the mean B-. But it is fair and it is not too bad to study so give it a try.
reviews.comment_workload: not much workload.

reviews.author: Karan
reviews.comment_content: Content was alright but didn't interest me that much. It was pretty basic though, about the fundamentals of accounting and it could be pretty useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teacher was helpful all the time but it felt like the class was a bit too rushed at times. If you've done DSE it becomes easier to understand.
reviews.comment_grading: Decent, not too bad but the exam's grading was a bit harsh imo.
reviews.comment_workload: Very little, just a few midterms. Most focus is on final exam, prepare for that as much as possible.

reviews.author: Jin_Kim
reviews.title: Not the best, not the worst
reviews.comment_content: i've never tried accounting before, but his course was okay to understand. it was not the best teacher, but he knows his stuff well.
reviews.comment_teaching: he's lectures are boring and the jokes dont even make sense to me
reviews.comment_grading: the grading system is not very harsh compared to other classes. if you finish your assignments on time, you should be good. please understand the concepts so that you could ace the assignments.
reviews.comment_workload: manageable workload if you are good with spotting numbers and ledgers. you also need to study the concepts in depth. this depends on how fast you learn.

reviews.author: austin2512
reviews.comment_content: The course provides insight towards Accounting stuff. If you are a new guy towards accounting, perhaps you'd better buy a textbook for your reference to build your concept. Only relying the powerpoint notes is not sufficient to deal with the Homework and Quizzes
reviews.comment_teaching: Teachers are well educated and well liked. Very helpful and kind. She always teaches materials that are not included in the textbook, so do attend lectures. Will recommend taking her classes if you want to build a solid foundation in accounting.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is good and fair generally. What impressed me most is the "cheat sheet" allowance. For Quizzes and tests, and even final exams, cheat sheets were allowed. So be alerted.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fair for a first-year course. 2 midterms, final exam and weekly homework. Class participation is required so try to ask or answer questions during class. No group projects required, unlike other classes.

reviews.author: Kyleleeuy
reviews.comment_content: It provides general knowledge on the course, but it is not enough to answer all of the tasks given. It is good if you know a little bit about accounting beforehand as it can help you develop the fundamental concepts.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very friendly, but you should be proactive in reaching out.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is very fair as long as you study hard. The final exam was a lot more difficult than the midterms, but if you know the lesson well you should be fine.
reviews.comment_workload: Some group related tasks, but the course generally has a light workload.

reviews.author: wcyuenab
reviews.comment_content:
Basic Accounting surrounding financial statements (BS, IS, Statement of SE and statement of CF).

Challenging Concepts: statement of cash flow, amortisation, cost of good sold.
reviews.comment_teaching:
PPT based. Lectures can be skipped provided that you read the notes briefly and do the exercises yourself.

No Attendance.
reviews.comment_grading:
2 In Class Quizzes, around 5 Group Exercises amounting to 10% of the final grade respectively. Don't miss those lectures with quizzes or group exercises.

Midterm=35%
Final=40%
Class Participation=5%

Midterm was more difficult than the final. Scores above the average by 1-1.2 sd would score an A+.
reviews.comment_workload: Exercises are given to you for your own study. Finishing all of the chapter exercises would do you well in the exams.

reviews.author: kTsang
reviews.comment_content: It's a okay course. Professor teaches in a slow pace, and basically reads whats on the board. Okay workload though. Content is not too difficult, since its just touches the foundation. It's pretty interesting if you're into more numerical stuff.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is okay, professor may skip some stuff when theres not enough time. Should take notes along, since the slides are very useful.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is average, need to work hard to get a A.
reviews.comment_workload: Average, not a lot, some assessments to do, should be able to handle by everyone.

reviews.author: ky man
reviews.comment_content: 大概都係中學dse學過嘅野，對於讀過dse BAFS嘅人黎講唔難，唯一要注意嘅係格式
reviews.comment_teaching: 會有好多課外知識同case study，但係考試唔會考。另外上堂其實有d悶
reviews.comment_grading: 無乜點上過堂都可以B+，老實講唔錯。但係無讀過BAFS嘅人可能要小心d
reviews.comment_workload: 得一個midterm同final

reviews.author: 開心
reviews.comment_content:
CONTENT
Fundamentals of accounting, understanding financial statements in general and be able to produce them.
reviews.comment_teaching:
TEACHING
Terrible Instructor, material not clear. Very strong accent and very fast pace to go from one topic to the other. Since he procedes so fast it is hard to understand.
reviews.comment_grading:
GRADING
Hard grader, very competitive. The first quiz is always what lowers everyone's grade. Midterm also definitively hard.
reviews.comment_workload:
WORKLOAD
The overall workload is moderate but a lot to study for midterms. Defintively have to study with continuity and do all the exercises to do well in the class.

reviews.author: Eason Lai
reviews.title: Effort makes sense
reviews.comment_content: The course provides us first insight towards Accounting stuff. If you are a new guy towards accounting, perhaps you'd better buy a textbook for your reference to build your concept. Only relying the powerpoint notes is not sufficient to deal with Homework and Quizzes.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is fine, fluctuated teaching speed. But if you have anything don't understand COMPLETELY, don't hesitate to find Prof CHEN, she is quite nice to clear your misconceptions. Be Active!
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is good and fair generally. What impressed me most is the "cheat sheet" allowance. For Quizzes and tests, and even final exams, cheat sheets were allowed. The mid-term exams were easy to get good grades, but contradictorily the final exam was extremely difficult (to me maybe) provided that 3 A4 cheat sheets were allowed. So be alerted!
reviews.comment_workload: Quite light workload, only some easy group-homework

reviews.author: Hanac
reviews.comment_content: The teaching material was great and the lesson was interesting. The interaction between professors and students are quite good.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching was nice. You can easily understand the content. The content he taught was not very difficult for someone who has learnt basic accounting already. He always asks students questions to ensure all of us understand.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade was not good at all. If your mid term result is higher than 1 SD of the mean only, even you get full mark in final exam, you still get a B+.
reviews.comment_workload: No homework, only a few quizzes.

reviews.author: Jenny Chan
reviews.comment_content: very hard to catch up the content for the one hasnt studied accounting in secondary school.
reviews.comment_teaching: The progress and speed is very fast. If you miss a lesson, it will be very very difficult for you to catch up and understand what is going on.
reviews.comment_workload: There are in-class exercise to make sure that you attend the lesson. Thhe workload is not very large but it is time-consuming. You have to complete the in-class exercise nearly all the lessons, if you forget that you will lose some scores and affect your final grade.

reviews.author: hiya
reviews.title: good

reviews.comment_teaching: Good I think it was.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grade. But you still need to work hard. If you don't know anything about accounting (just as I did) you need to work hard to get good grade. Memorizing, calculating and et cetera are needed.
reviews.comment_workload: You need to study hard to catch up with the classes. There are some works for you to finish before the next class

reviews.author: Michellekiukiu
reviews.comment_content: Easy to follow and have basic understanding
reviews.comment_teaching: Helpful and teaches extra things during lecture.Do attend lectures if you can. It will be useful for understanding the concepts.
reviews.comment_grading: grades are acceptable.The two midterms are in MC format and are easy as long as you study. The exam is difficult though so better spend more time on it
reviews.comment_workload: acceptable. no group works are required.The workload is okay for a first-year course. 2 midterms, final exam and weekly homework. Class participation is considered so do ask or answer questions during class.

reviews.author: yannnnnnnlky

reviews.comment_grading:
Good grading through the mean score is so high
Once mid-term, mean is 90 and SD is 10
reviews.comment_workload: Have in-class exercise, attendance and assignment, but the workload is easy. Attendance can be fulfilled by simply answering question in class or just cleaning whiteboard.

reviews.author: Yeung Ka Yi

reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite small compare with other courses. Only short exercises in class.

reviews.comment_grading: Make sure to get both MT and Final above mean to get a B range if u below mean for one of them u will possible to get a B-/C+

reviews.author: HydraCorrupt

reviews.comment_grading:
Grading was fine, except for she made two easy midterms and one super hard final. As you can see in the following, the final meant a lot.

Description Weight
In-class exercises 24%

reviews.comment_workload: Except for the fact that you need to finish you homework right on the day she finished her course, the workload is quite acceptable tbh.

reviews.author: tpm_

reviews.comment_content: Easy if you have studied accounting in secondary school before.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very boring.
reviews.comment_grading: As long as you have studied hard enough and finished most of the recommended questions in the textbook, the exam should not be too hard. The final exam is brutal, but the midterm and quizzes are easy to handle. The mean in both midterm and final is alright, it really depends on the professor, as different professors have different format of exam. Some have all MCs and some MCs and both short and long questions. Be careful in your calculations and beware of careless mistakes (it happens all the time).
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is okay, with few assignments.

reviews.author: gracelhs

reviews.comment_workload:

reviews.author: Lucy123456

reviews.comment_grading: Grading can be a bit tough, but fair. Always attend classes, so that you understand better what is explained. There were three tests: two midterms and a final.
