reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is interesting and encourages class discussions and questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Not very difficult to get above B+.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is pretty light. However, it is recommended to attend every class as class discussions are graded. An hour of work after every class should do.

reviews.author: Tyler
reviews.comment_content: debit, credit, depreciation expense, liabilities, cash flows, basically all the stuff preliminary stuff in accounting.
reviews.comment_teaching: The notes are unreliable as there are many powerpoint slides with no useful content on it,  which makes revision a lot harder. My suggestion is to download an e-book which is a lot better than his notes.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is unbelievably good. The  mean for the course is B+. People attracted to this section is primarily because of its unbelievably good grading curve.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is acceptable. There are one mid-term and one final, plus some class participation to do. For instance, you have to answer a few questions in lesson and do a news presentation to the class, then he will give you a few credit points. You need a maximum of 4 credit points to max the class participation criteria. The professor also stated that you need not to come to the lesson as he will not be taking attendance, which a lot of people will follow suit.

reviews.author: rororooo
reviews.title: Bad teaching
reviews.comment_content: It is not as easy as you imagined if you haven't studied accounting in high school before. I have no acct background and struggled quite a bit, it's hard to learn the basic in a short period of time. Also even if i learn't the stuff, the mean is VERY HIGH as most ppl have acct background already. So i would suggest to do A LOT of exercises that would help, or else it's hard to catch up with others.
reviews.comment_teaching: I would say it's very bad and not helpful for students to learning accounting form the start and build a better foundation. He keeps talking about out syllabus stuff -__- totally irrelevant to exams and not helpful at all. He keeps asking us to read bloomberg and financial times. :(   His attitude is not good and quite rude to students, he hates people who asks stupid questions
reviews.comment_grading: Quite bad. The Midterm and final is quite HARD! During revision, I completed all the class exercises and some sample paper of other professors and I know the answers. However, LI XI's question types are quite different, I haven't seen the format before :( so I did quite bad.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light, no project nor assignments. You can earn class participation by answering questions in class and also doing news reviews before class. Each lesson has 2 students presenting a news. Then you can earn extra scores.

reviews.author: Lavonn
reviews.comment_content:
The content is similar to what we learnt in HKDSE.
Therefore, for those who have take the BAFS as their elective and studied account before, it is easy for them in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is good.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading of this course is fine.
There are three mid terms and one final
Even if you get the score about mean 0.5 sd, you receive a b range grade.
Also, around half of the class have some account background, the mean of the course will be relatively high.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only inclass assignments and one project are requited.
There is no other workload in this course.

reviews.author: Jackylcc
reviews.comment_content: Basic accounting skills. For those who study DSE, it would be very familiar with you. The difference is just English and US accounting stye format.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nice teaching. Accounting is supposed to be a qute boring course while Tony teaches it in a way of humor and deliever the complicated concepts in a very clear way who is so far the best professor in my university life.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grade. Though the mean of the mid-term and final are quite high. 1 SD above mean is enough to get A to A+
reviews.comment_workload: Suitable amount of in-class exercises and quizzes. No homework intead optional exerises.

Moreover, a list of homework questions is suggested so that we can have sufficient practice before exams.

reviews.author: Hannah1212
reviews.comment_content:
The course will explain with real-world examples the uses and some technical details of various data
mining techniques. The emphasis primarily is on understanding the business application of data mining
techniques, and secondarily on the variety of techniques. We will discuss the mechanics of how the
methods work only if it is necessary to understand the general concepts and business applications. You
will establish analytical thinking to the problems and understand that proper application of technology is
as much an art as it is a science.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The course is designed for students with various backgrounds -- the class does not require any technical
skills or prior knowledge.

1. Lab participation: 10%
2. Homework (3): 30%
3. Midterm quiz: 30%
4. Final exam: 30%
reviews.comment_workload: very good

reviews.author: Lesley
reviews.title: Good. Not bad.
reviews.comment_content: The notes is not clear enough. If you haven't studied accounting, it would be better to buy a textbook, rather than just using her notes.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good. She is very patient and willing to answer every question. However, there are participation marks for students who answer her questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Good. It is hard to get a D or F in her class, even I performed really bad in every midterm and exam. I got a C- in her class. I am glad that she doesn't give a D to me.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. Just a group project. She doesn't count attendance but there are 10 in-class assignments. They are only available for present students. So there are no differences between taking attendance and in-class assignment.

reviews.author: KWY
reviews.title: ACCT 2010
reviews.comment_content:
About basic accounting theories
Should be easy for those who studied BAFS in high school
From writing double entries to financial statements and analysis by some accounting ratios, almost 80% are those taught in high school.
reviews.comment_teaching: Relevant notes for each class, but hard to follow sometimes as the professor shared many examples that we had to interpret the answers ourselves.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is still good until the final exam as the final exam was hard. MC questions are like comprehension. A piece of A4 size cheat sheet is allowed in final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: Just one in-class exercise to hand in each week. Marks are gained when handed in.

reviews.author: Jellobeano
reviews.comment_content: I did not have any relevant Accounting knowledge before enrolling this course. Do not rely on the instructor to teach you accounting knowledge. The basics will not be sufficient for you to survive the examinations. The power points has many slides which makes you hard to concentrate and study it.
reviews.comment_teaching: There are many, many, many irrelevant knowledge taught in class, good for you if you are interested in accounting. I highly suggest you learn by yourself, do not rely on the instructor. However, you should really attend lessons as what the instructor taught during lessons will be included in the examinations. He will give tips to students before examinations.
reviews.comment_grading:
Bonus points:
i got zero as i did not attend any lesson besides the first one.

Midterm:
it should be easy if you understand Accounting. I did extremely worse in midterms, Below mean >2 SD

Final:
it is very difficult comparing to midterm, everyone dad worse in finals. Still below mean ~ or < 2SD

I did not even try to study that semester and I thought I would had failed the course, luckily i didn't.
reviews.comment_workload: There are bonus points you can get during lessons, other than that there are only one midterm and final. So the workload is very light.

reviews.author: WKH
reviews.comment_content: Content was useful for introducing the basics of accounting, with some simple calculations. Was relatively easy to understand as someone with no prior experience with accounting
reviews.comment_teaching: Friendly professor who was able to explain concepts clearly so that they were easy to understand. She often uses many examples to explain her concepts, and also uses in-class assignments to help students understand better.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading. Exams and midterms aren't hard if you had did your work and listened during lectures.
reviews.comment_workload: There were three midterms in addition to the final exam, as well as a group project, and occasional assignments. If you are looking for a lighter workload, choose another lecture.

reviews.author: lammmmm
reviews.comment_content: 學既野比其他PROFESSOR深，一開頭教個幾課好簡單，bond 個幾課好難，其他PROFESSOR無教，DSE完全無學過，一走堂就唔明
reviews.comment_teaching: EXPLAIN得算清楚，但教得太快，太少EXAMPLE，得POWERPOINT SLIDE同上堂既QUIZ，無其他練習，EXPECT 你自己買書
reviews.comment_grading: midterm below mean 1 sd  final above mean 1 sd -->c+
reviews.comment_workload:
後未每星期有GROUP EXERCISE／INDIVIDUAL QUIZ
無ASSIGNMENT
1 MIDTERM 1 FINAL

reviews.author: danixsand
reviews.title: Mediocre Teaching, Difficult Grading
reviews.comment_content: Thoroughly covered course materials and basics of accounting. In the end students can expect to understand what accounting is, how it works, and international differences. Overall, content is very solid.
reviews.comment_teaching: Poor instruction, relies heavily on work outside class, and expectations not always clear. Not enough emphasis given to IFRS compared to its frequency on exams. Exams are disproportionately hard to classwork. Professor Shieh is humorous and has fun during class, but gets carried away and very often does not finish his lectures. He holds students past the end of class almost every lecture, and is arbitrarily serious during quizzes, making them unnecessarily difficult and confusing.
reviews.comment_grading: Tells students to expect new materials to show up on exams, even the final. Not inclined to give partial credit on questions, very difficult curve on exams. However, lowest quiz is dropped, which is helpful because everyone does poorly. A big problem is that the wording used on quizzes and exams is not clear, and clarification takes time away from the alotted time for evaluation.
reviews.comment_workload: Not demanding by itself, but to receive a good grade you must do all of the textbook practice problems. No homework, just review, reading, and practice outside class. In-class group assignments are good way to put together efforts to solve accounting tasks together and they raise your grade.

reviews.author: Daejun
reviews.comment_content: Class materials are mostly ppt, which are mostly extracted from the textbook. The materials are well shwon but some of the details are missing which we have to look for them by ourselves.
reviews.comment_teaching: She sometimes just reads the powerpoint or the presenter note included in the powerpoint, so the teaching was not very necessary. The information is well taught even thoguh
reviews.comment_grading: Fair since most of the quizzes and tests are multiple choice questions.
reviews.comment_workload: Not a lot of assignments but we had three quizzes which was pretty time consuming.

reviews.author: Wendy Wong
reviews.title: Ok Easy
reviews.comment_content:
對DSE讀過Bafs嘅人好簡單，講咗下double entries, journal, income statement, balance sheet, ratio嘅基本
唯一新啲嘅係statement of cash flow

因為教得都頗慢 冇讀過bafs嘅人都會follow up到 亦唔一定會比讀過acct嘅人屈機
reviews.comment_teaching: 講野幾清晰 因為係acct入門班 想幫以前冇讀過acct嘅人追返個底 教得好慢好慢 甚至到最後教唔切然後final我地班考少隔離一part xd 人幾nice有時上堂都會講下笑 不過對讀過acct嘅人都真係教得好慢...
reviews.comment_grading:
唔會話呢個係靚grade course
雖然根據ppt同書啲topics都簡單 上堂時大部份學生都明晒重點 但final難到一個點 有考到上堂冇直𤗈教嘅野 但有啲題目勁pk有叫你用返堂上examples*** 所以grade mainly depends on原本已有知識
reviews.comment_workload:
細workload
mid term + final + assignment x1

midterm final難 溫熟ppt要有mean冇難度

assignment有差唔多半個月定三星期做 比個case你寫返code of ethics 個case係啲出面比賽嘅exercise  佢有比guidelines跟住做 我無意上網搵到solution:0

有兩堂要take attendance 分組做個小型in-class practice然後每組填名交 會話定比你聽邊兩堂!!:)

上堂有答問題加paticipation bonus嘅紙 但本人就走晒堂或者上親堂都打機唔答野最後都A咗 所以最緊要係exam

reviews.author: Fiona Chan
reviews.comment_content: the content is a bit too much for those who have never study accounting before and even though you have study accounting in DSE the content will be slightly different from what you have before
reviews.comment_teaching:
the professor is nice and funny, she will use real life example and bring real stuff to class to explain

no ppt but the professor will hand out print out notes and upload to canvas after the lecture
reviews.comment_grading: the grading system is fair, 24% for the in class exercise, two mid-term exams take 10% and 20% of the final grading, final exam takes 40% of the grading and 6% for the participation
reviews.comment_workload: the workload is light, you only need to finish 6 assignments in total to get full marks on the in class exercise, usually it is only a A4 size paper but need to hand in on the lecture day. the content of the assignment does not affect the grading.

reviews.author: Xavi
reviews.comment_content: The course is mainly about some basic principles of accounting system and concept. Some knowledge is already included in the syllabus of BAFS in HKDSE. The course gives a overview on ethical principles, double-entry system and financial statments.
reviews.comment_teaching: The lecture notes are very well-organized with in-class exercises to ensure students grasp the concept. Everything is clearly explained with example.
reviews.comment_grading: Participation is quite important. The mid-term exam and final exam are pretty easy if you have studied the slides and attend the lectures.
reviews.comment_workload: Other than the exams, students only need to work on a case study on their own. However, it is pretty simple as the lecturer gives adequate guidance and reference.

reviews.author: Giac
reviews.comment_content: Fundamentals of accounting, understanding financial statements in general and be able to produce them.
reviews.comment_teaching: Terrible Instructor, material not clear. Very strong accent and very fast pace to go from one topic to the other. Since he procedes so fast it is hard to understand.
reviews.comment_grading: Hard grader, very competitive. The first quiz is always what lowers everyone's grade. Midterm also definitively hard.
reviews.comment_workload: The overall workload is moderate but a lot to study for midterms. Defintively have to study with continuity and do all the exercises to do well in the class.

reviews.author: ckwkelly
reviews.comment_content: Her notes are clear and easy to follow. Having revision over her notes is already enough for exams.
reviews.comment_teaching: She has passion over accounting and has clear teaching but she teaches quite fast and sometimes difficult to catch up if you are not concentrate enough.
reviews.comment_grading: The mid-terms are quite easy but final exam is very difficult.Having mean score will get B or B-.Score with one SD higher will get B+ or A-.So far the grade is not bad if you study.
reviews.comment_workload: a number of in-class exercises which count in final grade are given

reviews.author: benedict egg
reviews.title: very good grade
reviews.comment_content: learn about things some students have learnt in BAFS in secondary school. So a little bit not fair to those who don't take accounting in secondary school.
reviews.comment_teaching: Sometimes he teaches as irrelevant thing, like how to predict movements of stocks, how to read companies'  financial report, but luckily these will not be in the examination. Although I find his lessons a little bit boring, he is a really good teacher and can teach well, his accent is very clear and can illustrate his ideas very well. Also his in class exercise is very useful in revisions.
reviews.comment_grading: He has a very good grade this year, I got about median in both mid term and final and still I got B+, which is insanely good.
reviews.comment_workload: One midterm one final no assignment, he even said we don't need to attend the lesson if we can get good grade in the course.

reviews.author: yan_wcyan
reviews.title: Good course, good professor but too many questions?
reviews.comment_content: This course teach the foundation of accounting, such as accounting equation, financial statements. The topic is almost the same as the DSE syllabus, but the accouting method is slightly different, like the journal entries. Those students studied BAFS in high school still need to pay attention.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is quite well. He would explain every concept in details and make some jokes during the lessons. He emphasized in the first lecture that he really really encourages QUESTIONS and mentioned that he would mark down who have asked question after the lesson and give marks for participation. It leads to a result that a lot of people asked a lot of unhelpful questions while Tony would answer them seriously, making the lesson behind and behind the schedule.
reviews.comment_grading: Your grade is greatly related to your mid-term and final exam. Participation is not really matter. It is easy to get a A grade if you work hard.
reviews.comment_workload: He would give quizes and in-class group works regularly. In-class group works are open-booked and you can ask questions. Quizes are for individuals and close-booked. No out of class work. He might ask you to read the book first and do the questions in the book by yourself.

reviews.author: Scott McKiernan
reviews.comment_content: Professor covered the basics of accounting and was enthusiastic regarding the material.
reviews.comment_teaching: Xi Li is what you'd expect when it comes to an accounting instructor. Follows the syllabus quite closely and is always willing to meet if you need help.
reviews.comment_grading: Very fair grading. Somewhat tough to get an A, but if you put in the work Xi Li will give you the grade you deserve.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is somewhat heavy. There is a midterm and final, but also readings and assignments, which you are expected to stay on top of.

reviews.author: Caroline9460800
reviews.comment_content: Literally almost all the things on the Gibby and Gibby textbook are taught except a few chapters that are not that important.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Kathy is a very nice professor.

Her teaching is one of the best among all UST professors. However, you need to preview to follow up her speed.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is ok. Especially in the test, the proessor will provide you a sheet of equations so that you don't need to memorize a lot of things.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is ok. The professor didn't require us to do all the homework questions, but if you want to do it, then it's better for your grade.

reviews.author: Aakash
reviews.title: Slow as The Matrix
reviews.comment_content: Nothing too difficult, as it's just an introduction to financial accounting. This course covers material such as cash flow statements, income statements, the time value of money, depreciation, ratios, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
7/10

Your experience would greatly depend on whether you have learnt accounting before or not. If you have, be prepared to get bored out of your mind. He covers the content at a snail's pace. For instance, he talked about the concept of separate entity for about 40 minutes. Let that sink in. However, to the uninitiated, the professor would be incredibly good, since it is quite impossible to fall behind.

He is very casual and relaxed. He also uses good examples to illustrate his points.
reviews.comment_grading:
10/10

Pretty straightforward, with one midterm, one final, some class participation and the ethics case study (see Workload section of this review). Not too difficult to get an A. I myself have gotten an A+ with minimal background in accounting.
reviews.comment_workload:
10/10

The only homework in this course is an ethics case study, which is actually incredibly easy, since we are told to refer to the code of ethics for accountants.

reviews.author: Aduitya
reviews.comment_content:
Basic Accounting concepts
easy to comprehend if you've taken accounting in high school

If not, you'll still be able to follow the course easily.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Easy to follow and understand.
He uses a lot of real life examples and goes through the syllabus quickly and efficiently.

Invites you to voice out your opinion and Questions
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fair, your effort = your grade. Compared to other instructors, his grading is great.
He gives various opportunities for bonus marks, through presentations and doing in class work.
reviews.comment_workload:
Nothing extra to do.
Just attend lectures and do the in class exercises.

reviews.author: ajroed
reviews.comment_content: The class was not too difficult. I enjoy the subject of accounting more than other people though. The topics were introduced in an order that built off each other so it is good to attend class and keep up with the work.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher was fairly boring, but it is hard to make accounting more than dry.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was very fair and calculated mathematically. The tests had different types of problems, but were graded fairly and consistantly.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was average. If you do exta problems on your own the tests become much easier

reviews.author: StephenCurry30
reviews.title: One word: Meh
reviews.comment_content: Throughout my 12 years of pre-university education, I've never learnt any accounting knowledge... And I regret that. As expected, I started off the course panicking, uncertain of what's to come. But the materials were way to understand and guides you to LITERALLY, learn the principles of accounting. To me, that's awesome. The only downside to the materials is our professor requires us to finish 12 chapters for the final exam, while other professors only need their students to go through 3-4 chapters for the exam. Believe me, that kinda sucks. But overall, I'd say I actually learnt something.
reviews.comment_teaching: Same with the title: meh. I mean, I'd say this course is a total disaster based on the extra chapters we need to study, but after attending all the lectures, I could still vaguely understand what she's talking about, even though getting good grades is another completely different matter. Her classes aren't that funny and energetic, but also wasn't too boring or dull. So I'd say her teaching was so so. See what I did there? :)
reviews.comment_grading: Not sure if I've been through hell in other courses or what, I actually think The grades in this course is amazing. I've seen other comments complaining about the harsh grading of this professor, and at first I had the same thought. My midterms were getting worst, and I only studied for three days for the final exam. Seemed like a B or B- to me. Shockingly, it's a B+. Yeah o know, it's not worth bragging, but still, that's awesome to me. Bad thing is till this day I still have no idea of the grade I got in the exam.
reviews.comment_workload: There's a shit ton of workload in this course, so get ready for some ass-whipping. Three quizzes(identical to midterms), one project and one exam. Sounds pretty normal, but it's complete shit compared to other professors. Started the project two days before it was handed in, had two free-rider groupmates, and I'm glad I grabbed it in on time. Again, till this date, I have no knowledge of my grades or whatsoever.

reviews.author: kennylcw
reviews.title: easy, nearly zero work load !
reviews.comment_content: The course syllabus is similar to BAFS accouting in hkdse. You should be able to pick up easily if you studied bafs at secondary school.
reviews.comment_teaching: His lectures are full of out-syllabus content. Unless you are really interested in stuffs apart from accouting, you can simply skip those lectures.
reviews.comment_grading: u can simply self-study and get a good grade. I went over the course content a week before the final and mid-term and i got good results (above mean).
reviews.comment_workload: nearly 0. no hw, no quiz , only one mid term, and one final exam.

reviews.author: kh1203
reviews.comment_content:
對學過BAFS既同學好易，
KELVIN教得慢，所以一個SEM五會COVER好多野
相比其他Instructor計數少好多
就算我無學過bafs都唔算好難追其他學過同學既進度
reviews.comment_teaching:
教的進度很慢。。
SEPERATE ENTITY一個CONCEPT可以講半堂。。
就算走左上堂都唔使驚因為佢下堂會review同埋每個week既ppt最尾都有summary,所以佢會再簡單run through一次。
佢有心教，唔會hea教/一黎就當你識/有bafs底就狂飛書/狂比數你計，適合d未學過bafs既同學。好有耐心，會有pick up lesson但唔系compulsory，等我地唔明可以問翻。
因為佢本人好追求唔同section既進度一致，所以一個lecture如果因為特別事取消其他班都會cancel埋。好似上SEM遇到風雨同壞冷氣，最後乾脆skip左一個week ppt唔教唔考。
reviews.comment_grading:
幾好grade，聽講佢系注重上堂答問題多D。第一堂已經講明上堂參與好重要，而最後個grade都證明到尼點。。
走左好幾次堂，midterm啱好踩Mean，最後都拎到B+。
認為完全系靠答問題。。但我印象中自己只系答過4-6條，有時仲系佢抽我答。可能系因為九點堂無咩人互動所以相比下顯得好少少。
reviews.comment_workload:
1 midterm, 1 final, 1 case study, no homework, no attendance taken, 偶爾幾次上堂討論分組要交答案。
workload系case Study辛苦左d，上堂分組有學過Bafs既FD就可以CARRY，重點系五計ATTENDANCE。如果果堂要分組交答案，佢仲會呼籲你CALL翻d走堂fd反黎。。

reviews.author: Law~
reviews.title: Work hard especially for those who haven't studied BAFS before
reviews.comment_content:
ACCT2010 covers some of the fundamental accounting principles. Possessing BAFS Background in HKDSE is a very big advantage because 80% of the course is quite similar what students learnt in senior secondary age.

For those who haven't studied accounting before (like me). Be prepared to pay effort to catch up. You have to learn 2-year stuff within 3 months.

But anyway I do not recommend anyone to give up from studying this course: It is very important that you need to know how to read financial statements  and pay attention to some ratios in preparing business case analyses (Case Competition, LABU stuff) or let say, ACCT2200 you will study in second year in HKUST.

Your hard work may not give you A in this course but the effort you pay can be turned into real outcomes in no longer future.
reviews.comment_teaching:
In general, her teaching is fair.

She teaches the concepts in a step-by-step manner. It can be boring to BAFS Students but it helps students with no accounting background to develop their concepts in a steady pace.

However, Professor Chen usually 'get lost' amid her teaching - and advanced concepts will be suddenly mentioned at the beginning of the semester. It is very hard for students with no accounting background to catch-up

The conclusion is: She hopes to develop concepts for students with no accounting background but in reality she kind of fails to do so. If you are students with BAFS experience, skip her class. If you are students without accounting background, attend her class, work harder, and you will be surviving then.
reviews.comment_grading:
Professor Chen offers some of the best grades in ACCT2010 (Li Xi is slightly better). Mean should be around B (or slightly lower)

The two mid-term are very very very important. Try your best to avoid any careless mistakes. Careless mistakes put you 5-10 marks lower (which is a deduction of 1-2% in total course score).

You need to get 0.8 - 1 SD higher than mean CONSTANTLY in ALL assessments to get A-range, I guess.

For your reference:
In-class Exercise (8 in total, 24%): 24/24
Quiz 1 (10%): 100/100 (Mean: 90, SD: 10)
Quiz 2 (20%): 86.5/100 (Mean: 82.4)
Final (super difficult and cumulative, 40%): 146.5/235 (~ +0.8 SD)
Participation: 6/6

My grade: B+

I am quite disappointed that I have worked super hard for this course (I almost gave up my MATH1003 for ACCT2010). However, when I compare with students who haven't studied accounting before and those in other classes (such as Tony, Kelvin Mak Class), what can I complain about? HaHa !!!!!!
reviews.comment_workload: The only workload is the 8 in-class exercises you need to submit. All of them are adopted from the textbook. So if you get access to the answer of textbook (the professor will upload it on Canvas), it will never be a problem to any students XD

reviews.author: yayyyy
reviews.comment_content:
Basic accounting concepts
Involves some very simple calculations
As someone who is a beginner to accounting, I find the content really straight-forward and simple.
As long as you understand all the concepts, there is not much to memorize.
reviews.comment_teaching:
She explained every concepts clearly.
After teaching each chapter she would guide us to do some questions to consolidate our knowledge.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good.
There are 3 mid-terms and 1 finals.
The final is cumulative so better to revise all the topics way before exam.
Both mid-terms and finals are not that hard, just the basic concepts mentioned.
Kathy is pretty lenient on the grades.
reviews.comment_workload:
Pretty heavy to be honest.
Apart from the 3 mid-terms and finals, there is also a critical thinking project that requires us to identify some accounting problems and frauds. There are also in-class assignments tho those are very easy as long as you are present in class to do that.

reviews.author: KoeyTse
reviews.comment_content: hard to catch up for students who haven't studied BAFS in secondary. Therefore, students who study this course should have some basic understanding in Accounting or else it's hard to catch up
reviews.comment_teaching:
quite quick
and hard to catch
but is patient enough to answer the question people raise
reviews.comment_grading: heavy percentage on midterm and final exam. usually people are awarded grades  lower than what they have expected for final exams.
reviews.comment_workload: light workload with no hw or assignment. extra credits will be given to those who present news articles

reviews.author: Zerlinda
reviews.comment_content: Quite good. Made her own notes. She explained clearly during lessons and you could ask whenever you don't know.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching method is different from other professors. She adopts a secondary-like teaching method. She distributes new notes every lesson, which allows students to catch up more easily. Those who like to write notes would be preferred to take her classes.
reviews.comment_grading:
The marks of the exercises doesn't count into your final grade. As long as you handed in it, you will get full marks.
You can get a B if you were at mean.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload. Just have in-class exercises every 2 lessons.

reviews.author: kakei5844
reviews.comment_content:
主要教返DSE野
DSE讀過BAFS既未到FINAL都唔洗溫書(除左佢D格式有D唔同左)
但FINAL加左D新野
學個陣唔難 但考FINAL就勁難
reviews.comment_teaching:
英文有大陸人口音
幾熱心
落堂問佢野會教到你明
reviews.comment_grading:
1st mid term: 96/100
2nd mid term: 100/100
final: mean高少少
overall B+
reviews.comment_workload:
have 12 in-class exercise but only need to submit 8 of them
mid-term *2
final
midterm is too easy but final is really hard

reviews.author: Kwok Hiuching
reviews.comment_teaching:
Kathy is a very nice and kind person
You can feel free to ask her about accounting and she is so welcome to answer you
But her voice is quite soft
reviews.comment_grading:
quite easy to get a good grade
because exams(midterms) and final are not difficult

there is 5% of total marks counted for participation,
you just simply have to answer her questions in the lessons in order to get participation marks.
reviews.comment_workload:

the workload is a bit heavy but mini exams, assignments and final are quite easy

reviews.author: ch_leung
reviews.comment_content: The content examined in the tests are quite standard, all covered by classwork and chapter questions. If you are hard-working enough to study all questions in the chapter and finish the work in class, you'd probably see familiar questions in exams.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade of the instructor is relatively good, claimed by the instructor himself.
reviews.comment_workload: The whole course consists of two parts only - mid term and final. Comparing with other instructors, the workload is relatively low as there are no in-class exercise or other course work

reviews.author: Oscarrr
reviews.comment_content:
會分組, 差唔多個個星期都要做in-class group exercise

reviews.comment_teaching:
口音怪怪地
佢講書講得幾快, 之前無讀過bafs唔係好明, 但係有啲friend讀過bafs就話佢教得ok

要做in-class exercise要做
2個midterm
final好難

reviews.author: Chyan
reviews.comment_content: kelvin啲mid term唔算好難,就算冇讀過bafs只要温下notes都算handle到,但kelvin啲final真心好難,讀過bafs都未必識,啲多分題目好多都會留空左lol
reviews.comment_workload: kelvin啲workload唔算大,平時上堂久唔久會做下practice question,佢會鐘意人答佢問題,佢有張紙會mark低.佢有份ethic case要做,幾難下

reviews.author: Tornado
reviews.comment_content: The content is nice. It teaches the basis of accounting very thoroughly, while not delving into too much contents.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kathy Ho is a nice teacher, sometimes she would share her thoughts and feelings of her trips and certain incidents to her students. She also teaches effectively, so if you miss her classes, you will have quite a hard time.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is the problem, since it contains 3 mid-terms, which are too much. The final is understandable, so it could be challenging for students who are less smart.
reviews.comment_workload: Contains a group project that has to be submitted during project submission period, which is weird for a starting accounting course; otherwise, it's fine.

reviews.author: XabiAlonsoXB
reviews.comment_content: For HKDSE accounting students it would not be very difficult, but for those not, it could prove troublesome. The syllabus is very intense. A topic which could take a few weeks to learn in HKDSE is stuffed into 2 lectures here. Students who are new to accounting have to be prepared.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony is a very good teacher. He is kind to students, patient to answer their questions both in class and after class. He explains ideas well and he will repeat or draw in detail to make sure you understand. He likes to add in a lot of extra information about accounting. He is funny as well. His lesson would not get boring.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair in generally. But as HKDSE BAFS students can easily score 90%, hovering around mean won't guarantee a good grade. One major problem is Tony based on whether he know you to give you participation mark. For active students you can impress him in class with insightful questions and for those not plz at least ask him some questions after class. At least let him feel familiar with your face.
reviews.comment_workload: Midterm and final: 2.5 hours each non-cumulative. Don't be scared it is almost standard in accounting exams. 6 in class gp exercise (take the best 5) and 3 15-20min quizzes (count 2 out of 3). Not too difficult if you have listened to him or have a look at the notes. I would rather spend 10min to revise before each quizzes than doing assignments or presentations.

reviews.author: Justinchc
reviews.comment_content: She covered almost everything. The contents are basic info for accounting. Students who studied BAFS in high school will have a huge benefit.
reviews.comment_teaching: Really poor at teaching. You have no idea what she is doing and she has no idea what you are doing as well.
reviews.comment_grading:
The first and second test were extremely easy and were meant to boost up everyone's mark. However, the final exam was extremely hard and the average was about 54%.

The final grade usually only depends on the final exam because most of the students get similar mark during the first two quizzes.

Have to answer a question in class to get participation mark and hand in 8 in class practices to get perfect.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. Quite average.

reviews.author: candycloud
reviews.comment_content: Have lots of information about accounting but those are not cover in the final exam. Many content which is taught are not related to the exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony is nice. He make some jokes during the lesson. Also, it is very free during the lesson. So the teaching is nice.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is not too good. It is because the difficulty is too different between the assignment and the mid-term or final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: Only 3 quiz and 5 assignments needed to be done. And not all quiz are calculated for the grade.No need to take attendance and it is easy to handle.

reviews.author: Stacey
reviews.comment_content: She will provide notes with blank before class and some hard copies in class. After class, she will upload filled notes. Exercises are based on textbook.
reviews.comment_teaching: Although I don't think her teaching is good personally, she is a diligent professor who will keep answering most of the question on canvas and repeat what we confused in class many times.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very considerate on participation mark- you can choose to answer question (1 time during the whole semester) or to clean the whiteboard.
2 mid-terms. The first one is extremely easy- just for you to adjust into uni. and the other one and the  final are harder and harder.
reviews.comment_workload: Only 1 assignment per week and you can skip 3 times during the semester. (Answer is provided.)

reviews.author: kykchan
reviews.comment_content: Large proportion of the content overlapping with dse syllabus, so people who studied BAFS accounting module would have advantage.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very detailed explanation that students could follow easily. Friendly manner. Clear and useful powerpoints.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading. Three mini exams during the semester. Participation marks were given to those who answered pop-up questions in class. There were also irregular in-class exercises. Also a group project similar to case analysis. No attendance will be counted though.
reviews.comment_workload: Three mini exams would be a burden. But pretty similar to powerpoints distributed. (Remember to attend classes to get tips for exams!)

reviews.author: Momomo
reviews.comment_content:
The content for exam question is little. However, the notes included many other information about the real world and real incidents and figures. If you revise for midterm or final, you can ignore those thing.
The book is useless too. As there are a lot of things not included in the exam.
The syllabus is similar to BAFS but some format changed.
reviews.comment_teaching: 50% content, 50% other stuff(sharing of some news).
reviews.comment_grading:
Mean is very high.
Bonus marks are given to answering in-class questions on board, always asking questions and presentation of a news.
If you want A+, you must get highhhhh score in every tasks.
I got A (108/110 in midterm , 89/100 in final, 2 bonus)
reviews.comment_workload:
No HW.
One midterm and One final.
No attendance

reviews.author: Alice
reviews.comment_content: Teaching basic accounting skills, most of the things have been learned in secondary school, if you have study BAFS before. Using notes for teaching, no powerpoint is available. The notes are not really good, you may always lose your way in the lessons. But the notes solution will be post soon.
reviews.comment_teaching: She is willing to teach if you have any question, just go free to ask her. Her lessons are boring, you need to pay attention, I always do not know where is she talking about.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is fine, mean is B.
reviews.comment_workload: Not heavy. Hand in 8 in-class exercises, just hand in is okay, no matter is it correct or not. 2 midterm, 1 final examination. Participation mark can get by answering 1 question in the whole semester, or clean the whiteboard once.

reviews.author: WLYC
reviews.comment_content:
powerpoint teaching
Those powerpoints are edited by the textbook publisher.
Professor will modify a little bit.
Textbook question will be used as teaching material.
She assigned us to conduct a group project which is about finding mistakes under accounting policy.
reviews.comment_teaching:
acceptable
She is an Taiwanese visiting professor who went to United States for study/job purpose.
Her English accent is acceptable.
She was kind to answer student's questions.
She asked questions in lesson so as to give participation mark.
reviews.comment_grading: normal grading
reviews.comment_workload:
1 Group Project
3 Mid term exam
~6 lecture quiz
1 final exam
heavy workload

reviews.author: ctshih
reviews.title: easy if you have studied BAFS
reviews.comment_content:
The course mostly covered DSE BAFS materials. The course is easy if you studied BAFS before. But it is quite difficult if you have not studied BAFS before. It includes basic accounting principles and some basic calculations.

Some inclass exercises.
2 mid terms
1 final exam
reviews.comment_teaching:
A little bit boring but she is nice.
She is willing to answer your questions patiently.
reviews.comment_grading: Not bad. She will give some tips to you in the last few lectures before the final exam. The final exam is quite difficult.
reviews.comment_workload: Very little workload. Only some inclass exercises. 2 midterms and 1 final.

reviews.author: Kira
reviews.title: acct2010
reviews.comment_content: Notes are prepared. If the lesson is canceled, powerpoint will be prepared.
reviews.comment_teaching: Easy to understand and follow what she said. Sometimes will have some interactions in the class. Also, Professor Chen like to make jokes in class, so it won't be too boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
Average. It might have a better grading for those students who have studied BAFs in DSE.
Also, it is very easy to get the participation mark. e.g. only answer one question in the whole semester, then you can get the whole 6% participation mark.
reviews.comment_workload: Not a lot of workload, there is no homework. Although there are quizzes, it graded by attempt, not by score.

reviews.author: john doe
reviews.title: A great course for those who hv studied BAFS before
reviews.comment_content: NO assignment , NO quizs, as the professor said, if you hv studied BAFS before, you are welcome not to attend the lessons at all
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is a little bit boring, mainly focus on the accounting rule but sometimes talk about the worldwide stock markets which do not related to the mid term and final at all
reviews.comment_grading:
good, most of my friends and I get B or above
if u want some extra marks for the paper in final, you can answer some questions in class to get it
reviews.comment_workload: No workload at all, only 1 mid term 1 final , that's all

reviews.author: Jesslyn
reviews.comment_content: basic accounting to well prepare you for future ones. A nice introductory course for previously non business students.
reviews.comment_teaching: good powerpoint, easy to follow what he teaches especially for students with no accounting background.
reviews.comment_grading: He gives very little As. Try to score full mark for the quizzes and groupwork since they are relatively easy to score. Try getting mean + 1SD for both mid and finals and you'll secure a B+.
reviews.comment_workload: he gives lots of quizzes, groupwork and homework. He isnt going to check your homework but try to do all since some of the formats are similar to those of the quizzes/ mid/ final. (he'll attach an answer key for you to check so that's an advantage)

reviews.author: Liz
reviews.title: ACCT 2010
reviews.comment_content: The concepts were okay. She tried not to miss out any concepts that the actual book covered. Lots of print materials were handed out and the professor had exercise questions to make sure we understood the concepts.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching was fast. If a student missed one class, it became quite hard to do the catch ups. Also, she teaches fast and a bit boring, so it's important for a student not to lose his/her focus.
reviews.comment_grading: I guess grading is good. Even though i have not studied a lot, i was able to hit the avg.
reviews.comment_workload: homweork for the lecture (i.e exercises work) is quite bothering.

reviews.author: Daniel320
reviews.comment_content: 大部分是DSE acct 的內容，之前讀過應該不算難， 但沒讀過的就很辛苦。
reviews.comment_teaching: 這個instructor會令人不知道他說什麼，好難follow
reviews.comment_grading:
我FINAL 45%（Mean55%） 有 B，應該還好
2 midterm, both very easy ( Mean around 85-90%)
Participation mark is easy to get (Answer question or CLEAN THE BOARD after class ) 1 time = full participation mark
reviews.comment_workload: 沒什麼Assignment，只有in-class exercise, 交就有分， 可以亂做！

reviews.author: xxhoya
reviews.title: Workload最重
reviews.comment_content: Tony應該係咁多個教得最多嘢 所以真心學acct基本嘢係ok嘅
reviews.comment_teaching:
Acct有趣極有限 不過tony都算係咁
不過上佢9點堂就會成日瞓著 10半就好啲嘅
reviews.comment_grading: 如果你dse有讀過bafs 啲task就應該對你黎講輕鬆嘅 不過好似我呢啲無讀過嘅 死温難温都比讀過嗰啲屈
reviews.comment_workload:
Tony真心就幾個lecturer之中最多workload
隔堂就有in class exercise或者quiz 計分嗰隻 即係就無得走堂
Midterm exam就全部都long q條條都要計 對於無修過bafs嘅真心勁harsh
相比其他lecturers 得mc嘅就真係係難左d

reviews.author: natalie123
reviews.title: must take course
reviews.comment_content: normal content as other
reviews.comment_teaching:
very knowledgeable prof
but always teaching things about financial market not testbook related
reviews.comment_grading:
ok poor grade
mid term below mean a bit
final at mean

only grade on mid term and final
also have in class exercise but seems only answer a few time questions already ok
reviews.comment_workload:
nth to do
no attendance no homework at all

there is bonus in doing on class presentation and news clipping
each will give one bonus score to final score so many people are doing it and eventually everyone score the bonus

reviews.author: gfedcba
reviews.comment_content:
It covers many topics through out the semester.
However, many of those were being learnt from high school, given that the students studied BAFS.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kathy is nice and funny in class. This is the first time she taught acct 2010. I could feel that she prepared a lot for the lesson. However, if you have no concept about accounting, she may not be the best choice for you as she was not explaining accounting clear enough.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term exam x 3
Final exam x 1
In-class assignment x 10
Participation Bonus
Case Study x 1
reviews.comment_workload: Nearly no workload, as assignments are being done in class.

reviews.author: hibye01
reviews.title: Not so good grade
reviews.comment_content:
If you have studied BAFS before, don't expect to have the similar content that you have in high schools.
Compare to Li Xi or Tong's content, her is much difficult but actually you cannot find out how they can apply to acctounting
reviews.comment_teaching: OK. Just a bit boring as she talks so soft.If you seat quite behind, it is not possible get all the content she said.
reviews.comment_grading:
Poor grading!!!
The cut off between each level and sub level are not so clear and you will fall into some bad one for just 0.0X%

I have all the mid terms and final above mean and 1st mid term get full mark.
As well as finish the homework and participation.
However, I just get a B!!!!!1
reviews.comment_workload: Have Homework or you can say that is classwork

reviews.comment_content: Covers basic accounting theories
reviews.comment_teaching: Would be easy to follow if you've taken acct dse before, but many students find it difficult since the ones who've taken dse and the ones who haven't (which is the majority) study this course together.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grading!
reviews.comment_workload: Just one mid term and finals, the other classes might require you to take tests and quizzes, but this professor only requires you to study diligently by yourself, and cleverly asks your friends which chapters would be examined. He also will require you to do some news presentations or answering class questions but those re for extra points

reviews.author: mynickname
reviews.comment_content:
Brief introduction of accounting
Easy content
American accounting style
reviews.comment_teaching: I did not take Acct in DSE, and it will be very difficult for me to follow her teaching. But if you took Acct in DSE before, you will feel easy to follow. She is kind and considerate so you can ask her questions after lessons.
reviews.comment_grading: For the exam, it is really hard but you can easily get full marks in participation and in-class exercises.
reviews.comment_workload: Little workload. Only fews homework and some quiz in class. In class exercises are distributed every week and students need to hand them in every week.

reviews.author: ryukyuryukyu
reviews.title: Exciting Class
reviews.comment_content: The content of the class very closely follows the four basic financial statements which are: Income Statement, Statement of Cash Flows, Balance Sheet, and Statement of Stockholder's Equity. Going into this class, I didn't have much excitement surrounding learning accounting, but I think that Professor Shieh did a great job of making what he had to teach quite exciting. Although the class had some of the hardest and most dense content of my semester, Tony broke it down nicely and the final ended up being one my easier ones.
reviews.comment_teaching:
As stated before, I think that Professor Shieh was a wonderful teacher. He frequently gave real world examples to ground the concepts. He also tried to be extra enthusiastic about what he was teaching in order to bring the overall energy of the course up as well.

I think that having a good professor for this class is important. I can only imagine how bored I would have been if my professor was not enthusiastic about what he/she was teaching.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading follows the regular SBM curve. Final is non-cumulative and also had a much higher curve than the midterm. There are quizzes, the lowest score of these is dropped. Definitely recommend studying quite hard for the first one.
reviews.comment_workload: This really depends on how much you care about your grade in this class. It is recommended that you go through each problem in the textbook if you want an A. This is what I did. However, problem is, many of these problems require you to write out entire financial statements which can take up to 2 pages back to back of writing. Ultimately tho, it might be the only way to commit such lengthy processes to memory well enough to do well on the exams.

reviews.author: SlNG
reviews.comment_content: In this course, it teaches the basic components of a financial statement, such as shareholders equity and statement of cash flow. It mainly introduces the calculation of bad debt, inventories, and depreciation of assets.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He uses an interesting way to teach, often makes jokes.
Loves to answer students' questions, but sometimes uses too much time. Some missing parts of the notes need you to attend lessons to write down.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm: 92/100 Mean:72
Final:96 Mean:8x
Quiz and group ex: around 90%
A(dse, no bafs)
reviews.comment_workload: No assignment. Just need to revise for quizzes and group exercises(you can rely on others).

reviews.author: Moooon
reviews.comment_content: First half of the syllabus is similar to HKDSE BAFS. Difficult parts like bonds and shares
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher always talks about examples that are not printed on the notes, so you have to pay attention in class. If you have any question, she will answer you patiently and explain clearly.
reviews.comment_grading:
For those who have studied BAFS will be likely to receive high scores in the 2 mid-terms.

A 2-sided cheat sheet is allowed
reviews.comment_workload:
Some in-class exercise, but they are extracted from the textbook. You can directly copy from the answer
Some online quizzes on Canvas that marks will be given no matter you answer it correctly or not
2 mid-term (easy) 10% & 20%
1 final (extremely difficult) 40%

reviews.author: Gevin
reviews.comment_content: Good content. But he uses a different book, so it's quite troublesome if you want to form a study group.
reviews.comment_teaching: Excellent teaching method, makes you really understand the material even though never learn about accounting.
reviews.comment_grading: Quite good, I got slightly above mean in the midterm and almost mean plus sd in the final. I got A- for this course.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is basically quite low, some group exercises and quiz. But not all the grades are taken, one worst score will be excluded. The questions really help you learn, have to pay attention to the questions, some will be tested in the midterm or final with some minor modifications. The suggested question in the book is crucial as well.

reviews.author: jeannie
reviews.title: acct 2010
reviews.comment_content: In this course it teaches the basic components of a financial statement, such as shareholders equity and statement of cash flow. It mainly introduces the calculation of bad debt, inventories and depreciation of assets.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is clearly delivered, there are some missing parts in his powerpoint as the professor wants his students to attend his lessons
reviews.comment_grading: Mid terms and exams are both easy, therefor the median is relatively high as well. The professor would also give some tips before the exam.
reviews.comment_workload: There is no homework but in class group exercises and quizzes

reviews.author: ykc
reviews.comment_content:
中學有讀ACCT就一定輕鬆應付
冇底既人可能要辛苦少少
Tony教D野比其他professer深
但有溫書應該OK
reviews.comment_teaching: 教授presentation skills好勁，ppt清晰，上堂會講final考咩，但考試係以書做藍本，所以讀ppt可能未必完全cover晒，要買書做exercise
reviews.comment_grading: 好grade，教嘅野難但midterm,final較淺，唔take attendance但有participation分
reviews.comment_workload:
1 midterm and final
4-6 in-class exercises and quizzes
冇project and presentation

reviews.author: sandyyylwss
reviews.comment_content:
clear
lecture note with some in-class exercise
nice and fast to answer the questions in the book in canvas
even a student did not take BAFS before can also follow the content in the course
no attendance requirement
reviews.comment_teaching:
easy to follow
always share some business news to us
will print out the lecture note to us
have some in-class exercise and can have better understanding about the topic
reviews.comment_grading: quite gd
reviews.comment_workload:
less workload
one midterm and one final
(each percentage in grading is heavy)
no essay quiz project assignment

reviews.author: ustissochur
reviews.comment_content:
就算我之前係冇讀過ACCT,都掌握到堂上教既野
聽講格式同中學有少少唔同,但差唔多一半都係中學既野
同埋上堂教既野都幾豐富
本書都幾有用,有本書/ E-book 旁身都唔錯。
reviews.comment_teaching:
大概有17-18份notes,頁數唔多
上堂有少少悶
好肯教學生,通常落堂出去問都教得好詳盡,而且canvas入面discussion佢都會成日回應學生既問題。
有大概12份in-class exercise,好似做8份左右就攞到曬24分。
而in-class exercise多數係書入面既問題。
reviews.comment_grading:
in-class exercise  24%
mid-term 1  10%
mid-term 2  20%
final  40%
participation 6%
兩次mid-term都好簡單,唔少人滿分,第一次既mean係90分,第二次既mean係82.4分,但係要有心理準備,因為final極難,final既mean係126.2/235,highest係174/235,所以mid-term唔好缺席!

至於participation既6%,有兩個選擇,上堂答一次問題或者落堂幫手擦一次白板。
reviews.comment_workload:
workload一啲都唔大
in-class exercise只要有交就有分,而且上堂答既問題都幾容易,如果你答唔出,佢仲會幫下你手。
mid-term考既野兩次都唔同，所以唔算多。
而final就可以帶一張紙(兩頁)既cheat sheet。
