reviews.comment_teaching:
notes唔多 好多野要上堂聽佢講再自己寫番落去
講書唔算好清晰
notes答案canvas會有
in class exercise 全部係書入面嘅題目黎
同樣地canvas都會有哂答案比你
parti個6%好易攞
一係上堂之前同佢講定落堂幫佢刷白板
一係就上堂個陣答問題
reviews.comment_grading:
final 40%
midterm 1 10%
midterm 2 20%
in class ex. 24%
parti 6%
都算好grade, below mean都有c+
reviews.comment_workload:
workload唔大 in class有交就有分唔會理你啱唔啱
midterm考嘅野唔多
final有cheat sheet

reviews.author: Taedong Kim
reviews.comment_content: Very effective and useful. You will learn about basic stuffs about Accounting.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very useful and helpful with teaching materials. She gives very helpful teaching materials to students. These materials would help you to easily understand about Accounting.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very good except the final exam. You can easily get the points by clearing the white board or answering the question that she asks you.
Midterm exams are super easy. You don't have to read the books. You can just prepare for the midterms by reading all materials that she gives you.
However, the final exam could be quite tricky. Be well prepared!
reviews.comment_workload: Very light before the final exam. Assignments are easy, and midterms are easy too.

reviews.author: swaggyp
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite easy if you studied BAFS in secondary school. Almost everything is based on the content in DSE.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor always talk about things out of the content, and kind of expect we know everything related to accounting before attending lectures. Not easy to catch up if you did not study BAFS in secondary school.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is qute good
reviews.comment_workload: Not many workloads. Attendance is not taken. Sometimes there are exercise distributed but not related  to grading. Basically does not have to attend lesson if you do not want to. Only one midterm and one final exam so I think it is quite easy to handle.

reviews.author: Brian Lau
reviews.comment_content: very educative and it is not too challenging. It would be much more easier if you studied BAFS before.
reviews.comment_teaching: The explanation is clear but he talked a lot of extra stuff that is interesting but irrelevant to exams.
reviews.comment_grading: He claimed that the average grade is B+. Yet, the mean of the final and mid term  exam is quite high. Getting satisfying mark in exams doesn't secure a good grade for some students.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not too heavy. There is only one mid term exam with 45% and one final exam with 55%.

reviews.author: 卡斯
reviews.title: A Easy course with fundamental teaching notes
reviews.comment_content: Relatively complicated but helpful to your future studies
reviews.comment_teaching:
Providing extra knowledge.
Although professor sporadically made some jokes,the lessons were not interesting.
reviews.comment_grading: Because of my accounting background,i got A+ in this subject.However,the overall grading is about B or B+.Prof.Shieh may not give a good grade if you cannot comprehend the teaching notes well.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quizzes are quite difficult because they were taken simply after the professor taught you.
Workload may not be too heavy and everyone can handle it with the prerequisite that you have attended the lessons

reviews.author: Sooooo
reviews.comment_content:
Practical case anaylsis,
difficult to catch up if no prior Account knowledge in secondary school
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very willing to answer question, encourage students to raise any question
Quite amusing in his way of teaching, appreciate that:)
Many practical examples in explanations
He always require students to nod and have eye contact with him, a friendly lecturer
reviews.comment_grading:
Easy mid-term but terrible final
Poor grade but teaching is quite good though
reviews.comment_workload:
One ethical case anaylsis, very light workload
Required to answer questions and complete two in-class exercises for class participation
One mid-term and one final

reviews.author: Leo Ko
reviews.comment_content: the content is overall good and educative. it contains a lot of basic knowledge of accounting.
reviews.comment_teaching: the professor likes to tell business stories in class, which is not only interesting but also educative. but I don't think he has much experience in assessments.
reviews.comment_grading: he tries to make his exams simple, but everyone took good scores in the mid-term, in which case you can't really tell who deserves A range. so in the final the range became huge, and many people got bad grades. I don't think this is good.
reviews.comment_workload: it's not so heavy. some optional homework and two exams.

reviews.author: Denise Lai
reviews.comment_content: It's a bit hard. Even for ppl who have learn accounting before. Tony's teaching materials are probably the hardest amongest all the othe professors.  I personally think the bond and lease is the most difficult part.
reviews.comment_teaching: He's pretty good. He made everything clear and easy to understand andddd he is funny.
reviews.comment_grading: If you have learnt accounting before, it's fine; if you haven't, then... good luck
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. Just a few quizzes and group work and you're allowed to skip one quiz and one group work

reviews.author: brianaty
reviews.comment_content: The course covers elementary knowledge for beginners who just learn accounting. The course will not even include how to write an income statement or balance sheet. You will just learn roughly what accounting is, the concept of bad debts, components like account receivable/payable, accrued expenses in an income statement and a balance sheet.
reviews.comment_teaching: I would definitely suggest Prof Mak to be your lecturer. Not only is he funny, but he also knows what the weaknesses of most students are facing in accounting. He would therefore spend more time in explaining particular topics until we clear the doubt. Unlike other professors who are trying to cram all the knowledge they think a year 1 student should have to their students but in fact they cannot really understand what is going on... Prof Mak would rather pick quality over quantity in this situation.
reviews.comment_grading: The overall grading for the course is quite good, to be fair. All of my friends who took the course this semester or in the past semesters got a B+ or above, despite the fact that some of them did not study BAFS in their high schools.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload, to be fair. I got a case study assignment, a mid-term and an examination in that semester. There were also several classworks for taking attendence. Period.

reviews.author: whchanao
reviews.comment_content: easy thing learnt in BAFS during secondary school. Once you comply the knowledge she taught with what you have learnt. Good grade is waiting for you.
reviews.comment_teaching: She is keen on teach and answering all questions asked by her students in her lecture. She also loves encouraging her student to ask more and more.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is normal. Work hard can guarantee you a good grade which means A range.
reviews.comment_workload: Just final exam and mid term exam. They are both easy if you have done all the exercises she suggested. Assignments are easy and are done by groups.

reviews.author: abbychan
reviews.comment_content: the content is quite intensive and if you didn't take any accounting course in your secondary school, it will be quite challenging.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony is an amazing teacher who has passion in teaching. He makes accounting less boring and if you're  active in class, he will help you to get better grade at the end.
reviews.comment_grading: Quite active in class so even though I got one sd lower than the average in the final exam. still able to get a B at the end.
reviews.comment_workload: not much, just a few quiz and group exercise.

reviews.author: ElvisSo
reviews.comment_content:
Brief introduction of accounting
Easy content
American accounting style
reviews.comment_teaching:
Such a passionate teacher
Accept students' questions asking after every lesson
Funny teacher
Well preparation before lecture
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1 super easy
Quiz 2 easy
Final : difficult
6%participation (can be easily attained)
just answer question or clean the whiteboard for once
Mean is quite high for Quiz 1 and 2
reviews.comment_workload:
There's an in class exercise after every chapter ends and it's a must to hand in at least 8 of them but    all of them are too easy and you can discuss it with your peers
Only 2 quizzes and 1 fianl

reviews.author: jollykat
reviews.title: li xi good instructor
reviews.comment_content: li xi covered less topics and mostly the practical ones. i think he did skip some topics covered by other instructors, which i think is okay though i prefer to understand more fundamentals as i have no accounting background in high school
reviews.comment_teaching: he ddidnt hestitate to answer questions, but he sometimes did sharings on finance side, and discuss with us financial issues. Quite interesting to learn more than accounting though
reviews.comment_grading: good, i think he gives out full percentage of A range, leaving students overall better grading in the same course delivered by other instructors
reviews.comment_workload: no workload but only 1 midterm and 1 final, so it depends on you to do after chapter exercise to get get yourself familiar with questions in midterm and final. i can say if you really familiarise yourself wig after chapter exercise, you will be able to get good grade in the end !!!!

reviews.author: T123
reviews.title: Great introductory to financial accounting
reviews.comment_content:
The content is fairly straightforward, lecture slides and the textbook are easy to understand for the most part. The course introduces what financial accounting is and how its done. The topics covered were:
Balance Sheet, Income Statement, Statement of Stockholders Equity, Statement of Cash Flows, US GAAP vs IFRS, Journal entries and T-accounts, Adjusting entries, Reporting sales revenue, reporting cost of goods sold, reporting liabilities, reporting assets, reporting bonds and reporting owners equity.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor was very engaging during class, and she taught the concepts clearly so that all the students were able to understand everything. She would also incorporate the use of in-class assignments and examples from the textbook to demonstrate the concepts taught in the class.
reviews.comment_grading:
In my opinion, the grading for this course was alright.
3 mini exams (each on 3 chapters) - 13% each
Final exam (cumulative) - 40%
Participation - 5%
Group case assignment - 6%
In-class assignments - 10%
reviews.comment_workload: The main workload were the mini exams, because there was one almost every month. There were homework assignments but they were not mandatory, it was just to help for exam prep. You're given a long time to complete the case assignment so it's not very time-consuming.

reviews.author: CLee
reviews.comment_content: Easy for those people learned accounting before. Answering the questions and asking questions can also gain bonus marks. The attendance is not count.
reviews.comment_grading: Only calculate the marks from mid-term exam and final exam. The questions were similar to the questions shown in the lesson and the in-class exercises.
reviews.comment_workload: No homework assigned. Only have 1 mid-term and final. But can choose to do the news presentation in class around 1-2 minutes for getting the bonus marks. There were in-class exercises answering these questions can gain the bonus marks.

reviews.author: Wing Sharon
reviews.comment_content: Content is clear but covered some news which wouldnt be tested in exam.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Easy to understand and professor was willing to answer questions after class
You can also ask question during class. This even count as extra credit if you are willing to ask or answer questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grade
Exam is not difficult if you completed the assigned exercises
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite light

1 individual presentation for about 2minutes
In-class exercises per lesson , but the professor would do with you and show the answer soon.
Do not need to submit any assignment

reviews.author: ericagianotti
reviews.comment_content: Very well explained content. Professor Shieh also highlights what specifically is going to be in the exams and what he wants the students to fully understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: Clear, western teaching style. His English is perfect and the slides are very clear. He provides students with solutions to all problems
reviews.comment_grading: Pretty fair. He helps a lot during the exam itself. The final is not cumulative. Quizzes and group exercises are not hard and boost your grade
reviews.comment_workload: The more exercise you do, the better. Doing the suggested exercise is not enough

reviews.author: killerhater
reviews.comment_content: The notes are clear and easy to follow. Before midterm and final, just simply study the notes will be fine.
reviews.comment_teaching: I did not take Acct in DSE, and it will be very difficult for me to follow her teaching. But if you took Acct in DSE before, you will feel easy to follow. She is kind and considerate so you can ask her questions after lessons.
reviews.comment_grading: The mean is very low. About 50% will be B range. It is not easy to get  B, as long as you have studied the notes and do some exercises in the textbook.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light. Only 8 coursework is needed to be completed. Other online assessments are not necessary. There are two midterms but they are quite easy, especially you took Acct before. But the final is extremely difficult, so need to pay attention to study before final.

reviews.author: kaykaylav
reviews.comment_content: A bit hard if you don't catch up with the pace. Make sure you read the textbook and have some common sense.
reviews.comment_teaching: Detailed and easy to understand, many examples on how to calculate and tips for finals and mid terms. Tony was very willing to help students.
reviews.comment_grading: Lenient, even if you are slightly below mean for mid term and mean for finals, you can still get B+ if in-class exercices are mostly full marks.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload, only few class exercises and short quizzes. No projects at all

reviews.author: LaGreat
reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment_content: First of all,  the quizzes and exams are not really that hard. Quizzes are all about topics that are mentioned in class. Therefore, it would be okay if you pay attention in class and study lecture notes.
reviews.comment_teaching: Easy to understand what the professor said. Lesson is pretty engaging, the overall learning atmosphere is quite good.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is pretty good. If you always pay attention in class, do the questions that they suggested you to do, and study the lecture notes, it is possible to get B range or above.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload as there are no assignments. Maybe it would be better if you study the textbook before lesson for better understanding.

reviews.author: c/h
reviews.comment_content: 2020 mainly introduced the basic of accounting, mainly focused on balance sheet, statement of shareholders equity, statement of cash flow and income statement. The topics that are taught at the beginning of the course is covered in the hkdse bafs syllabus so its easier for ppl who have taken bafs in secondary school. And it'll be difficult for people who didnt study bafs to pick up the speed through out the course and higher effort than bafs-ers needed to be done.
reviews.comment_teaching:
-quite clear
-taught some out of topics things
-cant rely on his notes that much since it is too simple and didnt cover all the important stuff
reviews.comment_grading:
fair
work hard, got B- without studying bafs in secondary school
reviews.comment_workload:
medium
quizes and group exercise

reviews.author: isa
reviews.comment_content:
This courses introduces the basics of accounting, including four financial statement and accounting terms. Balance sheet and Income statement are thoroughly explained and taught to be nearly practical in real life whereas statement of cash flow is introduced a little bit. The accounting period is also introduced.
Methods and rules of recording transactions are introduced.
just as same as what other said.
reviews.comment_teaching: pretty well, humor, clear and detail teaching
reviews.comment_grading:
Pretty good grade for me
i get just little above mean in mid term
i am in A range overall
reviews.comment_workload: no much work load, just one assignment, class participation and some class activities

reviews.author: Pinball
reviews.comment_content:
This courses introduces the basics of accounting, including four financial statement and accounting terms. Balance sheet and Income statement are thoroughly explained and taught to be nearly practical in real life whereas statement of cash flow is introduced a little bit. The accounting period is also introduced.
Methods and rules of recording transactions are introduced.
reviews.comment_teaching:
-Well-organised progress of the course
-Welcome to questions (online or in person)
-Use of tools and games to help understanding
-Nice to students
reviews.comment_grading:
Getting mean marks in mid-terms and exam is likely to have B+
Homework and class participation are counted in the mark and they are easy to get. Class participant mark is guaranteed if you attend lessons and pay attention when professor instructs.
reviews.comment_workload:
-Homework each chapter for revision; each consists of about 2-4 questions
-2 mid-terms and 1 exam
mid-terms are easy but exam( cheat sheet allowed) is very difficult

reviews.author: 文西
reviews.comment_content:
Topics are mostly covered in HKDSE BAFS(Accounting), so it is pretty easy for those who have taken BAFS before.
REMEMBER TO ATTEND MOST OF THE LESSONS EVEN THOUGH YOU CAN LEARN IT AT HOME!!!!!
He put some in class examples into the final exam questions (carry many marks), those who skipped classes will not be able to answer.
reviews.comment_teaching: efficient
reviews.comment_grading:
Normal
but the midterms and final are very difficult.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is little, there is only one essay-type assignment (which is a little complicated as you will have to read some resources).
The overall workload is little comparing with other accounting instructors.

reviews.author: davidson
reviews.title: acct2010
reviews.comment_content:
The content is quite easy to read and understand, but you have to study really hard to memorize the detail while you want to get a great grade.
The class content only contains a book and the ppt that professor provides, it is recommended that to read all the content beforehand so that you can ask the good question to leave the better impression which is important to this class to the professor.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor's teaching is quite obvious and tone has ups and downs, so even though accounting is boring sometimes, you still can focus on the points that he made.
Though he is too funny sometimes, making fun of some jokes and student's name. Overall, he is still a good professor who is willing to answer every single question.
reviews.comment_grading: Heard that people said that he is a killer, but somehow it's not true to some extent. Though his midterm and final test are not easy at all, averaging 70 something, he still tries to remind us how he will test or grade during the in-class quiz or group exercise. However, you want to get an A, you still need to grasp any chance to speak up or score high, and that is the reality in this competitive school.
reviews.comment_workload: In comparison to other courses in the first semester, including isom2010 and so on. This course is absolutely harder and more to recognize. Thus, the workload shall be more, obviously. However, this course is still very fundamental in accounting, so the workload shall not be that much. All you have to do is to the practice and practice before the test and quiz.

reviews.author: mi
reviews.comment_content: content is simple. basically half of the course is similar to financial accounting in DSE. First half of the course is quite simple because it is similar to DSE.
reviews.comment_teaching: clearly explaining concepts. Tony is nice. The atmosphere in the lessons is good.
reviews.comment_grading: not too bad. i didn't do much thing but still got an B-. the average mark is around 7X in Final
reviews.comment_workload:
workload is low.
1mid-term, 1 final, non-cimulative
some quizzes
some in-class ex, around once per 2weeks
These exercises are done by forms of groups
Actually no attendance is needed.

reviews.author: pakpak
reviews.comment_content: this course is an advanced course of acct 3010 and the content is quite similar. if you did well in 3010, it is very easy for you to catch up the lesson.
reviews.comment_teaching: i forgot the name of my professor but she worked in big 4 in shanghai before. although her english was hard to understand, her teaching was very clear and full of content.
reviews.comment_grading: the mean was quite high and the standard deviation was small. i got full mark in my midterm and homework and i also think i did very well in the final. however, i just got an A. so only getting all full marks can get an A+ in this course. no attendance was counted but attending the lesson helps you have a better understanding!
reviews.comment_workload: there are online quizzes every week but they were quite easy. just keep in mind that the quizzes will be easier if you pay attention on every lesson. if you have skipped any lesson, you have to spend much more time to understand the concept. so worth to take the lesson.

reviews.author: htc
reviews.comment_content: This course is easy for those who studied accounting in HKDSE to handle. It includes basic knowledge and concepts. It is a useful course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony is a good professor. He is willing to answer students' enquires. His lessons are interesting and attractive. Have a good learning atmosphere in his class.
reviews.comment_grading: mean for final and midterm is quite high as it maybe easy for those who studies accounting before.
reviews.comment_workload: final is quite difficult. similar level with HKDSE. there are in class quiz twice a week. Have to pay atttention in class.

reviews.author: Martinlau
reviews.comment_content: basically the whole accounting textbook - for my sem, we did chapters 1-13 (skipping chapter 5) - the pace was quite fast (basically a chapter per lecture or 2)
reviews.comment_teaching: it was alright but she had problems with the microphone and every time she coughed it was like a mini explosion coming from the speakers
reviews.comment_grading:
only midterm + final + group project (which you can choose)
- mean was quite high for both exams
participation is mandatory in this class and students are cold called in every class to demonstrate not only their knowledge of the course material but as % of their participation
reviews.comment_workload:
little workload (if you decide to not do the textbook questions albeit highly recommended to do so)
-

reviews.author: Caleb Chan
reviews.comment_content: Kelvin教既野比其他professor簡單好多，對有讀過BAFS既人係易到核爆，唔上堂唔溫書都分分鐘有A range，powerpoint唔會太多野同太複雜，但係對無acct background既人會聽到一嚿雲，midterm同final出得易，同practice question差唔多level，但係好多人都好勁，midterm mean個分係88%
reviews.comment_teaching:
教得勁慢，上堂成日講埋d冇人會記既extra knowledge，其他班midterm考5個chapter，我地就考3個 (暗爽)，Final有一個chapter唔夠時間教skip左唔駛考。
個人認為教得太廢，想hea既就可以揀佢，想認真學野就唔好，
midterm前堂堂做自己野，midterm後1堂都無上過。
reviews.comment_grading:
Class activities and participation 10%
Case about professional ethics 15%
Mid-term exam 25%
Final exam 50%
Total 100%
上堂可以舉手答問題 / 問問題，會比張紙你mark返低你個名同id，但係小弟1次都無舉過手 (-.-')，加上份assignment求其寫得1頁半，overall照拎A，所以個人認為midterm同final高分就得

assignment同final既分無出，直接出grade
reviews.comment_workload: 平時無功課要做，可以自己做下practice question，每個chapter有2條，成個sem有1份assignment，比個situation你寫accountant既professional ethics，要寫3頁，又麻煩又難吹

reviews.author: yvonne9773
reviews.comment_content: actually his teaching style is funny but the content is more deeper than others professor.it's difficult for students who never learn bafs before
reviews.comment_teaching:
the powerpoint isn't good,just use the publishing company's ppt
need to jot down notes,coz his exam like to have some extra tips
reviews.comment_grading:
me midterm have mean,final below mean 0.5 sd got c+

my classmate both midterm and final below mean likely 2 sd got c,so the sd is quite big
reviews.comment_workload: have to finish many in class exerciase gp exercise and one midterm one final

reviews.author: Lennon
reviews.comment_content: The content is about basic financial accounting theory. It is not very interesting and most of students hate it as they take it in the first term of the first year and the content is not easy to understand compared to other courses.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching was quite boring. I studied all contents by myself with textbook. Her presentation is not really helpful. Try to get friends in other class notes for help. However, she was an exchange professor and doesn't teach at ust anymore.
reviews.comment_grading: It is not easy to achieve a high letter grade. You will get C+ if you only achieve mean. The exams were more about theory than practical skills. Practical questions are quite easy, but theory questions are on details on slides and textbook.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was not that bad, but there was a group assignment at the end of the course. Considering that other classes did not have the group assignment, the workload is high. The group project was to find accounting faults in a case study from Harvard Business School. The answer is not online, so you actually need to study for it. There were two midterm exams and one final exam.

reviews.author: a.stupid
reviews.title: Very good teaching
reviews.comment_content: The content is just general accounting stuff, introducing double entry system and teach you how to prepare balance sheet, income statement and cashflow statement. It's time consuming to get to know to the concepts, but once you got it then everything go smooth.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony encourages you to ask questions in class if you can't get his point. He will then explain it clearly. His powerpoint is clean and easy-to-understand. For students studied BAFS before you can just read the ppt and skip all lectures. (of cuz, not recommend). And he remembers everyone's name!
reviews.comment_grading: I think grading is acceptable.Tony is not a good grade professor indeed. I get mean in mid-term, above one sd in final and then got an B+. Of course, if you participate more in class and ask more questions it will contribute a bit to your grading.
reviews.comment_workload: If you have already study BAFS accounting before, you already safe loads of time to study. In class quizzes, tests, is not really hard and need little tiem to study. However, have to put effort on mid-term and finals.

reviews.author: Melodic
reviews.title: Caring professor but confusing and boring teaching
reviews.comment_content: The content is not similar to dse bafs and the ways of doing  the same account or transaction may be different. However, it will be better for students with bafs(accounting) background in my opinion.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher is very sincere and caring to students but the lessons are sometimes very boring. Professor has tried her best to make it more interesting though.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is relatively high compared with other courses.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fair. There are in-class exercises for nearly every lesson but it is not compulsory and marks will be given as long as you hand in.

reviews.author: chy
reviews.title: if you want a good grade, you should try your best to get full mark in the midterms
reviews.comment_content:
the midterms are quite easy and comparatively shorter than other professors'
the participation mark is easy to get, you can either answer a question during lesson time (once is enough) or help the professor to clean the whiteboard
however, the final is quite hard and differ from the midterms, cheatsheet is allowed and i think it is quite important
reviews.comment_teaching: the lectures are just normal teaching, without using powerpoint slides, overall quite easy to catch up
reviews.comment_grading: she has different types of grading system so that you can have the highest grade with your results, generally speaking, the participation marks, midterms, are quite easy to get, although the final is hard, the mean is usually not that high, so it won't really affect much
reviews.comment_workload:
there are classwork during class time and you have to hand it in to her office before the due date and time, she won't go over the questions during lesson so you have to do it by yourself
however, the classwork mark will be given once you have handed in the classwork, regardless you got the questions right or wrong

reviews.author: BigMonster
reviews.title: Too competent for the curve, not easy to get A range
reviews.comment_content: 90% of course content is about the fundamental business rule which is quite useful for building up the basic understanding about Finance and Accounting. The course content follows closely to textbook. later part of include some Financial Mathematics that need to devote more time to practice.
reviews.comment_teaching: She is the visiting teacher and she would leave after this Semester. Standardized teaching method, Powerpoint Karaoke. Sometimes she would use Excel to crunch the case and questions step by step which is the most clearest way to understand the accounting concept, but her teaching style is a bit boring, i nearly fall asleep every lecture.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair, but too many local students have studied accounting in their high school, the content is basically the same as this course, so they can master this course easily, and most of them gain full mark in their mini exams and assignments. It is not easy to get A range, and most of the students falls to B and C range.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite a lot workload, three mini exams (cumulative), a case study group project and in class- assignments. basically, you need to study it every week in order to clear all the concepts, as the mini exam is once a month, and the mean is quite high as well. there are quite a lot students getting full mark and nearly full mark. Since it is cumulative, you need to study it consistently in order to utilise the concepts which are interrelated.

reviews.author: shirleyLin
reviews.comment_content: The course was actually very usful for student who have no pre-knowledge about accouting. It was taught from the very begining and covered all basic and necessary material. it was not difficult at all as long as you follow the course. You don't even have to attend all the lecture, reading the textbook and self study will also do.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kelvin is an brilliant teacher, he is local but his english is excellent. He some times told jokes in class and the teaching atmosphere was always quite relax and enjoyabe. Also, he has beautiful hand writing. Love him.
reviews.comment_grading: I have not learnt accounting before and i have a perfect grade, so i'd say good? The standard deviation in midterm and the final were not large and i was half sd and one sd above the mean. I got A* in the end.
reviews.comment_workload: One midterm, one final and i assignment. some class participation. So, i'd say light work load.

reviews.author: leahhhh
reviews.comment_content: It contains the basic knowledge of accounting. Most of the content is the same as DSE BAFS (accounting elective). For examples, Debit and Credit, income statement and balance sheet (only need to know the accounting items, not prepare one) For those who studied DSE accounting is easy to handle.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Mak is super friendly and nice, he is very patience to answer students'questions and would love to teach student steps by steps, so it is easy for non-accounting background student to catch up.  He also encourages students to participate in class. Overall, he is a really nice guy.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got slightly above mean in my mid-term. (no more than 1 sd)
For the essay and final examI don't really know my marks, but I got A+ eventually. To me, the content of the course is not difficult since I've studied accounting in DSE. However, for those who did not,  need to do more practices in order to get good grades. Also, to answer the questions and raise questions attentively in class to get participation mark!
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload compared to other business courses. Only one mid- term, one final and one asssignment about business ethics. There are some practice questions which will be done and discussed in class (not graded).

reviews.author: jeffery
reviews.comment_content: It is about learning how to prepare financial statements (e.g. income statement, balance sheet, statement of cash flow and statement of shareholders' equity) and also understanding the differences between the US accounting principle and IFRS (International Financial Reporting Standards).
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is good and he is willing to teach you. You are welcome to ask different kind of questions.
reviews.comment_grading: There are three quizzes, one midterm and one final. Attendance is not counted. The grade is quite good.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is low and there is no homework but there are about 4 group exercises.

reviews.author: nandattou?
reviews.comment_content: Covered a lot of topics in the book and before midterms or final exams, we did the exercises in the books together which helps to reinforce the comprehension of the course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her pace in teaching isn't too slow or too fast in comparison to other teachers teaching the same course.  Teaching was easy to understand if you listen attentively.
reviews.comment_grading: Both midterms and final exam were not that difficult honestly.  As long as you have enough practice solving questions and have a comprehensive understanding of the concepts, you'll do well.
reviews.comment_workload:
She gives in-class assignments which are counted towards the final grades and also helps to better understand the content and how to work out the set problems.
She also has participation points in which you have to answer her questions during class for extra points to your grade.
There was also a case study in which you had to do it with two other people. Content wasn't hard to understand and easy to finish.

reviews.author: awtw
reviews.comment_content: Didnt learn account in secondary school. It is to learn how to prepare financial statement.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is good that he is willing to tell you some knowledge outside the book which is useful  .
reviews.comment_grading: There is one midterm and one final. Attendence is not counted. There is extra point you can get through answering questions or demonstrating your work in class.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is low.There is no homework. Although the professor will distribute in class exercise, he wont collect it. He will just discuss the answer with you in class.

reviews.author: zcachuang
reviews.title: The first business course I took
reviews.comment_content: Professor Li's course is well-organized and you can know from the beginning what he is going to cover and test in the whole course. He will show many real world cases in his class which are really fascinating.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Li teaches in an appropriate pace and encourages us to do class-related presentations and to solve in-class questions on board, which, personally speaking, is really great.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grades, yet a little bit hard to get top grades.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is medium. Professor Li will tell you what will be tested and what will not, so you can prepare with clear mind. Also, get familiar with what he teaches in class is enough, yet you will get a better understanding if you review the textbook.

reviews.author: KATHLEEN
reviews.title: Principles of Accounting I
reviews.comment_content: hadn't study account before, quite different at first.But if you pat attention in classes, you learn lots of things.And I think  mid-term and exam is very different
reviews.comment_teaching: Good professor, teach with ppt, the clear points and easy to catch, teach with good tone
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme                 %
Attendance and Participation 5
In-class Group Exercises  10
Three  In-class Quizzes @ 20 points each (drop the lowest one) 10 Mid-term Exam 35
Final Examination (non-cumulative) 40    
TOTAL   100
mid term mean
final mean
In-class group exercises+quizzes: around 17/20
total grade B
reviews.comment_workload: I think workload is okay. There is 4 group exercises. You and your groupmates need to finish it within 15-20 minutes, so both of you need to do some revision.Otherwise you may find that time is not enough.

reviews.author: strivethebest
reviews.comment_content: Similar to DSE BAFS (accounting module), some new topics( eg,statement of cash flows). However, midterm and final quite difficult. If you pay effort, you will get a good result, (even though you have never studied acct in secondary school before).
reviews.comment_teaching:
Quite interesting, good professor with clear presentation skills
Teach with Powerpoint slides, not boring at all
reviews.comment_grading:
5% attendance
10% In-class group exercises
10% In-class quizzes
35% midterm
40% final
Midterm: higher than mean 1SD
Final: higher than mean 1SD
In-class group exercises+quizzes: around 15/20
Overall grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload:
1 midterm and 1 final
4 In-class group exercises
3 individual quizzes (in-class)

reviews.author: mVerY
reviews.comment_content: The content is not so difficult, that with certain effort, it is absolutely manageable to all students. However, the content is quite similar to the ACCT taught in secondary schools, so it favours students with ACCT elective in HKDSE.
reviews.comment_teaching: The explanation is clear and simple. However, it may be quite boring since the instructor may only copy the content on the slides prepared.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is great I think. It is quite fair. It basically relies on the performance of the 3 mini-exams and the final one. Also, it is with total 6 or 7 inclass assignments. All of them are easy but the mean of exam is extremely high, so you must do it carefully.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not so heavy but there are many exams.

reviews.author: KellyW
reviews.comment_content:
Basic accounting knowledge learnt from high school
A couple of new things only
Accounting ratios, accounting principles, double entries, preparation of income statement, balance sheet, statement of cash flow and owner's equity are taught.
reviews.comment_teaching:
for students who havent studied BAFS in high school, it may be a little bit difficult to catch up
but the effort will pay out
coz the stuff are not too hard

good teacher that answer all questions patiently either in classes or on canvas
reviews.comment_grading:
Quizzes are super easy
though this causes a high mean
but remember not to skip them coz they are too easy and u should make good use of them

Final is cazy
just try your best to study and even though you think you meesed up the whole thing, you can still reach or even get a result aboove mean, because everyone messed up.
reviews.comment_workload:
not heavy
just hand in some in-class exercises
two super easy quizzes and a final
no midterm

reviews.author: lilyyyou
reviews.comment_content: content is manageable for those without any accounting background.
reviews.comment_teaching: kelvin teaches very slowly, making sure every student understands the content thoroughly. he is one of the best professors ive had so far.
reviews.comment_grading: grading is based on the mid term, final, ethics assignment, as well as in class participation.
reviews.comment_workload: workload is close to none if you choose not to do the recommended practice questions from the textbook. there was only an ethics assignment. reading the textbook and doing the practice questions provided is more than enough to study for the exams.

reviews.author: ywendy
reviews.comment_content: Content is quite easy to follow in the beginning but a bit hard in the some topics as concepts should be clarified. However, you can understand them even though you have not study it before. Of course, hard word is required for better grading
reviews.comment_teaching: The lessons are quite boring so you may not be concentrated throughout the lesson. However, the teacher is very nice and she welcomes all questions from students.
reviews.comment_grading: grading is not too bad . if you get mark above mean in two mid-terms and final, you can probably in B range.
reviews.comment_workload: workload is quite light as you only need to finish most in class exercises

reviews.author: Kcwong
reviews.comment_content: All things taught are just fundamental concepts that are comparatively easy to the other instructors. It is highly recommended to take his course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kelvin taught vividly and his teaching is easy to follow. He is also helpful that would provide many back up.
reviews.comment_grading:
I have attended only three lessons and got a final grade of B+.
If you intended to get A, I highly recommend you to attend his lessons and pay attention to the IN-CLASS EXAMPLES that there would be questions based on the example in the final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not so heavy and of adequate level. All I have done is just examinations and one ethics assignment. For

reviews.author: terence0305
reviews.title: Review
reviews.comment_content:
Quite general acct knowledge you would expect to learn. Everything from the balance sheet, income statement to statement of cash flow.

Balance Sheet
Adjusting Entries
Bad debts
Cost of good sold
Property, Plant & Equipment
Liabilities
Statement of cash flow
Financial Analysis Tool
reviews.comment_teaching:
Mr Kelvin is really helpful and nice. His teaching pace is suitable and always make sure we understand first. He answered almost all questions raised in class and after class.

Moreover, he used many examples in class. (Make sure you write them down, they will be tested in the finals). He is really friendly. In general, I really enjoyed his lessons
reviews.comment_grading:
15% Class participation! You need to ask enough questions in class to gain these points. He will also collect in class group work from time to time, but he will tell us in advance when that happens. Kelvin said that this score is both quantitative and qualitative. So you need to make sure he knows you (hence front row or frequent emails).

15% Case Study on Ethics
30% Midterm (quite easy)
40% Finals (relatively harder)

Kelvin's class quite good grade. I didn't work to hard to get A-.
reviews.comment_workload:
There is not a lot of work except for the case study (which is a little struggling at first). Kelvin also hosts extra class on Saturday (attendance not counted) just to help students out.

As long as you don't miss too many classes/ read along the semester, you will do fine. The main thing here is to prepare for the midterms and finals by practising a lot of past questions.

In general, I wound not worry about this course. It is quite easy.

reviews.author: JCCH
reviews.comment_content: Try to attend all the sessions since ppts are not that detailed and you would have to add notes. He mainly uses ppt and exams are basically based on ppt. He often uses in class examples. So if you miss the class, you might fine the exam relatively difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Easy to follow, detailed ppts, class based on his ppt.
He makes sure that everyone class follow his class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair,
Class activities and participation 10%
Case about professional ethics 15%
Mid-term exam  25%
Final exam  50%
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much, there was on short essay and practice questions were optional.
No regular assignments

reviews.author: CodyWen
reviews.comment_content: 最基礎的acct知識，有一些概念比較confusing，但總體都不算太難
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony 會記住所有學生的英文名，so nice！我覺得他講acct的那些principles還可以，上課認真聽的話起碼概念是能懂的，但是還是需要自己去做題啦
reviews.comment_grading: 給龜不算特別好，算是fair。midterm和final都過mean一個sd多一點，平時的exercise也有幾次滿分，這樣拿到A，算是fair吧。
reviews.comment_workload: tony堂跟其他堂不一樣的地方在於會有group exercise，也有個人完成的課堂quiz，頻率還挺高的幾乎每堂課都有，算是督促大家不要走堂＝ ＝其實workload是可以自己決定的，想要考高分就一定要自己做很多題，所以我覺得workload應該算average咯

reviews.author: 點解要咁對我
reviews.comment_content: A bit more and different from what we have learnt in DSE.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not really funny teaching but she is really helpful. Just feel free to ask her questions and she will try her best to help and she is willing to help us to get a higher grade.
reviews.comment_grading: For the exam, it is really hard but you can easily get full marks in participation and in-class exercises.
reviews.comment_workload: Very low workload as only two midterms (The first one is easy to get full marks) and 12 in-class exercises (which you can simply find the answers).

reviews.author: purple
reviews.title: The grade is quite good
reviews.comment_content:
1. Overview of corporate financial reporting
2. Investing and financing decisions and the balance sheet
3. Opering decisions and the income statement
6. Sales revenue, receivables, and cash
7. Cost of goos sold and inventory
8. Property, plant, and equipment
9. Current Liabilities Time value of money
10. Bonds and long-term debts
reviews.comment_teaching:
It is hard to catch up the lesson if you don’t have account basic knowledge.
On the other hand, he talked a lot about many contents that dont include in the exam. For the one who like to learn more practical usage of accounting and have studied account before, It is highly recommended him.
Also, he is super kind. He won’t count the attendance. He also said that he let us to attend his lesson or not as soon as we can get the good results and manage our time.
He offered help as well. He welcomed students to ask question in the canvas and he answered one by one. Besides, He opened some official hours to answer students’ questions. It helped me to improve my grade a little bit.
reviews.comment_grading:
midterm exam 45%
final exam        55%
total                100%

Students could get 4 bonus points by presenting an financial news and writing answers of in-class exercise

scope of midterm: chapter 1,2,3,6
scope of final: all chapter mentioned above

Midterm: 89/110 mean: 96.7
final: 87/100 mean: 67.7
grade: B+

I didn't study account in the secondary school. So this grade is very good from my perspective.
reviews.comment_workload: There is no homework. The presentation is optional for extra credit. Writing the answer of classwork is also for extra credit. The workload is quite low among all account course.

reviews.author: Jooooo
reviews.comment_content: Content is mostly studied in secondary school BAFS. But it's quite different in some forms of presentation.
reviews.comment_teaching: Some in class exercises for you to ensure you know everything in the lessons. And professor's teaching is easy to understand by providing some simple examples.
reviews.comment_grading: No attendance. 6% Participation marks are earned by answering one question only. The midterms are quite easy. But final is much more difficult than midterms. Getting around 70% in final can have an A range if you did not too bad in previous midterm.
reviews.comment_workload: You can skip 3 in class exercise to get full mark in this criteria(24%) when there's 11 in total. Quite easy to earn marks even if you are lazy.

reviews.author: Wawachoi
reviews.comment_content:
大部分都係教中學野 所以係中學讀過Acct 既有著數
內容不算難
reviews.comment_teaching:
上堂prof 成日會分析一d上市公司既financial statement 同埋有時會分享買股票既野 悶唔悶就見仁見智
除此之外，其他都okay 既
prof 會唔答已經提及過既問題(i.e. final 範圍)
reviews.comment_grading:
有幾個方法可以得到bonus mark
－上堂出去做問題
－問問題
－present 有關既新聞
有一次midterm and final
考得唔錯就好grade
reviews.comment_workload:
No homework
No quiz
workload 極少

reviews.author: yhngao
reviews.comment_content:
rich content and detailed powerpoint with examples

topics:
financial statements
balance sheet
income statement
year end adjustments
sales revenue+receivables
inventory+cost of goods sold
PPE
liabilities
owners equity
cash flows
reviews.comment_teaching:
prof gave a lot of examples to explain each component of the topic
he is willing to spare time for students to ask him questions and he always ensures that students understand everything before moving on to the next topic
reviews.comment_grading: i am not sure about the grading but i got below mean 1/3 sd in mid term. grading not that bad actually i think average people get b-/ c+
reviews.comment_workload:
workload is quite light. 1 mid term (MC plus short questions), 1 accounting case analysis and finals.
some inclass exercises but they are not included in the calculation of marks

finals would be a problem as prof mak may use examples he only used in class to set a question, if you missed the class you won't be able to do the question.

finally, no attendance taking is required, this may be an attractive point to those who don't want morning classes

reviews.author: kamkachun
reviews.title: I LOVE U CHEN SZU FAN
reviews.comment_content: content is not much and what we learnt was just like high school level. It is easy to catch up the content of class
reviews.comment_teaching: keep reading the ppt and other unrelated stuff. But sometimes she likes talking about current affairs related to the business which are totally unrelated to the exam.
reviews.comment_grading: I got not bad marks but the grade is not good. and the final is difficult. but midterm is extremely easy. I got a mean in final exam but that gave me a B+.
reviews.comment_workload: Little workload. Only fews homework and some quiz in class

reviews.author: sone
reviews.comment_content:
content is not much he will try to cover as less as chapter he can.
he said he will test what he taught but it is not true. When i saw the final, i was panic.
reviews.comment_teaching: keep reading the ppt and other unrelated stuff. he likes talking about current affairs related to the business which are totally unrelated to the exam.
reviews.comment_grading: I got not bad marks but the grade is not good. and the final is difficult. but midterm is extremely easy but the mean is extreme high 96/110
reviews.comment_workload: no workload, no homework quiz presentation (optional), only one midterm. but the problem is the grade only depend on the midterm and final.

reviews.author: BBBoss
reviews.comment_content:
Chapters 1-3, 6-10 [Short, Libby, and Libby. Financial Accounting, 8th edition (2014)]
[Less content is covered and tested compared to other professors.]
reviews.comment_teaching: He teaches at a relatively slow pace, and sometimes side-tracks away from accounting. As a result, less content is covered.
reviews.comment_grading: He says he uses the highest grading curve he has provided. There is also some bonus marks for doing in-class questions on the board, raising your hand in class, and doing an article analysis.
reviews.comment_workload: There is homework and in-class exercises for each chapter covered, but it is not mandatory to do it. However, I highly suggest you to do the homework, as some of the homework questions will appear in the mid-term and final exam.

reviews.author: swaggerjaggerry
reviews.comment_content:
basic accounting topics u learn in high school
very very very basic in the first few lectures, but gets a tiny wad bit tougher in the last few lectures
reviews.comment_teaching:
he goes through the lesson and explains extremely slowly and makes sure 110% of the class understands
super slow in the first few lectures
suddenly pickin up the speed in the last few lectures
reviews.comment_grading:
just listen to what he has to say in class, jot it down cus he includes it in the exams
if u study well, its easy to get good grades
reviews.comment_workload:
a few in-class worksheets
ethics case essay
midterm + final
participation points in class

reviews.author: hadkjbvw
reviews.title: Normal but need to be careful
reviews.comment_content:
Topics are mostly covered in HKDSE BAFS(Accounting), so it is pretty easy for those who have taken BAFS before.
REMEMBER TO ATTEND MOST OF THE LESSONS EVEN THOUGH YOU CAN LEARN IT AT HOME!!!!!
He put some in class examples into the final exam questions (carry many marks), those who skipped classes will not be able to answer.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kinda boring and the pace is a little bit slow for those who have learnt before, but it is VERY FAST and hard to pick up for those who have not learnt before.
reviews.comment_grading:
Normal
but the midterm and final are very difficult.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is little, there is only one essay-type assignment (which is a little complicated as you will have to read some resources).
The overall workload is little comparing with other accounting instructors.

reviews.author: Victoria_dxy
reviews.title: Good prof
reviews.comment_content: 這門課不算特別有意思，但是是解讀商業信息的基礎課所以還是比較重要的吧
reviews.comment_teaching: 教授上課喜歡講跟accounting本身不是很有關係但是有意思的商業小知識
reviews.comment_grading: 大家分數相差都不太大，所以小小分差可能給grade給的都會不太一樣..
reviews.comment_workload: 還好，沒有作業

reviews.author: peterc
reviews.comment_content:
Attendance and Participation 5%

In-class Group Exercises 10%

Three In-class Quizzes @ 20 points each (drop the lowest one) 10%

Mid-term Exam 35%

Final Examination (non-cumulative) 40%
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony上堂講野好有條野，內容清晰，加上佢雄厚嘅聲線，上堂都幾充實學到嘢。
reviews.comment_grading: Normal
reviews.comment_workload: 會分組做grp exercise，然後每grp佢會影張相，所以佢認得哂大部分人。而grp exercise方面有6個，每個10分，全部都係手板眼見功夫，基本上之前嗰堂有聽書都會識做兼滿分，不過分組最好搵啲有讀過acct嘅人咁就輕鬆得多啦。

reviews.author: aejonathan
reviews.comment_content:
It's about financial accounting which covers these chapters:
- 4 financial statements
- T-account
- Operating activities
- Bad debts
- Inventory & Cost of Goods Sold
- Depreciation
- Time value of money
- Bonds
reviews.comment_teaching: I only came to 3 or 4 classes so I cannot say much about his teaching, but he likes to give real life examples about the topics discussed in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Super good grade. He gives the largest number of As compared to other ACCT 2010 professors.

Midterm : 45% (mean:88/100)
Final : 55% (mean:67/100)

You can also gain bonus point up to 4 points by presenting a business news in class or solving an exercise in class or being active in class.
reviews.comment_workload: No workload. Only midterm and final, and the exams are easy.

reviews.author: QAQ
reviews.comment_content: The content is more or less the same as what you have learnt in secondary school in the first few lessons but you will find something new in the following lessons such as shipping term and statement of cash flow.  The powerpoint is simple and clear.
reviews.comment_teaching: He taught students with real daily examples and sometimes ask questions. His lesson is interesting.
reviews.comment_grading: He will count your attendance by asking questions and mark down on his logbook if you have answered.
reviews.comment_workload: He only give us one case study as assignment.

reviews.author: rae
reviews.comment_content: The content was above average. The professor followed the textbook in an orderly manner with high relevancy with the textbook in regards to text. She also lectured with powerpoints during class and shared them online as well.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching was very organized and well-prepared. She will have certain patterns to lead her class.
reviews.comment_grading: I got a C from this course, which was pretty predictable. This is a pretty rigorous course and participation matters.
reviews.comment_workload: There was a monthly test for every three chapters. I think it's best to read each chapter of the textbook before class to excel in this class.

reviews.author: sapna
reviews.comment_content:
Content is not too heavy because it is non cumulative and therefore your midterm exam will cover 6-7 chapters and the final will cover the chapters not covered after that.

Content is quite tough for students who have not done accounting before.

The individual quizzes are quite straightforward as he will tell you exactly what topic to prepare for and the group quizzes are tough when you have freeloaders in your group however not too big of a deal because they are open book.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor doesn't mind whether or not you attend class however it's pretty useful for the parts of the course that involve mathematics because he explains these well. Other parts of the course can be easily understood through the textbook and the professor isn't very helpful.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is based on
- In class participation (5%)
- 3 Individual Quizzes, best of 2 taken (10%)
- Group quizzes (10%)
- Midterm exam (35%)
- Final exam (40%)

Midterm exam is very difficult but then final is made much easier.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not too heavy, he will suggest doing some background reading before the lesson which is actually quite helpful but of course not mandatory.

The quizzes are every 2-3 lessons and he alternates between group quiz and individual quizzes.

reviews.author: sdfghj
reviews.comment_content:
Content is less than other teachers
mostly theoretical for his class
no making of full balance sheet or income statement
reviews.comment_teaching:
he explains some points in his ppt but elaboration is sometimes confusing.
have to self-study for the basic accounting principles and skills
easier to understand if you already studied accounting before
reviews.comment_grading: His grading is fair, exams are based on examples in his ppt. participation marks are important to score a good grade in this course
reviews.comment_workload:
he gives class activities which students are supposed to do in class but he posts them on canvas already, so you can do it at home first
essay is an ethics case of no longer than 3 pages
no quiz

reviews.author: Azura
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony is a great professor but giving out fair grades :( He is passionate in teaching, answered all students' question clearly, you may take his course if you'd like to earn more participation marks.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grade only, participation doesn't count much but do help. Final, mid-terms and quizzes take most, so you'd better work more on studying.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload acceptable, there were in-glass group exercises, quizzes, mid-terms and final exam. Unlike other professors, Tony's paper is comparatively harder, longer and no MCs. Might be killed by tricky question types.

reviews.author: Tcy
reviews.comment_content: no attendance requirement. There are two simple midterms, but the final is extremely difficult. Cheatsheet is allowed in final.
reviews.comment_teaching: She uses examples to explain different cases. But the speed of explaining is a little bit slow. She will distribute her own notes and i think it is not bad.
reviews.comment_grading: I got a B+ by gaining 82% overall. You can gain participation mark by cleaning the blackboard or answering questions. Marks are included by handling in in-class exercises.
reviews.comment_workload: In class exercises are distributed every week and students need to hand them in every week. Those exercises are not that difficult since they are similar to the exercises in the book.

reviews.author: hihilex
reviews.comment_content: The content taught was appropriate, throughout the semester 9 chapters were taught.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kelvin is a knowledgeable professor, he answered questions asked by students very patiently. Moreover, there are some practice questions that Kelvin will do with us during class. Kelvin stated his teaching with the final financial statements to consolidate the most basic elements of financial accounting.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading scale is appropriate, though the essay handed in was not returned in therms of score or feedback.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of the course isn't very heavy, no group project throughout the whole semester but an individual assignment of 3 pages is required. Kelvin gave us enough sources and hints to complete the essay.

reviews.author: Emeric
reviews.comment_content: Teaching syllabus is around 10 chapters, while other professors may only have 8 chapters, so it will be more difficult to get a higher grade.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good teaching as she will review all the examinations questions after examination and give us tips about the exams.
reviews.comment_grading: Overall the teaching is very good, but the grade is a little "broken".
reviews.comment_workload: Exam syllabus is a little bit too much, comparing with the other professors. There are three mid-terms but it is easier to catch up the content of ACCT. However, there are no homework but only class assignment.

reviews.author: thelazyaf
reviews.title: ACCT2010
reviews.comment_content: A really good course if you wanna learn basic accounting. The content is pretty basic as it does not require you any previous knowledge of accounting to excel in the class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony's teaching is excellent in my opinion.
reviews.comment_grading:
The Grading Scheme is as the following:
Attendance and Participation 5%
In-class Group Exercises  10%
Three In-class Quizzes @ 20 points each (drop the lowest one) 10%
Mid-term Exam 35%
Final Examination (non-cumulative) 40%

Do well in the midterm and you'll do fine. Do ask questions in the class as he will remember your name. The group exercise will be for 3-4 students per group. There were 5 group exercises (he initially said there would be 6 but there wasnt enough time), so only 4 was taken. The quiz will be a bit trickier (even than the midterm and the final, lol) but it doesnt matter that much.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of this course is relatively low. There is no project, just midterm, final, and some quizzes, and also in-class exercises. Remember to do exercises from the book.

reviews.author: Seungtak Lee
reviews.comment_content: The course is quite similar to the DSE accounting syllabus
reviews.comment_teaching: Every class a class note would be given, you can download it from canvas. Also the prof. is really nice ,if you have any questions you can ask after class or on canvas discussion board
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation = 5%
In class exercise = 10%
Midterm = 30%
Final = 45%

The professor will remember your face and your name so just raise your hand and ask some questions to get full 5% marks.
reviews.comment_workload: Here's only in-class exercise around once a week,no project or other quiz. extra exercises are provided, you can do it for practices.

reviews.author: dongdong
reviews.comment_content: the course is quite similar to the DSE accounting syllabus
reviews.comment_teaching: every class a class note would be given, you can download it from canvas. Also the prof. is really nice ,if you have any questions you can ask after class or on canvas discussion board.
reviews.comment_grading: there are 6% attendance mark, you just need to answer one  question during the class for getting all 6% mark.
reviews.comment_workload: there's only in-class exercise around once a week,no project or other quiz. extra exercises are provided, you can do it for practices.

reviews.author: Churrrrr
reviews.comment_content: This course is suitable for students who want to learn basic accounting knowledge. Basic information like credit and debit,  different type of accounts, how to prepare income statement, statement of cash flow, balance sheet and how are they related, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Li used powerpoint and in-class exercise to teach, around 30% of the lessons are taught about financial news, which is not very related to accounting but it was good to students who want to know more about operation of business companies.
reviews.comment_grading: 45% midterm exam; 55% final exam. The final exam was not cumulative but it was not stated clearly (better if he had stated this); he tried his best to give us marks (which is true) and graded normally.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload, no attendance is taken and no assignments. Only in-class questions were given and it contains no marks. You can get bonus marks in final exam if you do presentations or ask/answer questions during lesson.

reviews.author: Anlanther
reviews.title: Relevant, content-heavy, but just not worth it
reviews.comment_content:
We learnt 12 units in this one term, all of which appeared in the final exam. We followed a textbook, which I recommend you getting a hard copy to. All topics we very relevant to accounting, but were very content heavy.
Chap1: Financial Statements and Business Decisions
Chap2: Investing and Financing Decisions and the Accounting System
Chap3: Operating Decisions and the Accounting System
Chap4: Adjustments, Financial Statements and the Quality of Earnings
Chap6: Reporting and Interpreting Sales Revenue, Receivables and Cash
Chap7: Reporting and Interpreting Cost of Goods Sold and Inventory
Chap8: Reporting and Interpreting Property, Plant, and Equipment; Intangibles; and Natural Resources
Chap9: Reporting and Interpreting Liabilities
Chap10: Reporting and Interpreting Bonds
Chap11: Reporting and Interpreting Owners' Equity
Chap13: Statement of Cash Flows
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Ho was a good teacher in that she provided us many tips on how to calculate the different values we needed. She was always on topic and also gave us real life examples while teaching. I would only comment negatively on her organisation (in moving on from topic to topic) and technical skills, as there were many times I could not see what she was writing. Also, while she had her moments where she was engaging, due to how she speaks and its pace, it's very easy to get too comfortable... even when in her slow speeches she is going through the whole chapter in that one lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
I GOT A C+ DESPITE BEING WITHIN STANDARD DEVIATION IN ALL EXAMS AND SIGNIFICANTLY ABOVE AVERAGE FOR ONE OF THEM. I DO NOT EVEN KNOW MY GRADE FROM THE FINAL AND IT SEEMS THAT I WILL NEVER KNOW.

In addition, I have cross checked with some of my friends' grades and it turns out they also got a C range! One of them even just got a C despite being above average for all mini exams! Just what????
reviews.comment_workload:
3 f'n mini exams, case study right after and then a final. In between, we also had 6 in-class assignments. Participation points are also given out like crazy, so you may end up being the only one in class without one if you do not constantly study for the lesson. Also, do not forget it is 12 units you are going through. Not 6 or 8 like the other classes. And you are tested on all of them!

The workload is not worth the grade.

reviews.author: Candy1025
reviews.title: 2016-2017 fall
reviews.comment_content:
ppt and  extra example
quite similar with the acct in secondary school
eg inventory, balance sheet, income statement etc.
jot down everything (as more as you can )in the lesson because they will appear in the exam
reviews.comment_teaching:
quite interesting
teaching  process slow
many Q&A session
over-run every lesson
there are some practices in the lesson (work in group)----->participation mark
reviews.comment_grading:
good
do not take attendance
it is easy to get good grade if you have studied BAFS
reviews.comment_workload:
Class activities and participation 10%
Case about professional ethics 15%
Mid-term exam 25%
Final exam 50%

reviews.author: Sandy1998811
reviews.comment_content:
His class is interesting
Very suitable for the students whom haven't studied acct before
But try not to skip any lectures
reviews.comment_teaching:
He did help many fm who dont know acct before. He is patient and friendly.
He seldom skipped the topics like other prof. I found acct is quite interesting after his lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Below mean then u c+
Midterm below mean a little
Exam above mean a little
Grp ex is not good as well
finally B-
reviews.comment_workload:
Many quizzes and group ex.
Dont have a group with your classmates who haven't study acct.
I think the ex is quite important to the grade

reviews.author: Jason fung
reviews.title: good grade course
reviews.comment_content: for the final exam, it is not cumulative so the workload is comparatively lower
reviews.comment_teaching: tony will use cantonese to answer students' questions and he maintained a good atmosphere in class. but sometimes it is a bit too fast and what he explained is too difficult
reviews.comment_grading: my score is slightly below mean in midterm and higher than mean a bit in the final. while my participation mark should be 0 and much lower than mean in those quizzes and in class group works and i still got an B
reviews.comment_workload: many in class group works. there are a lot of extra information in lesson so it is not recommended to skip lesson

reviews.author: Quantum
reviews.comment_content: quite useful
reviews.comment_teaching: Not bad for classes and the powerpoint included most of the important concepts of the course
reviews.comment_grading: my marks of so called "mini examsss" ( I bet the reason why they dont call it midterm is that a term cant be mid for three times!!!!!) was overall above mean  (the marks of final is not released and the whole course vanish without a trace on canvas so as all the marks of project and quizzes, theres no way that you could argue with the professor about your grading as even if you ask for the marks and details of your grading no one will EVER reply you) and eventually I got a  C range!!!!!
reviews.comment_workload: we're required to finish ~6 in-class assignments and which means you hav to attend most of the lessons to keep yourself informed of the date when you will hav to finish all the in-class assignments and you will also hav 3 mini exams(which are actually midterms but they polished their names and patently they were never as MINI as they claimed) at the end of the term we hav to submit a critical thinking project, its not as shit as the above provided that your group mates are not free rider or retard that cant read the instructions!!!!!!!

reviews.author: Sharon dxj
reviews.comment_content: It is basic accounting knowledge which is not difficult for completely new learners. It mainly covers financial statement and some GAAP concepts,
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is nice and prepared PPT well. Her teaching is average and easy to follow.
reviews.comment_grading:
3-4 mid-term, one final and one accounting case study (group format with maximum 4 people/group)
participation point would be given when you ask/answer professor question.

I guess the mean is B as many people I know got good result.
reviews.comment_workload: not heavy . one group project and some easy in-class assignments.

reviews.author: IvanZhanggg
reviews.title: 課無聊pro有趣
reviews.comment_content: 做為第一門ACCT課，內容很基礎，無非是基本概念和報表罷了。LI XI上課會有很多有意思的擴展，對於國際局勢啊金融市場啊評論也很有趣，個人覺得一學期下來收穫很多。
reviews.comment_teaching: LIXI教的比較淺（和課本難度持平），但是非常良心。NOTES、exercise全部課堂上會發打印版，簡直良心。概念解釋的還是很清楚的，對於完全沒接觸過的初學者而言完全沒有理解方面的問題。需要注意的是第一章導論部分LIXI會講的很細緻，初學會誤以為課很難，實際上學到後面會加深對於前面章節的理解，重複的內容很多。
reviews.comment_grading: LIXI自稱龜神，A range事全部2010裡最多。四個BONUS很好拿。
reviews.comment_workload: 一個midterm一個final四個bonus。bonus包括白板演示做題、新聞pre（年稿即可）和participate。workload在各pro之間比較算很小的。不過初學ACCT需要多花時間在自己理解概念上。LIXI的in-class exercise實際上是midterm和final的同類型題，課下多做課本練習也很有用。

reviews.author: michael_teng
reviews.title: ACCT2020
reviews.comment_content:
Content

The comtent covers the most important parts of the book. From corporation itself to its investing and financing. The class also includes a tutorial, whose schedule is decided in The first one or two weeks. My schedule totally conflicted with all its tutorials, even the later added one. So I have never been to one. But I think it's ok since the tutorial slides are very easy.


Teaching

Well, what you learnt in class is just NOT ENOUGH! You have no idea what is going to be in the exam! For example, the first part about corporation is covered too little, but it was highly required in the exam!



Grading

10% participation(9% PRS 1% bonus card)
15% homework 9out of 10
30% midterm
45%final
I scored about 87% in total and got a B＋... pretty disappointed. But as I said before, the class is full of experts, so you just can't expect a good grade.


Workload

A bit of heavy I think. The homework is just s

reviews.author: IpNing
reviews.comment_content: Not so difficult to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Able and very pleased to answer students' questions.
Well teaching
He explained the concept clearly and easy for students to understand.
There are many foreigners in the class and they usually ask a lot of questions and that also help other students to understand the concepts.
reviews.comment_grading: not so good in mid-term but got the highest in the fianl, at last get a A+
reviews.comment_workload:
No HW
3 in class quiz and count the best two
3 to 4 in-class group exercise and there will be hints and instruction
1 mid-term and 1 final

reviews.author: Paul Ho
reviews.comment_content: Basic accounting stuff, mostly dse bafs content
reviews.comment_teaching: good professor, easy to understand. Although I did not take bafs in dse i can still fully understand the concept.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance and Participation 5
In-class Group Exercises 10
Three In-class Quizzes @ 20 points each (drop the lowest one) 10
Mid-term Exam 35
Final Examination (non-cumulative) 40
reviews.comment_workload: he has given all end of chapter ex solution to us, and it is optional. The only real wordload is mid term and final. grp ex and quiz are easy as long as u attend all lessons and understand the concepts:)

reviews.author: T4teatime
reviews.title: You can't imagine how difficult the final exam can be
reviews.comment_content:
The course includes 11 chapters.
It nearly covers the whole syllabus taught in NSS
Excluding partnership and some accounting principles.
But something new are the calculation on bonds and fixed assets.
And some terms used in American accounting are quite different from which in British accounting.
So even though you have learnt accounting at high school
This course can still be difficult to you.
ESPECIALLY BONDS!!! BONDS!!! BONDS!!!

But honestly, the material taught is quite comprehensive and useful.
At least, the curriculum is good.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Though her notes are quite clear and easy to understand.
But the teaching routine was FUCKING MESSY!!!
She always skipped to another example without any omens
Even the geniuses like Gbus students could not catch up with what she was saying.
Besides that, some of the calculation methods she taught are different with which in textbook.
It is difficult for you to do self-revision!!!

But because of the well-prepared notes,
She might be a good instructor to those beginners.

Btw, when you ask her question,
Her response was usually VERY VERY VERY unclear.
But honestly she is nice and willing to answer any questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 6%
In-class exercise 24%
Quiz 1 10%
Quiz 2 20%
Final Exam 40%

The quizzes were extremely easy even a junior secondary student can get a pass
So she expects you guys will get full marks

But if you make few careless mistakes just like what I did
It is nearly impossible for you to get a range

Because the final exam was FUCKING DIFFICULT!!!
The question is as long as a comprehension
Even though she allow you to bring a cheat sheet
It is USELESS for this exam!!!
And mostly you can't even get partial credits
Even I have got 5* in DSE, I just got nearly 60% of marks.
And finally just a B+
Overall I got 82.38%
reviews.comment_workload:
The in-class exercises are easy
And mostly you can just copy the answer she posted in canvas
(( It is sure that I do not suggest you copy answers....

But the deadline she set is fucking not reasonable!!!

reviews.author: soontodie456
reviews.comment_content:
Useful
Mainly from the textbook though she does try to add little background knowledge of her own
11 Chapters in total
Most questions mainly come from the textbook
so its better to revise that
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very BAD
Not due to a lack of effort
Her lessons are very chaotic and not structured at all
Nearly everyone has no idea what she is talking about
She jumps from one example to another without even telling us that she is
reviews.comment_grading:
24% is in-class exercises which you don't have to even do but still I only did half :(
Though there is no class participation these exercises are in fact ur class participation marks
For the two mid  terms they are too easy
But the final will make u pray to God even u don't believe him
It is the most difficult exam I ever did in my life
reviews.comment_workload:
In hindsight
Even though it seems u don't have to put in a lot of effort when u are doing in class exercises actually for the final u have to put it in a lot of effort that it seems

reviews.author: chloenhw
reviews.comment_content:
Quite similar to DSE BAFS (accounting).
Topics like Cash flow, bad debts and bonds are more challenging than the DSE syllabus
reviews.comment_teaching: It is sometimes hard to follow during lectures, but prof is patient and willing to answer questions after class. She replies to canvas discussion questions quickly and clearly.
reviews.comment_grading:
- 2 Quizzes (midterms) : very easy (most people get full marks)
- Final exam: very very difficult (highest score 174/235)
- 8 in-class exercises
- class participation: cleaning the board/ answering question
marks for in-class exercises, class participation are easy to get
the two quizzes are very simple (for people who have not studied accounting in high school as well)
grades are quite good
reviews.comment_workload:
Besides midterm exams and final exam, all you have to do is hand in at least 8 in-class exercises, which are quite easy and short.
You just have to try your best to complete it, but don't have to get 100% correct for full credit.

reviews.author: ayamgoreng
reviews.comment_content: The course only covered some of the most basic accounting principal. If you are going to take accounting as your major, I wouldn't recommend this course, but if you take it only because its pre-enrolled you MUST be in this class.
reviews.comment_teaching: He teaches every material very clearly and he make sure everyone in the class understand the materials.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is good, but its a little bit unfair because  students who have learned accounting in high school are also in this class, so it will be a little bit tougher to catch up for those who haven't learnt accounting before.
reviews.comment_workload: No compulsory assignment but to do well in exam we have to do the in class exercises and practice questions recommended by the instructor

reviews.author: ustjaychou
reviews.title: Tony is a great teahcer
