reviews.comment_content: This course is mainly about basic accounting knowledge. The content is not easy to understand for some people who had never learned accounting, but hard works pay off. For people who know those basic things, it is very easy for them to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony is a good teacher in terms of solving students' questions about accounting. It is not uncommon to find out that a lot of lecture time are spent on answering questions. But sometimes he might spend so many time on it, and may slow down the schedule and make the schedule tight.
reviews.comment_grading: As accounting is really a course with exact answers and the content of this course is basic, the mean if the quiz or exam are usually quit high. For Tony, the number of a range are not so high and usually the mean is B-/C+.
reviews.comment_workload: There is only one midterm, compared to other tutors for this course. In class group exercise and quiz are also required. However, the questions are quit difficult and tricky. Students may need to spend lots of time on practicing.

reviews.author: klaw
reviews.comment_content: Content is quite easy whether you have accounting background or not. For someone with no accounting background, he explains the material very clearly.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good teaching skills. Attentive to student's questions and tries to be engaging in class. PowerPoint slides were very detailed and act as a summary of sorts but you would still need to buy the book as he gives suggested problems to work on from the textbook. He gives quite challenging problems for in-class assignments as well as quizzes and exams.
reviews.comment_workload: We have in-class exercises almost every week, and quizzes in the weeks that didn't have in-class exercises. Basically you have to review the materials every week but it's also good in a way to motivate you to study. No other projects and assignments.

reviews.author: supersherlockxd
reviews.title: What am I doing in this course...
reviews.comment_content: Content is easy if you have accounting background. Or else you need a lot of time to catch up. I studied almost every day on materials but can't find relevant pages in the textbook. Had to reread the whole book and ditch the PowerPoint.
reviews.comment_teaching: I have no idea what I have been doing mainly because of Kelvin. He's a nice person but since he does taxation more than auditing (from his LinkedIn) he isn't really that familiar with financial recoding stuff.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is ok, mean is 56/65 with sd 9 (midterm), as a student with no accounting background I still got above mean
reviews.comment_workload: Very light. Only one assignment throughout the term, and we can discuss about it (take-home assignment)

reviews.author: Yatz
reviews.title: Complete overview of Accounting
reviews.comment_content:
Content aspect can be looked in two different ways:
A. For those who have done accounting in high school, you will find around  80% similarity, hence shouldn't be a problem.
B. For those who haven't done accounting in high school, the content is sufficient to make you aware of what accounting really is.

Overall, the content is basic.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching method is very good and everything is explained in detail. Doubts are handled really well.
reviews.comment_grading: Mean is relatively high hence you need to work hard.
reviews.comment_workload: You have to revise concepts regularly. Hence workload is medium.

reviews.author: Tony Yuen
reviews.title: joyful course with prof. mak
reviews.comment_content:
it's quite easy to handle for those who study accounting in high school
the content is basically the same as high school accounting but the terms are slightly different
reviews.comment_teaching:
good, enthusiastic, care about every students, funny
sometimes, he makes jokes during the lesson
if u have any questions, he's willing to answer it all the time.
reviews.comment_grading: the mean is quite high all the time, extra effort is needed for getting an A
reviews.comment_workload:
not very demanding, be aware of the ethical project
little amount in class assignments

reviews.author: 也許不必知道我是誰
reviews.comment_content: Basics of financial accounting: accounting system, 4 basic financial statements, and the accounting treatments for the items which appear on the statements, like revenue, inventory, long-term assets, liabilities/bonds, cash flow, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Chen's lecture notes are precise and clear, though having typos and calculation mistakes sometimes. Proof-reading is essential for her LOL.
However, she uses examples not stated in the lecture notes to illustrate the concepts very often. That's fine for me as a previous BAFS student in high school, but certainly not okay for my peers without accounting background.
Nevertheless, I must say Prof Chen is a nice professor. She is always patient to answer the questions raised by my peers with a smile. She also treats every single word she says seriously. One day she shared a piece of information about the characteristics of the accounting frauds. On the next day I saw her announcement on Canvas, asking us not to use race and gender to judge others (Although I think no one treat her words seriously...). That's really hard to find a professor treating teaching seriously as her.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading scheme:
24% In-class exercises
6% Class participation
10% Quiz 1
Mean: 90/100  SD: 10
(Just because it is extremely easy.)
20% Quiz 2
Mean: 82/100  SD: 12
(The level of difficulty is moderate.)
40% Final Exam
Mean: 126/235  SD: 26
(Testing your ability to apply the concepts in the real business world. Very challenging.)

Got full marks for Quiz 1, in-class exercises and class participation. 98 marks for Quiz 2 and 156/235 for final exam. Getting approximately 1 SD above mean can secure an A, and I think the grading is very generous.
reviews.comment_workload: Absolutely acceptable. One in-class exercise for each 2-3 lessons, after a chapter was finished. You have to hand in at least 8 in-class exercises out of 11 in the whole semester. Prof Chen also encourages us to do more exercises on the textbook, but not compulsory.

reviews.author: RR***
reviews.title: acct2010
reviews.comment_content: Professor sometimes won't follow the chapter of book. But mostly he teaches things in the book.Always say some thing that will not be covered in the exam but has some practical usage. I think it's useful in the future
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor will answer students' question with enough patience. And in class there are some in class question that will be fully explained. So I think he teaches pretty well.
reviews.comment_grading: It's said that it's good grade. And professor also say that he will give as good grade as he can to make things less miserable for the students. Also just the midterm and final can make things fair for the students.
reviews.comment_workload: workload is not that much.only some exercise in the book and some in class questions. Professor will list the question that he prefers student to do with. So there's not so much end of chapter questions. But it's suggested to give a news share before class. It needs time.There will only be one midterm and one final. And I think workload is not so much.

reviews.author: Janet Xu
reviews.comment_content: It is somehow a completely whole new world to you even though you learnt accounting in high school. Yet, the powerpoint is useful. As long as you can fully understand the content in ppt and do more exercise, it would not be that bad.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very interactive. You will never feel boring in the lesson because his voice is not plain at all.
reviews.comment_grading: My grade is fairly enough, both group work exercise and quizzes. The questions can be expected from the textbook but it will ask you to do more (somehow more difficult)
reviews.comment_workload: Fair but you have to do more exercise to get a higher mark.

reviews.author: lemonswirls
reviews.comment_content:
Very Good !

His ppt covers almost all the material in the textbook ( except  some examples )
reviews.comment_teaching:
I love how he starts his lesson by discussing news and his experience.

He is super clear in teaching, not too fast and not too slow.
reviews.comment_workload:
No homework !

He only gave in-class exercises which are really useful for midterms.
If you are aiming for the 5% participation score, you need to present news in front of the class / volunteer to answer the question in class.
It's recommended to do the exercises from textbook for exam !

reviews.author: helpme
reviews.title: hmm
reviews.comment_content: useful
reviews.comment_teaching: He tries very hard to answer our questions through canvas or offline means. He also makes good point and provides useful tips during the class. He also tries to make jokes which mostly works well.
reviews.comment_grading: I cannot make any comment on this yet, because the semester is not over yet; no exams taken so far!
reviews.comment_workload: He is the type of professor who does not collect and grade the homeworks. So the workload is very low 'for now'. I heard we are having a group project though, lets see what happens then.

reviews.author: imahitman
reviews.comment_content: Professor Ho provides good powerpoints which are in-depth and relevant. However she does tend to repeat similar points throughout the lessons.
reviews.comment_teaching: She teaches well and in depth, however she does not allow students to work through the classwork first before going through the answers which becomes a bit frustrating.
reviews.comment_grading: She has a generous grading system with good distribution between mid-terms and the final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: She does not really give much work out, all the work is optional and has no due date. No attendance as well.

reviews.author: Kn
reviews.comment_content: She uses powerpoint with lots of notes. However not everything is relevant to the course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Personally I found her lesson pretty boring. She has a good teaching background, but she seems to assume everyone has learned accounting before and didn't really explain all the contents in detail.
However you can always ask her questions by email, and she will answer your question immediately.
reviews.comment_workload:
3 mini exams, 1 final exam, 6 in-class assignments that will count towards to final grade.
Workload isn't really hard after class, and its voluntary for you to do the questions on textbook.

reviews.author: YOYOYO
reviews.title: Boring lesson but helpful professor
reviews.comment_content: the note is quite detailed with many examples. However, i think that she often teaches something which is not included in the notes, so better not to skip any lesson or you will miss something important.
reviews.comment_teaching: I think her teaching is really boring. Not many interactions with the students. And sometimes she assumes that all we have a basic knowledge of accounting so she tends to skip some steps.  But you can email if you have any question, she usually answers in detail and makes sure you understand the concept.
reviews.comment_workload: workload is not heavy. Only a weekly assignment which is easy.

reviews.author: billpwchan
reviews.comment_content: The content is fine, and the Prof's notes is pretty good. There're a lot of examples on the notes, so we can have a lot of practice to clarify some confused concepts.
reviews.comment_teaching: She kind of assumed most of us have accounting basis, as local student who took HKDSE might leanred some basic concepts already. However, this creates certain obstacle for International and Non-JUPAS students. We might have to pay extra attention to every word the Prof. said. Another issues is that the Prof. often talked about something that are not mentioned on the notes, so it's better to bring your own notebook to the class so you can take some notes about some interesting knowledge.
reviews.comment_workload: There're some in-class exercises for each lecture. We have to hand-in before 8:00 P.M on that day, which is kind of rush as I have classes right after the ACCT 2010 class. Besides that, the workload is perfectly fine, and in most cases, we're required to self-learn some concepts during spare time from the book Financial Accounting 8E.

reviews.author: Vicky Wong
reviews.comment_content: She prepared some notes for us but those notes are very short and are not detailed enough. I am new to accounting which makes me very difficult to follow the notes that she has given to us.
reviews.comment_teaching:
She use a lot of examples which is great.
However she assume most of us have some basic knowledge about accounting which is not true. She did not go through some basic terms clearly like what is credit and debit.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is "okay". There is some in-class exercise that is due on the day after classes. The workload is perfectly acceptable.

reviews.author: karen_kawai
reviews.comment_content: She prepared her own powerpoint and worksheet for us.She also use the textbook content to teach.sometimes, she will add her points on the board.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching style is quite good. We can understand the content clearly with her explanation.
reviews.comment_grading: We Just start the lesson so i don't know what grade will get .
reviews.comment_workload: It is just the beginning of the fall semester. There are just a little work to do in the class or at home. however, the workload will be increased in the coming future.

reviews.author: Peter Lee
reviews.comment_content: Quite difficult to understand her concepts of accounting
reviews.comment_teaching: Her lecture is to dull, also she didn't really explain how the accounting system works. If I am a beginner, I will totally not understand what she saids.
reviews.comment_grading: I am not very sure about her grading. You may need to ask the seniors more about the grading. She doesn't take attendance very highly. As long as you submit all your work on the dropbox on time, you will pass. Only marks under 45% will fail.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 11 assignments to hand in in total, but you need to hand in at least 8.

reviews.author: Hihi88
reviews.title: testing
reviews.comment_content: The content is great, you learn about intellectual property law - things like copyright, patents, trade marks, etc. All really useful stuff and must know imo. However, since you need to memorize a lot (and I mean a lot) of laws, court cases and things, it can get a bit boring/dry sometimes and difficult as well. No attendance required. Just study the material but seriously, why would you not want to attend Prof. Clark's lecture? He's one of the best!
reviews.comment_teaching: The content is great, you learn about intellectual property law - things like copyright, patents, trade marks, etc. All really useful stuff and must know imo. However, since you need to memorize a lot (and I mean a lot) of laws, court cases and things, it can get a bit boring/dry sometimes and difficult as well. No attendance required. Just study the material but seriously, why would you not want to attend Prof. Clark's lecture? He's one of the best!
reviews.comment_grading: The content is great, you learn about intellectual property law - things like copyright, patents, trade marks, etc. All really useful stuff and must know imo. However, since you need to memorize a lot (and I mean a lot) of laws, court cases and things, it can get a bit boring/dry sometimes and difficult as well. No attendance required. Just study the material but seriously, why would you not want to attend Prof. Clark's lecture? He's one of the best!

reviews.author: Tsang Wang Dan
reviews.comment_content:
Similar to dse bafs accounting course (Introduction to Financial Accounting part)
- financial statements
- ratios + analysis
- journals + ledgers
- Cost of goods sold + inventory
- Property, plant and equipment + depreciation
- current liabilities
- bonds + long term debts
- equity (capital)
reviews.comment_teaching:
A bit boring.
He often talked about irrelevant materials eg. stock market.
reviews.comment_grading:
Easy to get good grade if you have studied dse bafs before.
Just remember to spot out the differences between dse accounting course and acct 2010, eg. format of financial statements.
If you did not study bafs before, get yourself an ebook to read and ask questions if you are confused. It should not be difficult to handle.

Answer questions in classes to get bonus marks.
(Though he does not take attendance.)
reviews.comment_workload:
Not heavy.
Only 1 midterm and 1 final exam.
No homework or quizzes.

reviews.author: c.long10
reviews.title: testing
reviews.comment_content: Its quite easy to handle. Indeed, many fm will also take this course
reviews.comment_teaching: its fun course but i think if it would be much better if the prof. could speak more fluent english.
reviews.comment_grading: its easy, good grading  course. I highly recommend all of you to take this great course.
reviews.comment_workload: In terms of assignment, this course is on average. However, the tutorial of this class is really demanding. Without good lecture, you really have to rely on the tutors and TAs.Luckily, I think they did a good job overall

reviews.author: Ivanyiu2017
reviews.comment_content: Its quite easy to handle. Indeed, many fm will also take this course
reviews.comment_teaching: its fun course but i think if it would be much better if the prof. could speak more fluent english.
reviews.comment_grading: its easy, good grading  course. I highly recommend all of you to take this great course.
reviews.comment_workload: In terms of assignment, this course is on average. However, the tutorial of this class is really demanding. Without good lecture, you really have to rely on the tutors and TAs.Luckily, I think they did a good job overall

reviews.author: Nicole Yu
reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment_content:
Very funny but you need to do exercise in the book
acceptable exam and midterm
reviews.comment_teaching:
quite good and no need to take attendance
not boring but you may miss the important exam tips if you don't attend the class as he will mention what is more important in the class and the quetion will appear in the final exam and midterm
reviews.comment_grading:
quite good
b range
there are many people who have studied bafs before to compete with you
reviews.comment_workload: not big there are some assignments and quizs but mostly in group so you don't need to spend a lot of time on them

reviews.author: immanyi
reviews.title: Good grading for fm
reviews.comment_content: The course content is more or less same with the others' professors, and it is quite easy to pick up for freshman.
reviews.comment_teaching: Mak teaches in an interesting way, and his lesson is not boring.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading are quite good in fact. Students just need to memorize the notes given in the lectures to finish the exams. It's a memory task!
reviews.comment_workload: Some quiz will be given in the lesson, but it is not so difficult as those are the topics discussed in class already. All you need to do is to revise after the lesson, and you will be fine.

reviews.author: Ellenchu
reviews.comment_content: what she taught is really practical and useful, not only in accounting but also daily basis
reviews.comment_teaching: she teaches really well in class, and always ask if any student got questions, she will hand out participation cards if anyone answers the question she asked.
reviews.comment_grading: although I got below mean in 1 of the midterms, and just on mean for another midterm and final, i still got an B+ which is a very good grade to me.
reviews.comment_workload: we need to do 5 assignments, but with group mates that she assign.it is not very hard if you guys work together.

reviews.author: wahahapurewater
reviews.comment_content: Super easy and elementary if you have studied BAFS in HKDSE. But for those who haven't, it can be quite hard, especially when it comes to ch.6.
reviews.comment_teaching: Xi Li's teaching is okay. He clearly explains the theories and gives real life example which helps a lot. However he often talks about his career out of UST (about his company) and mentioning different financial news which is totally out of topic and useless.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is good. If you studied, your grade will be fine. But if you don't, you fail. Those who have learnt BAFS will surely dominant the good grades in this course, which is super unfair. But Xi Li will not make midterms and finals hard so even though you did not study BAFS beforehand, getting B range should be quite easy (if you study). I'm giving this a C just because of the unfairness incurred by putting both non-BAFS and BAFS students into the same course.
reviews.comment_workload: Oh workload is small. With only one midterm, one final and several in class worksheet, this course won't occupy much of your out-of-class life. All you have to do is to revise for tests and exams, no homework is required.

reviews.author: Omgust
reviews.comment_content: About basic accounting principles
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor used lectures notes as well as exercises for teaching, she had used visualiser and PowerPoint in the same time.
Professor will ask questions and students need to answer the questions in order to get participation cards to satisfy the attendance requirement. Or you can ask questions to get the card as well.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading quite good. There were two midterms in which I was below mean 2 sd in the first one and got marks near mean in the second one. Got 40% marks in the final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: Group exercises every chapter, every group need to submit one copy.

reviews.author: emily870717
reviews.title: ACCT 2010 Tony Shieh
reviews.comment_content: Basic knowledge of financial accounting. It is one of the essential and easy courses in the school of business and management.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Great professor.
The professor is passionate on his lectures, and teaches in clarity. Energetic and has a sense of humour. The professor is Taiwanese, and he is really helpful when you ask him questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair yet not the best,  above mean in midterm, above 1 sd in final, got B+.
reviews.comment_workload: Many quizzes and exercises. You should practice often as you often find long questions in midterms or finals.

reviews.author: Vincy
reviews.comment_content: The content is simple enough for understanding. The professor will provide a lot of examples to instruct the concepts. By doing the class activities, students have a better understanding in calculating and have a clear mindset.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is quite funny and kind professor. Also, he would love to answer your questions. You can talk with him as friends. Sometimes, he will mix the content together at the beginning of the lectures. No worries, he will explain them to you one by one in the following classes.
reviews.comment_grading: This course includes one mid-term and the final exam. The content in the final exam does not include the content in the mid-term exam. The essay will be graded as assignments, and the participation mark is based on the group exercises.
reviews.comment_workload: You have to submit an essay and some group exercises. The workload id quite light, but you may feel difficult in working with your essay, as the topic is quite unfamiliar to us. The professor will give you support with your essay, so you don't have to worry about the essay.

reviews.author: sting.c
reviews.comment_content: He is a good professor, he elaborate all the key points about all accounting principles. Don't skip class as he take attendance as parts of the final grade.
reviews.comment_grading: grading is good as long as you have studied his powerpoint and try some question in textbook. The exam and mid term is quite easy when you are familiar with those questions in the book.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is light as their is no homework for this class, all homework is voluntary. There are only some classworks in groups and two quiz before both mid term and final exam

reviews.author: nicknick
reviews.title: king of killer is not bad
reviews.comment_content: he is rly good at teaching from zero to something. He is a funny person. He wear a stylish cloth to school.
reviews.comment_teaching: very funny. A hongkonger, sometimes he will say cantonese on the class. He will teach students to do step by step. if you have taken bafs in secondary school, youmay think he is rly teaching slow.
reviews.comment_grading: good. i start from zero but i got b+
reviews.comment_workload: attendance is very important. Homework needs to hand in. Somethings he will tell us to form groups to discuss for a whole lesson.

reviews.author: kyleyuen
reviews.title: Easy to understand
reviews.comment_content: ACCT2010 is a business core course to sbm student, so business students must study this course. This course is mainly about basic concepts of accounting and some accounting foundation knowledge. If you have studied BAFS (acct) before, that will help you a lot.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor teaches according to the textbook, but he will illustrate and give you more time to practice on class, which does help you to understand.
reviews.comment_grading:
good grade
mid term + attendance + cumulative final + problem set
reviews.comment_workload:
Acceptable workload
3/4 problem set only and they are not very difficult to handle if u have studied

reviews.author: Andrew G
reviews.title: ACCT 2010Principles of Accounting I
reviews.comment_content: Acct 2010 is the basic course for SBM students. No complicated contents are mentioned during the lectures. I personally believe the concepts and contents in 2010 are useful for all students.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is a nice guy which is very willing to help students. He usually  covers half a chapter each lecture, but he ll save more time to deal with chapters with more contents.
reviews.comment_grading:
I heard that comparing to other professors, Charles give less A to students, approximately 20% of As.
I messed it up and got a B, but I believe hard working students will have no problem on it.
reviews.comment_workload:
Highly recommend this course to students from other schools who are curious about accounting concepts.
The workload isn't too heavy and the information and concepts are easy to understand. Ordinary students with hard-working attitude won't get below B.

reviews.author: Ah Ming/ Jeremy
reviews.comment_content: Learn to make income statement and balance sheet. Also, some basic concepts, including T-account, debit and credit are mentioned. It might be difficult for some beginners.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony explained every concept clearly. And he will personally answer your questions after class .
reviews.comment_grading: Mean = b-or b . If you want to get an A or A+, you have to get 90 or above on average.
reviews.comment_workload: Need to study for the quizzes and in class exercises. But those exercises are quite simple if you pay attention to the lectures and understand the concepts .

reviews.author: vkrishnan
reviews.comment_content: Good enough content with not too much homework. You're basically on your own to finish off as much as you think you need in terms of practise.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very detailed and good. Professor focussed on finishing as much as he could and didn't rush through the concepts.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading but the mean tends to be very high as many people are present who have a background in Accounting.
reviews.comment_workload: Depends upon you. A few exercises given from time to time but they aren't mandatory. There is also a possibility of getting a few marks extra if you can solve the given exercise for the class.

reviews.author: blackface
reviews.comment_content: Most of the contents are the same as HKDSE BAFS syllabus. The content mainly focuses on introducing financial statements and the accounts appeared in the financial statements, especially income statement and balance sheet.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kelvin prepares his own powerpoint but the powerpoint is quite brief. His teaching is quite clear but it may be too fast and difficult to follow for non-BAFS students.
reviews.comment_grading: Since BAFS students and non-BAFS students will take this course together, BAFS students may be more advantageous in this course. For me, since I have BAFS as one of my electives in HKDSE, this course is not too difficult for me.
reviews.comment_workload: There are mid-term exam, final exam, case study and in-class exercises. The exams are not too difficult and they are not cumulative. The case study is about the ethical issue of a company and it has nothing related to financial statements. For in-class exercises, students will need to divide into groups and finish 1-2 in-class exercises after every chapter.

reviews.author: PrashantK
reviews.comment_content:
The content is very similar to the BAFS syllabus.
Just some new topics however, his notes and textbook questions are very elaborate.
reviews.comment_teaching: His english is really good, he remembers everyone's names in class. There's no attendance taken however, it is better to follow his teaching as he teaches very well.He often asks questions, especially to the girls.His lecture notes are key, along with his recommended textbook questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Doing well on the first midterm is very important, as the mean is very low, easily possible to gain 1 to 2 SD above mean.The first midterm is difficult. The exam is easy, mean is very high.
Both midterm and exam above 90% can get A grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload, just some in class group exercises and quizzes, only one midterm and exam.

reviews.author: nikking
reviews.title: ACCT2010
reviews.comment_content: If you have studied BAFS in high school, that would be a piece of cake for you, but still bear in mind there is some new stuff in the content.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony got a really clear voice and his English is good enough for your understanding. I really appreciate his teaching with clear outlines and the step-by-step teaching can help students who are new to accounting understand the content really good
reviews.comment_grading:
There are about 5 - 10% of the attendance which I feel like quite important in proceeding at least a sub-grade because Tony can recall almost everyone's name and he will randomly ask people questions.

I got 89 and above in Mid-term and Final Exam respectively but I was informed that I got a B+ only. So the trick is to send email to the TAs and go to the after exam review sessions, let them recognise you and they will help you negotiate a better grade. I finally got a A-.
reviews.comment_workload: Just what is typical in other UST courses

reviews.author: Giselle
reviews.comment_content: The subject can be very boring, but if you are good at following methodical, careful processes then it isn't too difficult. It's the initial learning curve within the first few units that make the class feel difficult. Accounting is a subject that rewards those who work efficiently and carefully.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony Shieh is an excellent professor. He really cares about his students and wants to see them succeed. I found him to be very helpful during office hours. Make sure you pay attention to him in class.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is generally very fair, but it's hard to cross the gap between a B and an A. The midterm average was around a 60 and the final average was around a 70. I found the final to be much easier than the midterm, which was extremely difficult.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is very manageable but make sure you do as many practice problems as possible. The suggested homework questions are the best way to learn and remember how to do the problems. There are several quizzes throughout the course, but you are allowed to drop your lowest grade.

reviews.author: ckf98
reviews.comment_content:
No midterm exams but have 3 mini exams
Textbook required (classwork questions are all from the textbook)
Although the professor didn't mark down the attendance records, he may recognize some of the students. Also, there was a fixed seating plan. Therefore, it is not recommended of you to skip classes.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very clear powerpoint, easy to understand.
Very detailed explanation.
reviews.comment_grading:
Although I got above mean in the mini exams, but I got half a sd lower in the final exam=> C+
People got really high scores in this course=> median>mean score
reviews.comment_workload: Only have a few case studies which have to be done in groups of two. Have to finish classwork every lecture and the professor will collect them in at the end of the class.

reviews.author: klaudius
reviews.title: Good Instructor
reviews.comment_content: Content is very good and very clear. He uploads all his materials in the form of power points on canvas. Also, the contents are very concise and direct. He also expects us to be able to read real financial reports.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is a very energetic and passionate teacher, he teaches clearly although sometimes he goes too fast. He also often tells the students about real life examples of accounting cases. Overall, he is a very good teacher with a very broad knowledge about accounting and he is very recommended is you want good understanding about accounting(although his grading is so so)
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is not really good, got +1SD in midterm and +0.5 SD in final got a B+. Have quizzes and group exercises, both worth 10%. The exams questions were relatively easy, which means that the mean usually is high (around 80)
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is very light, no homework or projects at all. But he will give us some questions in the textbook and ask us to do it in order to get a good grade for the exams(but not compulsory).

reviews.author: potat0
reviews.comment_content: Covers the basics of financial statements, time value of money, bonds, etc. You will need to memorize some terms but the course is straightforward. As long as you attend class, and don't fall too much behind it's fairly easy in terms of content (just not that interesting... boring)
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof explains very well, not too fasts, not too slow and really underlines the logic behind accounting. Very methodical and easy to follow, good English too.
reviews.comment_grading: Ouch... well, most of the students already have had a taste of accounting in high school so if you are new to it, you might need to put in some extra work to fall on the more desirable part of the curve... Getting a good mark is not difficult, but beating the curve is damn hard.
reviews.comment_workload: a couple of homework questions due before every lecture and you need to constantly stay up to date. Reading the textbook  AND lecture notes plus 2 midterms and a final... that's quite a bit of work, and sometimes not that rewarding because of the curve.

reviews.author: nwko
reviews.comment_content:
provides overiew of financial accounting
Some of the new contents are difficult to follow, so reading course slides or going over textbook before class is encouraged.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Good.
- Prepares exerceises which come up in exams
- Asks questions during class, to help students to earn participation grade.
-
reviews.comment_grading:
Generally good.
Doing well in midterms can be helpful, as final exam is really difficult.                         

**Failing to correctly answer at least 10% of the final exam leads to F grade, regardless of the performances in the midterm exams.
reviews.comment_workload: There are group homeworks, which are not that difficult. Group members are randomly assigned.

reviews.author: cheunghoiting
reviews.comment_content:
foundation course of acct
bafs ppl will have advantage, but not much
have in-class exercise and suggested exercises
some of the questions in midterms and final are similar to suggested exercises, so just follow her suggested ones then will be ok in exams
reviews.comment_teaching:
will ask questions in lessons for you to gain participation mark
有問必答
reviews.comment_grading:
normal grading
have participation mark (answering questions in lessons), not much help though
reviews.comment_workload:
normal workload (6hw, count top 5)
do hw in a group assigned by her, hv peer evaluation

reviews.author: JerryC
reviews.comment_content:
ACCT嘅foundation course
對有讀BAFS嘅人會相對容易明 不過同以前嘅system有少少分別
3個mini exams加1個final exam
2個好少野做嘅cas study
有in class exercise 所以等如take attendance
有時候會點名
reviews.comment_teaching:
concept教得幾好 好用心
上堂會問下問題
最後20分鐘會叫我地做classwork 解答下我地問題
reviews.comment_grading:
above mean ～1 S.D. 攞B
要再高分d先會有A range
reviews.comment_workload: 正常workload

reviews.author: Lydia777
reviews.title: Useful but bad grade.
reviews.comment_content: Very useful
reviews.comment_teaching: Great. Charles 给大家固定的座位，意味着要take attendence。上课挺有趣的，每节课有当堂练习，考试十分集中所以感觉大家都学得很好。
reviews.comment_grading: Totally bad grade. The worst grade ever.可能是local 学过， 同时在大陆生非常集中的一堂，所以真的烂龟了，是这个学期龟最烂的课。
reviews.comment_workload: Large. Charles gave us 3 quiz and 1 final.

reviews.author: Tang
reviews.comment_content:
Content of the course is comprehensive
it covers every single aspect of financial accounting
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony is a good instructor, he explains every concepts in detail and expects students to ask question at anytime
reviews.comment_grading:
grading is fair
I didn't put too much time and didn't do well in exams. overall I am just above average, and I got B
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is not little to people who didn't touch anything about accounting before

you need to put a lot of time in final and midterm, just keep practicing using the problem sets in the textbook

reviews.author: Lea
reviews.title: Difficult to excel among students who have learnt before
reviews.comment_content: The content covered in the first few lessons is quite similar to those DSE students learnt in high school according to my friends. Nonetheless there were many new concepts. Be aware of what Prof. Tony says during class about the concepts.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Tony is a very passionate teacher. He takes the time explain concepts so make sure to take notes. However, don't forget to practice the textbook questions a lot because those are ultimately what will be tested in the exam. I liked his class because he was funny and interactive. He often asked people questions and took the effort to remember our names. He did mention that he cares a lot about,  impression during his grading so it may be good for people who often speak up in class.
reviews.comment_grading: Although the class was interesting, its quite difficult to stay on top of everyone in order to get a good grade as many people have learnt accounting before in high school. You have to work extra hard from the beginning because the mean was quite high. He also has a lot of quizzes and in class exercises. Make sure to find the right group unless you are confident that you will get everything correct.
reviews.comment_workload: There was no compulsory homework but you are basically recommended to practice regularly after each chapter. You will struggle if you do not practice regularly. There are also quizzes and in class assignments (group and used to take attendance) so you have to be prepared after each chapter. There was one mid term and one final exam (non cumulative).

reviews.author: anom
reviews.title: useful but painful
reviews.comment_content: useful class. painful grade. it teaches me some basic accounting knowledge.............zz zzz
reviews.comment_teaching: i think the pace is too fast for a student who haven't learnt any accounting knowledge before. Zz zz
reviews.comment_grading: 3 quiz +1 final+two case. finally got a B.......... zz zz zz
reviews.comment_workload: two case as assignment. have exercise on class and after class but don't need to hand in. however, if you want to get a good grade, you have to work very hard and spend a lot of time on this course.zz zz

reviews.author: Jason W
reviews.title: Easy course because of this instructor
reviews.comment_content: This course should have cover a lot of topics in accounting, however, the instructor decide to skip a lot of topics. As a result, those topics are excluded in our exam, which is a glad thing. But in long term, if you want to major in account, i believe you will have to work harder in order to catch up with the other classes.
reviews.comment_teaching: He had told us that he want the students who had learnt BA to learn something new so he had added in a lot of cases and extra concepts to us, it is definitely a good thing for those students, however, for students like me who didn't study ba in high school, it is pretty hard to distinguish what will be on the test and what will not be on the test. Moreover, it sometimes make students like me feel bored.
reviews.comment_grading: I perform fine with this course and getting scores above mean in the course, and I get a B+ for this.This is a fine grade for me so I don't have much to complain. However, for one of my classmates which perform similar with me, he think this kind of grading is not as good as he imagine, so i believe it depend on your own judgement.
reviews.comment_workload: This course definitely have a low workload, with only two exams to be cover. You can choose to answer questions in class or do news paper sharing to earn bonus credit, however, I believe it won't greatly affect your grade so it is up to you. In this case,I believe the workload is pretty light.

reviews.author: kat
reviews.comment_content: Basic accounting knowledge. Easy to understand for those who have studied accounting.
reviews.comment_teaching: Detailed explanation of the accounting concept. Welcomed students to participate more during the lessons. He'd love to answer your questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
FAIR. (Do really depend on your exam)
5% Participation
10% In-class Group Exercises
10% In-class Quizzes (Different lectures may have different version)
35% Mid-term Exam
40% Final Examination
reviews.comment_workload:
NO assignments but had 5 in-class exercises and 3 Quizzes.
Some HW problems are given to you for reference. Better to finish it before exam or quizzes if you haven't studied accounting.
*NO attendance is counted*

reviews.author: ar hiu
reviews.comment_content:
Please note that Tony use the book different from other professors. (He said that the book is more easy for us to understand)The content of this course is similar to the content of the DSE BAFS but not all the same!
Be careful that the style (USGAAP) is totally different from the  DSE(2015) (IFRS). Some of content is more difficult that DSE.

The exam content is not as difficult as DSE. Sometime is quite straight forward.
reviews.comment_teaching: very nice. If you have any questions, you can ask him in the class or after class. He loves to help students to solve their problems. The explanation is well and you can learn more too. He will adjust the speed of teaching according to the class. In each lesson, he will do some revision of the materials of the last lesson. It makes things clear.
reviews.comment_grading:
It depends. If you have studied BAFS before, it is very likely that you can get a good grade. If you haven't studied it before, please work hard, do more exercise and ask people if you not understand.
The 2 best quizzes out of 3 will be counted and some in class exercise will be counted too.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not very heavy. There are 3 individual quizzes and some in-class exercise. There is no compulsory homework but it is better to do more exercise in the books.

reviews.author: Clemens
reviews.comment_content: Very basic and useful knowledge for students who had never studied Accounting before
reviews.comment_teaching: Though not allowing you to use electronic devices, the prof's method worked perfectly to demand students' focus, allowing easier understanding of the content
reviews.comment_grading: Not too bad, but would have expected to obtain a higher grade. This course demands you to work hard and do a lot of exercises, which does help with the understanding of the content and the subject.
reviews.comment_workload: 2 assignments, 1 mid-term, in-class exercises to count attendance, plus 1 final exam. Not too demanding for an average student. But if one wants good grades, you have to continuously do exercises to maintain good standards for exam

reviews.author: htliab
reviews.comment_content:
有難有淺既
讀過bafs有優勢
容易d明content
reviews.comment_teaching:
好多NDS成日搶答
課堂氣氛幾好
professor好樂意答問題
份人so nice
reviews.comment_grading:
唔算太靚or太爛
acct個底打得穩既有著數
要做多d ex
reviews.comment_workload:
基本上係無功課
有一大堆suggest questions
要自己自律去做
professor會upload ans自己對

reviews.author: whoami
reviews.comment_content:
12個chapters(skip左ch5)，11個PPT
4種financial statements都會講下，有堆terms呀格式之類嘅野要記
有讀過bafs嘅係輕鬆，有絕大優勢
冇讀嘅就自求多福，睇你理解到記到幾多
reviews.comment_teaching:
跟住ppt講d basic野，自己返去睇番書至明得哂
有in class exercise做，上堂問ans係咩，答左有participation card
開頭係搶答，後黎有人反映過之後轉左點名答(關照下冇acct底嘅人)
reviews.comment_grading:
唔知點分grade，計分大約係:
40%Final，30%midterm1+2， 25%HW， 5%計Participation
Midterm1係MC(20條)+一條唔知咩題，5分一題MC錯幾題隨時冇廿分
full mark 10X分
Midterm2要計數，難度一般
Final(MC+計數+寫fina statements)極難，250分Full mark
每條Qs同之後都有d關連，冇acct底嘅空左幾版都唔奇
reviews.comment_workload:
唔算大，5-6份HW，分組做一組submit一份，拎9成分唔係問題
最低分果次好似唔計，第一份肯寫野錯左都可能滿分

reviews.author: kristen
reviews.comment_content: Basic knowledge of accounting, not difficult to understand, if you have studied BAFS in secondary school, you'll be fine
reviews.comment_teaching: you can understand everything by reading the notes, the words of professor are kinda useless
reviews.comment_grading: Even though the marks I got are almost above mean 1 std, I still got a B only... Maybe because of the participation? you can ask more questions and stay focus in order to impress Charles
reviews.comment_workload:
12 In-class groupwork + 3 mini exams + 2 projects + 1 final exam
Many works to do but not hard to finish them

reviews.author: dimsum
reviews.comment_content: easy to follow at the beginning but became harder to understand as it goes. It is a compulsory course but personally think does not suit non-jupas students.
reviews.comment_teaching: He's a funny guy with Chinese accent. He is okay in teaching as he is just reading out the highlights of the book and using the same examples.
reviews.comment_grading: His TAs are very tolerant in grading.
reviews.comment_workload: No much work to do, except there is a group work for every lesson. There is 2 case studies for the course and it is relevant to the course and relatively easy to handle. There is 3 midterms - easy and 1 final exam - hard.

reviews.author: Ian
reviews.comment_content: Beginner level. The course starts to get difficult only at the very last few lectures. Very easy to follow in general.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is excellent. Power points are very clear and straight forward. You have to pay attention in class to fill the blanks though, but the class is good enough to pay attention. The Prof. jokes a lot and guides students to arrive at the correct answers; he provides extra useful tips occasionally.
reviews.comment_grading: The bad thing about the course is that many students with prior knowledge of accounting is registered into the same class with people who don't. The grading is thus very extreme. However, comparing to other profs of the same course, Prof. Hsu's "mid-terms" (mini-exams actually) and final exam are the easiest.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload. The only assignments are 2-3 group assignments of real life cases; they are very easy to score above 90%. Mini-exams (3 in total if my memory does not fail me) are easy enough to score 95% or above; the mean and sd are very high though. The Final exam are more difficult than the mini-exams, but manageable. There are classwork every class, but the amount is minimal. He  counts your attendance (makes a seating plan and checks accordingly), and allows 2 unexplained absence.

reviews.author: sisichristy
reviews.comment_content: The topic are relatively easy to me, as I have studied accounting before. It mainly involve basic accounting knowledge. However, if you have not studied accounting before, you do need to spend sometime to grab the basics as the basics of accounting is the most important.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching speed is relatively slower than other professors from what I know of, so I think if you have no accounting background whatsoever, it is quite a smart choice to swap class so you can understand better. His notes, however, are from the publishers, so it is not as detailed as other professors. Also due to his speed, the final exam covered less topics compare to other class.
reviews.comment_grading: His grading is relatively high. From what I heard, mean is B-, which is relatively higher compare to other courses. However, if you mess up in your piece of essay(homework), it may easily affect your grade. My midterm was just above 1 SD, and I think my final is more or less the same, and yet due to my essay, I only got a B+.
reviews.comment_workload: His workload is really mild. His only homework is a piece of essay on a case study on accounting ethics. However, I must say the essay is pretty difficult and it count 15% of your final grade.

reviews.author: Jwong
reviews.comment_content: Basic accounting, will be very advantageous if you have studied BAFS in DSE since most of the things are the same.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kelvin teaches slowly and clearly. Got some in-class exercises to consolidate the concepts so it is pretty easy to pick up. He is also very passionate in teaching and tries to make jokes from time to time.
reviews.comment_grading: Grades are quite good if you can finish all exercises in the book, grades should be fine.
reviews.comment_workload:
quite light
mid-term, assignment and final
class participation will get you bonus marks

reviews.author: Candace
reviews.comment_content: Most contents are covered in HKDES, if you studied BAFS in secondary school, it should be quite easy to understand. Yet, students may need to pay more attention on some topics which have difference with those in DSE, since the approach is quite different. For students with no accounting background, may need more time to understand the principles behind.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not good at all, but not too bad. Required students to learn through self-practice.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair, can get good grade if you are hard working enough. Attendance is not really important, but you may get bonus from participating in in-class activities.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload, most are in-class exercise.

reviews.author: Nickname1
reviews.comment_content: He teaches with clear powerpoint slides and also use some sample questions in textbook to illustrate how to tackle the problems (though the samples are the easiest ones from the book).
reviews.comment_teaching: He explains pretty clear. His pace at first was quite slow, but when midterm or final approached, he started to teach very fast. Besides, he has special intonations on some words, making the lesson a bit more interesting.
reviews.comment_grading: As long as you have clear concepts and do more exercise from the book, you will get the mark that you deserve.
reviews.comment_workload: There is one midterm and final, with three quizzes and several in-class assignments.

reviews.author: HermanK
reviews.comment_content: He teaches with clear powerpoint slides and also use sample questions in textbook to illustrate how to tackle the problems.
reviews.comment_teaching: He explains well clear, though the pace is a  bit fast, and also teaches by using real life examples which is easy to understand.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term: 1 mark higher than mean (SD is 7)
Final: unknown
Ended up B
reviews.comment_workload:
There is one mid-term, a homework assignment about accounting ethics (which is very tough and I don't know the grades) and one final.

One more thing is that the teaching assistants were working with super low efficiency that they spent four to five weeks to mark the mid-term.

reviews.author: w!nn!e
reviews.comment_content:
The content is simple
The notes are clear.
Easy course, especially to those studied BAFS accounting in dse.
Many content learnt before. e.g. income statement, balance sheet, GAAP
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lessons are a bit boring.
But the notes are useful and example used in class can explain concepts well
Professor willing to answer questions
Must print notes, no electronic devices
reviews.comment_grading:
Many NDS
easy to get high marks but not good grade
reviews.comment_workload:
3 midterms plus 1 final
2 group project, just like homework, simple
every lecture have in-class exercise
no homework
take attendence

reviews.author: redsunsam
reviews.comment_content: just fundamental knowledge of accounting
reviews.comment_teaching: Clear and lively. The professor would remember most of the students.
reviews.comment_grading:
Those who studied Accounting before, that is probably half of the class, would have a great advantage. The mean was really high.

I got 88/100 in the Midterm and 94/100 in the final exam
But I screwed up two of the three quiz so I got a B+.
reviews.comment_workload:
No assignments
There are 5 to 6 in-class group exercises and 3 quiz.
But students are strongly advised to do some exercises in the textbook. The professor had a list of suggested question.

reviews.author: Jason Xu
reviews.comment_content:
1.very detailed and clear
2.Actually you can just read the lecture notes to do the review
3.clear explanation of the key concepts
reviews.comment_teaching:
1.normal talking speed
2.normal accent
3.very patient and passionate
4.always looking forward to receiving your questions
reviews.comment_grading:
1.I get 2 full marks of 3 short mid-terms and 100 of 115 in the final but i only get A-
2.300 points in total:120 mid-terms   115 final the rest is the in-class works and two projects
reviews.comment_workload:
1. I have to say because of 3 mid-terms, you can't have a rest till the end
2.Basically if you finish your mid-terms, your final is around the corner!

reviews.author: Cupid
reviews.title: You'd better work hard from the beginning till the end. I'm serious!
reviews.comment_content: The class contains nearly every aspect in financial accounting expect several complicated issues which will be covered in the Intermediate Accounting. Among the four financial statements, three of them will be covered in exams and the remainder, the Statement of Shareholders' Equity will be reference only.
reviews.comment_teaching: Generally, Prof Shieh's lecture is very clear and easy to comprehend with lot's of interesting stories about accounting and business. One of my favourites is the Arthur Anderson fraud, which he mentioned a lot. Besides, he is really a nice person whom you can chat with during the office hour and ask any academic stuff. But, it seemed like Prof. Shieh assumed that everyone in the class was already familiar with accounting so at the beginning a lot of guys like me who hadn't learnt accounting before got totally puzzled.
reviews.comment_grading:
Here comes the awful part. The syllabus stated the grading will be accorded to:
Participation: 5%
In-class exercises: 10%(Drop the lowest one)
Quizzes: 10%(Drop the lowest one)
Midterm exam: 35%
Final exam: 40%
From the information above, you may see that the midterm exam bears the same importance as the final. Yup you're right. I did horribly in the exam(below mean) but got nearly full mark in the final. BUT! THERE IS NO USE AT ALL!  
So, apparently, don't fail any of the exam.
reviews.comment_workload: The instructor will present the recommended homework in the book but no homework will be checked. But, the best strategy is always, the more the better.

reviews.comment_content: This course teaches a lot of useful information. There are two midterms, one final exam, one assignment per lesson, and the professor does not count participation. Cheatsheats allowed for the two midterm exams. Graphing calculators allowed for all three exams.
reviews.comment_workload: Fair workload. He gives one assignment per lesson and the students are required to turn in at the beginning of lesson. The assignments are a few questions in length and can be done in an hour. The assignments are questions from the next lesson, so a preview of the next lesson is required.

reviews.author: Diego
reviews.comment_content: The content of the class was solid, we covered the Cash Flow, Statement of Shareholder's Equity, and in-depth into the Income Statement and Balance Sheet. I thought that the course covered the accounting concepts well, and I learned more than I thought I would in that class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony is a great teacher. He cares about teaching the material to his students, and I think that it shows. He does a good job using examples to try to help make a boring (sorry!) subject more interesting, and makes it pretty easy to understand. One thing that he could work on is his slides - most of the time the numbers are off, which makes it hard to study again after the class or if you miss it.
reviews.comment_grading: I thought the grading was very fair and straightforward (as a black and white class like accounting should be). It seemed like everyone that I know in the class did fairly well in the end. Study for the midterm a lot though, because the mean of the midterm ended up being something in the 60's, while the final was much higher. I ended up with a B+ in the class, even after a 99 on the final.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fair - I think there were 3 quizzes and 6 group exercises, and your worst score from each was dropped. It helped me because I was able to stay on top of the work each week, but also probably hurt my grade at the end. No homework for this class but when he says do practice problems, you should do it. It will help your grade a lot.

reviews.author: christophercao1
reviews.comment_content: Basics of financial accounting.
reviews.comment_teaching: Makes the class interesting by incorporating a lot of practical examples. Plus he's got a sense of humor and is very open to questions. I'd definitely recommend him.
reviews.comment_grading: B for the mean. Pretty reasonable grading.
reviews.comment_workload: Four quizzes throughout the semester, but only three count towards your grade (he drops your lowest grade). There's also a number of group assignments in class. Quizzes and group assignments aren't weighed too heavily. Material requires you to study regularly throughout the semester. Need to work quickly through quizzes, group assignments, and exams; time management is really important.

reviews.author: Sonali
reviews.title: Extremely engaging!
reviews.comment_content: Basics of financial accounting. Simple calculations. Need to be quick in exams. Most local students have already done this syllabus in High School though so if you don't have any background in accounting, work hard to stay at par with the rest of the class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Brilliant! A very fun Prof with an amazing sense of humour. Knows what he is teaching and keeps everyone interested and on their toes.
reviews.comment_grading: B for mean. Do well in the Final and your covered.
reviews.comment_workload: A number of quizzes and group assignments which keeps you upto date with the material.

reviews.author: Roddie
reviews.title: Principal of Accounting I
reviews.comment_content: This is the required course for all business student, regardless whether they've studied it before or not. But basically this is the easiest part of accounting, so the content is comprehensive to all the students, there will be only some simple calculations.
reviews.comment_teaching: Undoubtedly she is the greatest professor ever, her classes are interesting. She will always stay in the corridor after class, and leave until all students' questions about accounting are solved.
reviews.comment_grading: She grades her students generously. I think the mean should be B or B+.
reviews.comment_workload: There is not much workload. There will be 6 assignments to submit, and the best five of them will be counted into your grade, which mean you can fail one of them. But I highly suggest you do your best in all the assignment. Also, the most important thing is that, attendant doesn't mean participation. That means you have to or else raise some accounting-related questions, or else answer the question raised by professor to get the participation point. By the way, there will be 3% of bonus comes from participation, which means the highest score you can get is 103%.

reviews.author: Kingchi
reviews.comment_content: The content is not too hard. I did not take accounting in high school, and still did fine for this course
reviews.comment_teaching: He is quite nice, and often uses real life situations to show some situations, and is able to make the class really interesting
reviews.comment_grading: Grades are okay, but the final exam is really hard compared to other professors. However, the midterm exams are quite easy with the mean being close to 90%.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much to do, other than studying for midterm and final exam. He does not have any homework for us to turn in

reviews.author: Samantha
reviews.title: Good prof, Decent grade
reviews.comment_content: The content is not too hard, though compared with students with accounting background, those who didn't might feel left behind.
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof was quite nice, and likes to use stories to illustrate some situations. However, personally I don't really like that he always have group discussions and glassworks. But overall he is a good prof.
reviews.comment_grading: Grades were quite good, given that I don't really have a high mark on the midterm and exam.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is fair, 1 midterm, 1 case study, 1 final, plus some in-class exercises.

reviews.author: Low Jin
reviews.comment_content: Just mid term and final. PPTs' content is generally fine.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor really cares about us and he is patient in getting us to understand the right concepts. Although sometimes he will talk about finance-related stuff which is not relevant to the course syllabus, we knew that the extra knowledge being taught is for our own good.
reviews.comment_grading: It is not that hard to get into A range, as long as we complete and review the in class exercises as well as the assigned textbook's end of chapter questions.
reviews.comment_workload: The in class exercises and the assigned textbook's end of chapter questions may be sufficient for the mid term and final.

reviews.author: Tpm
reviews.comment_content: Basic accounting concept,Mostly those covered in DSE BAFs, still some new concept, people who has studied BAFs is easier to catch up with the content.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nice , useful powerpoint and in-class homework
reviews.comment_grading: not very bad, but people who study BAFs in secondary school average get B grade or above.
reviews.comment_workload:
every lesson has in-class homework
attendance is counted in grades
2 assignments
3 quizzes in a term, first 2 quizzes are quite easy, the third one is relatively more difficult.
Final is quite difficult so better work harder in quizzes.

reviews.author: JCh
reviews.comment_content: Learning BAFS will bring in an big advantage. It is easy for people who studied BAFS in DSE Level. A little bit different from DSE in the financial statements' presentation and use of T-account.
reviews.comment_teaching: His English is quite difficult to understand. Boring lessons but have some in-class exercise to do.
reviews.comment_grading: all HW nearly full marks, mid term full mark, final above mean for 1 sd. Final grading A
reviews.comment_workload:
The HW is easy for everyone , most of the people get full mark
no attendance counting and parti card
midterm are very easy with no seating plan
final are more challenging and tricky

reviews.author: Chilli
reviews.comment_content:
different from DSE Level, need to pay attention to financial statements' presentation and Use of T-account.
Learning BAFS will bring in an advantage in terms of first 6 chapters.
reviews.comment_teaching:
detail and patient prof. but sometimes waste too much time on discussing pointless question.
Concept oriented with ample examples in ppt.
reviews.comment_grading: all HW full marks, 5 participation card and 2 mid term below mean, final above mean. Final grading B+
reviews.comment_workload:
6 HW with heavy weighting, must get full mark if want to get B range or above
attendance counting = parti card (through answering question or asking question)

reviews.author: CindyLee
reviews.comment_content: My first time taking any business-related course and I really enjoyed it. Although the contents were more based on book-keeping materials, they were still interesting enough to keep me motivated.
reviews.comment_teaching: He was willing to take in students' comments and actually apply them to his teaching method. He was very nice, answered all sorts of questions clearly and he seemed to have lots of experience in his field.
reviews.comment_grading: as long as you answer the suggested problems that he give, you will be fine. It would be helpful if you put the "extra" effort like the prof. suggests.
reviews.comment_workload: Very little. Only one midterm and one final. No homework, no attendance check. it was all up to you.

reviews.author: ccyyggy
reviews.comment_content:
I don't know why so many financial things involved but still very interesting.
and he always told us that we need to connect what we learn in class to the real world.
reviews.comment_teaching: good but sometimes is not very clear. and always skip a lot of PPT due to short of time
reviews.comment_grading: good grade
reviews.comment_workload:
extreme light, only 1 mid term and 1 final. no homework, no assignment,no essay.
and you have 4 chances to get bonus pints: 1 news sharing, 1 in-class exercise, questioning in-class as more as possible and the last one I forgot (sorry for that. )

reviews.author: tlui
reviews.title: 試卷都係做數，唔洗背野咁濟，concept清就得
reviews.comment_content:
基本上account都係果啲野，中學讀過bafs就應該幾輕鬆，一半以上都係中學學既野(a/c module)，dep、allowance、格式之類既野會有啲唔同，仲有唔少新野，不過好快上手，例如：Statement of Cash Flow / Stockholders' Equity等等。
佢唔cover到ratio，冇乜野要背，基本上有上堂再做啲數就好輕鬆。

Topic (通常兩堂教一個)
Ch.1 Overview of corporate financial reporting
Ch.2 Transaction analysis and the balance sheet
Ch.3 Revenue and expense recognition and the income statement
Ch.4 Adjustments, financial statements, and the closing process
Ch.6 Sales revenue and receivables
Ch.7 Cost of goods sold and inventory
Ch.8 Plant assets and intangibles
Ch.9 Reporting and interpreting liabilities
Ch.10 Bonds and long-term debts
Ch.11 Owners' equity
Ch.12 Statement of cash flows
reviews.comment_teaching:
呢個Prof用in-class exercise黎Take Attendence，有固定seating plan，分好組每堂兩個人一齊做一份exercise，好似得2-3堂可以走，仲會點名問問題。
啲in-class ex好有幫助，等於同你review果日教d咩，到時考試就好輕鬆，所以記得一定要上堂。

上堂冇得用電腦、電話，記得一定要PRINT NOTES，一黎佢規定要，二黎好多野係佢份ppt先有，Canvas果份冇，要自己抄返低。

讀過acct都知，書除咗做ex就冇乜用，佢notes好清晰，唔會好似某啲prof咁成版都係字，有唔少公仔同圖表幫你理解同溫習，好方便。

冇讀過bafs既都可以放心，因為prof成日都話可以忘記哂中學啲野，而且佢都教得幾詳細、幾易明，最緊要明最基本既concept，唔明既可以透過in-class ex幫手，再唔係可以落堂問佢問題，就算係佢教既以外既野佢都會答，份人好NICE。

唔好走堂，記得帶NOTES就得。
reviews.comment_grading:
Total: 300 points
Attendance and Participation: 15 points
In-class Group Exercises: 30points
Cases: 20 points (2份Case，每個佔10pts)
Midterms: 120 points (3個midterm，每個佔40pts，50分鐘)
Final: 115 points

我個grade冇乜參考價值，所以都係講大概cut-off：
A+要好小心，我諗295/300以上先有
A~A-應該要280/300以上
B+已經係275/300左右
因為考既都係做數咁濟，所以個mean通常都好高，sd好細。
但係如果你唔上堂，通堂都係C Range，我有幾個識既都係，所以reg咗佢就記得上堂喇。
reviews.comment_workload:
成個sem得兩份case，仲要兩個人一組做（跟你既平時既groupmate分組），除此之外佢要你做既hw都係ex，可以唔做，佢唔CHECK，亦都唔計分，考試前做返就當溫習就得。
好少考背野，通常都係做數，平時有上開堂既，考試前review一下就得，我都係做左幾個鐘數去考，結果都ok。

reviews.author: croy
reviews.comment_content: The content is a little bit easy and many things are related to BAFS in high school. But sometimes he will teach something related to real life, which is practical but a little bit difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching: Funny and cute:D Use cantonese to talk with local students but English throughout the class. Always answer student's question.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is not so bad. Mid-term above mean 1sd,final below mean and finally got a B.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is low, contains only one essay which is 15% of the course. No need to take attendance.

reviews.author: Viv
reviews.comment_content: PowerPoint slides are very clear. It's a little bit wordy but it covers everything that may show up in the exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Shiel is very enthusiastic and he's very nice. He's always willing to help and you can always make appointments with him to ask questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
My class mean was quite high, but I would say that he is quite lenient on grading.
He values your effort a lot. And class participation counts. Trying to leave an impression would help a lot.
reviews.comment_workload: 5 in class group activities and 4 quizzes. There are suggested homework questions but he never checks it. It's better to do them to perform well in the exams tho.

reviews.author: (爛)Grade神手
reviews.comment_content:
I would describe this as an extension of the financial accounting in the BAFS syllabus, those with accounting background will have an edge over those without in general.
However, even though some basic principles like double entry is the same, the format of various financial statements will be quite different from the DSE format.
The exercises he provided is from the book, and the answer key will also be provided, so I find the textbook quite redundant and expensive... But it will be useful if you know nothing about accounting or you cannot understand a word during his lessons.  
My advice is if you learnt them in the past, you may skip some lectures, but if you haven't, you better attend the lecture and try hard to understand his teaching.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Fair.
Please do not expect too much from his teaching, he has his special accent that makes his teaching quite hard to understand sometimes...
So if you have taken BAFS in the past, you will have less to worry about.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair to Good grading.
For your reference, this is my mark for obtaining an A+:
Final Exam (100/115)
Mid-term (108/110)
I have asked a few of my friends, I found he gave quite a number of A and A+, even if you are in B range, he tends to give B+ instead of B or B-.
Please be noted that, there will be past paper available online, but you have to find that out by yourself... And the exam is generally difficult than the exercises (quite difficult indeed...)
reviews.comment_workload:
Light.
There will be a group exercise for each chapter, not difficult in general. You can find similar questions in the lecture slide.
Suggest to find groupmates with accounting background in school, you can form group by yourself.

reviews.author: CRDZY
reviews.title: Pretty good class
reviews.comment_content: The content is relatively comprehensive. There is almost nothing in the book that isn't extensively covered in class. Whatever is taught is generally on the examinations too.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Chen is pretty monotone but she's thorough. She'll go through whatever is necessary and omit things that are not relevant to examinations. She'll give "good to knows" and will explicitly point out exactly what you need to know. So pay attention to those. If you follow carefully, you'll have no problems with the mid terms plus exams.

She likes participation, so participate as much as possible.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is lenient. and participation plays a big role for grabbing back marks that you lost during the assignments.
However! It may be different for you, but the final has an absolutely different format from your mid-terms and in class exercises. For you to get a good grade in the final, you legitimately need to know how to read balance sheets and financial statements. So you need to revise that carefully.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is pretty light. There are 5 assignments. The worst out of the 5 will be omitted for marking. The rest are in class assignments that are done at the end of classes. There are no other homework assignments so the rest is on you in terms of studying.

Good luck.

reviews.author: PPM
reviews.comment_content:
if u have studied accounting, you will probably know most of the content.
he taught relatively less chapters.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Fair.
Always like to share some financial news in the class.
always welcome you to ask him questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
the mean of mid term is high, around 8x
final exam is comparatively difficult
as most of the people score quite high, you need to get higher mark as well to get good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
no assignments
no heavy workload
you just need to do in class exercises
exam syllabus is not demanding

reviews.author: nj
reviews.title: acct 2010
reviews.comment_content: Basic accounting, learned from high school. debt and cre i am writing this to make the words length be long enough.....
reviews.comment_teaching: Good!!!!! Interesting and well-prepared. He is quite charming , English is fluent and easy to understand , he is a mainland  or a Taiwanese?
reviews.comment_grading: Bad! even all exams are above mean and near full mark ,still got b+, i really dont know hotw to get an a
reviews.comment_workload: not much, just need to finish some questions in the book and read all the lecture notes which is around 40 pages per chapter

reviews.author: harshit97
reviews.comment_content: For anyone who's done accounting in high school, it should be fairly easy but it does get difficult at points. I found it really tough because I had no previous accounting knowledge. Content is tough in general so would recommend working hard from the beginning for a good grade.
reviews.comment_teaching: He's apparently the best professor for Accounting but I did not see that. I mostly studied it myself even though I went for every lecture. He started off slowly but went really quick in the final chapters.
reviews.comment_grading: Mean was low in midterms- 68/100. In the finals though it was 80/100. This showed that the paper was tough both times but in the finals everyone was more used to the kind of questions and thus scored higher. I ended up with a C+ even though I worked really hard for my finals. The questions in the exams are mostly long and not like other professors who give MCQs sometimes.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is a lot not in terms of assignments but studying for the course. There was no homework or anything as such but only in class group exercises and some individual ones. Most weightage is on finals and mid term so studying for them really counts.

reviews.author: Kenson
reviews.title: DSE有讀acct輕鬆讀
reviews.comment_content: Most of the contents are based on DSE level, just a little bit in advanced level. It is easy for one who takes BAFS in high school. It definitely has an advantage for them.
reviews.comment_teaching: Generally, her teaching is boring and make us easily feel sleepy. So I have skipped many lessons.
reviews.comment_grading: Before final exam, I have achieved around 90% of marks, and get 7x% after final exam and get B+. I got almost full mark in all assignments. Both mid-term and final pass mean.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not too heavy if you have studied BAFS before. Assignments are based on group work, and just a piece twice a week.

reviews.author: lostangella
reviews.comment_content: Heavy content, but very practical. Knowledge learnt can be applied in the Accounting industry and is perfect for beginners.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very good teacher, explained everything in detail. Cared a lot about the class' progress. He is one of very few classes that I atteneded regularly. He made sure that the class was fun and interactive.
reviews.comment_grading: The SD is not that wide, so it was hard to get a good grade. Being within 0.5 SD above would only land you a B+ at most. It is very hard to get above A in this course. Regular studying is needed.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload isn't that heavy, there are only 3 mid-terms and 1 final exam. The key is to pay attention in class. The mid-terms are rather straight-forward, but the final exam is tough.

reviews.author: PaPu
reviews.comment_content: It is a bit different from secondary schools. Students who have studied accounting before may encounter some difficulties since the teaching content is not the same, the standard required either. However, for those who have not learnt accounting before would see the course some kind of hard at the early stage but handy afterwards if you pay full attention to classes or finish the practices.
reviews.comment_teaching: Normally, Tony just follow the flow of the PowerPoint. But, you can raise questions at any time and Tony will be very happy to explain further until you understand.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite okay. Quizzes, group work, mid-term and final. It is better for you to stay with groupmates who have studied accounting before to get full mark in those group works. The mid-term and final are both okay if you know the syllabus well.
reviews.comment_workload: There is no assignment for Tony's classes but if you want to be prepared for mid-term and final, finish the practices that Tony gives us (questions in textbook) since the question in the exam

reviews.author: Mandy233
reviews.title: Choose Peter
reviews.comment_content: the content is useful and practical, but it seems there is no universal format, and different professor teaches different things
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very kind and humor, however not well spoken English. The teaching style was quite lazzie faire,
reviews.comment_grading: good grading, I only got above mean in the midterm, and 1 SD above in the final, and I got an A. Final seemed to be much more important compared to midterm, more difficult as well.
reviews.comment_workload: little homework and practice was required, however if you want to perform well in the exam, you have to read the textbook and do more exercises yourself.

reviews.author: DontSearchMe
reviews.title: ACCr2010 Chen Szu Fan
reviews.comment_content:
about basic accounting
Mid term x2 both 15%
Homework 25%
participation (answer questions) 5%
the rest is final
no attendance requirement
reviews.comment_teaching:
the teaching part is acceptable
she always answers questions even the silly and stupid ones
no email questions you can just ask them on discussion board on canvas
reviews.comment_grading:
would be good if u study accounting before
for me, around 80% and get an a
reviews.comment_workload:
just group homework
she will assign you into a group and you will work with the same group of people throughout the whole semester
there are questionnaires to ensure no free rider in group

reviews.author: NicoEx
reviews.comment_content: There is quite a few content and you should be aware of where in the syllabus you are.
