A lot of the students in the classes have taken Accounting before in their previous schools but if you did, you may need to forget some of your old habits of answering questions as they may be different from what the professor expects. You don't really have an advantage for having studied accounting before as the professor will cover all the necessary information for those who hadn't. In general, listen in class, attend classes, review and you should be fine.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is very nice in general. If you sit in front of the class he will at least recognise you, but that doesn't guarantee anything. He likes to bring other materials, sometimes have nothing to do with the syllabus, to class and it should be always interesting. His ppt is very useful but so is his lectures.
reviews.comment_grading: It shouldn't be too hard to get a B but you have to be near perfect to get an A. You have opportunities to earn extra credit which is nice but you don't really need to. For some of you the content may be too much or too confusing so you should attend all, if not most, of the lectures.
reviews.comment_workload: There is hardly anything for you to do other than study for mid terms and finals. Though you can increase the workload of this class if you want to do extra credit.

reviews.author: YT
reviews.comment_content:
Basic accounting (balance sheet, income statement, cash flow, etc)
People who studied acct in bafs may find it easy.
reviews.comment_teaching: I like the way he doesn't take attendance but you have to catch up. He is willing to answer student's question.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class activities and participation 10%
Case about ethics in accounting 15%
Mid-term exam  25%
Final exam 50%

The case analysis is basically about ethics, not really related to acct concept.
reviews.comment_workload:
There is just one writing task and midterm+final so I would say its fair enough.
There are in class exercises but he will check answers later in class.

reviews.author: Antony
reviews.title: A good grade course with a lot of workload
reviews.comment_content: This course contains basic knowledge of accounting. It is slightly different from BAFS of HKDSE as it is US Accounting.
reviews.comment_teaching: To be honest, you can skip all the lesson as the knowledge are really easy lol.
reviews.comment_grading: I got a A grade during the course.  Professor Chen grading is different from other professor, our final mean is 45% while the other accounting lectures final mean is around 80%-90%.  Also the final is very complicated as we have to read a lot of T-account and finish the whole final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: Professor Chen workload is VERY HEAVY compared to other lecturers.  Some professors only have one midterm exam and one final during the whole semester.  Maybe you may consider that the grading can be spread through the whole semester but the workload are VERY HEAVY.

reviews.author: Connieaky
reviews.comment_content:
ppt唔太有用,但睇書就會明
attendance要上堂答下佢問題先count
reviews.comment_teaching:
冇讀過bafs都聽得明,唔明問佢佢都會解答
都幾nice但有少少悶
reviews.comment_grading:
midterm below 2 SD,final到mean都有B.
都算好grade
reviews.comment_workload:
做份case analysis就okay
no quiz or other assignmments
workload重唔重,就睇你做唔做足佢叫我地返去自己做下嘅after chapter ex.

reviews.author: Yin_ka
reviews.comment_content: Useful course for beginners. The content might be difficult for students who have not learned accounting before.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Chen's teaching is quite good. She explains everything clearly and briefly. She always answers the questions raised by students in class. It's easy to understand the content.
reviews.comment_grading: Need to get very high marks to get A range. Class participation also affects your grade. You need to ask or answer Prof.Chen's questions in class so as to get participation cards. Easy midterms but the final exam is much more difficult .
reviews.comment_workload: Group assignments, not difficult to finish. Two midterms that are easy to get high scores. One final exam. Not much workload.

reviews.author: babyjake
reviews.comment_content: the first few chapters are the most difficult to catch up as over half of the class have studied BAFS before. so if you are not one of them, you better go through the textbook once after lessons.
reviews.comment_teaching:
she requires participation, and will record down for bonus points(which i think it's very important for A range)

she always gives examples that are not include in the notes so you have to be focused in order to understand what is she talking about.
reviews.comment_grading: grade is good. midterms and final around mean--> b+
reviews.comment_workload: she will help us form group for doing homework, not much workload!

reviews.author: ymfungab
reviews.comment_content:
The fundamental knowledge of financial accounting, such as journal entry, T-accounts and financial statements.

Accounting standard used: International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).

Students who had studied accounting before (such as BAFS - Accounting elective in HKDSE) can pick it up easier.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Li tried to link the content of this course with the real life events as example, which maintains the interest of students. He balanced the contents and the students' workload.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade is quite good.
The questions in the mid term test and final exam are similar to the in-class exercise. If you can finish and understand them, you could get a good grade for the course.
reviews.comment_workload:
1 Mid term test, 1 final exam.
Students are free to do the in-class exercise on board, or to present news for obtaining bonus point.
No assignment and no attendance taking.
The workload is small.

reviews.author: wanwannn
reviews.comment_content:
teaching material not very good       
annoying sometimes
maybe another professors notes will help but not notes from only one professor
reviews.comment_teaching:
veri good instructor
answer questions patiently
but not really clear explaining
read notes by yourself would be better
self learning is really recommended
reviews.comment_grading:
grading is ok
around 85% B+
and exams and midterms are easy
just do all the worksheets will be fine
and read the notes thoroughly
reviews.comment_workload:
no assignments at all
just  one midterm and one final
45% and 55%
but if failed each of that will hurt so bad

reviews.author: lily715
reviews.comment_content: The course is rather on fundamental accounting, like double entry, journal, financial statements etc.  Those who have studied BAFS Accounting before can pick up more easily.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony is a comparatively good professor. His english is better than other acct professors (from what my friends and I have discovered) because of this many foreign students will take his course. But this brings another disadvantage : the foreign students will pull up the mean and SD because they have already learnt the materials taught in this course before. And although his English is good, his lessons grew boring afterwards.
reviews.comment_grading:
In my two exams,I got a score lower than the mean and got a C in the end.
But for studying his exam, he will always say to do exercise on the textbook. Do not do this, it is completely useless, the exercises are nothing like his paper. He is also unwilling to give out sample papers because he worries students will only study the sample papers.
reviews.comment_workload:
No assignments in his class, except for the optional homework.
One mid-term and one final
Some in-group exercise and quiz, the one with the lowest score will be taken off consideration of final score

reviews.author: warren
reviews.comment_content: Li always talk about something not related to the course but he may teach you some skill on investing share as he used to teach based on the sources in financial time.
reviews.comment_teaching: quite good, he is willing to listen to others question and answer each question patiently. Willing to modify his teaching method.
reviews.comment_grading: emphasizes he will give as many A,B as he can,haha
reviews.comment_workload: no assignmentttttt and will not take attendenceeeee so what you need to do is go home and download all the powerpoint and read it yourself.

reviews.author: jcC
reviews.comment_content: It is a rather elementary course is about fundamental knowledge of accounting: double entry, journal, financial statements etc. For those who have studied BAFS in DSE should have a bit advantage over the others, but it is suggested to attend classes or practice on the given questions in textbook as some contents covered in DSE were said to be insufficient.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor was nice and willing to answer questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading of this course is quite fair: it actually reflects how much effort you devoted into studying. Even an ameteur in accounting can score higher marks than those studied BAFS before if they worked hard enough.
reviews.comment_workload: As I said before this course requires hardwork, but its workload is still manageable.

reviews.author: Nicolle
reviews.comment_content:
Based on the basics of accounting, learning based on profit and loss, transactions, balance sheets etc.
Learning how to construct these.
reviews.comment_teaching:
THe instructor has a pretty monotonous voice, but otherwise, he is quite interesting to listen to (if you are able to stay focused and awake).
He is very knowledgable and helpful when it comes to accounting in the real world. He's also very passionate about it so he tends to go off topic quite a lot.
reviews.comment_grading:
You could get bonus marks by presenting a speech about accounting based on real life examples.
The mid- term exam was pretty straight foreward with questions arising mostly from the textbook, however the final exam was quite difficult.
reviews.comment_workload: No work that essentially has to be submitted for grading but it is vital that you do enough practice to be familiar with all the concepts.

reviews.author: Olina
reviews.comment_content:
The professor covered the first 11 chapters in the textbook except chapter 4.
She gave adequate examples to illustrate the concepts and raised tricky questions for us to think. She will cover what she has mentioned as well as sample paper in the exam.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Logic teaching and many examples.

She is always willing to answer questions and make appointment with students.

very helpful and friendly
reviews.comment_grading: Though the final was too difficult, I think, the professor tried to give as much a range as possible. (at least she said so...)
reviews.comment_workload:
fair workload.
In-class exercise
no homework
need to do exercise yourself

reviews.author: Victoria
reviews.comment_content: An overview of the fundamentals of financial accounting. Content is clear and concise (but probably too little?) and can be easily understood by anyone with/without accounting background. Great for beginners.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor can teach very clearly although it is not to say that he's a fun guy (lol, he can be pretty boring but I guess that doesn't really matter, as long as he can make the students understand the materials). He asks quite a number of questions and also interacts with students, so he's quite engaging.
reviews.comment_grading:
The exams are pretty easy, so it's really hard to get mean+SD, and there was one time when the mean+SD > 100% lol so yeah it's almost impossible

Mini quizzes are approx 40% of the total grade (my total is 114/120, with 40 total marks per quiz)
Final exam is <40%, got full mark
The rest of the grade is from attendance, cases (homework), and in-class exercises -- anyone could easily get 100% on these though
Final grade is A+
reviews.comment_workload: You need to do exercise in every lecture and he also gave 2 cases you need to work on with your group mate; there are also 3 mini quizzes and a final. However, I can say that the workload is pretty light and the problems he gave are quite easy. Finals and quizzes are pretty easy compared to other lectures too (which explains the high mean).

reviews.author: anghol
reviews.comment_content: An overview of the fundamental concepts of accounting for any school students, which is very useful. In-class contents are a little bit difficult to understand, however, you can study the textbook contents instead,
reviews.comment_teaching: For those students without accounting background, it would be very difficult to catch up with the slides and teaching. Then you need to ask Prof questions and study hard after lecture.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading was satisfactory, even though the final examination was much difficult than the mid-term exams.
reviews.comment_workload: There were 2 mid-term exams and a final exam, however no attendance requirement, but with participation marks. There were many group-based assignments, and the workload depends on your groupmates actually.

reviews.author: Ekkachai
reviews.comment_content:
In-class contents are difficult to understand, yet it is interesting to study the textbook contents instead.
The textbook for this course provides an overview of the fundamental concepts of accounting. Topics are new and useful to business students.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof might overlook the needs of the students without accounting background.
Students without accounting background may find it difficult to catch up with Prof. Chen's slides and teaching. Prof will answer students' question frequently in class or on canvas. Yet, most of the questions are raised by students with accounting background and students like us do not understand them at all, which may affect the learning progress and atmosphere.
reviews.comment_grading: Got a grade of C for this course even my grade for the mid-term exam and final exam are both below mean. The final examination was a difficult one yet the grading was satisfactory.
reviews.comment_workload: There were lots of assignments but all of them were group based. (which means the workload actually depends on your group mates). There were 2 mid-term exams and a final exam. No attendance requirement.

reviews.author: Jae
reviews.comment_content: Basic things in accounting that you have to know. Contents are simple and straight-forward
reviews.comment_teaching: She taught pretty well, but you need to self-study some of the topics to catch up in class if this is your first time studying accounting.
reviews.comment_grading: If you studied and prepared well before the exams and achieve above mean scores, you will pretty easily get B or B+ since professor usually gives out full marks for homework. Cheat sheet can be a great help during exams but don't cram too many things in there because you might spend all your time during exam looking for the stuff you have written.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much work given out. All you need to do is finish 6 homework with your group.
Midterm exams were not that tough. The professor tells you what kind of questions she will ask before the exams and goes through questions that your having difficulties with. She also allows students to bring in a double-sided cheat sheet with them and it could be a great help.
Final exam was a bit tough, and there aren't much time to look through 3 double-sided cheat sheets so better prepare well beforehand.

reviews.author: acinom
reviews.title: ACCT 2010
reviews.comment_content: Basic stuff only. It gives you an idea of financial statement and brief analysis. You will be asked to basically assess which transaction is within which account category. The only thing you should do in this course is to attend the lecture and understand the construction of each statement.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony is a great teacher. He gave us a complete "starter" pack such as real-world challenges, implications on such system, and numerous practices. He himself is resourceful and beyond approachable.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading. I forgot the results for two midterms and one final exam, but I can clearly recall I got all above mean and one SD. My final grade turned out to be A.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is decent. I didn't feel that the coursework was cumbersome. There was one group assignment wherein students should submit a paper. Besides, some in-class quizzes were held during the semester.

reviews.author: Nick Cheng
reviews.comment_content: The classes covered basic accounting concepts and financial statements. For those who had high school accounting background could easily understand the lecture without attending it. Still, attending the lesson is advisable since there will be class activities during lesson.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kelvin's teaching was good! His classes was fun and well-taught. 15 minutes or so are given at the end of every two lessons for group exercises and in-class work, Kelvin would join our group discussion for better learning results which was great as a local students.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading in every accounting courses is hard to judge as many people had their accounting background. The SD for midterm was high and difficult to get higher than one SD.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is ok-ish. There was only one essay as assignment throughout the course and its about works ethics which was kind of unrelated to the course material. Other than that, only in-class exercises are given for the sake of learning.

reviews.author: Ivy Sze
reviews.comment_content: The content of Acct 2010 is quite easy. it is only about the basic accounting and if you have the background of accounting, you can skip all the classes and still understand what's going on.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony's teaching is quite good. However, he remembers the name of students. If you skip the class, he will know.
reviews.comment_grading: I have got a 98% in final but still got a B+ in acct. Since the paper was quite easy, many people can get a high mark and the mean is quite high.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only one mid term and several quizzes and group exercises. The final is non- cumulative.
Every quiz or group exercise will be notified by the professor a week before or a lesson before. So there will not be any pop up quizzes.

reviews.author: luca590
reviews.title: ACCT2010 standard class
reviews.comment_content: Content it super straightforward ACCT stuff. If you speak english and know elementary math, you should be able to understand the concepts. A bit tedious though.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kelvin says he doesn't try to trick his students, but that's not true. Although he will test you on the information taught in class (and not anything unrecognizable), he occasionally words questions in a way which makes it unclear, or blatantly tries to trip students up. For example, on the final there was a question on the 4th page of the exam, which referred to information the 1st page of the exam, but he worded the question in a way that kind of concealed that fact. Overall though he's a great teacher. Nice and flexible.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is pretty straight forward, just to lots of practice in the book. Often problems in the book will appear on exams.
reviews.comment_workload: Not a lot of assigned work, but you'l need to practice to get used to the concepts.

reviews.author: Andy12345
reviews.comment_content:
Clear content, cleat lecture notes .
most of it are from secondary school bafs, i believe hard working can still get a good grade as the content is quite easy for sbm student
reviews.comment_teaching: speaks very well and explains concepts  precisely, making them pretty easy to understand. , attractive, question and answer forum provided, open to receiving questions from everyone at any point in class and also after class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good, mid term easy, final difficult

good, skip half lessons still b range
some are from past paper and textbook
reviews.comment_workload: Low, only one essay, only classwork, one midterm (fewest among instructors), final exam

reviews.author: samyip97
reviews.comment_content: it is all about secondary school bafs, it will be a big benefit if you have studied before, but if you are hard working, you can still get a good grade as the content is quite easy
reviews.comment_teaching: Kevin teaching is quite difficult to understand despite the syllabus is simple, but he will still try to make some jokes during lessons
reviews.comment_grading:
good, sometime sleep during lessonsand skip half lessons still b range
midterm and final are not difficult, some are from past paper and textbook
reviews.comment_workload: Low, only one essay, only classwork, one midterm (fewest among instructors), final exam

reviews.author: JonSnow
reviews.comment_content: Financial accounting was relatively easy. I did not take accounting in my highschool, so I did not have any knowledge before. However, the content was really simple and easy to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is  a really good teacher. Explains everything really well. Makes the class really personal and answers any questions you may have. No electronic equipments allowed. So will need to bring a hard copy of the content to every class.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading quite tough
reviews.comment_workload: Workload was relatively low. Had 3 small quizzes, 2 assignments, and 1 final exam. Have to work with partner.

reviews.author: Hkysk
reviews.title: NO GROUP PROJECT ANY MORE
reviews.comment_content: Examination content is indeed very similar to those in the book. So practicing the exercises of the accounting book are more than enough to deal with the exams
reviews.comment_teaching: Li Xi generally gives great teaching. The teaching speed is relative low comparing to other instructors, so it is definitely good for accounting newbie. His notes encompass various out-sy but interesting financial accounting concepts and financial news. If you are interested in financial market, his notes might suit your appetite.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got A- with less than 1 sd higher than mean
Midterm mean = ~86
Final exam mean <70
reviews.comment_workload:
NO Homework and group project
Only mid term and final exams, very light workload patently

reviews.author: Ust Toxic Boy
reviews.title: Acct2010
reviews.comment_content:
Excellent but a bit boring

Have to Raise Hand ask more question
to get more participation marks or not it will be so hard to get a better Grade Easily  !
reviews.comment_teaching:
Effective  
Teach AMERICIAN ACCOUNTING
Explanation is detailed but u need to raise ur hand more
reviews.comment_grading:
Good Grading ! Really Good
Even though i haven't studied account and i could still get B+ without Intensive Drilling / Revising
reviews.comment_workload:
Really Load
Only 5 Hw ( Hw 1 2 3 4  5 6 ) Choose the Best 5 one So its Great  
2mid term and 1 final
MC -> LQ ->MC+LQ
So it's very good

reviews.author: Holly
reviews.comment_content: 會教usa gaap system 既accounting, 同dse 既format唔太似，format要記過，有學過bafs 會有着數(如果你叻), 如果唔係就係簡單既本身唔識既好快明，難既你識唔識都係一樣咁學。
reviews.comment_teaching: 教學雖然唔太有趣，但勝在每樣野都好清晰，佢會1邊做落白紙，1邊ppt, 同你一路講1路做，專心有上堂，mid-term 同hw 一d 都唔難。
reviews.comment_grading:
好好grad
15% 1st mid-term
15% 2nd mid-term
25% Hw
5-8% Participation (攞卡，問/答問題，唔係1張1%,  唔知點judge)
(如果你Hw冇full, 而parti 又好先會多過5%,  hw+parti max.  30%)
40% Final (好難，超級難，學過bafs 都未必掂，但。。。個個都咁低分，所以低分都冇咩影響)
reviews.comment_workload: 6次hw, 佢只係計最高5次既分，頭5次full mark 可以揀唔做第6次

reviews.author: Benny Hui
reviews.title: Principles of Accounting (I)
reviews.comment_content: The content taught in this course is the fundamentals required, i.e. the four statements in accounting, as well as how to draw and analyze the statements. They are not very hard if you follow the lecture notes and ppt. However, it would be a definite advantage to those who studies BAFS in high school.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Chen is quite good. Providing clear explanation through ppts and exercises, she can let students understand concepts clearly. She asks students to ask questions frequently, so they can get participation marks and understand what is taught in the lesson. She also tells some jokes and real life examples in the lecture to create a good learning atmosphere.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading of this course is quite good. With satisfactory participation rate, i.e. one answer each lecture, mean score at each midterm and finals, and full mark in hw (all students get full marks so it is not hard at all), you can get a B+. It is not hard at all if you revise and participate.

Students who did accounting before have a great advantage and it is not hard to get A.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is relatively low. Apart from the frequent hw (a total of 6 in the semester), the only thing left to do is to revise for the 2 midterms, which includes mc and lqs, and there are some hard questions. Students who studied accounting before will definitely handle the work better.

reviews.author: jhyleung97
reviews.comment_content: Professor emphasizes combining both knowledge on class and real life examples. Thus he usually spends some time to explain on one or two related issues in every class. Generally speaking, the content would be okay for students who have taken bafs before in dse, only point to mention is that part of the entries are different from bafs, since this class uses American style accounting. However, non-bafs students might find it necessary to pay much effort to catch up.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Xi has a generally slower teaching pace than other classes, since he spends comparatively larger portion of time explaining real life examples. His lessons are usually in good pace, and students are generally attentive. Only few of the classes might be boring, but students still take initiative to ask questions.Both Professor Xi and the TA are very willing to answer questions on the discussion board of CANVAS.
reviews.comment_grading: In view of a bafs student, the levels of difficulty of the mid-term paper and final exam paper are generally acceptable , with the later more difficult. The SD of the class are generally high, and full marks are not impossible. Grades are good if you pay enough effort. Also, students who volunteer to give news presentations in front of the class or demonstrate completing in-class questions can obtain bonus marks.
reviews.comment_workload: No homework is given. All preparations and practices have to be done by yourself. There would only be mid-term, in-class exercises and final exams. It is suggested that students prepare the powerpoints or read the text book before class. Only materials covered in both ppt and textbooks would be in exam syllabus.

reviews.author: kkli
reviews.comment_content: Do not choose this instructor if you cannot stand a boring lesson. His tone is extremely flat. He will teach the hard knowledge by talking the powerpoint most of the time. He would teach for a hour first , then give you some time to finish the class works. These class works are also used to mark your attendance. He would let you form your own group and choose a good classmate can surely benefit your study in ACCT.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is quite fast. He would read out the powerpoint and may be read out the example in the powerpoint then. His teaching is fully based on the powerpoint, But as he said, Acct is all about exercise. His teaching is not as matter as your self studying and exercising.
reviews.comment_grading: I got a C plus in this course. I had never studied Acct before. The mean of every test and exam is quite high in fact, may be around 80%. I got mean in average in the test and below 1 SD in exam. Others assignments and attendance are quite well.
reviews.comment_workload: His workload is not that heavy as he does not require us to do many homework. But the matter is others classmates work so hard that you have to follow suit. Otherwise, you will be out of the game in a not far future.

reviews.author: yoyo556
reviews.title: acct2010
reviews.comment_content: don't take  Li Xi's lecture. Because it requires you to do project and during lecture, most of the content is related to finance and not really about how you deal with acct. But if you are really interested in how to apply acct and fina knowledge and do some case studies, it would be good to take his course.
reviews.comment_teaching: His english is quite good. He merely uses powerpoint slides to teach and most of the time he can make his points clear.
reviews.comment_grading: Most of the acct courses require students to score high because most of the students score high. If you cannot score higher than 1 sd, you cannot get good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Have assignment every week.

reviews.author: beckhamlampard
reviews.title: BAFS人有優勢
reviews.comment_content:
Business school 第一個sem必修嘅course. 對於有DSE Bafs Account背景嘅人會有較明顯嘅優勢(特别係頭幾課).個course主要係教accounting嘅basic野,例如基本嘅accounting concepts,點樣畫d常用嘅accounts(e.g income statement, balance sheet, etc), account  ing equations等等, 大部份都係有account底嘅人學過嘅,所以會比其他人事半功倍,但注意ust教嘅account係美國版,而DSE account係用國際版,所以部份topic嘅做法會有出入(e.g bad debts).
唔同DSE, 個course考concept多過畫表同計數.
利申: DSE BAFS Account 5** (非晒名)
reviews.comment_teaching:
教得幾有心,幾nice,雖然有時幾悶,但睇得出佢想令到個lecture有趣d,好樂意解答同學嘅問題.主要都係跟textbook教
兩個TA效率幾慢,考完mid term成個月都未改晒lol.
聽聞佢係爛grade嘅,但我最後拎左個A,所以請大家自行判斷
reviews.comment_grading:
Class activities and participation (10%): 自行分組(5-6人),堂上做textbook入面嘅題目,本身一早講定邊堂lecture做class work同做邊題.話就話堂上做,但通常都係做唔切,可以下堂先交番. 同時呢個都係識fd唔錯嘅機會
Case about ethics in accounting (15%): Individual嘅功課,會俾個情景你,要你講個情景犯左咩accounting ethics同點解決d問題,DSE冇乜讀過呢d野,自己做到一頭霧水.最後冇派番份功課,幾多分都唔知.
Mid-term exam (25%): 30條mc佔60%,考concept居多,計數題少; Long q佔40%,包括畫accounts(包括Journal),計數同文字題.整體唔太難
Final exam (50%):non-cumulative,即係唔會考番mid-term前嘅syllabus,形式同mid-term差唔多,會比mid-term難,好大程度上因為後期教嘅野難d,DSE account 考生都未學過.考試時間充裕. 最後都係都知final嘅result
reviews.comment_workload:
正如頭先講過,個course對有account背景嘅人都幾着數,基本上考試前溫一晚就ok, 而class work都唔係太難,因為textbook嘅example都幾多,更何況有d人可能本身有textbook solution.反而係份individual功課要認真做.
至於對冇account底嘅人黎講,就要努力少少,畢竟本身我自己中學開頭讀bafs嗰陣都要一段時間先清到account嘅概念. 一開頭不妨請教下高中有讀過account嘅同學,咁樣會幫到你地清下concept,否則之後唔係咁易跟得上.

reviews.author: mshtom
reviews.comment_content:
Principles of Financial accounting, and mainly financial statements.
His powerpoint notes are basically summarized from the textbooks.
All the practice questions are from the textbooks.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Goes over powerpoint with notes every single classes.
Not particularly boring during the class, but you might get tired eventually.
He likes when you participate in his class, so make him remember your name.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance and Participation (5%)
In-Class Group Exercises (10%)
In-Class Quizzes (10%)
Mid-Term (35%)
Final (40%)

For the group exercises, it would obviously be better if you team up with your smart friends. We had total five group exercises, and although not mentioned in the syllabus, the professor dropped the lowest one.

For the in-class quizzes, he dropped the lowest one.

Mid term tended to be harder than the final. So prepare for the mid term.

One thing about grading for accounting is that one number error can screw the entire number, which TA, with too much workload, sometimes cannot find it and give you partial credit. So always check you quizzes or midterms if you can claim any more points.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is decent. Just keep up on the reading and DO solve the assigned practice questions. He posts the answers for the practice questions. So if you can understand what is going on in the practice questions, you are good to go at least for the in class group exercises and quizzes.

reviews.author: SBML
reviews.comment_content: Notes are easy to understand and main points from textbook are covered in the notes.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching and notes are clear and easy to follow.
Quick and detailed responds are given in Discussion on Canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
Cheat sheets are allowed in both mid-terms and final.
Participation is the bonus mark. Asking and answering questions are easy.
But, final is quite difficult compared to other classes.
I got higher marks in the 2 mid-term(nearly full mark) and full mark in all the HWs. But I didn't  do well in final. Still got B+.
reviews.comment_workload:
6 HW in total, all are group projects
2 mid-term exams. Don't worry they are easy. Hints are given and questions are similar to those in textbook(exactly the same questions but changing the numbers). So you just need to do more textbook exercises in order to get higher marks.

reviews.author: Patrick
reviews.title: ACCT2010
reviews.comment_content: seems not so hard comparing to others, design and the arrangement of the notes is perfect
reviews.comment_teaching: easy to understand the concepts behind,design and the arrangement of the notes is perfect
reviews.comment_grading: the quiz and final are easy,so you have to attain a very high score in order to get a A/B range
reviews.comment_workload: Not much in HW. but there are 3 quizes each semester replacing the midterm, no worries, those quizes are easy and just like those in the textbook exercises, so just finish the exercises/practice from the professor and u can get good marks

reviews.author: SSss
reviews.comment_content: Basic accounting principle,since the definition of terms is not examined,understanding on the topic is more important.Mainly discuss how we record the journal entries for different transaction, and how we present them on financial statement.The content of the course is quite simple.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching style is quite relax, the teacher would ask question to students, and encourage students to ask question. His teaching is clear and will let you know which part is not required or not important. It is easy to follow the lecture with different examples in lecture notes. Attendance of class is very important since every in-class exercise carries points for final grade.
reviews.comment_grading:
Don't know much on grading since I don't know how others' grades are.But I think that the grading is fair for me.
Grading Scheme

Attendance and Participation 15
In-class Group Exercises       30
Cases                                     20
Three Mini Exams
@ 40 points each                 120
Final Examination
( cumulative)                         115
   TOTAL POINTS                  300
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very light,there would be three mini-exam which covers up to three chapter individually. The cases are not very difficult and would not take you much time to work on.

reviews.author: Brian Hong
reviews.title: ACCT 2010
reviews.comment_content:
mainly based on ppt he created.

many topics in textbook are not covered during lecture.

it gets harder as chapter goes on.
reviews.comment_teaching:
lecture + class exercises.

class exercises help a lot
reviews.comment_grading:
Gives very poor grade.

three mini exams and final exam are difficult and short of time
but cases are easy to get full marks

for participation grade, he assigns seats and records participation
so do not miss the class.

no extra credit assignments.
reviews.comment_workload:
Three mini exams (40 points each)
two cases analysis
Final exam (cumulative, 115 points out of 300 total)

reviews.author: curry
reviews.comment_content:
the ppt was not simple enough and quite hard to understand
His coverage is also more and harder than other professors, so if you are really interested in accountings His course will be good for you.
No attendance is taken but he does remember people's name, even if you never speak. He will ask for your reason of absence. Also due to the numerous quizzes and assignments in class, you can hardly skip lesson. So don't try skipping his classes.
reviews.comment_teaching:
he taught really fast and was hard for me to keep up
You might want to do some preparation and studying before taking his classes
However he is very friendly and will be very happy to answer your questions anyways.
reviews.comment_grading: They give grades according to curves. Given that Prof Shieh's exam are difficult, getting a good grade is hard. The mean is pretty high.
reviews.comment_workload:
quite a small amount
there are 3 quizzes and 3 in-class assignments
so each and then there will be quiz or assignment
make sure to be there every time.

reviews.author: rice
reviews.comment_content:
Intro
Balance Sheet
Income Statement
Adjustment and Closing Entry
Revenue Recognition
Inventory
LT assets
Liabilities and time value
Bonds
Owners Equity
Statement of Cash Flows

covered quite a lot of topics compared to some other sessions
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching pace was a bit fast but one should be able to follow if u pay attention. The prof. would tryto cover as many topics as possible and expect you to go through the details on textbook by yourself.

PPT slides are well organized and concise. Taught according to ppt, and would quote textbook examples or her own examples for demonstration in class.

Asking questions in class is strongly encouraged, and the prof would also answer students' questions on canvas discussion board
reviews.comment_grading:
22-25% Homework
5-8% Class Participation
15% Midterm 1
15% Midterm 2
40% Final

Mean for the two midterms were about 75-85%, but the mean of final exam was below 50%
reviews.comment_workload:
Homework:
6 group homework, counts the best 5
Usually 2-3 questions which are not very difficult
and you can find similar question types on textbook
Groups are assigned by the professor, around 5-6 ppl per group

Participation:
need to ask questions or answer questions to gain participation cards

Exams:

MC (emphasizes the conceptual details), Short questions with calculations, and some complex long questions in final

Some of the midterm questions were modified from textbook exercise, it is recommended to get a textbook for self practice to prepare for exam.

Content of final exam is cumulative. And cheatsheets are allowed for both midterm and final.

reviews.author: mixedswagger
reviews.comment_content: Professor was teaching according to the PowerPoint slide with details, seldom talked about anything out of scope, while sometimes used some daily example to show us how things work. There's around 10 chapters in total and are almost similar to what the textbook is providing. This course is a fundamental course for accounting, therefore it might be beneficial for someone who has studied account previously in high school. There are some financial content as well, but they are quite easy to be understood.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Chen never talked too fast or too slow, he used most of the lecture time to talk about the content of the slides while sometimes he would do some examples to show us the methodology behind. He would answer questions from students, rather it is face to face or via email. You can even find him at his office on the given office hour, he would still kindly answer you inquiries even it's not his office hour though. He knew that some of us might not have been studying accounting before, he described every little point with detail. I'm sure that even you haven't studied accounting before, you will have no problem in understanding most of the course.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework 10%
Mid-term 40%
Final 50%
That might be a huge weighted score for exam, but the difficulties of the exam is average, it is similar to what the textbook have, should  you practice more with your textbook, the exam would be easy for you. There are MCs in the exams, but they were straight forward and nothing really conceptual. The use of his words in the exam is clear enough, college student shouldn't be confused at all.
reviews.comment_workload: He gave 10 homework assignments in total, which are given after he finishes a chapter. The answer of the assignment need not be correct, but you should show your passion in doing it! Usually it's a one-question assignment, and nothing else needed to be done.

reviews.author: Dreamscometrue
reviews.title: Basic Accounting Course
reviews.comment_content:
Basic Accounting knowledge which stress on the accounting mechanism.

Similar to HKDSE BAFS, with some minor differences, mainly becuase they are following two different accounting standard.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Shieh has taught this course for a long time (both in UST, cityu), so he understands what students are struggling about most of the time.

Concepts are illustrarted by different examples in the boon, which are useful, especially for those who do not know accounting at all.

Good presentation with cute voice, feel that he teaches with and by heart. If you attend all the lectures, most probably you will understand the basic techniques.

Prof. Shieh has been to HK from Taiwan for more than twenty years, he speaks English, Cantonese and Putonghua in a extremely fluent way (he knows what you are talking in Cantonese, don't try to say anything bad). No difficulties In understanding his words. You may speak in one of the three languages mentioned after class, in case of any questions.

Anyway, heard from friends that their prof are some how difficult to understand, if you don't think you are smart enough to understand things easily, enroll in his class. :)
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grading, your effort will paid off.
1 * Midterm (94.5/100) (mean 69,sd 18)
1* final (95/100) (mean 81)
3 *quizzes ( drop the lowest one) (10/10 for 2 counted)
5* inclass group ex (10/10 for all)

Turns up A+, heard from previous years that he distributed quite a lot A range and C range

Again, work hard, you will get what you pay
reviews.comment_workload:
For midterm and final, he is quite different from other professors, his exams are similar to DSE( paper 2A) and AL, in terms of format. NO MCQs in both exams, all are structured questions which requires you to set up account/ compute. While each questions will consists of some concept sub questions( i.e. You have to write some sentences and apply acconting concepts in the case), but most important things is the work concerning account/statement/ computation. Textbook will be good for you.

Both examinations are not really difficult if you get all the concepts in the powerpoint, comparing to other professors, at least (other lectures' students look horrible after final)

Quizzes sometimes are difficult, inclass group exercises are not really hard. Good to have a student who have learned accounting before.

reviews.author: Inez
reviews.comment_content: Simple account...even without any account ratios...The concept is easy but it's not really the same with HKDSE syllabus...
reviews.comment_teaching:
I think Tony taught a bit fast...you may need to review the content in leisure time if you want to fully understand...the time on the lesson is hard for you to understand the concept clearly.
However, Tony explains and teaches very clearly and you just need time but it's generally easy to understand.
Some schoolmates reflect that other prof. can hardly explain that clearly and it's hard for them to understand...I'm not sure.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grading.
He will surely consider your attendance by watching your photos in class to determine who is in the classes hahaha
reviews.comment_workload:
Not many workload.
Some group-exercise which don't need much preparation.
Quizzes should be seriously treated...
The examinations are quite different with other classes but it's not really difficult.

reviews.author: min
reviews.title: ACCT2010
reviews.comment_content: Content of this course provides the basic understanding of accounting. It is also easy for the beginners to understand. However, it gets slightly difficult towards the end when the chapters get related to each other.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Tony is great, he has humor ad great English as well. However, his teaching is very unique among the other ACCT2010 professors, so it is little difficult to compare our work with others.
reviews.comment_grading: I think grading is good. I managed to received A. However, it is important to note that if you mess your mid term or final, you will really slip in your grade. Doing well in quiz and group exercise will not make a significant impact on your grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is fairly good. There are several group exercises and quiz, but for group exercises we can ask him for any doubts. I had only 3 quiz throughout the term. Preparation is really easy because you only need to do the book exercises. Also, you can drop the lowest score for the quiz as well as the group exercise.

Professor Tony also separates the syllabus for mid term and final exams.

reviews.author: MC
reviews.title: Having BAFS background is certainly an advantage.
reviews.comment_content:
The course materials are almost the same as BAFS.
so if you studied BAFS before, you have an advantage.

i did NOT study BAFS before so this course is demanding for me as i have a lot to catch up and have to do a lot of exercise to understand the concepts.

for her course, i think you need to have a thorough understanding of accounting concepts. knowing the calculation is not enough.
reviews.comment_teaching:
i have no comments on her... as i skipped most of her lessons...

you are free to ask her questions as she said but i never asked one...
reviews.comment_grading:
homework 93%(only best 5 counted)  mean = 96.8%

midterm1 68/102 , mean = 79.4, SD~12
one cheat sheet allowed.

midterm 2 89/102 mean = 84.8 SD~11
one cheat sheet allowed.

final 145/250  mean = 114/250 didn't ask for the SD
the final exam is extremely difficult and covers all chapters. and three cheat sheets allowed.

only got 2 parti cards

final grade = B+
reviews.comment_workload:
6 homework only best 5 are counted in course grade (5x5%@=25%) there is a peer review after each assignment submitted.

2 midterms (15%@)= 30%

1 final = 40%

participation mark including your class participation and participation in homework ( not actual grade as stated on canvas)

reviews.author: TCheung
reviews.comment_content:
Mainly about the preparation of financial statements. The topics overlaps most the DSE content, except the statement of cash flow.

Having studied in BAFS in high school is an advance, but be careful that the format of the financial statements may not be exactly the same.
reviews.comment_teaching: Monotone, but very clear pronunciation, at least better than many Mainland professors. If you pay attention in class, you will have no difficulty on understanding what he said.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grading. But although there was no attendance taking, 10% of the course marks were given based on class behaviours. So, don't skipped lesson to let the professor remember you.

Midterm one above 1 SD, Midterm two above 1.5 SD, Final above 1 SD. ->A

Instructor’s discretion  10%
Class participation  10%
First Mid-term  20%
Second Mid-term  20%
Final exam  40%
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload.

Students were required to submit some class-review problems before each lecture. Whenever you have completed it, you get the full credit.

reviews.author: Samo
reviews.title: Review of Course
reviews.comment_content: Content in the course is appropriate for an introduction to accounting, but, be advised, that if you do not have an accounting background, you will find it a little tough in the first few lectures of the semester. Basic concepts include journal entries, depreciation, balance sheet, income statement, statement of cash flow, dividends, bonds, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Mostly PowerPoint based - helps if you do the readings of the PPT before class begins. Aside from that, heavy reliance on the cases from GOME / Apple, to consolidate all the knowledge obtained from the classes, and apply them tor all financial statements.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading for this course - mean is generally in the low 80s / high 70s, since lots of people already have some level of accounting background, and therefore the means generally become high.

Neither examination is really that hard, and if prepared well enough, then it is not hard to score well on these examinations.
reviews.comment_workload: Optional homework given based off the concepts covered in class, quizzes and in class exercises here and there which require little preparation. One midterm, one final, and one ethics report (3 pages). Workload not high.

reviews.author: Praycurse
reviews.title: short review summary
reviews.comment_content:
The syllasbus of the courese have almost been covered by dse level in bafs. So students who studied bafs would have advantages. But i think this course is quite straight forward and easy to understand for those who do not take bafs. But still so effort should be put in doing exercises.
The mean and sd of mini exam exam is quite high （3X out of 40）
His lessons were not too boring, sometimes he might make some jokes. But his pronounciation is not very good but it is easy to catch up what he is saying.
Not too much workload. Only two cases consist of quite few questions. And the question are quite easy to answer.

reviews.author: cecilia
reviews.comment_content: The syllasbus of the courese have almost been covered by dse level in bafs. So students who studied bafs would have advantages. But i think this course is quite straight forward and easy to understand for those who do not take bafs. But still so effort should be put in doing exercises.
reviews.comment_teaching: His lessons were not too boring, sometimes he might make some jokes. But his pronounciation is not very good but it is easy to catch up what he is saying.
reviews.comment_grading: The mean and sd of mini exam exam is quite high （3X out of 40）
reviews.comment_workload: Not too much workload. Only two cases consist of quite few questions. And the question are quite easy to answer.

reviews.author: Avocado
reviews.title: Interesting class.
reviews.comment_content: Very detailed content, each of the chapters covered in class is very informative. Class presentations for each chapter are uploaded on Canvas, as well as in-class exercises taken from the textbook. A very comprehensive and thorough introduction to financial accounting, and a useful course for beginners.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is relatively good, however for students without previous accounting background, it's quite tough in the beginning because the content is covered quite quickly. However, the teacher is patient with answering questions about the course material. There are also plenty of opportunities for you to ask questions, and gain participation cards.
reviews.comment_grading: The mean for the midterms is very high, as there are many students with prior knowledge about the subject (from DSE or A-Levels). Standard deviation is also pretty low for both of the midterms. Do your best in the homework assignments, and try to get a lot of participation cards.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 6 homework assignments to be completed in a homework group with 4-5 other students, and the 5 assignments with the highest marks will be taken into grade consideration. It's advisable to do all the suggested problems, as similar questions appear in the midterms. The final requires extensive knowledge of all the syllabus content though, and requires you to prepare full financial statements.

reviews.author: abc123
reviews.comment_content:
not too difficult
easy to catch up even without account background
it will be easy for those who have accounting background
reviews.comment_teaching:
his english is easy to understand
concepts are well explained
willing to answer students' question
reviews.comment_grading:
good grading
above one SD for quizzes and final and get an A for this course
reviews.comment_workload:
workload are acceptable
no mid term but four quizzes and final (non-cumulative for each quizzes)
you can bring one a4 size cheat-sheet(with words only written on one page) on every quizzes and exam

reviews.author: frisjwara
reviews.comment_content: ACCT 2010 is definitely where you want to get your basics for accounting, and Tony Shieh is definitely a good lecturer to get your basics right. We looked at financial statements and learned what some terms meant, what the numbers indicated, etc etc. Definitely a good course to get you introduced to the applications of financial accounting--one that every basic financial statement user (external) needs.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tony Shieh definitely knows his stuff. He's currently the Academic Director of MSc in Accounting here at UST, and teaches in great detail. He's very open to questions and very approachable in and outside class. If you don't understand something, he'd gladly go over the material again as per request.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is definitely competitive, but this is mainly because a lot of the students enrolled in ACCT 2010 have some accounting background back in high school. Even so, the course is generally lenient in terms of grades.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is quite a lot. There are a bunch of quizzes and group exercises, but he doesn't grade the worst one. The quizzes are generally easier than the group exercises, since the former count more towards your grade than the latter. There's also a group project, and you're required to make a short report in groups of 4. It's not that hard, and a guide is provided to help you write it out.

reviews.author: gracie
reviews.comment_content: Very good. Not covering all content in the textbook, though. No homework. Only group work which is in class exercise.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very patient and elaborative. Use online forum to answer all questions. Sometimes might be a bit difficult to follow because of the instructor's accent and low tone when speaking.
reviews.comment_grading: I got more than 1sd above mean in midterm. All participation and group work full marks. Did not do well in final, which was extremely difficult. Got A- at last.
reviews.comment_workload: Higher than the average of 3-cred courses. Need to get very clear idea about the concepts. Should do a lot of practices.

reviews.author: Alfredshengyi
reviews.comment_content: A lot of finance knowledge accompanied with basic accounting. Quite demanding for me but certainly worth studying.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is used to explain theories with real business cases, which in my point of view, makes the classes more vivid. More than that, we are required to present a company analysis in the end of the course in teams, which adds real practice and team corporation into the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading: It is said that the professor graded a great number of A range.
reviews.comment_workload: I find it a little burdening regarding the pre-class exercise, a lot to write.

reviews.comment_content: If you have studied BAFS in high school, then you would have no problem understanding the concepts and contents covered in this course. It starts from the basics (dr and cr) etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Shieh is super friendly and are very willing to answer any questions raised. Also, he explained concepts and principles very clearly. He would ask each group to stand in front of the whiteboard to take a photo with your name on top, so he could remember most of our names.
reviews.comment_grading: I think Prof. Shieh follow the school's grading policy. Asking questions in class would definitely give you bonus points as he would be able to recognise you from the photos and give you participation points.
reviews.comment_workload: There is a midterm and final (contents are not cumulated). Also there's a case study that you have to finish in groups, but a really short one, so the workload is average.

reviews.author: Kingsley
reviews.comment_content: The ppts written by Prof Chen are very clear and easy to understand, which truly facilitate revision.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Chen is very friendly and is always willing to answer students' questions. She is also very passionate about teaching, always attempting to engage students and helping weaker students in answering her questions (everyone in her class has to answer 5 questions raised by the prof throughout the semester for class participation).
reviews.comment_grading: The final was shockingly hard, especially when compared to the midterm exam, and even those who took BAFS as an elective in high school found it difficult. Despite so, the percentage of students getting an A-range is high.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light, without any homework but only weekly in-class exercises.

reviews.author: Stetanjung
reviews.comment_content:
Basic accounting concept, appropriate for those who have not learned anything about accounting stuffs.

It basically teaches you about how to make financial statements (balance sheet, income statement, and statement of cashflows) using various types of standards (GAAP and IFRS). It also teaches you about how to write an entry journal and trial balance.

Also explains about each component of the financial statements, but not in a detailed one.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Perfect teaching! Really love how he teaches.

Good knowledge, lenient teachers, he builds the spirit in the class. He uses ppt and basically refers to the ppt, but he always adds some of his experiences, or explains more about the ppt. Ppt is very readible.

Professor is also open to questions and discussions in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pretty lenient, I guess. Since there are many quizzes and in-class exercises, only 2-3 of your best will be taken, thus it will be easier to get a perfect score.

No idea about how he grade the class participation and group project, as scores will not be given to us for them.

Final and mid-term are a little bit tricky, but if you understand this course really well, it is pretty easy to get a very high score.

40% from final, 30% from midterm, 5% of class participation (basically you should be more active and ask questions if you want to get full score from this), 15% from quizzes and in-class exercise, 10% from projects that you do with your group
reviews.comment_workload:
There will be around 3-4 quizzes (individually, close book), and 4-5 in-class exercise (work in a group, open book) throughout the whole semester.

1 midterm with 5 essay questions (usually to make financial statements and do calculations), 1 final with 6-7 questions (non-cumulative)

Also, there will be 1 study case that will be done per group which we can choose by our own who will be in the same group with us.

reviews.author: Albert Hans
reviews.title: The courses teach about basic accounting such as adjustments and journal entry
reviews.comment_content: The content are mostly basic accounting such as adjustments and journal entry. Most of the material are already thought in highschool, except for the late chapters.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof tony is really funy and d dicated. You could always make an apointment with him to dicuss the materials regarding with the course. He also pays attention toward the students
reviews.comment_grading: The grading ispretty tough. The mean is high, around 75% but you could easily get 80% if you study and pay attention to the lectures. The question are relatively easy, but a bit tricky.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite heavy. Youvwill got a lot of quizes.

reviews.author: Jayden
reviews.comment_content:
The course is mainly about the basic knowledge of Accounting.
Maybe the content will be similar with the things you learn in secondary school accounting lessons. I think the class exercise, group work are really helpful to deepen your understanding.
reviews.comment_teaching: Peter chen is a funny instructor with his stylish English. As he comes from the mainland, his English is not quite accurate and the accent is different from Hong Kong too. Therefore, you may find difficult to understand what he say.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading scheme is absolutely fantastic, as it only count on the group work you have done , mid-term and final. I got an A+ finally
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very light, as the class exercise and group work is easy enough. In Peter's class, there is no group project and participation mark. Therefore, the course is really relax, and you just need to revise the material precisely. Then, you can get a good grade

reviews.author: SBMKK
reviews.title: The best ACCT prof
reviews.comment_content:
Its useful and you will understand the basic theories behind those complicated annual reports.

Students who have studied BAFS will have some advantage - the theories are the same but the methods of how to deal with the problems are a bit different so its recommended for those who studied before should attend lectures as well.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. You is a mainland prof and he was graduated from a US school so no problem for students to understand his lecture. Also, he taught very clearly so that you can easy to understand - the best thing is - he will tell you the difficult part in advance so that you can have a look before his lecture. Moreover, after his lecture, he would say' oh this part is very important in the acct system' and you will know that that part must be tested.
reviews.comment_grading: Many mainland students would register for his course and that's why the mean of the course is quite high but the grade is also good - appx. 20% A range and most of my local friends at least got B range.
reviews.comment_workload:
2 mid term exams + 1 final exam - the first one with many ppl got full mark, but the nightmare was that the second one was much more difficult and many people suffered because they still thought that it would be easy

For the final exam, as prof You did mention at his last lecture, thats much more difficult and the mean was 8x/120 comparing to 10x/120 in the previous mid term exams.

So be careful of the last two tests and dont skip lectures

There are some in-class quiz, basically that would be the first lecture of week has no quiz and the second lecture has.

reviews.author: Kody
reviews.title: Very Good Professor
reviews.comment_content: Content is very standard and basic stuff. Journal entries, balance sheets, income statements, statement of cash flows, and statement of stockholders' equity. Just be aware of not balancing everything because of a small mistake...
reviews.comment_teaching: Peter has very solid knowledge of accounting, but he has an accent, and talks EXTREMELY SLOW. Accounting is very boring stuff, so it can get very sleepy during lectures.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is fair (I guess), because he (or his TA) did not release the final exam scores, but I got into A range by getting 1 SD above mean in the mid-term and missed the whole final question on the final exam, so grading should be fair.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is EXTREMELY small. Peter gives in-class exercises during lectures (practice is very important when learning accounting), and there are 10 very easy group homework assignments. Mid-term and final exams included.

reviews.author: MK jai
reviews.comment_content: The content of this course is about the foundation of Accounting. Indeed it favours the ones who have studied BAFS/ Accounting in the past, it is quite easy to master for those who have no Accounting knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Chen taught well and the teaching materials he has prepared are easy to understand. He would demonstrate some questions in the class which makes us know better about the topics.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading of Professor Chen is really good. Many people got B range although they scored below the median.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was very light. There were only 10 group assignments submitted in the semester, while the assignments were similar to the ones he demonstrated in class. There were also no quiz nor project. Therefore, Peter's class was considered to be a relaxing one.

reviews.author: kyloah
reviews.comment_content: Introduction to the concepts and principles of financial accounting, including the analysis, recording, and reporting of business transactions and preparation of financial statements like opening T-account, balance sheet and income statement.
reviews.comment_teaching: He teaches easy things with clear explanations. He also teaches about the real business situation.
reviews.comment_grading: since the exam and mid-term are super easy, all students could get high marks. Therefore, even people get very high marks , they can't get a high grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
for a BAFS student, you can easily handle the course.
1 mid term
1 exam
1 project
7-8 hw

reviews.author: Stellaya
reviews.comment_content: Teaching Fundamental accounting concept. Basically DSE BAFS Syllabus, plus some concepts of bonds, statement of cash flow.
reviews.comment_teaching: Speak Fluent English.With Clear powerpoints with some examples. But few detail of accounting concept. Students without accounting background may feel hardly to follow.
reviews.comment_grading:
One midterm and One final for Prof. Chen. Different from other classes that I heard, they had two or more midterm and quiz. It's more risky compare to other profs lecture.
Also, FINAL EXAM was much difficult than anyone expected.
And I didn't get back my final exam grade but its far better than my expectation.
reviews.comment_workload: NO HOMEWORK but one group assignment every week. It counts in grading.

reviews.author: Ken_Mak
reviews.comment_content:
Teaching about fundamental concepts of basic accounting.
E.g. balance sheet, Equity, Bonds.....
reviews.comment_teaching:
The lesson is a bit boring but the concepts is welly explained.
For peter's lesson, he will teach about the concepts in the first half of the lesson and then he will finish the in-class exercise together with the class in the second half of the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
One mid-term and one final for Peter's lecture.
For the mid-term, the mean is around 100/115.
For the final, the mean is around 80/115.
I got 90% of the total marks and received an A+ for this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Around 1 simple assignment per weeks in the purpose of reviewing what you just learned over the week.
No attendance required.

reviews.author: Cedric
reviews.title: Light workload for DSE acct students
reviews.comment_content: Actually it's easy if you have studied accounting before. It is just a brief introduction on accounting and starts from zero. However, it is taught in american style accounting system so some may find it in a mess.
reviews.comment_teaching: Although it's hard to listen clearly from his accent, he's still a good teacher who teaches step by step with clear and useful PowerPoint notes.
reviews.comment_grading: Just follow the grading standard from mainstream. Probably you will be in A range if you are above 1 SD in both midterm and final.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload which only have group assignment per week. More than that is only midterm and final.

reviews.author: thy
reviews.comment_content: Not very difficult as long as you have taken BAFS accounting as your elective in secondary school.
reviews.comment_teaching: Fair.  Not very clear sometimes but she will make sure all of us understand the contents.  She will always ask us whether the class is going to fast and make the corresponding adjustment.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite good even though the final is very difficult.  Got an A.
reviews.comment_workload: It is fair.  Just need to hand in a class worksheet at the end of each lesson.  It can be done by yourself or forming a group.  Also, there is 5% for the class participation and you just need to take 5 cards during the lessons.  As long as you try, you can get a card.  The professor will give you tips always.

reviews.author: Pinky
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite good, some examples shown in the ppt,  with some step-to-step teaching. If you have study accounting before, the ppt is adequate for you to study, but the one who never study BAFs, I recommend you to buy a textbook to do more exercise, which is quite good for your study. However it is quite often of having some typo in the ppt and class review problem, so be careful for this.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor's teaching is quite boring, and the ppt used is with black background and white word, it is quite difficult to see and not printer-friendly. I have played truant several times, I think it is okay for you not to attend if you know enough about content.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is quite good if you have study BAFs in high school. In both mid-terms and final, there is one question is taken from the practice problem, so the one who is not very good at it can study more from the practice problem. Cheat sheet is allowed in both mid-term and final.

Grading:
Instructor's discretion (base on class behaviour) - 10%
Class participation (homework, no attendance) - 10%
Mid-term (2 mid-terms) - 2*20% = 40%
Final - 40%
reviews.comment_workload: If you have study BAFs in secondary school, it would be quite easy to finish the homework. Each lecture needs to hand in 2-3 questions homework, which you need to preview the new chapter. However, it may be a bit difficult for those who never take BAFs. And the homework won't be graded, you only need to hand in, so the workload is not very heavy.

reviews.author: MATH = HELL
reviews.comment_content: Comparing to all other professors, Dr. Chen put a lot more emphasis on theory understanding rather than the high school type of memorizing formats of statements. A lot more effort in revising is required than other sections.
reviews.comment_teaching: Use an approach which hopes you to understand the theory behind every concept. Spends a lot of time after class and in-class to cope with students' problems. Tries a lot to engage students into the class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Would be at least OK if you have studied related subjects before (e.g. BAFS), because it is too difficult for those without any knowledge to catch up. Mid term is ok, but final is a lot more deeper into the concepts and to the real world situation, where you would be given a lot of reality-like statement which are very disturbing to read.
P.S. B+
reviews.comment_workload: 0 Workload except in-class excercise.

reviews.author: qq
reviews.comment_content: It may be quite difficult for beginners without any accounting background to pickup at first. There are many specific terms related to accounting that must be first understood. After you understand the basics, the rest is pretty easy to follow.
reviews.comment_teaching:
One of the worst professors I had this semester. I'm not one to skip classes (usually) but I really did not want to attend this professors lessons. It was difficult to understand her, and she does go through things too quickly. I would sit through the whole lesson and listening to what she was trying to teach but still end up not understanding a single thing. Then she expects us to do in-class exercises to show her what we have learnt but how can I show what I have learnt when I learnt nothing at all?

She will answer any questions you ask on LMES discussion board pretty quickly though.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair. Not especially good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is not that much. It is okay to just focus on midterm and finals. She claims that she cares about participation (i.e doing in-class exercises each week, and talking in class to get cards) but it didn't really affect my grade.

Midterm was pretty easy but final was a different story. It is nothing like what you will go through in class.

reviews.author: cheeser
reviews.title: Not bad
reviews.comment_content: For S B & M students, and programs that designate the course as a required/specified elective course. This is the first course of the principles of accounting sequence. Introduction to the concepts and principles of financial accounting, including the analysis, recording, and reporting of business transactions and preparation of financial statements.
reviews.comment_teaching:
clear presentation, many examples, not bad

have a review lesson before every midterm / final exam
reviews.comment_grading: kinda good
reviews.comment_workload:
need to hand in one or two class review questions every lesson, either by photo taking or paper

no attendence taking tho thats good

reviews.author: gg
reviews.comment_content: Basic accounting concepts which mainly cover concepts in HKDSE BAFS (accounting module). If you have studied BAFS before, you can certainly get a good grade in this course
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite good, professor provided a lot of exercises which you can learn a lot of things. Mid term exam and final also cover these exercises as one of the questions,
reviews.comment_grading:
5% Participation
10% In class exercise
40% Mid term exam
45% Final exam
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload at all as you would do exercises in class but not out of class. Just focus on your mid term exam and final

reviews.author: _HTB
reviews.comment_content:
中學讀過BAFS既讀呢個course應該唔算太辛苦
教既新野唔算太多, 主要係比冇底既人學啲入門野
不過啲人普遍都攞好高分, 有個mid term mean係103/120
應該係acct course常識吧
reviews.comment_teaching:
prof幾有心機教, 好多細節位同講得好詳細
朋友冇account底讀落都話易明
佢講既英文都好清楚冇咩特別口音係難聽
仲有每堂教完plan定果啲就會落堂, 所以成日都會早咗幾個字走得
reviews.comment_grading:
2 mid term + 1 final + in-class exercise + performance

mid term一次above一次below mean, final above mean
in-class exercise做足(佢話有交就會攞足分)
最後出黎B咗, 中規中矩啦
reviews.comment_workload:
冇assignment, 每一課有都有in class exercise
workload算係少

reviews.comment_content: comparing to ACCT2010, this course is more fun, less calculation and more concept thingy.
reviews.comment_teaching: Allen is really a good professor in terms of his teaching and his look :) (i'm sorry girls he is already married). Interesting examples during class and many fitness tips ;p
reviews.comment_grading: Allen is good grade though his final is a bit difficult. Doing more exercise in textbook should help in getting good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: No homework, some class exercise. suggest reading through the chapters in txtbk to get a better understanding.  Preparing for midterms and finals can be tough since it requires lots of exercise.

reviews.author: Kevin
reviews.comment_content: I will say there's some advantages that exist for those who have prior accounting knowledge as this course is really at the introductory level. Remarkably however, this course adopts a slightly different approach than the usual IFRS. The course used GAAP so it may take some time for one to adapt to GAAP.
reviews.comment_teaching: Peter's English was not that fluent. Occasionally, he may swap to Chinese for better expression. Notwithstanding, you may refer to the PPT that he made for reference. Those PPTs were quite useful.
reviews.comment_grading:
Peter Chen gave very good grades.Personally, i scored below mean in my mid-term examination and above mean 1 SD in final examination. I got a Level B+.
The thing is the grading method of this course is weird. 40% mid term, 45% final and 15% course work.
reviews.comment_workload: Basically no take-home assignments and no projects. Only have in-class assignments.As soon  as you can find good group mates, that would be fine.

reviews.author: Xmas
reviews.title: hea住好grade 其實唔難
reviews.comment_content:
跟ppt讀 基本上中學學過bafs既都可以走堂 自修

Acct knowledge 唔好expect係佢身上學到好多
reviews.comment_teaching:
Hea... 上堂遲到早放是常識
教書照直講... 基本上你上lecture同你落完堂自己睇ppt冇咩分別
有時會自己搞gag (雖然唔好笑)
聽講以前佢成日帶漏野 考試帶漏比學生既ratio reference sheet都帶漏 touchwood 今個sem無事
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term淺 final好難 但就係咁先分得出高低 比grade鬆手
利申 mt above 0.5sd, final above 1.2sd -> A
reviews.comment_workload:
每2堂有個hea到嘔既gp assignment 做
Mid term 食老本都夠做 唔洗點溫
係final要認真下 不過平時有聽書既話應該覺得其實唔難

reviews.author: Oab
reviews.title: Suck but good grade
reviews.comment_content:
Basically the simplified version of DSE.
The only difference is the cash flow statement.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Poor teaching.
I skipped almost every lecture.
He just read every word in the slides.
He is not a teacher, more like a reading machine.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance: almost full
(I skipped almost every lecture; you can do so as long as you have good friends take it for you)
Assignments: Full
Mid-term: Full
(He just used the question bank and never checked the paper - there are three repeated questions, and all MC for two hours.)
(I slept a while during the exam, it feels good)
Final: Unknown
Grade: A+

I am 5** in DSE BAFS (Accounting).
I guess as long as you have five or above in DSE, you can get A-range. (Please note that some terms are different from DSE.)
No need to study; he allows us to bring a 6-page cheat sheet.
So, you just need to put the format of all statements in it.
Then it should be easy to get A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite heavy.
There are 10 assignments, but unlimited attempts.
So should be easy to get a full marks.

reviews.author: HaileyStar
reviews.comment_content: 资料很齐全啦，prof用excel表格做笔记的
reviews.comment_teaching: 特别耐心的prof，回email超快，周末放假也回复
reviews.comment_grading: 成绩评价还蛮宽容，final的题目很难很吓人，但是给等级分给的比较松，所以卷面分不好看而已，难，但是等级分好看！
reviews.comment_workload:
1 assignment+1 mid term exam+1 final exam
assignment只有一份，但是workload比较大，大概需要一整天的时间才能完成，花了十多个小时，但除去这份assignment就没有别的作业了，平常没作业

reviews.author: Ovaltine
reviews.title: Hard for non-experienced students, but teaching is good!!!
reviews.comment_content:
The content of the course can be a little boring or confusing if you aren't into the financial accounting side of business management.   A lot of the content revolves around transaction analysis, different financial statements, and how to record transactions.

The course and content is pain for students who never did accounting before, because they cover a lot in a very short time.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Wilbur is quite good at presenting topics of this course and his presentation slides are quite tidy.  However, I recommend using the online textbook video explanations for revision, I don't really fully understand topics just from lectures and slides.  

He speaks fluently, but sometimes too quickly for some students unfamiliar with accounting.  

The TA is also very helpful, he replies to emails relatively quickly and provides answers and example questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 5%.  For Wilbur's class, you only need to answer Menti meter questions during lectures.  You don't need to get it right, just make sure you attempt every question for the 5%.   

Homework 20%.  Assignments on the CONNECT online textbook.  

Midterm 25%
Final 50%

Pass is 55%

There are 2 types of people in this class, those who learned accounting before and get 70-90%, and those who never took it and get below the mean.  So PLS study each topic well or u might die.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is pretty good for this class.  Only one homework assignment every 2 weeks.  The homework itself might take some time to do if you aren't too familiar with how to record transactions and fill out sheets and it can get a bit frustrating sometimes.  However, you do get unlimited attempts for every assignment.  Prof Wilbur is also willing to extend deadlines for students with problems accessing homework online.

reviews.author: Marwa
