reviews.comment_content: Not so heavy content but just quite boring--however wilbur chen makes it a bit more interesting. Content requires a lot of consistent practice to understand and master the material! Do the homework assignments diligently and engage in the polls in class
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching style is great! It's very interactive as we have polls during class to practice the concepts that we're learning! He presents the material in a very easily digestible way! Simplifies concepts and offers lots of real-world examples to help you understand material
reviews.comment_workload: Pretty light workload! Offers unlimited attempts on homework assignments, so you have the opportunity to get a perfect score on homework! You have two weeks to complete each homework assignment!

reviews.comment_content: Basic accounting knowledge. Including the charts, the accounting principles and applications in reality. Somebody who have learnt them in high school can easily get the hang of them.

reviews.comment_content: using slides and extra reading materials

reviews.comment_grading:
3 Homework assignments : 30%
The lowest score of homework #1 or #2 will be dropped. Homework #3 cannot be dropped. Each counted homework (HW3 + the higher of HW1 and HW2), therefore, will account for 15% of your grade. so it is okay if you do not do hw1

Midterm 30%
the questions is set to be very basic where median : 100/100, mean : 97/100 so if you score lower than mean, you will get a C range

Final exam 40%
the questions is set to be quite challenging and once you score below mean, even if you get 100/100 in midterm, you may drop to C range
reviews.comment_workload: Light in general as there's only 3 homework and they are doing basic accounting calculations but because of this it makes the scores in midterms and final very crucial.

Content is a bit different with BAFS, but BAFS students still have advantage. Also, the schedule is a bit packed, around 1 week for 1 chapter.
reviews.comment_teaching: "Blended-learning mode": have to watch lecture videos before class and the class will be Q&A and quiz. Lecture video is quite interesting and you do not need to attend classes except classes for quiz.
reviews.comment_grading:
10 Assignments: 20%
(mostly fill in numbers, have 2-3 chances and the questions could be found in textbook)
10 Group exercises: 22%
(around 7-8 ppl in a group, full mark if you finished it on time)
10 In-class quizzes: 30% (8x2%+2x7%)
(MC and checkbox for 2% quiz, MC & checkbox & fill in numbers for 7% quiz)
Class participation: 3%
(1% for each "good" questions posted on Canvas or answering a question in class)
Final: 25%
(3 cheatsheet allowed)

Got almost full mark for assignment and quizzes. (Mean is very high, almost full mark except the second 7% quiz.) Final exam is very difficult and we did not know our final exam score "to avoid unnecessary panic".
Final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload: Quite high workload. Around 1 assignment, 1 quiz and 1 group exercise each week so have to keep revising.

reviews.author: Sleepy~~
reviews.comment_content:
Basic accounting concepts, you will have some advantage if you studied BAFS in secondary school. However, as the course follows GAAP instead of IFRS, the advantage will not be very big.
Also involve new statements such as statement of cash flow.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tang Chao is a good teacher as he is willing to answer any questions after class. His powerpoint is clean and tidy. He also illustrates various concepts clearly such that every student can understand.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pretty good grading. As the course uses absolute grading, you will not need to afraid about some students pulling the mean/SD very high.
However, as almost every student can get full mark in their homework and participation, the grade depends very heavily on your performance on midterm and final exams.
The midterm will be quite easy, so make sure you can get as many marks as you can in the midterm.
For me, I get 87/100 and the mean is 80.(Remember to provide clear steps otherwise you will receive 0 marks even your answer is correct!)
The final is extremely difficult, as what you may expect from other comments, the questions are completely different from what you will see in the textbook/homework. It is very important to fully understand all concepts and use them wisely.
The highest score in the final is 83.5/100.
As i get 83.5 in the final, I finally get an A+.
Therefore, I would say it is not a difiicult course if you pay effort in it.
reviews.comment_workload:
Pretty small workload. There are 5 problem sets in total. Each problem set has 2 weeks of time for you to finish, with unlimited attempts provided. There are also 5 practice quizzes which are all MCs. Each chapter has extra questions provided but it is optional.
Also, there will be a zoom poll at the beginning of the first class in the week, only MCs and prticipation will receive full credit.

reviews.author: zmalqp
reviews.comment_content:
Basic accounting contents.
Course for the students who are first time in accounting.
You must buy online textbook and exercise questions will be helpful for your exam preparation.
reviews.comment_teaching: Even though some students said his class is boring as he teaches step by step, I really liked it as I was completely new to accounting study. If you ask for help, he is very willing to help you out.
reviews.comment_grading: Assignments and midterm were OK. Some assignments questions are made to make students hard to solve. However, you will make it if you review the course materials and think logically. Midterm was relatively easy compared to the final exam. Final was But don't worry too much. If you study hard and hard, you will get a satisfactory grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Acceptable. Only 7 assignments throughout the semester.

reviews.author: Timmy Chung
reviews.title: intensive but fair grading
reviews.comment_content: It is an introduction to accounting. I didn't study accounting in high school but can still catch up after some effort.
reviews.comment_teaching: This course is in blended learning mode. Professor Chen will put teaching videos on canvas and you need to watch them on your own time. She will teach some common errors and Q&A in class (optional to attend). The teaching videos are very clear.
reviews.comment_grading:
Interactions and discussions  3%
In-class group exercises (10 sessions)  22%
In-class quizzes (10 quizzes) 30%
Homework assignments (10 assignments)  20%
Final exam 25%

75% of the mark can be obtained with no big difficulty. I got around 73. The in-class quizzes are mc and some calculations (although one of the quiz is quite difficult).

The final exam is another story.  The questions are challenging and involve a lot of calculations. The mark for the final is not released in order to avoid panic according to the professor. I thought I screwed up the final but I got A+ at the end. So I guess as long as you know some questions you are fine.
reviews.comment_workload: You need to watch all the teaching videos at your own time. There are exercises for each chapter, which needs roughly an hour to finish. The most chur part is the extremely frequent quizzes. There are nearly quizzes every week. If you want a good grade, you need to revise the content every week and make sure you catch up with the progress.

reviews.comment_teaching: He is a very passionate person in teaching accounting because he is willing to stay behind to answer our questions and prepares so well in teaching. Moreover, he prepares a lot of notes and extra exercises on canvas for us to practice and revise, like the study guide for midterm and final. Although his lectures is boring, he can deliver the materials in a clear way with detailed explanation so even with no accounting background can understand the content easily. reviews.comment_grading:

Homework: 25%( 5 problem sets with unlimited attempts, so it is easy to get full marks in it, me: 25/25)
Midterm: 30%(me: 91/100)
Final: 40%(me: 46.5/100, mean:46.5)
For the midterm, it is very easy so everyone can get a high mark and someone even got 100 in the midterm. So the most important thing is the final which he makes it very difficult and I just meet the mean. So final grade: B
I think the grading is reasonable as I only got mean on the final.

The mean is way too high (at least 90%) for homework and midterms. If you make one single mistake you will fall below mean.

Study it before he teaches is what I highly recommend.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is a famous lecturer(?). Lots of students from different lectures and tutor come and "sit" his lessons.
He gives examples and patiently answer questions.
(But if you are too shy to ask questions or you have no idea on what is he talking about, it is no use. lmao.)

When the lesson have in-class practice, after he goes through the ppt he will ask if any questions AND THEN he will give u the practice and you need hand-in before he leaves.
You could work as teams or individuals to complete the tasks.
reviews.comment_grading:
I do not know if it is fair enough.
I got C. But maybe its my own problem.
I regret not revise after-class and so my confusion sky-rocketed after a week of teaching.

His exams are quite difficult and time-consuming. A lot of calculation is needed and most of the students could not finish the exams in time.

It was like hell. But that is how HKUST stereotype itself. This course is just a reflection of HKUST. Content is certainly useful but grading is trash. Your effort put is not equal to your grading. (DON'T EVEN DREAM)
reviews.comment_workload:
~IN-class practices (frequently)
~Mid-term
~Final
(No case-study)

U can choose to attend the lessons only when there is in-class practice if you prefer self-learning than lectures-teaching.

You better clear concepts after-class/before the next accounting lesson. If not, you will be more and more confuse.

reviews.author: why am I here
reviews.title: Dennis was great
reviews.comment_content: Most of the syllabus is same as the Dse exam. If you have studied BAFS before, you can easily catch up with the class since most of the stuff are same. Howecer, some people may think it’s so boring but I think it’s quite interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dennis was definitely a nice lecturer. He put many examples in his lessons in order to let us understand those accounting concept. And I think he doesn’t mind to answer our questions since he was always nice to all of the students in class. He would mention the Chinese name of some accounting concept as well. I think he is very good lecturer.
reviews.comment_grading: It’s hard to tell since this year was very different from the others. Mid term was changed to an assignment and also a inclass assignment. Final exam has changed into a full MC. So it’s quite hard to tell but I only got a B+. I am a little bit disappointed.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is quite low since he didn’t take attendance. Normally, there isn’t any assignment but due to the cancellation of the mid term, he added an assignment and the assignment was a little bit tricky but I think it’s not that hard.

reviews.author: .mön.
reviews.title: Friendly professor
reviews.comment_content:
Mostly DSE-level Accounting concepts, very easy to master
will get to study company financial statements and learn about ratios, then use them to analyze a company's financial health
reviews.comment_teaching:
Good enunciation and provide lots of tips and guidance on midterms and finals
Sidd would always upload the solutions (T-Accounts, BalanceSheet, IncomeState, Ratios, and CashFlowState) to the respective folders on Canvas
reviews.comment_grading:
midterms are easy to manage, most people scored full marks in mt1
for mt2:
Average 92.5
Median 94.0
SD 6.8

final questions are a lot harder and definitely much less straight-forward

final grade:               
A range 22%
B range 39%
C range 38%
D 1%
reviews.comment_workload:
basically no workload
only 2 easy assignments and exams
cheat sheets are allowed in midterms and exams

reviews.author: annaaa
reviews.comment_content:
DSE content
and some easy topics(if you have learnt accounting before), like
statement of cashflows
shares and bonds
inventory counting
reviews.comment_teaching:
very good with many explanation
some classmates didn't learn accounting before could understand what he taught
He gives extra exercises( but u don't have to do them)
sometimes he is very cute
reviews.comment_grading:
assignment基本上你有做就ok
2個midterm 個mean基本上都幾高
因為個course內容幾簡單下
reviews.comment_workload:
there is assignment for each topic
The assignment isn't difficult.
You just have to look through the examples in the lecture notes, and the follow the steps.
so it is quite easy if you have attended the lessons.

reviews.author: Avenger
reviews.comment_content: The amount of content is acceptable.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor was very nice. She had given quite a lot of examples in the lesson time, and she is not a very strict teacher. She was also willing to answer people's questions after lesson time.
reviews.comment_grading: The mean was high in quizzes and exams. And it turns out quite hard to get a really high grade. And the difficulty in quizzes and exams was quite high.
reviews.comment_workload: There is not much workload I would say. Most of the homework was provided with solutions so it would be easy to handle.

reviews.author: L7E2O9
reviews.title: good professor but not too good grade
reviews.comment_content: basics of accounting concepts. For those who had taken BAFS as their electives, this class should not be hard unless you never study/ attend his class. However, there are some extended knowledge such as statement of cash flows, LIFO, FIFO method so it is a must to attend his lessons.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The only business course that i never fell asleep. I love his teaching style. He is willing to answer questions and provide answers in a very detailed way.

However, he set class exercise so damned hard, people who have studied BAFS before do not have advantages
reviews.comment_grading:
homework assignment: 50/60 (mean: 45)
Class exercise (midterm): 45/80 (mean: 51, median: 52)
Final: unknown

Grade: B
I think my final was higher than mean so it pulled me up from C range to B.
reviews.comment_workload:
1 classwork per week(6% in total)
1 homework assignment (12%)
1 class exercise (mid-term)(30%)
final exam consists of 60 MCQs (according to the on9 online exam policy)(50%)

reviews.author: 想當年
reviews.title: 【special semester because of HK situation】無BAFS底，推介；有BAFS底，不推介。
reviews.comment_content:
Content 其實是ok 的，但是 assessment policy 就有改善空間。
midterm2 前多數BAFS野﹐係多左cash flow statement。midterm2 後係新野。
reviews.comment_teaching:
新professor。坦白講，教係ok的，覆email快，每次都提早落堂，落堂後都認真答同學問題。

又係果句，assessment policy有改善空間:
2 個 midterm 都有超過 80% 係改了少少 example transactions ，又比你帶5張cheatsheet，所以 mean 唔高至奇，有BAFS底無乜着數。
到online final，比48小時做，是難的。

reviews.comment_workload: workload 算輕，得2份assignment ，唔會好花時間。

reviews.author: GPA 2.7小隊
reviews.title: Best professors in accounting.
reviews.comment_content: Fair content. Simple accounting
reviews.comment_teaching: Dennis should be the best teacher in acct 2010. He has a very strong presentation skills and English. I think he will be able to get an A if he  is a student in Lang1002s @@. Professor like using funny examples to explain concept. If you ask him questions privately , he will be able to solve your problems within 1 minute.
reviews.comment_grading:
Since he teaches really well. It attracts many good and elite students to study his course , especially for those who to major in accounting. It makes the cut off so high. In this course , you have to battle with students who are better than those students in other acct professors' course.

Also , it is heard that Dennis will give few A grade to his students.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light.
Attend 6 classwork get 6 %.
Only 1 assignment bearing 12%.
Only 1 mid term bearing 15 %
Final bearing 67%--> All MC.

reviews.author: ghali
reviews.comment_content:
Investing and Financing Decisions and the Accounting System
Operating Decisions and the Accounting System
Adjustments, Financial Statements, and the Quality of Earnings
Sales Revenue, Receivables, and Cash
Cost of goods sold and inventory
Property, plant, and equipment
Reporting liabilities & bonds
Reporting and Interpreting Stockholders’ Equity
Statement of cash flows
reviews.comment_teaching:
Pretty good professor, clear, and willing to adapt some aspects of the teaching methods depending on students' feedback.
Has good teaching methods.
reviews.comment_grading: First midterm mean 85%
reviews.comment_workload: A few homework assignments. Most of the workload is to prepare for exams adequately.

reviews.author: whyee
reviews.comment_content:
50% stuff is about secondary school's content.
Easy if you have studied BAFs before.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Not bad. Nice tutor.
Maybe a bit difficult for those who did not study BAFs before.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grading
The following will account to your final grade
Attendance
2 Quizes
Homework (you can score full mark as long as you do it completely and hand it in on time)
Midterm
Final
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is acceptable.
Homework is required after finishing each chapter but there are only 4-6 questions for each assignment and more than adequate time is given for you to finish the job.

reviews.author: horo
reviews.title: You are an ape if you took BAFS in DSE but fail to get an A
reviews.comment_content: Basic double entry, then statements, cash flows, accounting principles. 60-70% belongs to BAFS coursework. I guess other reviews have already talked quite a lot about the content and those can be easily obtained from all sort of sources. Btw, it appeared that Chao Tang's content is a bit shallower than the others, but I am not so sure about that.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very understandable for idiots, willingly answer questions, but I often    
doubt his answers. If you are a keen learner who always insists to understand something thoroughly, go with other professors. But I still recommend anyone despite how good or bad you are to attend the lessons, it helps you to be acknowledged what's going on and greatly saves your time to learn yourself
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grading, most of us scored above 80, so you may imagine the curve. For the first stupid mid-term the mean was like 87 or 88. It is literally a test of mental handicap, your dying grandma would have scored 90. The final exam though is quite challenging, I still vividly remember how frustrating people were when they were leaving the exam venue. I already have a strong accounting background and I still found it challenging, at least, compared with the previous two TSA level mid-terms. Some basically left several pages blank. I would say it is too harsh for those who didn't have the training in past paper or DSE exam.

I got 97% in the final exam, forgot my score in homework and mid-term. 97-98% overall and nailed my A+. The A+ cutoff was around 95-96%
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was light. Was like 8 homework each with just a few questions. Need not to spend so much time on revision. Once you mastered the concept, you will feel so comfortable in dealing with the whole coursework. Do practice questions to find out what you omit and overlook, be confident but also humble especially when it comes to the trivial parts. He said we should spend 10 hours a week if we expect an A-range, then again, if you really did so, go back to the zoo

reviews.author: Sonia R
reviews.comment_content: It's introductory accounting so I can't imagine how interesting it can possibly get.
reviews.comment_teaching: Xinlei was a brand new teacher when I took this course. She mostly read off of the slides. She told students it was okay not to attend class but then penalized those who didn't attend in the final grade.
reviews.comment_grading: I thought Xinlei's grading was incredibly unfair. Moreover, the final exam was NOTHING like the midterm or any of the content she taught in class. Nor was it anything I assume an introductory accounting class exam should be like.
reviews.comment_workload: fine

reviews.author: Hahahahahahahaa
reviews.comment_content:
2 quizzes + one final + class participation  (25, 25, 40, 10)

The quizzes were not too difficult, but I screwed up the second one...The final was so hard. You can get the participation mark by answering his questions.

Attendance doesn't count
reviews.comment_teaching:
His voice was too soft, you would just fall asleep. But he's a nice guy, and would spend time to answer your question if you ask him privately.

The powerpoint he use was simply a short summary of the book. Prefer reading the book.
reviews.comment_grading: I think it's ok. Just make sure you did well in the quizzes. Trust me, the exam is really tough.
reviews.comment_workload: Not heavy at all. Just two quizzes and the exam. You need to score nearly full in the two quizzes to compensate for your final. The final exam would be extremely hard, even NDS doesn't know how to do.

reviews.author: ustjj
reviews.comment_content:
It's mainly DSE BAFS syllabus, but it's still easy even for people like me who haven't studied BAFS in secondary school.

Yet, you may get stuck in some part if you haven't fully understand the previous parts, so make sure you keep up with the learning progress, or it will be a vicious cycle.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is very enthusiastic in teaching. Some people may think he teaches too fast, but you can actually ask him to slow down a bit or ask him questions after lessons, and he is very willing to answer you.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is good.
Attendance: 6%
Homework: 14%
Two midterms: each 15%
Final: 50%
Midterms are easy, but the final is much more challenging and it counts a lot, so please prepare well for that.
You can easily get full mark in attendance and hw as you can miss at most two attendance and one hw.

I got full mark in hw and attendance, 96/100 in both midterms and 94/100 in final, finally got an A+

Heard people got mean and got an B, so the grading is at least satisfactory, if not very good.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very low workload.
About one hw per chapter, but it's easy and for later chapters he even gave you do solution before the deadline. But I recommend you to do it by yourself as a practice.

reviews.author: Justin S
reviews.comment_content: Content is challenging but enjoyable if you are decent with numbers.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is acceptable and slides are helpful for understanding.
reviews.comment_grading: The grades are fair for an introductory course, but sufficient studying must be done outside of class. If students do more than what is assigned, they can get an A.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is fair given the nature of the course, but studying must be done outside of the class in order to achieve a decent understanding of the material. It can be easy to excel if you put in more work than what is just assigned.

reviews.author: T.Ting
reviews.title: it's quite hard for beginners
reviews.comment_content:
only some of the DSE syllabus are covered. You also have to learn statement of cash flow, bonds, issuing at par/ premium/ discount which is something new.  More practice will be fine.

(I got level 4 in DSE BAFS)
reviews.comment_teaching:
His teaching is indeed very good! The atmosphere is nice.
he talked detailedly and will repeat the difficult part again and again.

He is open to all questions. He explains so many times and he is very patient.
reviews.comment_grading:
There're two mid terms and a Final.
Attendance will be taken in random lectures.
I got ~1sd above in both of the mid-terms.
And ~0.5sd above in the final.

The exam is hard af and i suggest you to review all given exercise plus the extra classwork (if any). The exam format will be out of your imagination

Final Grade:B
reviews.comment_workload:
Since there is no tutorials for this course, there will be only two lectures which lasts 100 mins each. Twice a week. Homework is assigned every (other) week. <- it depends

Homework is graded based on effort so almost everyone got full points for their HW.

reviews.author: flora yau
reviews.comment_content: the content is fair to students who did not study BAFS before. At first, it is a bit confusing but when you regularly do revisions after lessons. it would be easy
reviews.comment_teaching: Tang is a passionate teacher but his pace is a bit fast. you will easily miss some content if you did not pay attention for seconds. but he is willing to listen to students' advises and adjust to it. just feel free to ask him if you have any questions.
reviews.comment_grading: easy to get A range. The mean is high as the 2 mid-term and exams are not too difficult. the final is a bit challenging but most of the questions are something that we can handle.
reviews.comment_workload: light. have homework each week which to be submitted to  canvas. accuracy of the hw ans is not important, he just rate your hw by yr effort. easy hws which can be finish within 1 hr. 2 mid-term and 1 final

reviews.author: Tsoi KM
reviews.comment_content:
Basic accounting concept
-bad debts
- T-account
-financial statements
-inventory control
-statement of cash flow
etc.
Should be easy for those who learnt bafs before
reviews.comment_teaching: A nice and patient teacher. Put efforts in teaching students. he asked for comments from us about his teaching. 超有心教書. he prepared extra learning exercises for us. good teacher.
reviews.comment_grading:
grading is soso
2 midterms (late sept and early nov)
1 final
1st midterm: about mean
2nd midterm: a bit higher than mean
final: about 1 sd higher than mean
full attendance
final grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload:
quite high at the first few weeks, 1 homework per week.
but later he send out hw with ans.
he said he will randomly pick 5 days to record attendance, but only 3 will be graded, so that means u can miss 2.
workload is soso

reviews.author: za_01
reviews.comment_teaching: He explains well, and will answer your questions if you ask him, but you have to be proactive. He teaches very fast, so you need to do extra work after class to keep up with the pace.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 8 hws and you have a week to finish each one. The assignments are ok since they are marked "based on your effort". But you might need to spend quite a lot of time doing extra practice questions the professor gives or from the book to really understand what he teaches in class.

reviews.author: Shi KaiLi
reviews.title: ACCT 2010
reviews.comment_content:
the content is kind of useful for the later study of the major(if you are the student in the school of business).
it is also interesting I think.
reviews.comment_teaching: gerry is actually not that good at teaching, all the notes are  copy from the book and it is not easy to follow and understand the key points. I spent a lot of time studying by myself after class.
reviews.comment_grading:
there are two quiz (each with 30 MC)
mid-term and final( each with 4 essay question)
attendance also counts
you can get a good grade if study hard
it is not that easy for mainland student because they have never learnt about it before.
reviews.comment_workload:
only 5 assignment and four exams
but you need to spend a lot of time after class for better grade

reviews.author: Bobo Wong
reviews.comment_content: It somehow similar with DSE syallbus but if you didn't study before, it might be hard for you.
reviews.comment_teaching: He teaches too fast. It is hard to catch up if you didn't study before hand and he likes to ask questions a lot.
reviews.comment_grading: If you didnt study acct in secondary school, it is hard to get good grades
reviews.comment_workload: Not really big workload.There is midterm, final and some in-class quizzes. Make sure you go for the quizzes then it will be fine. There is no assignment except some self-study one.

reviews.author: 秋名山深一
reviews.title: Ignore This
reviews.comment_content: The course provides us first insight towards Accounting stuff. If you are a new guy towards accounting, perhaps you'd better buy a textbook for your reference to build your concept.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is fine, fluctuated teaching speed. But if you have anything don't understand COMPLETELY, don't hesitate to find Prof CHEN, she is quite nice to clear your misconceptions. Be Active!
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is good and fair generally. What impressed me most is the "cheat sheet" allowance. For Quizzes and tests, and even final exams, cheat sheets were allowed.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite light workload, only some easy group-homework

reviews.author: wongalven
reviews.title: NO GOOD
reviews.comment_content:
hardest among all instructors
he taught more than other that students studied DSE BAFS have no significant advantage.
test all topics in the final examination
reviews.comment_teaching:
just simply read the powerpoint, with less further eaboration
quite boring
which makes students do not like accounting not to mention choosing it as a major
reviews.comment_grading:
poor grade
the syllabus is board and difficult which is quite hard to have a good grade
not much people can obtain an A range not to mention A+
reviews.comment_workload:
heavy workload
few quizzes mid terms final
and plenty assignments practice and in class quizzes

reviews.author: knowsnothing
reviews.title: Nice and Clear lectures, good grade
reviews.comment_content: The content is rather straight-forward. It is a pre-reg course for year 1 business students. You don't have to worry about not having studied BAFS before as the professor will explain the concepts at a slow pace.
reviews.comment_teaching: the slides cover only a small part of the textbook materials. Better read the textbook before proceeding to the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
nice grade.
studied for 2 nights and did not pay much attention to the slides. I read the textbook and finished the suggested problem sets of each chapter.
participation: full ( everyone was supposed to have it)
mid-term: above 1 sd
mid-term 2: above 1.5 sd
final: above 1 sd
Grade:A
reviews.comment_workload:
very light.
the assignments' solutions are given in lectures.
all u need to do is to input the answers into canvas.
good luck year 1 mates

reviews.author: 樂訓
reviews.comment_content: 入門acct 追番中學冇讀bafs黎講幾有用
reviews.comment_teaching: 教得清楚 上堂氣氛都好好  答問題會記低名可能加attendance分掛
reviews.comment_grading:
有一個mid term 一個final exam
分別30% 同40%
有幾個quiz 同exercise 同自己grp人做
計分會撇除最低分一次
btw 組員自己搵既
reviews.comment_workload:
喺year1 sem1黎講 作為冇讀過BAFS既人 覺得算最大workload一科 cos好多新嘢
但讀過BA應該就執豆咁執

reviews.author: Leung Ka Wai
reviews.comment_content:
Most of the content are covered by the BAFS in HKDSE. So if you have taken BAFS before, this course is quite for you.

One thing has to be noted is that , the content is in US GAAP instead of IFRS (Internation Financial Reporting Standards). So beware of that there are some differences in formats and concept.

Quiz 1 10%
Quiz 2 10%
In-class exercise 24%
Participation mark 6%
Final Exam 60%
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor teaches quite well. Lots of example.
2 questions have to be answered for class participation marks.
You are free to ask her question. Prof. Chen is nice!
reviews.comment_grading:
Good Grading!

I got
Quiz 1 10/10
Quiz 2 9.8/10
In-class exercise 24/24
Participation mark 6/6
Final Exam ~43/60 (above mean 1.25 s.d.)

Overall A

The 2 quizzes are easy so the mean are high. For the final exam, the mean is about 50% as it is extremely difficult.
The grading is satisfying for me.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload.
Only some in-class exercise have to be done at the end of a chapter.
Don't forget to hand in every in-class exercise as all of them are counted in.

reviews.author: 鐫仔
reviews.title: great
reviews.comment_content: great subject i like it coz i want to enter math and econ.
reviews.comment_teaching: well done, he is a nice guy, he is willing to teach me many things. i like him because i really like him. there is no reason that why i like one person. yes in one word, he is surely a nice guy who i am facinating.
reviews.comment_grading: it is fair becaues i did little things, you know that only little things can get such a good grade that is because he like me too.
reviews.comment_workload: not many things do

reviews.author: zhang
reviews.comment_content: just basic accounting introduction, pretty much including every aspect of accounting from balance sheet to shock, bonds etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: she is very nice and responsible, and make things very clear. if you post some question on canvas, she will answer them in a very short time.
reviews.comment_grading: it is fair but not really great. i think most people got a .
reviews.comment_workload: has three quiz so it is a little bit bough, but the quiz is simple.if you listen carefully and do the quiz with patience,since there is some very detailed thing she test you.

reviews.author: ustlol
reviews.comment_content:
It would be quite challenging for students haven't studied accounting before. (One chapter for two lectures)
Mid terms are quite easy but final is difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching: A nice teacher. She is willing to explain once again if you don't understand. You can ask her during the lecture/after the class/on canvas.
reviews.comment_grading: Some people who are below mean can still get a B+. You can get a A if you are above one SD.
reviews.comment_workload:
In class exercise
Quiz on canvas(not graded)
U can gain extra marks for cleaning the whiteboard or answering easy questions.

reviews.author: xhuangat

reviews.author: Jammy
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite simple. The professor discusses a lot about different terminologies in the course as well as relativly simple numericals. He also shows a lot of video clips and discusses a lot of examples to ensure that the students clearly understand the concepts.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is a very kind professor and is willing to answer an queries one has. He ensures that the students make most out of the 3 hours and are not bored in the class. He is very entertaining in the class and very concise while explaining the content. However, he does go quite slow and is not able to finish the topics completely as planned. As a result, the amount of the content being tested reduces.
reviews.comment_grading: He is quite slow in terms of the grading. He is not a very quick checker but he checks the quizzes and test adequately. In terms of the overall course grade, one has to wait a long time before receiving it.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload for the course is not very high. There are two tests, couple of pop-quizzes in the class therefore the students need to fully understand the content of the course. The presentation and final Market Plan can be quite challenging with the limited time since it is in the summer but it is still doable. There is an additional Observation Research which is relatively simple and does not take a lot of one's time.

reviews.author: Christiana

reviews.comment_workload: 1 group project, 1 mid term and final exam respectively, 5 group exercise and 3 quizzes. No too much workload. You can ask your friends to go in a same group with you.

reviews.author: Davis Chow
reviews.title: Good Course
reviews.comment_content: I recently completed a course in accounting and I must say it was an excellent learning experience. The course covered a wide range of topics from basic principles to more advanced techniques, which allowed me to develop a strong understanding of accounting concepts. The professor was knowledgeable and engaging, making the lectures informative and enjoyable.
reviews.comment_teaching: One aspect of the course that I particularly appreciated was the emphasis on practical application. The assignments and group projects allowed me to apply what I had learned in class to real-world scenarios. Additionally, the training on accounting software such as QuickBooks and Excel was extremely valuable and has already proven useful in my current job.
reviews.comment_grading: The Grading is great. I got two full marks in the mid term and a full mark in the exam so I got a A+. No attendance~
reviews.comment_workload: Overall, I highly recommend this accounting course to anyone interested in the field. The workload was challenging but manageable, and the knowledge gained was well worth the effort. I feel confident in my ability to apply what I have learned in the classroom to my career and look forward to continuing to build on this foundation."

This makes me very frustrated and are OPed by most BAFS students, which leads to a poor comment after all.

However, the course design is excellent, at least not boring compared to other subject. Becuz there are a lot of content that will raise your interest in not just the ACCT field, but also some contents related to Finance, which is useful, from my point of view.

Btw, Cash flow statement is the most challenging topic afterall, and will determine whether u get B+ or an A-range
reviews.comment_teaching: Excellent teaching, with a little bit Hong Kong accent, but at least better than a lot of professors. Although sometimes he claims that he worked in an Ibank to do M&A before, he seldom talked what he do, which will be an interesting thing to raise student's attention in lectures. He goes through lecture contents in a moderate and acceptable speed, sometimes explaining tricky concepts very in detail, which is good for non-BAFS student like me. Patrick  is definitely an excellent and warm-hearted professor that is willing to answer questions and teach students after lessons (not just ran away immediately), but the final exam paper could be more difficult after all.
reviews.comment_grading:

reviews.comment_workload: Easy lah, intro course, easy assignments, it shouldn't be too big of an issue if you know what you are doing, and be patience in doing homework haha. reviews.author: Giancarlo G.
reviews.title: Great Prof, Moderate Difficulty
reviews.comment_content:
- 12 Chapters of highly relevant and useful accounting concepts that go over a lot about what it means to run a business and how to keep track of your business activities
- We used Financial Accounting - Libby, Libby, Hodge 9th Edition

Rough breakdown :
Chapter 1 : Introduction
Chapter 2 : Fundamentals of accounting
Chapter 3 : Accounting systems and how to write basic journal entries
Chapter 4 : Adjusting entries, Balance Sheet, Income Statement
(we skipped chapter 5)
Chapter 6 : Accounts Receivables, Bad debts, Allowance for doubtful accounts (we skipped the second half of the chapter)
Chapter 7 : Inventory, FIFO, LIFO (we skipped the latter part of the chapter)
Chapter 8 : Property, Plant, Equipment (we skipped a lot of the content in this chapter)
Chapter 9 : Liabilities (we mostly skimmed this chapter, and focused on the present value of money)
Chapter 10 : Bonds and Accounting for bonds purchased at premium and at discount
Chapter 11 : Stockholders' Equity
Chapter 12 : Statement of Cash Flows
Chapter 13 : Analyzing financial statements (this was a bonus chapter that he discussed for fun; not tested)
reviews.comment_teaching:
- Fun, engaging, and very detailed teaching
- The professor is very willing to answer questions in class and is quite helpful as well, as he is willing to conduct additional study sessions and consultation sessions after the midterms and before the finals
- He provides very detailed study guides which were very useful for the midterms, but not so much for the finals which was a bit of a surprise at the end

- Unfortunately, it is not very easy to contact the professor outside class; he does not always respond to emails and has said in his course outline that he will not answer questions asked via email :/
- Also, the canvas discussion boards are empty
- The teaching pace is quite fast too; might be a bit challenging if you are not a fast learner or if you are sleepy during class (like me)
reviews.comment_grading:
I was worried that my grades would not be so ideal due to the steep curve, but actually, it is possible to score A range even when you make several mistakes in the midterms and the finals

2 Midterms (15% each)
- Not too difficult, imo, just be careful when reading the question and do the journal entries carefully (e.g. remember to write the date)

1 Final (50%)
- Rather challenging
- some multiple choice questions asked about things mentioned briefly only
- the last part asks several questions based on tons of T accounts - have a good eye for dates and practice working backwards

Attendance and Classroom performance (6%)
- he likes checking attendance using in-class quizzes, so try and attend the lectures

Assignments (14%)
- quite easy to get high marks here, especially since he grades assignments by effort, not accuracy
reviews.comment_workload:
Roughly one assignment per chapter, not too difficult; they serve as good practice too

2 Midterms
1 Final

I did not spend much time on this course because my other courses ate up so much of my time; still managed to do well though

reviews.author: Hohoho_777
reviews.title: Great professor
reviews.comment_content: As a student with no BAFS background, this course is not too difficult to handle, this course let students like me know more about accounting. The course focuses on fundamental accounting concepts and principles.
reviews.comment_teaching: His pace is quite fast but he is a passionate teacher and willing to listen to students’ opinion. He also encouraged us a lot in the lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
I did well in the two mid-terms but just got the mean score in the final since the final was quite challenging for me.

reviews.author: kingofff
reviews.comment_content:
The course basically covers basic accounting knowledge, including the preparation of financial statements for limited companies, journal entries for different transactions, financial ratios and etc. For those who have accounting backgrounds, this course'll be easy, but for the beginner, it may be a disaster.
BUT AS LONG AS YOU WORK HARD, THAT'LL BE FINE.
reviews.comment_teaching: He has the heart to teach. Willing to answer questions raised by students. He'll also prepare some study guides for us. The study guide highlights the key parts in every chapter. Sometimes, he is humorous. hahaha Overall speaking, he is a very good teacher.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading scheme:
Homework 14%
(7 out of 8 homework is graded. There will be homework for every chapter)

Attendance  6%
(He'll take attendance for 5 lessons randomly by asking us to fill in the Google Form OR take the in-class quiz)

Midterm 1  15%
(The 1st midterm is easy)

Midterm 2  15%
( The difficulty is same as the 1st midterm)

Final Exam  50%
(The exam is cumulative. It is challenging so make sure to work harder for this heaviest-weighted component)
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fair.  8 homework, 2 midterms and 1 final exam.

reviews.comment_content: Teach basic accounting knowledge, like making journal entries, financial statements, calculating financial ratios and accounting principles. Topics also include accruals and prepayments, bad debts, inventory calculation, depreciation of assets, and etc... Most content is pretty to easy to me, coz I have studied accounting before. But the last few chapters are quite challenging.

Step by step, from basic definitions to practical solutions, you will find it not as hard as you think to learn as long as you take it seriously.

reviews.comment_content: Some basic knowledge of accounting; compulsory course for all year-1 SBM students. He also puts some extra practice on canvas to help you learn better( which myself find quite helpful). He is also very patient and ready to help, so if you meet with any trouble on accounting or didn't do well in exams, you can always appoint with him and talk about your problems.

reviews.comment_workload:
Workload actually differs from individuals. For me, it's pretty hard. As a student who hasn't studied accounting before, I just find 30-40% of my study time is on accounting. I go through every materials in hand( notes, practice, hw, textbook etc) and pay 100% attention in class. Of course efforts will pay off. My performance in exams is quite satisfactory.
There're 8 assignments after class. Usually you have 1 week left to finish it. Each assignment will include 3-4 questions and I think it's okay. Besides, 2 midterms, 1 final, and some extra practice( which is not compulsory). Again, you can fool around with these assignments and quizzes, but if you aim high, you should devote your time to this course. I have to say this is my favourite course during this sem cause I find out I really learnt something useful and interesting in class, and this is what matters most.

reviews.author: :-D
reviews.title: dou ok ge
reviews.comment_content: many
reviews.comment_teaching:
新professor, 感覺上幾好人,但係佢好唔鐘意人bang道門話會認住你扣parti, 同埋話你sd email問問題會無視你要你用discussion forum問

parti易拎到喊, 要你答/問問題拎卡, midterm前max拎3張卡,midterm後max拎3張, midterm前後加埋拎4張parti就full mark

in class group exercise有交就有分唔理你岩唔岩, sem頭既時候佢幫你分組5人一組做一份, 之後sem中叫全班填feedback比人鬧完多freerider之後就改做1-5人既exercise,可以自己分組/你鍾意既話可以solo, 基本上1課1次exercise(大約每2堂就有1次)

midterm有T/F, MC, Short question, Long question同bouns 5 part。T/F同MC極考concept, short同long question有d似佢上堂派既exercise/midterm sample paper, bouns都係mc黎, 話就話bouns, 其實只係由mc part既3分1條變5分1條mc, 根本唔係bouns。因為份卷真係好考concept,所以mean都幾低(mean=median=94,sd ~15, full mark 130)

final exam極難, cumulative之外仲要考d 好practical既大公司financial statements(唔係你平時學果d, 有好多好特別既account會教, 其他professor/dse都唔會教), 仲要lecture notes係無提過要你上堂先會識。4月尾既時候其中一堂上堂會派surprise quiz, 一定要拎勁重要唔會放上lmes, 雖然無答案只會上堂同你是但講下點做, 但係final會出番一樣既題目出黎, e份野一定要拎到同要識哂點做。final無出分不過mean應該仲低過midterm, full mark 250

ACCT2010係acct elementary course, 因為有讀過同無讀過都係reg e個course, 所以中學有讀過bafs係e個course輕鬆刷grade, concept清既話reg Chen Szu Fan幾好, grade好似唔錯。 但係最重要一定要上足堂, parti, in class exercise盡量要full mark同埋surprise quiz一定要拎

reviews.comment_teaching: Kathy讲课语言思路清晰，容易听懂。唯一比较刁钻的地方就是经常会点名，所以如果是Kathy的班不要随便翘课。
reviews.comment_grading: 不大记得了，三次mini exam好像各占百分之20左右，还有百分之十几是课堂出勤、课堂参与和case study。剩下的部分都是期末考。
reviews.comment_workload: 和其他的堂相比，workload确实比较大。一学期一共有三次mini exam，加上期末一共四次考试，而且还需要做一个Case Study。不过至少没有需要交的作业，最多就是in-class assignment，下课收，而且教授通常会带着大家作一部分，甚至先对下答案才收。

reviews.comment_content: about 4 financial statements
reviews.comment_teaching:
quite nice and passionate about teaching
illustrate many examples that help you understand
open to questions and very patient to answer
reviews.comment_grading:
grading is good as long as you pay effort in every assignment(try to get full marks) and perform well in both midterm and final
I think the grading is quite lenient at last I got a B

reviews.author: SmallShortGuy
reviews.comment_content: Most parts are covered by the DSE BAFS syllabus, but there is still some not covered e.g. cash flow statement.  The content is simple compared to sessions of other instructors.
reviews.comment_teaching: His tone may be a bit boring but in general he teaches quite clearly.  He can explain things well.  However sometimes he keeps using examples which involve topics to be taught and he can only answer 'We will mention that later' when students raise the question.  I have studied BAFS so it is easy to catch up but there are also some friends who didn't study BAFS who still manage this course very well.  Slides and exercise are clear and provided on Canvas.  Good in general.
reviews.comment_grading:

Midterm2 15%

for me:
full mark for homework and attendance

Only a few assignments.  You can get full mark if you submit them anyway.  
There are quotas for being absent.  Not every attendance has to be taken in order to get full mark in attendance.  Sometimes pop-quiz is provided but just for attendance record use.

reviews.author: Daaaniel
reviews.comment_content:
The course provides an introduction to the financial accounting. Topics such as the 4 financial statements, bond pricing, bad debts are covered.
Attendence is taken randomly so better pay attention.
reviews.comment_teaching: The pace can be quite fast but most content was explained clearly. He also covered many details student needed to pay attention to. Moreover, a lot of time was spent on practice questions or exercises so you will know how to tackle the problems as long as you pay attention.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading seems pretty fair
Homework 14%
Classroom performance 6%
Midterm 1 15%
Midterm 2 15%
Final exam 50%

I got an A after getting roughly 90% for the 2 midterms and the final.
reviews.comment_workload:
There are 8 homeworks which can be a bit heavy. However, it seems that as long as you submit something, you will get points. I still suggest doing them though.
However, with 2 midterms the workload can be a bit heavy.

reviews.author: IY
reviews.title: Unexpectedly good professor
reviews.comment_content: Typical introduction to financial accounting course. If you have taken BAFS (accounting module) in DSE, you will have a great advantage since many of the topics are introduced in the DSE such as bad debts, prepayments and accruals. Of course the accounting treatments are slightly different but if you have a solid foundation then it is absolutely easy to understand. New topics can also be expected such as the treatments of bonds and cash flows statements. If you have not taken any accounting courses before, it is better for you to read through the textbook to understand more.
reviews.comment_teaching: I registered this lecture only because this session had the shortest waiting list but professor TANG Chao is unexpectedly good. Although it seems that he is not a local professor nor a native English speaker, his English accent is clear and easy to understand. His teaching pace is simply easy to catch up with and he provides examples as well. He explains clearly and will remind you of the main points and common mistakes made by students so as long as you pay attention in class, you will be fine. He will explain again if he thinks a number of students do not understand. Also, he is willing to answer students' questions. In fact, quite many students ask questions in class and he explains one by one patiently. Good choice if you are considering which session to register.
reviews.comment_grading: I think the grading is just as usual. If you pay effort and show you understand the topics well, you will do well. You can refer to the mean and median in other comments. You may notice that the mean of final is particularly low (around 62 if I remember correctly) but I think it applies to all sessions. I heard that final exams of other professors were also much more difficult than their midterms so it is fair.
reviews.comment_workload: Around one assignment each week or every two weeks. Each assignment consists of 3 to 4 questions. As long as you submit, you will get the mark. Accuracy seems not the point. But practice is needed for accounting so doing assignments is just for your good. 5 attendance taken throughout the semester.

reviews.author: Mandy King
reviews.comment_content: It is the foundation of accounting, if you didn't learn accounting in the past, practices and lecture slides may not be enough, it is suggested that you buy the textbook since there are a lot more practices in it.
reviews.comment_teaching: He actually teaches really thoroughly. Additionally, he goes through practices in class and the learning atmosphere is nice, you can raise and ask questions in class easily. It is quite interactive since he takes attendance and questions on every class, it is very likely that he remembers every students name lol.
reviews.comment_grading:
two in-class quiz
midterm
final
reviews.comment_workload: There's almost no workload. Whether you do the practices or not depends 100% on yourself.

reviews.author: ZhuKexin
reviews.title: interesting professor
reviews.comment_content:
I. Course Description
Accounting is the language of business. In this course you will learn how to "speak" and "read"
this new language. The course is designed to provide an overview of the financial accounting
frameworks and processes leading to the preparation of financial statements, and develop your
relevant skills to read, interpret and analyze corporate financial reports from various dynamic
business perspectives.
II. Course Objectives
Upon the completion of this course, you should be able to:
1. Develop a comprehensive understanding and well-founded knowledge of financial
accounting, covering:
a. the accounting categories: assets, liabilities, equity, revenues and expenses;
b. the ways an accounting system keeps track of data and information;
c. how generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) influence what is recorded
in the books of an entity;
d. the preparation of a balance sheet, income statement and cash flow statement;
e. the reading, interpretation and analysis of a set of financial statements.
2. Understand the role of financial accounting in the decision-making process of business
organizations, and apply financial accounting frameworks to business situations.
3. Form critical judgment covering an ability to identify and define accounting and business
problems, apply analytical and quantitative techniques, and to make and justify decisions;
Page 2 of 5
4. Communicate effectively through collection, analysis and organization of information and
ideas and their clear transmission;
5. Demonstrate teamwork, independence and creativity including working, learning and
problem solving as a team and independently; and
6. Develop ethical and social understanding including a knowledge and respect of ethics and
ethical standards in accounting and an understanding of social and civic responsibility.
III. Required Textbook
Libby, Libby, and Hodge. Financial Accounting, 9
th Edition (International Student Edition),
McGraw-Hill, 2017.
Note: You are required to purchase/get a copy of the textbook for your reading and practice of
the exercises/problems. Previous experience indicated that students who followed the reading
and practice in the teaching schedule were more likely to achieve a higher final grade.
IV. Course Assessment
Class Participation 10%
Quiz 1 10% (Sep 25 in class)
Mid-term Examination 25% (Oct 26 at 7:15-9:15pm, venue: TBA)
Quiz 2 15% (Nov 13 in class)
Final Examination 40%
Total: 100%
V. Course Policies
1. ACCT 2010 will have two class sessions per week that will each blend lecture, tutorial,
problem solving, and discussion together. Each topic will start with a lecture followed by a
discussion of some selected exercises/problems in class to improve your understanding of
and familiarity with the topic lectured, subject to availability of class time. I expect that you
will come to each class adequately prepared by a brief and first-time reading of the
appropriate chapter of the text. This allows you to pay more attention during a lecture to
issues that you have had difficulties in understanding the concepts and theories on your own.
The course is practical in nature and case-oriented requiring a problem-solving approach in
your learning and you are strongly encouraged to participate in doing the assigned
exercises/problems both inside and outside the class, though they are not collected and
graded. The solutions to all practice exercises/problems at the end of each chapter will be
posted on the course website after the chapter is done.
2. Class Participation. You are expected to attend all class regularly and on time, having
prepared beforehand all readings. I also expect you to be actively involved in all class
discussions, including asking questions, sharing your knowledge and experiences during
the class. All of us, your fellow students and me, will be benefited from insightful comments
and thought-provoking questions. On the contrary, those who chat in class are doing a
disservice to everyone present.
Page 3 of 5
3. Quizzes, Mid-term and Final Examinations. All quizzes/exams are closed book, closed
notes unless otherwise announced. The scope of the quizzes/exams will be announced
during class. Two quizzes held in class are scheduled on Mondays, September 25 and
November 13. An evening mid-term examination is scheduled on Wednesday, October
25, 2017 (7-9pm). The final examination is cumulative which may include topics under
the scope of the mid-term examination and quizzes. Programmable calculators are not
permitted.
It is expected that all students will take the quizzes and examinations at the scheduled time.
There will be NO make-up examination for the quizzes and mid-term. If absence from the
examination is due to unexpected medical emergency, the marks earned from the final
examination may be adjusted to substitute for the missing quizzes/mid-term grade. A
student foreseeing unavoidable absence due to a strong justification may seek approval from
the instructor for similar arrangement. Any other absent students will get zero marks for the
quizzes and mid-term exam.
4. Academic Honesty. It is important that students follow university regulations on academic
integrity and honesty. Academic dishonesty will not be tolerated and will be dealt with in
accordance with university rules, which can be accessed at the university website:
http://www.ust.hk/vpaao/integrity.
VI. Getting Help and Staying in Touch
I will post course-related information at the course web site on CANVAS. There are prescheduled
office consultation hours for the course. I suggest that you either visit during these
office consultation hours or make an appointment by sending an email to me. You can ask
substantive (as opposed to procedural) questions by e-mail — but please keep in mind that the
questions pertaining to the course material should be preferably asked in class.
Apart from asking questions in class, you can also use the discussion board on CANVAS to
raise smart questions for the benefit of everyone – the questioner, the instructor and other
students. I will check the discussion board and post replies regularly. You are encouraged to
reply to other students’ questions on CANVAS as part of a supportive learning environment.
I strongly encourage you to raise your questions either in class or on the discussion board as
soon as your problems arise. Do not allow your puzzles or confusions to accumulate because it
will be more difficult to solve them at a later stage.

reviews.author: yvonneharu
reviews.comment_grading:
5%的participation，【attendance≠participation】教授大人第一节课就和我们说了，你要拿分的话请说话！！！问问题！！！或者回答问题也可以呀！！！可以拿卡片！！！！写上你的大名！！！然后下课给她就好啦！！！pssssss participation最最最多可以拿到8%哦！！！！请将3%bonus一并拿到（意思就是你最高可以有103%的分数）。话说我也不知道要拿多少张卡才算满分啦所以你们就多说话吧。

40%的Final。这个是地狱啊！！！难度和前面两个根本没得比好吗！！！
我就来说一道题让你感受感受.
Bond,没有maturity date，没有issue price，没有coupon rate，没有market price，没有payment time。全部都要找出来！！！！后面那二十几个T-account把我翻得神志不清我都翻不出来答案啊！！！！！告诉我一个半年的amortization但是我不知道是effective-rate method还是straight method我怎么做嘛呜呜呜呜呜。当时我整个人是懵逼的谢谢。

不过龟还真的蛮好的。

以后大家看到她请快速飞去她的怀抱吧！！！
reviews.comment_workload:
我覺得這門課：

先说说这门课的组成吧嗷嗷嗷

15%的midterm两个，第一个几乎全部都是选择题，后面有这么一丢丢大题。个人感觉好难【心疼学渣的自己。然后第二个midterm就是都是计算题啦，个人觉得蛮简单的。所以不要太担心。

25%的homework，homework请记得一定要做哦！！！！！！！！！不然没有及时上交拿0分就呵呵哒。BTW，我们今年是六个homework里面选最好的五个计分的，所以一个没有交也没什么所谓?
